review_title: Not the good made in USA ones of years ago
review_text: I have worn Crocs for years, but the well-made ones that came from the USA (Colorado) many years ago.  These made in China ones are a harder plastic and extremely wide so that my feet slip around in them or the shoes fall off.  They also aren't anywhere near as comfortable due to the harder plastic, even if they did fit properly.  I have already started the return process, very disappointed since after many years, my American made ones are finally starting to wear out and need replacing

review_title: Two completely different sized shoes marked the same size
review_text: We have been buying crocs for a long time and this time we received crocs that were marked the right size .... but one was significantly smaller and more narrow than the other. This was something we only realized after leaving on vacation. Our 12 year old constantly complained that the one was too small and the other was too large. He had to wear them until we could find a store to buy him flip flops and so we couldn't return them by the time we got back as they had been worn. Not sure what happened here but I have them and they are definitely two different sizes...

I was hoping these would fit like the Classic Clog Crocs I already have but, they still feel too small.  It's the third pair I've ordered lately and can't seem to find the fit I was hoping for.  Ended up donating these and the others to Value Village since I had worn them a couple of times.  None of them seemed as roomy as the ones I have almost worn out.  I love Crocs but am frustrated trying to find the right fit!

I would never recommend the now-a-day Crocs clogs to anyonecrocs Unisex Classic Clog,Black,5 M US Men's / 7 M US Women's  . I have worn a pair of Crocs clogs for over 10 years and decided it was time to replace them. The clogs now are nothing like the clogs of years ago. And sad to say the quality of what was a great buy is gone. This clog is now a plastic of some sort and the insole is not any more comfortable than a regular pair of shoes. I normally wear 6.5US and got a size 7. They are tight across the foot when using the strap, my foot is pushed forward and is uncomfortable. But without the strap the clog doesn't seem to fit right. Sorry to say I will not be buying Crocs clogs anymore.

I bought these to replace an earlier pair which were just great, and which I wore for two years.  These were the exact same size and style as before (different colour only).I received these on October 4th, 2018.  Photo taken November 2nd, 2018.  That is less than a month.  You can draw your own conclusions from a glance at the photo.Also, this pair seemed smaller/tighter than the original pair, despite supposedly being the exact same size.  And the rivet/pivot on the strap raised a nasty blister on my foot.Will have to give serious thought before buying another pair of these!

These are a cheap Crocs.  They have no arch support like the better Crocs do, the rubber is hard and not flexible and soft like other Crocs.  And they are much too large for a womens B width foot.  In fact, these Crocs actually hurt my feet and legs when I wore them out.  I will never wear these Crocs again.  In fact, I am taking them to Goodwill today and I just got them!I have 2 pairs of older Crocs that cured my Achilles tendinitis and plantar facshitis (spelling sorry), that mold to my feet and are so soft and cushiony and non slip.I think alot of what's wrong with these Crocs is the unisex thing.  I wouldn't buy them if I were you, you'll be sorry.

review_title: Are they Knockoffs or just made much cheaper?
review_text: Either I got a knock off pair, or the quality of Crocs has went way down. The new ones are made much cheaper and smaller, and the harder plastic is more uncomfortable. There is no more padded arch or footbed (insole), and they are just downright uncomfortable compared to the nice soft, thicker rubber they used to make them with. What happened Crocs? PLEASE bring back the Original Great Quality!

I bought a pair supposedly in the same style and size as my original pair from 8 years ago.  The change was both startling and disappointing.The size of the new pair is visibly smaller than my original pair.The little rise at the back of the footbed is almost non-existent so my feet slide out backwards as I walk.The nubs on the footbed are so coarse it's like walking barefoot on gravel.Overall, they are very tight compared to the originals.  In fact so tight that I had to reorder in a larger size.

review_title: Was sent a cheap knock off instead of the real thing!!!!!
review_text: The product I received was not Crocs! I got some knock off brand called "Satihu"  They looked just like Crocs and I didn't notice right away, but I started getting tendonitis pain in my left foot.  This is a recurring problem that is usually improved by wearing Crocs.  I took a closer look at the shoes and was shocked to see that they aren't real.  I went back and checked by order to make sure that the mistake wasn't mine, but the order clearly states that I purchased Crocs.

I don‚Äôt know what to tell you. Crocs are dead to me. I have searched high and low for the elusive roomy fit crocs that I first purchased about five years ago. They were made in Mexico of a somewhat softer material than the new ones I find now. After much research, I thought the Classic Crocs were the ticket with their ‚Äúroomy fit‚Äù description. This description is BS. I don‚Äôt think Croc makes a roomy clog anymore. I certainly can‚Äôt find it if they do.

February 2019 Review:Shoes fit perfectly but there was a weird orange stain on them I saw when I first opened the package. Possibly used shoes and then resold?September 2019 Review:I love love love my crocs but I have only had them for 7 months and now they are completely turning orange. I have no idea how they are turning orange and I really wish I had the clean sleek white croc color as appeared in the product ad.  I could see your crocs possibly turning green if you walk in the grass a lot with them on but orange!? I have nothing in my home or outside that would explain this. Super sad to see my first pair of crocs not even last a year. First two images are when I first opened package and next two images are updates I took this morning. :(

review_title: Crocs has apparently decided to save money on materials by ...
review_text: Crocs has apparently decided to save money on materials by shrinking the shoes. These are a full 1/2 inch shorter and 3/8 inch narrower than the same size ones they were intended to replace. I have returned them. I'm hesitant to order a larger size as they are also narrower, so I guess after 15 years of wearing them, I will have to find another shoe.

DO NOT buy these crocs if you are looking for the real deal, they are huge and the holes are the wrong size/ in the wrong places. They look fine on their own, but compared with real ones they are obviously fake. Spend the extra 5-10 dollars on real ones from the store or Crocs website.

I wish I had believed the comments about various size differences according to country of manufacture.  The Crocs I've always purchased in the past ran at least a size too large and very wide.  So, I ordered a size smaller than I usually wear; but the Croc slip-on I received is like a woman's size 8 regular (and I wear and 11 wide).  I can't even get my foot into it.  I guess I'll have to branch out to another brand of footwear that's more reliable.  I hate returning things and I usually just take the loss, but these are going back.

I got these because I wanted something that could get wet, without needing to dry forever like tennis shoes, for when I have to take the dogs for their morning walk, and still protect my toes and provide some arch support. I should never have bought them.First, if you have wide feet, just don't bother.  I ordered the Men's 9, because I wear an 11 Wide in Women's shoes.  HA!  These were barely long enough and tighter than any other man's shoe I've ever tried on before.  I wear men's tennis shoes because I have wide feet, but these shoes are very narrow for men's shoes.Second, your feet will sweat in these like crazy.  If you thought your feet sweat in your workout shoes, just wait till you wear these for a few minutes in the heat.  I have feet that sweat, not as bad as some people I know, but still, I like a shoe that breathes.Third, the little nubs that are supposed to keep your feet from slipping are very hard and unpleasant on the bottom of your feet and, even though this shoe runs small, your foot will slip around once it starts to sweat or gets wet.These are now shower shoes only, and that is a lot of money to spend on something you can only wear to take a shower.

I have owned Crocs in the past and these were not of the same quality. The left show was significantly larger than the right. The shoes were a slightly different color. PLEASE read the negative comments before purchasing! I did but was swayed but the amount of 3 + star ratings and failed to read the negative comments which matched what i experienced. Buy at your own risk. These were not made in the USA rather in Vietnam.

I am very upset! I spent $45.00 purchasing these to wear a month!??!! The first time I cleaned them in hot, soapy water.....by morning when I put them on my feet, the left one had shrunk CONSIDERABLY. The right one only a little. Regardless, I cannot wear them now. The left foot is too short and it squeezes my foot as it became very narrow and snug!So be careful cleaning them. You may have regrets like myself! What a waste of my money!!!**ordered a second time because I loved the heel cushioning these offered up until the left foot shrunk. We shall see how the second pair work out. So far, so good but I haven't attempted to clean them either.  I will update after I do. I have to say I am absolutely DISGUSTED I have not heard from the seller! So even if this second pair works out, I will never give them more than one star. That is extremely poor customer relations. Obviously once they have your money, they could care less if you have an issue with your shoes.

review_title: Toe box not nearly as high as previous Crocs
review_text: I have one pair of Crocs, ordered from Amazon in 2008.  This year, they got full of paint due to painting our house.  There still is nothing wrong with them other than the paint.  So, I decided to treat myself to a new pair.  The new ones are stiff, the nubs on the inside hurt and the toe box really wants to yank off my baby toenail, even though I trim them weekly.  Returning.  Way to screw up a great product, Crocs.  I soaked my old ones in soap and water overnight, dried them in the sun, stuffed newspaper inside and gave them 2 coats of Rustoleum flat black spray paint.  Viola!  Like new.  I am now a former Crocs customer.  The old ones fit like a glove and are the most comfy shoes I own.

review_title: Sizing Inconsistencies (maybe based on region of manufacture)
review_text: This was my first pair of Crocs. I'm a men's size 8 in almost all brands of sneakers, so ordered my normal size. When these arrived, they were massive. My feet were swimming in them, and I could rattle them around by shaking my feet, heel straps engaged. But, I read that Crocs are supposed to be very loose, and just rolled with it. They never felt right, and so I decided to stop by a local Crocs store to make sure. The Crocs at the retail store in the same size/model were completely different. Since I had them both, I was able to compare and the Amazon ones felt and looked more like a size 9 or 10. I thought maybe they were fakes, but they were sold directly by Amazon and looked legit. The only difference I could tell was the retail store ones were made in Vietnam, whereas the Amazon ones were Brazil. So maybe they have very different injection molds at each location that cause for the size inconsistencies. Luckily, Amazon allowed me to return them and I bought a properly fitting size 8 pair of Crocs, made in Vietnam.

I‚Äôm a nurse and wore Crocs for years. Love them, they‚Äôre ugly but sooooo comfortable. I retired and gave all my Crocs away ‚òπÔ∏èI decided I needed 1 pair to go to Disney World so I ordered these and was so excited to get them but...... they are NOT nearly as comfortable as original Crocs, in fact they hurt my feet without thick socks. The little nubs in the sole are kinda sharp and the shoes are not cushy.So disappointed ‚òπÔ∏è I‚Äôm at Disney and my feet aren‚Äôt happy.

review_title: Like big fuzzy pink slippers, only, not.
review_text: Sigh, I expected to love these. My boys are so obsessed with their crocs that they practically live in them. My mother also insists they are the only shoe comfortable enough for all day wear for working on her feet all day. However, I immediately noticed how big they look. I slipped them on, hoping they would look less large, but no, they looked like little boats for my feet. I figured this would be ok, mostly wearing these for stream play, but they are constantly filling with sand and little pebbles. So of course, that is not a great quality in shoes dedicated to stream play. However, when I was brave enough to wear these ridiculous slippers out in public, the squeaked with every single step. Given their high price tag, I‚Äôm pretty disappointed.

I have purchased several pairs of crocs in the past, and this pair was supposed to be exactly identical to a pair I had previously purchased on Amazon. I actually clicked "Buy it again" on that previous order.These are not the same shoes. The new one is way too tight, and just a couple weeks after getting them and leaving them outside for a few days under the elements, they are now bent. The pair I purchased in the past stayed outside much longer, and is still in perfectly good condition. I seriously doubt these are real Crocs, or Crocs has recently drastically lowered the quality of their products. Crazy that this is sold by Amazon. Seriously?

These are much stiffer and wider than the Crocs from past years. The length was fine but they were wide boats on my feet! Since the description didn't say they're wide I was expecting the same snug feel they used to. They went back right away. The Crocs website says their shoes are available in narrow sizes but I haven't found them anywhere online in narrow.

review_title: Back Strap Is Sized Bigger Than Shoe
review_text: I have loved Crocs & have bought countless pairs. This pair was defective. The back strap was clearly a size larger than the shoe itself. It was raised up & did not fit flush when it rested on the top of the shoe & was longer then the shoe back than it should be. I will be returning these & not ordering any more from this seller or any other. Crocs have been going downhill for a while- not lasting as long as they used to, etc. I was hoping the quality had improved, but apparently it's just getting worse.

I got these because someone recommended them for wearing around the house on our hard tile floors. We take off our outdoor shoes inside our home. Anyhow, they are the ugliest pair of shoes I have ever owned. They also make my feet look huge and wide. But that is ok since I got them to wear inside and not many people will see me in them. However, there is another problem. In spite of the holes, they get very hot and are not breathable. If you wear them without socks, your feet will get stinky sweaty. Lastly the arch support is ok, not as good as Birkenstock. The only good thing is they are soft and cushiony which I need walking around in hard tile. But other than that, I think they are no good and don‚Äôt understand the popularity. To me they are just overpriced made in china foam shoes. Nothing great. I wish I got a pair of EVA birkenstocks to wear around the house instead. Eva Birks are not as ugly, and have better arch support and nice cushion. Also price wise I think they are about the same. My Husband got the Birkenstock‚Äôs and I like his way way better. Also birks are made in Germany (not China like crocs) and they are better quality as a result.

I was so disappointed by the fit. I've owned dozens of Crocs and these dug into my feet where the circular connectors are. I'm not sure whether they're counterfeit but I'm at a Field and Stream store now trying on an authentic pair and they fit perfectly just like they always did. I should have returned them. Buyer beware at these prices.

review_title: Fatal Flaw - ‚ÄúMade In Mexico‚Äù - Raised Heel Strap Printing
review_text: I have been buying Crocs for my son since he was old enough to walk. He‚Äôs always found them comfortable and we have gone through many pairs over the years. Now we just bought a new pair and they fit great with ONE BIG EXCEPTION. They are now ‚ÄúMade in Mexico‚Äù and they used raised printed lettering on the inside of the heel strap that is very uncomfortable. When my son pointed this out and how uncomfortable it would be I thought he was kidding. Sure enough I ran my fingers over it and yeah it would be very uncomfortable. Luckily I had his previous pair and was able to remove the heel strap, without any printing, and replace it on the new pair. Most people may not have this option so I would caution against buying these as I know it would rub against the skin and be very uncomfortable. Bad decision from the manufacturer! I hope this can be corrected ASAP. They almost were returned because of one seriously fatal flaw from the manufacturer.

ugh. I don't find these comfortable at all. They're a  lightweight rubbery kind of  shoe that makes my feet hot and sweaty, the inside is too bumpy and rough and my knees started aching after walking around in them for less than 15 minutes. Walking in them is not a pleasure.I suppose I will use them around water, but it's kind of disappointing because everyone seems to like them.

review_title: They run large. And contained a brown recluse spider. Thanks a lot Amazon.
review_text: Shoes arrived in an absolutely filthy plastic shipping bag, 6 days after ordering. The shoes were in an inner bag so I assumed they were okay, but they weren't...Didn't check the inside of the shoes before wearing - they are supposed to be new. Immediately after trying them on got a needle-like sharp pain in my toe and a black and blue swollen spot. (I didn't see the Recluse spider as they are very shy and inconspicuous and quickly disappear. (I have had these bites before and know what they are like). The pain kept coming back. Luckily I had a homeopathic salve and pills on hand. After applying the salve twice and taking the pills twice and sticking my foot in a cold compress, the pain subsided.The next day my toe is still swollen and a little sore...  Thanks for the envenomation, Amazon.Re the shoes: Love the color and ease of wearing. Love that it's waterproof. Got stuck in a rainstorm today - no problem. The only problem was the seller/packaging. I will only say this. Buy from a different vendor.

review_title: The size 9/11 croc made in Mexico sold in this ...
review_text: The size 9/11 croc made in Mexico sold in this store, is 2 sizes smaller than the size 9/11 made and sold in US.  Same product, same numbers and big difference in size!!!

review_title: These crocs are tighter and different than my many older pairs
review_text: The cut of these crocs is different than my older ones. It is very tight around the instep and cut is different on the heel. The material is much stiffer than my other crocs. Debating whether to order a larger size, or try to break them in. But the whole point of crocs is that they are roomy and require no break in time. What is going on with crocs now? Why are they shaped differently? I loved crocs and have a lot of foot issues so would like to find a solution.

author_name: Take care of the earth it's our home üè°
review_title: they are NOT happy how did they have persnal information prime???
review_text: Will call amazon on this personal information was given out !!!It was more then color are they china knock offs these were junk or made wrong tripped 2 tiem in home that God I was not in a street etc like to left feet very hard to tell knock off this company product also has gone to mexico and also making crocs not a nursing choose or doctors etc ! Very wide no a noral  foot for a gift for by husband a surprize so I used them he tripped to my sons in medical the color is off not deep wine more red look like clowns shoes we put twith 5 year lod croc wow the old one are much better so we will trash them as I don;t think the are safe sorry sell look close at your stock are you a vender???????

review_title: Does not fit right - Too small - Not soft
review_text: I had to return it as it did not fit right.It doesn't have enough height for the size.  It was also a lot harder than previous Crocs I bought which were very comfortable, so even buying a bigger size would not have worked (and the bigger size would have been too long.I don't know why Crocs seem to think that people's feet have changed in th past few years...

review_title: Size depends on where they‚Äôre made
review_text: These are my first crocs I‚Äôve ever purchased. I was looking for a comfy house shoe that I could also wear out if needed. I couldn‚Äôt decide which color I wanted so I ordered two with the plans of returning one. They‚Äôre both the same size, but they‚Äôre off from each other. One is from Mexico and the other pair are from China. The China pair (pink) are noticeably larger in width. The orange Mexico pair are more narrow and the footbed is shorter in height as well. Very strange. It‚Äôs hard because I like the orange color more, but I like how the pink ones fit. I might have to keep returning until I get the right fit. Definitely a hassle, but I know once I have the right ones it‚Äôll be worth it.

review_title: Insides are coated in glitter, stains feet
review_text: I have previously enjoyed three pairs of Crocs and ordered two pairs this time. Both pairs arrived with tags in a sealed plastic bag. Both pairs were coated with glitter on the inside. I had to immediately wash them thoroughly lest the glitter get tracked throughout my house. Previous Crocs I've owned did not have glitter, nor have any other shoes I've ever purchased for that matter. One pair additionally had a small dirty spot. Very strange, and makes me wonder if they are fake. "Bright cobalt" does not look like the picture, but is instead more of a royal blue. After several weeks the blue color continues to rub off and stain socks and skin.

My husband had a pair that was made in Canada.  After several years, the soles have smoothed out making them a slip hazard, so I decided it was time to purchase a new pair.  What a disappointment.  They new pair was made in Vietnam. They are not the soft squishy, great arch support Crocs that they used to make.  What a shame.  After wearing his new pair for a week, he went back to wearing his old, original Crocs.  So sad that you can't purchase the original Crocs anymore.  :(

I bought these for my daughter back at the end of May. She said they were tight but wanted to keep them. After much complaining I finally bought her a new pair, same size at a local retail store. I couldn‚Äôt believe they were the same size as the ones I bought on here. These were so narrow it was crazy. I would not buy again on here. I honestly have no idea how they were so different.

review_title: Not as Pictured. Quality not up to par.
review_text: The shoe pictured is not the shoe they sent. I sent it as a gift to my mother, and she commented on this, and the fact they don‚Äôt cushion her foot like the other pair she had before...same style shoe/same brand. The others she says she can wear all day, these she has to add an additional pair of socks or ‚Äústay on the carpet‚Äù.I suspect these may be a counterfeit product.

I have to totally agree with other reviewers.  The strap on the back forces your toes to dig into the front of the shoe and even when not using the strap, the shoes force your toenails to dig into the front of the shoe.  The bumps on the sole of the shoe are sharp and not comfortable.  I dont know what they changed since this is my first pair, but I will never buy another pair of crocs.

review_title: A little snug. Go at least one size larger.
review_text: These crocs were exactly what I ordered and wanted for my daughter. But when my daughter put them on she said they were a little snugger than her last crocs, (though same size) and not as sturdy or steady. Her last pair of crocs were the ones without holes around the toes.  The sole on her previous pair was a little flatter and the outside rim had a dark blue stripe around the shoe ( I think they were called crocband  clogs). This was her comparative to the new crocs. She‚Äôs still happy with new crocs since they look like the ones her friends are wearing. But i think the previous crocs fit better and were more comfortable.

I purchased these as a replacement for a pair of first generation crocs that were marked size 8-9.  I wear a size 9M American, size 42 Euro, and after reviewing the fit reviews and Croc's sizing chart, I ordered size 9.  The new size 9 crocs are much too big.  While the length was okay, the width was much too wide.  I returned the size 9s and re-ordered a pair of size 8s which are much closer in fit to my original pair but the heels are wider than the originals.  I've attached a photo of the size 9s on the left, size 8 in the middle, and the original size 8-9 on the right.  Note the width of the heels and the overall shape.  The originals fit (me) much better.  The 8s will have to do.

review_title: Painful bumpy things, and a little narrow for wide feet
review_text: Can't believe more people aren't complaining about the little bumps all over the sole of these shoes that stab me whenever I stand up, even when wearing socks. I'm a big guy, so maybe being heavier puts more pressure on my feet. But I'm probably gonna return these because I feel like I'm stepping on tiny rocks. Ok maybe not that bad, but it's not the comfort I'm looking for. Also, I have wide feet (4E) and usually buy a half size up when wides aren't available. But even a half side up, these are a little snug.On the positive side they look nice, seem to be decent quality, have good tread, breathable, everything that Crocs are known for.

review_title: Learn from my mistake! Dont order!
review_text: I have ordered i think 6 pairs of these crocs. I was very happy at first. However i have noticed that they are very inconsistent in sizing. I usually wear a 6/8 but due to a navy pair i ordered bring WAY too small i decided to start sizing up to 7/9.The first 2 photos are of "pink lemonade" size 7/9 and the left shoe is much larger than the right.The second 2 photos are of the color "tangerine" size 7/9 and the right shoe id much larger.The last photo is of "white, navy blue, and mint" all size 6/8. I love the white and green pair however the navy blue is much smaller than the other two which is why i started ordering a size up. I wont be ordering anymore.Also the colors Navy Blue and Chocolate (not pictured) are WAY darker than i was expecting, but the preview photos are very misleading compared to the realistic shade.

Not sure what the big deal is with these and why they have been so popular. In an effort to fit all, they are very wide and loose. The length is the correct size and they stay on my feet, but they sure do not allow walking in any conventional sense. I am sure they will be good for campground shower facilities and kicking around a campsite or swimming pool, but they are not a replacement for sandals or water shoes.

I own 5 pairs of original crocs in size 11 and all of them are the same and then I got these and they are super narrow.  I already took the tags off so I do not think they will take a return.  They are sold by Amazon but provided by Crocs and what is odd is Crocs are made in many different countries but these do not come from a different country than 2 others I have that are normal width.  So do not take the tags off unless you are sure and if they do not fit well the first shoe fitting they probably never will so don't try to make it work.

Bought these for my husband for Christmas 2018 as they were on sale very cheap and he has always wanted a pair of Crocs. I've never heard that their sizes were not true to size but my husband has small feet at a size 7 in mens and the 7 in means I ordered him were too large. He can wear them but he has to move the strap behind his foot to ensure they stay on.

review_title: Possibly the most uncomfortable and ugly footwear ever
review_text: I bought these Crocs to wear at the beach. The little dimples inside the shoe annoy me. Uncomfortable. Also, by virtue of being open, your feet get filthy. Worse than with sandals or flip flops.I knew up front that one looks like a doofus wearing rubber clogs, but hoped they would work out better and last longer than the water walkers I usually wear. Those tend to last only one or two seasons.I wore them for a couple of weeks hoping they would grow on me. No such luck. I cleaned them and donated to Goodwill. Maybe someone else will enjoy these Crocs.

review_title: Great shoes, but man they are really ugly.
review_text: I never have liked the looks of these butt ugly things but my podiatrist told me to get a pair because of a foot problem.  They do offer great support and curiousness for my poor broken foot.  I find that when I walk my heel tends to extend over the inner sides and wants to roll in.  This is because I have such a high instep that my foot does not go all the way in.  I have about an inch of room in front of my big toe and my heel actually sticks out the back a little.  Perhaps I should have gone with a larger size?  The construction of these shoes is great and they are comfortable.  I expect that I will continue to wear these around the house once my foot has healed because of the support they offer.  I like them as slippers but not for walking any distance.

The 2020 version of the classic Croc's is a size smaller than the old ones and at least a size narrower. Plus the material is stiff with little cushion. 15 years ago when I bought my last pair of the classics they fix me well because they were over sized in all directions plus had a cushioned ride that lasted for many years. I can't buy these any more in this new small size. I do have a recent Croc work shoes that seems to have the old dimensions as well a Garden shoes that fit fine. I bought a 12 when I used to wear an 11 and its fits tighter. I have toe and foot problems so I can not recommend these.

review_title: Check the size before too late to return!
review_text: I've been wearing Crocs as garden clogs for years (never in public!).I decided to order 1 size up so I can wear with thicker socks in winter --  but they were enormous!  WAY bigger than my old pair.OK, so I ordered my normal size 6 Men/8 Women.  The left shoe was super tight and I couldn't even get my foot in the right.  When I held them up next to each other and the right shoe as an entire inch shorter than it's mate!  They were both marked 6/8 on the bottom -- Made in China.I give up. I guess I have to go into a store and try them on to know what size I'm really getting.

You expect good quality control from a brand name like Crocs so it‚Äôs disappointing to get one with obvious defects. The strap on the left slipper is bent out of round, so it‚Äôs not comfortable to wear. I tried stretching it over the back of the slipper overnight to get it back in shape, but it didn‚Äôt help. It seems something went wrong in the molding process. I bought this on sale on Black Friday so maybe they were unloading second quality items during this sale, or I just got a bad one. The question is whether I want to go through the hassle of shipping this back to exchange it on Amazon!  It‚Äôs a disappointing to have to go through this on a simple order.

I bought my first pair of Crocs almost ten years ago, back when they were made in Colorado.  They were the most comfortable shoe for hanging around the house or cooking in the kitchen for long periods of time.  My house has tile or hardwood so there isn't a lot of give there.  Those Crocs were made out of a softer, squishier rubber that had a lot of give to it.  These Crocs are made of a firmer material that seems like it has some plastic in it.  They aren't very cushioned.  They are also a lot smaller.  They fit but just barely.  Don't know if that's because I got a pair from Mexico instead of China (and how weird is it to be hoping you get one of the ones from China but all the reviews agree they fit better than the ones from Mexico.)  Also these have anti-fatigue nubs inside.  They are arranged in ridges, higher in some parts than others.  You can see it's meant to be higher above the ball of your foot, under your toes but the weird sizing keeps my foot from fitting perfectly in that area so mostly I'm just walking on uneven nubs.  I don't know if they work for anti-fatigue because they hurt my feet and I can only wear these shoes for about an hour at a time.  I suppose it will be like when I was a kid in the summer and at first it hurt to go barefoot outside but after a while your feet toughen up and it stops hurting.  Not thrilled though to have paid money for shoes that my feet have to toughen up for.  They are also a lot hotter to wear than my old Crocs.  Not sure if it's because of the smaller size or the new material.  Overall, I'm very unhappy with these shoes.  Looks like I'll have to find a replacement for my old Crocs elsewhere.

review_title: Wrong size.  Size misprint.  DO NOT BUY FROM THIS SELLER
review_text: I wear a size 10.  I purchased 4 pair of Crocs and the red pair is smaller than the other 3.  I've had the red pair for over 1 month and decided to wear them to work today.  I immediately noticed that they felt short but I went to work anyway.  When I returned home I compared them to my other Crocs and discovered they are a size too small.  It says  size 10 on the bottom but its obviously a misprint.  I took a picture to show the difference.  The purple ones were made in China and the red ill-fitting ones were made in Bosnia.  I will never order from this seller again.  Now I'm questioning if the red ones are authentic Crocs or a knockoff.

review_title: I ordered these to replace my original rubbery Crocs but these are way too hard I had to return them
review_text: I'm sorry but these are not the Crocs that I am used to. They are made out of hard plastic and the bumps on the inside of the sole actually hurt the soles of my feet I am flat-footed and Crocs were the best when they were made out of rubber but these are not rubber at all these are not cushy at all so I had to return them I replaced my order with a better product which is cushy soft rubber. Amoji brand. They are made of soft rubber and they are half the price of the Crocs so that's a win-win for me

Ordered a pair of Crocs to replace my 5 year plus old crocs that I really enjoyed wearing while doing my yard work.  These new crocs look and feel like they used a completely new type of material and the sole feels like it is now made with hole areas (web) in the middle, and give you a mushy feel with little support to the bottom of your feet.  Not worth the $50 bucks I paid for them.  When I chose the Classic Crocs, that's what I expected - same look, feel, material and solid construction that I enjoyed in the last pair I purchased.

Very upset. I purchased some Crocs (or so I thought) on here for my nephew before Christmas, and gave them to him already. My daughter ordered from the same place and noticed that they were a bit off and when we compared them to Crocs bought on the actual website, we realized the ones purchased from here are FAKE. You might see the picture listed twice because my daughter posted a review on the ones she bought as well but both were made in different countries. My daughter is returning hers but I sadly cannot because my nephew has already worn them. Very disappointed because these should not be listed as Crocs because they aren‚Äôt. I would like a refund or at least some sort of credit because this is false advertisement, and I am unsure of the quality of these since they aren‚Äôt from the actual company.

review_title: These new shoes are made in China and are defective.  Do NOT buy this shoe.
review_text: The interior surface of this shoe is defective.  Painfully sharp points on the floor of the interior.  Advised the company and they blew me off.  I have multiple Crocs and this one is the only one with this problem so far.  You have to return them right away if yours are defective.  Otherwise the company won't cover the defect.

review_title: They Work for What I Need, But They Seem Highly Overrated
review_text: I bought these specifically for my rowing club needs. I needed something waterproof, easy to get on & off quickly, and the ability to stuff my foot into while wearing bulky wool socks (and, as I encountered the other day, the ability to actually float). They do provide for all of these needs. The fit, however, is a little weird. I'm a pretty solid Women's 7, with a fairly wide foot. The width is fine, but my toes hit the end of the shoe pretty aggressively without socks, and the toe grip thingy on the sole seems oddly placed.That said, I can see why some people think they're comfortable. But here are my top cons:They are terrible for gardening. If I'm walking on wet grass in the morning, my feet get wet. If I'm doing even light weeding, I get dirt stuck everywhere between the shoes and my feet.They are plastic and no matter how many holes you put in them, my feet sweat like crazy.They seem kind of expensive for plastic shoes.I think I'm going to stick to my FitFlops for life outside of rowing a boat. They have way better arch support, and they aren't quite as ugly.

These are different from the classic Crocs of yore. I'm bummed out, but I'll just use these until I find a new go-to comfort shoe. Probably go back to running shoes for casual comfort.Not only are they much narrower, but the arch support is gone and they've changed the sole from a slight heel to flat, exacerbating the lack of arch support.It seems insane that they'd change the design and not alert their loyal customer base. I guess they wanted us all to buy one more pair before we switch our loyalties.

review_title: Measures 1/4" narrower than same size bought one year ago
review_text: What happened to the sizing? I wear M10/W12, so that's what I ordered. The ones I got are 1/4" narrower than the one-year-old crocs I'm currently wearing!I drew an outline on paper of each because I couldn't believe what I was feeling. The new one rubs against my foot and the old ones (only one year old) don't. I have two pair of the old ones (different colors), and this new one is measurably smaller. Crocs don't stretch.Looks like I'll have to go up a size but they don't have the next size in stock.Don't know how to rate this. I love crocs, and I'm going to go up to get (hopefully) a size that fits. Just hope the larger size isn't too large.

Extra big disappointed ‚òπÔ∏è. I had a pair of Crocs that I loved. I wore them probably much much longer than I should have. It came time to replace them. This pair is the most aweful things I have ever put my feet in. The little nubs felt like walking with my shoes full of rocks. It was a disaster. I wore them out 1 time. My knees hurt. My lower back hurt. My hips hurt. If you are prone to these things stay far far far away from these shoes.

I have two sets of Crocs I've been wearing for 10 years or so. I love them and they're all I wear, all year around. I've been needing a couple of more pairs to match outfits I have, so I ordered two pair (black and brown) last week. They're too small. They're the same size as the other two sets I have, but they're too small. I wear 8 wide, and the size 8 in the past has been perfect. Not this time. I can't return them because I wore them, so I'm hoping they give some over time. If I were to purchase them again, I'd get a size larger.

review_title: Bought 2 pairs and loved one pair, but not the other.
review_text: I bought 2 pairs of these crocs. The pink ones (excuse my unboxing mess), as shown in the picture, and a pair of black ones (not pictured). I LOVE the pink pair they feel perfect and comfortable. Although for some reason, the black pair feels completely different. The sole for the black pair is extremely abrasive and bumpy to the point where it feels sharp. I was upset and also skeptical because I bought both of them from the same exact page. I don't know if crocs are meant to vary like that? Anyways, I'm exchanging the black ones and hoping for the best at this point. It's unfortunate I have to do that. 2 star rating for inconsistency.

review_title: smaller than other Crocs of this size!  Unauthorized $10 deduction
review_text: So I bought the same size Croc I always do and it came in great condition, color and everything. I put it on and it felt great until I brought the heel strap up around the back of my foot. suddenly it is too short, and pushing my toes through the holes at the front. Not sure what's up but can't use it, I initiate the return on the Amazon end and come to find out what I paid $45 for they are only returning me $35 of!  No explanation. It is not shipping related. totally pissed!

My normal shoe size is 10.5 - 11 so I ordered a size 11.  There is a solid 1"-1.5" of room from the tip of the Croc to my big toe.  I also noticed they are extra wide.  I usually wear a 4E sneaker and even these are almost too wide for my feet.  I feel like I should have gone for a size 10, but was afraid they would be too short.  Maybe if I sported Crocs + socks, in true dad form, they would fit more snugly, but with bare feet they are very, very roomy.

5 stars for the product, 0 stars for the idiotic sizing.  You'd think they'd fix it with all the complaints.  Bought my first Crocs at a yardsale and they're wearing out so I ordered these which I believed to be the same thing, but they're absolutely not.  The bottoms of my old ones say "W10-11  M8-9".  These are "M9 W11" and the shoe is so big my foot is just rattling around in there.  They're going back, but I honestly don't know what size to order now.  My advice is to never buy shoes or hats on-line without free returns, and even then don't do it.

I bought this for my daughter in her usual size for Christmas and it was WAY too big! I went to exchange it and the price more than doubled--I couldn't evenly exchange it so I had to return the pair I bought for $9.99 and re-purchase a new pair for $26.21! If she wasn't so excited about getting them (Her swim team wears them on the pool deck) I wouldn't buy her the new pair. I wish they offered an even exchange or explained that they didn't. Good product but bummed about being out an extra $16.

I try these because I needed  garden shoes and since the black in my size was on sale I wanted to try for myself if they are really all that different of the cheaper copies.Well they are lighter than many I tried, but I got a pair when in Italy, brand named "Woz!" they are made of identical stuff.The list price on Croc side is $35 for these, I pay quite a bit  less here but I wonder how can some vendor ask close or more than 100 bucks for rubber shoes...This are garden clogs... maybe the brand has a kind of placebo effect or maybe my feet are not attuned to the different quality of rubber...One good thing, this design with the back strap, would make a better choice versus slides to use in the shower for an older person.

Broke strap same day first wore them by adjusting the strap to the ‚Äúback position ‚Äú it tore from the side of the croc........I‚Äôm going to try one more pair and if it has same problem I‚Äôm going to guess they are not authentic

review_title: Buyer Beware. Item not as pictured
review_text: This product may not be a real crocs brand and the color is actually gray a dark gray completely different from what's pictured. Amazon should not allow this sellers on its platform. Too many of them these days listing incorrect items or shipping items that were not pictured. Yes you get free return but imagine the headache of printing labels and returning at drop off locations. Product description totally misleading.

review_title: Not as squishy as my other Crocs
review_text: I was excited to get these at a cheaper price but I wish I just ordered some from the Crocs store website instead. These crocs are much harder than my other ones and a little bit smaller too. I dunno if they are a knock off or what, but something is off about them.

Personally I don't like the loose fit that Crocs have. The arch support and heel comfort is decent though. These are very expensive for what they are but I needed some house slippers and these do the less damage to my body compared to my other sandals so Crocs it is.

The fit was okay.  They just don't seem to feel like the original crocs.  Their not as cushioned as they use to be.  My husband and I have been long users of this shoe and either they cheapened themselves or they are knock offs.Very disappointed in the shoe.

Sizes run a little small in the actual foot size (length) of thats the correct wording.  My daughter wears a women‚Äôs 7 but needs an 8 in crocs, but she has a ton of extra room in the croc overall, but not in the actual size. Very roomy if that makes sense. We‚Äôve purchased multiple pairs from other retailers and don‚Äôt have this issue. This is the only pair she has that she could swim in. She can definitely wear cabin socks, maybe even multiple pairs and still not fill up the shoe.

This is the third pair of Crocs I have owned and I really like the fit and comfort and the protection over the toes but the previous two pair both shrunk several sizes when left out in the sun.  So much so that they were unwearable and had to be thrown away.  People have said they could be stretched out again with heat and water but I had no luck.  This pair I plan to keep in doors and hope they do not shrink.  I would think for the price of Crocs they should be able to stand heat without shrinking beyond use.

I purchased these Crocs Classic Clogs last Aug 2016.  I wore them through the summer and fall. They fit as expected, very comfortable.  This May I would wear them to do yard work. They became wet. I put them out in the sun to dry, like I have done with all my previous Croc clogs. After they dried I tried to put them on, to my surprise the clogs had SHRUNK. I couldn't put my forefoot into the clogs. What a disappointment!!!!

Got my pair today and was so excited until I unwrapped them. The right shoe on the top was completely crushed in and so uncomfortable to wear. It won‚Äôt form back to normal and you can see ripples in the shoe from it being crushed. So much for these üò¢

review_title: Lasted a month, do not take outside in the heat!
review_text: Initially these were great! My daughter absolutely loved them! Then she left them in the sun next to the pool on a 95 degree day  and they warped and shrunk.  They are half the original size and twisted up, They are unable to be worn at all even by someone in a much smaller size.

review_title: Issue with Amazon, moreso than the product
review_text: The Crocs are shipped by Amazon in a bag. Because of this, anything on top of them are going to compress the shape. Clearly mine had been squished for quite some time, as the shape of the shoe opening is drastically creased. Stupidly, I figured this would reform over time... Instead I get blisters every time I wear them, so they're going to be donated. I'm a big fan of Crocs (mostly for the sex appeal), but I would never get them through Amazon again.IMPORTANT ALSO - The actual material itself feels much cheaper than the other crocs I own and purchased direct. Perhaps they are making an "amazon" version to keep up with demand? I'd highly recommend finding them elsewhere.

In the "how does this product fit?" drop-down list, "too narrow" and "not wide enough" are not choices. CROCS come in MEDIUM. No AA, B, C, D, DD etc.I realize it is not a serious shoe like a Florsheim, a Rockport or a New Balance. But how about an a B, C and D at least.I loved CROCS till I got these. I have 2 pair that are at least five years old and half hundreds of thousands of miles on them---no tread so they are scary on wet roads, but still serviceable. Both pair are substantially wider than the new ones so I know CROCS weren't always just Medium. Just like I know that people are not all Medium. And that's really the issue in making a product.The CROC website says there are different widths: "Roomy", "Relaxed", and "Standard." You just can't get them. Amazon and Zappos and all other outlets have Medium. Which is a "CROC."

This was my second attempt at getting a new pair of Crocs that fit. My shoe size is W6.5 so I bought the size W6 Crocs. When they arrived and I tried them on, they were too small. My toes were scrunched together and walking just a few steps was not comfortable at all. I returned them and ordered the next size up (W7), but they were still too small. I compared them next to the pair I currently have (size W6-7/S/M4-5, bought from a shop in Mexico) and you can immediately see the size difference (see attached photo). Haven't decided yet whether to go up the next 2 sizes or just go up 1 size at a time. I am able to return them for a full refund, so that's good. But seeing how much smaller they are, I might jump up to size 9 even though my shoe size has never been that big. If those fit me well, then I will change my rating to 5 stars, as I love my Crocs and wanted to replace them with ones I could wear outside (wore a hole through them that they are now inside shoes/slippers).

review_title: Wrong sized shoes a waste of my money
review_text: I have worn crocs for years, never a problem. I ordered these and they came in and had the right size stamped on them so I tossed them into the closet since my old crocs were still hanging in there. Pulled them out yesterday and both shoes are too small despite the correct size (13) stamped on the bottom.  The left shoe is even smaller than the right one.  What a waste of time and money. I should have tried them on back then but with the correct size stamped on them it did not even occur to me. I have long ago tossed out the box. A waste of time and money. If you buy from this place then make sure you test out everything. Crocs are a very loose fitting casual shoe and I have never had one not fit. But live and learn. Use care with this provider, perhaps a problem with quality control.

Uggg. I wore these for 3 hours gardening and they are going back. My feet are killing me. It was those little bumps on the footbed that did me in. Two hours later and my feet are still complaining. Then, I began my research. Yes, ER docs and operating room people love them. What other shoes can you hose off? Podiatrists, however, hate them and don't recommend then for more than a few hours. There are two exceptions -- those with super high arches and those with lots of swelling in their feet.

These Crocs are extremely large and don't appear to be sized properly. They are sized and mens' 9 and women' 11. My husband wears a 9 and his feel were swimming in them; same for me, and I wear a women's 11! They would only work if you wanted to wear "boats"!! Would not recommend purchasing these.

review_title: What happened to the original Crocs I adored so very much?
review_text: Oh, Crocs!  Why, oh, why did you change your, ‚ÄúClassic Crocs‚Äù?  You make me üò¢!  (And not in a, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm -just-so-happy!‚Äù kind of way.)These Crocs are nowhere near as soft/cloud-like as the same Croc from years ago.  What happened to the Crocs that every-other kid and every intelligent/self-confident woman wore during the Great Croc Craze Years?Where are those tissues...üò≠

Waste of money. The quality has changed not for the better. I had purchased crocs a few years ago for myself and kids and they were great didn‚Äôt have any issues. Just recently the kids outgrown them so I decided to purchase new ones for our camping trip. So a week after we received them we take them with us and when we went to bed we left them outside the tent. The next morning the crocs shrunk about 3 sizes down. It was horrible we were left without shoes. Don‚Äôt know what happened because with our old crocs we left them outside in 120 degree weather and nothing ever happened. Such a waste of money and now we need to purchase new sandals again.

My husband wears Crocs all the time and has several styles, including multiple pairs that look like these. However, this gift to replace a worn out pair are awful! They have nubs inside the shoe that poke the foot when wearing with and without socks. They are not wearable. They feel like you are walking on a nail bed.  I couldn't imagine needing to return,  and bought them early for a birthday gift. Now we have past the return date and have a useless pair of shoes. I am also left feeling insecure about ordering others. Need help to exchange, but can't find that either.

These were perfect for my 12 year old brother. He wanted something to slip on and off and these worked great. Unfortunately they already wore out and the band broke off after just a month and a half. They weren‚Äôt worn every day or with rough use either which was just disappointing.

Bien hechos y bonitos pero la talla no corresponde. Tengo otros crocs comprados en almac√©n de la misma talla y no me quedan igual. Los de Amazon me quedan m√°s peque√±os y se sale un poco el tal√≥n atr√°s. Recomiendo verificar medidas del pie o irse por una talla m√°s de la habitual.

I got my pair in mid April of this year, and have worn them over the summer, and now, just past the 90-day period for the warranty, all of a sudden, I can't fit my feet into them. They shrunk! They seriously shrunk from a size 10 to like a size 6!!!! Looks like I'm out some shoes, and the neighbor girl just got some new play shoes. Don't buy!

review_title: lighter shade of green than expected
review_text: I made this a 3 just on color... the quality of the Crocs themselves are a 5 as always, I've been wearing them for years. I'm just giving it a 3 in case it helps anyone else w/ color choice. I guess I remember Army green being a little darker (from having actually been in the Army)it's on the beige / sandier sider of green than the darker OD green i was thinking. If you are looking for a darker green it's not the right choice.

The baby blue color was pretty. I bought it in size 9B (W)/ 7 B(M). My daughter wears a size 7.5-8.0, and I am a size 8.5-9.0. The shoe was too long by a thumb and a quarter length for me and even longer for my daughter. I based the purchase on an older croc that was labeled 8-9 and which fit her just fine but touched my toe. I tend to like to purchase a half size up, so I ordered the 9. Because the length was too long, the ankle strap was useless. The width was too wide for my medium width feet and extra wide for my daughter's narrow feet. If you are a size 8.5-9.0 like me, I'd order a size 8. But beware that the width will still be big in general and especially for folks with narrow feet. The little nubs in the shoe were more pronounced in the toe area and hardly felt in the other areas of the shoe. I have flat feet, and the shoe did not have any arch support which works fine for me since my feet tend to hurt when shoes have significant arch support.

review_title: The bumps inside hurt my feet
review_text: Just got these classic crocs  today. When buying I didn't know they have bumps inside‚Ä¶ and they are hurting my feet.  I guess it's  ok to put them on and go out with the garbage but I wouldn't go for a walk.

review_title: Hard as a rock with a much thinner heel than it looks
review_text: I needed a pair of house shoes with good support since I recently was diagnosed with plantar fasciitis. I had a pair of knock-off crocs that I bought at a flea market for years that I absolutely loved but ended up wearing them through. I thought I'd just go with the real Crocs this time since the others didn't seem to have a brand on them. These are so disappointing compared to them! The knock-offs had a firm, yet cushioning sole that was a good height off the ground. These basically feel like I'm standing barefoot on a hard wood floor! The heel is much thinner than it looked because the heel dips down on the inside. I will not be purchasing another pair of crocs again.

I purchased a Womens 7 in the Crocs Classic Clog, the size I have worn for years. Earlier this year I had purchased a leopard print Croc in a Womens 7 which was small.  I just assumed the Classic would fit as it always had. I liked to wear Crocs in the house or to go out with the dogs in the backyard, as they were easy to slip into. I'm disappointed that they don't fit like they used to. (My old pair, a Women's 7, that I have to throw out was much more comfortable.)  The way the straps are attached, they don't go all the way to the back of the shoe, so you are losing almost 3/4 of an inch.  If you use them like a clog, they fit okay.  I guess I would have to buy an 8, to wear the strap in the back, but I think it would be too big otherwise.

review_title: I question whether these are true Crocs.
review_text: I use an insert for Plantar fasciitis and fallen arches. These "crocs" are more shallow in the foot area than the real crocs, and the insert wants to walk itself out of the back of the heel due to the shallow depth. I question whether these are genuine crocs as they are certainly different. I had to give mine to my granddaughter. The size is slightly smaller, as well as the shallowness of the food area.

Said order to size and was wrong. All my shoes and boots are 12. Should have ordered 11‚Äôs as was very loose, even with heal strap. Should have know to go down a size like flip flops as need perfect fit toe to heal, not extra room like regular footwear. Seemed very comfortable and supportive otherwise. Returned and awaiting new pair in different size.

review_title: How do they get the sizes so wrong?
review_text: I have an old pair of Crocs Freesail in size 8 that fit perfectly. I can't find the Freesail on Amazon/Zappos so I tried the Classic Clog. The Classic Clog in size 8 is huge -- feels like a 9 or even a 10. Since I'm normally an 8.5 Wide, it makes no sense to me that a size 8 would be so large. And yes, this was Women's 8 in the Crocs.

I wear 9.5 to 10 USA shoe size. Got a size 10, and it was way too big. Returned for a size 9, and that is too big as well. The size 9 is too long and wide. Not at all a nice fit. I plan to use when kayaking and I‚Äôm afraid they could slip off too easily. I suppose I should return these too and try a size 8. This is why I am hesitant to buy shoes online.

I recently bought a pair of white Crocs from a Crocs outlet and I find them really comfortable. I decided I wanted a second and so I bought a pair from here.When They came I immediately noticed the holes were in different places (not a big deal), but once I put them on I realized not only were the holes in different places, the foam was a lot less responsive and overall uncomfortable.After inspecting the sole of the Croc I saw that this pair was manufactured in Vietnam while my first pair that I bought in the actual store was made in China.Ultimately, they look pretty similar and I'm wearing them as slides around the house anyway. I'll give them two stars, but would not recommend anyone purchases from here. If you want Crocs go to the store, or Crocs.com.

review_title: The material is NOT the cushy comfortable foam that I had hoped for - it is ...
review_text: These are not the "same ol' thing" that I was hoping for.  The material is NOT the cushy comfortable foam that I had hoped for - it is much less rubber-y and much more plastic-y than the old ones and the sizing is also way off.  In comparing the two, the new ones are about a half inch shorter in total length than my old ones of the same size.  I had another pair that I purchased about a year ago--same problem, but gave them away in hopes it was a fluke batch. Apparently not and I have returned the shoes and am searching for a replacement--anyone know of any OLD stock Crocs for sale?

Product described as garnet, which is a deep red, but these are not a deep shade of red, they are plum. Crocs seems to have a problem with reds. Their red is pink, their pepper is orangish, and their garnet is plum. All I want is a solid Coca-Cola red, or a dark shade of that. Gimme a real red and I'll buy 20 pairs!

review_title: dont think they are real crocs
review_text: I placed an order they were to small so i returned them for a bigger size and they are still to small. I have another pair that i purchased at the crocs store and they fit great, compared to these i don't think these are real crocs, would not recommend. Better to just spend a few more dollars and get originals.

They‚Äôre a little wide, even on my wide feet. The color is not what is pictured. They are truly cantaloupe-colored, as the name says. But I went by the image and thought they were more honey-colored. I wanted to return them, but Amazon was going to charge me $7 for the return, even though it says free returns. So I Zan keeping them. Other than those issues, they are great.

Bought a size up like I normally do with crocs. But these are tight. I font know if they shrunk in transit or just made smaller than all my other ones that are the same size. I love the color!! Just can‚Äôt wear socks with them and have had a few blisters on top of my foot. Order a size up than what you normally would

review_title: Think I need 8 1/2. Now need to re order size 9! No response from seller om seller!
review_text: First got size 9. Too big. Size 8 seems way smaller than the older pair I have of size 8. I‚Äôve tried contacting the company & they aren‚Äôt responding to me. I‚Äôm EXTREMELY DISSAPOINTED IN THIS PRODUCT TRYING TO GET A PAIR THAT JUST FITS ME. NOT EVEN GETTING A RESPONSE FROM SELLER IS EVEN WORSE NOT MAKING ME WANT TO RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT TO ANYONE! No support from this company!!

review_title: Not like the old Crocs and that's a shame.
review_text: I was happy to see Crocs available again and was looking forward to my new pair.  Unfortunately these shoes are too small and don't have the nice thick sole that was previously available.  The straps were also way too large on these and though I don't normally use the straps it did make me question the overall quality. I ordered my original size (11M) and am not convinced a size up would be better

review_title: Bumpy sole, difficult to walk on.
review_text: Would not recommend. These used to be cheap and good. Not they are expense and low quality. The soles have small bumpy indentations that perhaps we supposed to massage your feet? I actually found them painful I guess one could wear socks to soften the rub. But the whole point of it is to wear them in the summer without socks. So whatever. Not impressed. Returned them.

It's SO UNCOMFORTABLE. I got these to bathe big dogs at work and then change into my regular shoes but they're SO friggin uncomfortable. I HATE them. How some nasty plastic can be 40 friggin dollars is beyond me. I bought rocket dog rainboots and those keep my feet super dry. These burn your feet and feel like the little pokey things stab your feet. HORRIBLE!

So I ordered two of these, identical shoes in the same size, just a different color. We went camping and left both pairs in our trailer to come back and find the blue pair shrunk BADLY. All I can think is that it was from heat but they were right beside the other pair. I can't even get my foot into it anymore, but the pink pair is fine. Rather BS for a $38 product.

review_title: Bough Men's 10/Women's 12. The shrunk and got misshaped within a few hours of wearing outside.
review_text: We have been buying Crocs for years for the whole family, and this is the first time we hand this kind of issue with Crocs. This pair shrunk really bad (I am a Women's 7, and can't get my feet into this Men's 10/Women's 12). They also got significantly misshaped, as you can see in the pictures. Do not buy.

These are great shoes but if you order a men's size 11 what you get says size 11 but in reality it is really a size 10 so If I were you order the next size bigger, it will feel and fit better. I can wear the size 11 but without socks, not with socks too tight. It's time that shoe manufactures set a size standard on all shoes.

Much smaller than usual for Crocs. I purchased the 7 women‚Äôs which has always given me plenty of room since I‚Äôma size 6.5, but with these, my toes are pushed to the end of the shoe which is a bit uncomfortable. Not only are my toes hitting, but they are hard and not the typical squishy feel of Crocs.  No bueno!

Not happy I ordered 6 pairs of Crocs for my family. My black pair says made in Mexico and after 1 day of wearing them they are creased, peeling and the bottom wore down. Next rto my purple pair I have worn everyday for 2 weeks straight,  they say made in Vietnam and they are great not worn down at all not creased not peeling. When I put on one of the purple and one of the black to see the difference the black is way thinner then the purple and are not near as comfortable. Pissed that I spent my money on fake Crocs.

review_title: Strap broke in the first two hours of wear!
review_text: I got these so I could have a black pair. For wearing to church where I am the pianist...I wore them for the first and only time two days ago and the strap just...broke. I was just sitting there and the strap gave way! Not very well made, me thinks! I am expecting to be given a second pair as a replacement. If the next pair breaks like this, no more crocs for me.

review_title: The instep was so low I couldn't get my foot in.
review_text: I bought these a size too big to make sure there was plenty of room.  The instep was so low I couldn't get my foot in far enough to put my heel on the shoe.  A pair of scissors fixed that but of course now they look like crap.  I won't be buying Croc brand shoes again.  Why did Airwalk go out of business?

review_title: Harder than other models and no refund on return
review_text: Fit is good for size 11.5 in tennis shoes and 12 Nike running. These were harder than the rugged but never got money back when returned immediately after I chose the rugged model. What a scam. Not going to renew Prime or buy from Crocs. Too many choices now where I don‚Äôt have to waste time chasing down a return for $40.

review_title: Broken strap after ONE WEEK ‚òπÔ∏è Dissatisfied
review_text: Being a Croc wearing family, purchased these as a Christmas gift for my brother in law. Purchased the gray in men‚Äôs 15 (he has big feet!)  gave them to him Christmas Eve- he wore them daily in/outdoors for one week....strap on left foot broke on New Year‚Äôs Day!!!! I have never had a strap break on my 4+ pairs! Totally disappointed and bummed for my gift! Now he has to wear them with the strap forward....again totally disappointed with this- especially being Croc brand
These were supposed to be a gift but their ripped in a lot of places and have a lot of hair on them like wth !!?!!??

Warning, despite having this exact pair from a Crocs store, this pair arrived very small for the labeled size. My son loved his last pair so I ordered one size larger for his growing foot. They arrived and actually measure smaller than his last pair. Took them to a Crocs store because the difference was so shocking. Sales associate at the Crocs store was perplexed as to why they were so off. They are a pain to return because they arrive in nonreusable plastic shipping envelope.

The crocs were used but not marketed as ‚Äúused.‚Äù The crocs have noticeable wear on the bottom of the soles indicating that someone else has previously worn these crocs. The bottoms were very dirty and the rubber was worn down were the heel strikes the ground. The tags were in the bag, but ripped off from the crocs. Very disappointed.

review_title: Loved them for the month she wore them...
review_text: and then the plastic piece broke... for no apparent reason. I'm wondering if Crocs stands behind their product, if we attempt to send them back to them directly...??I purchased these the end of November to give as a Christmas gift. She wore them until Feb 1st, the weekend of her volleyball tourney and they broke. No unusual use other than typical wear! That's pathetic! We would love some help with this matter...but that's doubtful.The shoe is fine, it's the little black things that hold the strap. It just snapped making it impossible to fix. Frustrating!

Unhappy customer!The shoes in the advertisement photo showed ‚Äúmade in Mexico ‚Äú BUT the shoes they sent me said Made in China.I DONT BUY ‚Äú made in China‚ÄùFalse advertisement, let‚Äôs see if they respond!I don‚Äôt trust china not to put harmful chemicals in other companies products.They have no moral code. Yes! They!

My husband had surprised me with a pair of this style Clog in black, so I ordered a pair in navy. After mis-ordering one size larger, I just received the correct size that I assumed would fit as my original black Clogs do. Unfortunately, this latest pair is 1/4 inch shorter in length, which results in my toes/toenails touching the end of the front portion of the shoe.CAUTION! Be sure to try both shoes on and walk around carpeted area to make sure there is adequate space before disposing of box/packing.

review_title: Returned first pair - Second Pair a little tight for a wide foot
review_text: The first pair had the heel loop come off. The plastic part which secures the loop to the shoe came off. Luckily this was after just 5 minutes. Check this part first before wearing it outside. Other than that the second pair arrived and seems to work well. This are my first Crocs so we will see how much I like them as time goes by. Note - I usually wear a Wide shoe and the 11 M seem a bit tight when I wear socks. The similar Crocs offered on the Crocs website say that they are roomy, but I beg to differ and these same shoes don't seem to be.You might try a larger size if you have a wide foot. Note - if I don't wear socks the Crocs are fine - so I guess it depends on how you are going to wear these. If you plan to wear them with socks, get a larger size. On the beach, these would be perfect for me.

I am a size 9.5-10W in normal shoes, but I already have a pair in a different color that are a size 7W that pretty good but I wanted a pair that had a tad bit more space so I ordered a size 8W. The size 8W was drastically smaller than my size 7M so they are the exact same size as my feet and hurt to walk in. I still gave this product 3 stars because the color is exactly as shown they were a really nice bright white and they seemed to be good quality also one shoe was distributed from Mexico and the other China so that could be a part of the problem, but US sizes should be made the same from all their distributers until they have an option to choose which country we can order from.

I use to have a pair in the military that got worn out decided to rebuy a new pair after 5 years the new pair does not fit the same as the old ones did these are loser than my older pair even though they say they are mens size 10. My old pair i never had to use teh strap to keep my foot in place the new pair i do, maybe i should have ordered a size smaller or maybe croc need to look at where these where made.

review_title: Maybe the older ones were better
review_text: I so much wanted to like these as in years ago I heard they are extremely comfortable . The larger sizes were hard to find so I never got a pair till seeing them on Amazon I  first ordered a size 15 and it was about two inches too long. I returned them and then got a size 14. They seemed to be the right length but made my left foot very sore from rubbing a toe. I had to return them also. The return process was quick.

Ordered one size up from my women‚Äôs 9/men‚Äôs 7 Crocs for my son (mine were just a bit short). The difference was more like three sizes up!  SOOO wide. And much longer. Like boats on his feet. Both were classic crocs. Not sure why such a difference in going up one size. Returned them.

I have another pair I bought from Crocks and they fit great. So I decided to buy another pair from this sight. They look great but these say they are made in China and they rid my foot raw on the outer arch area. I‚Äôm not sure why these say they are made in China and my original ones are from Vietnam.

I have two sets of Crocs I've been wearing for about 10 years and they've been great. They're the only shoes I wear, year around. I love them. Or I did. Recently, I ordered two new sets (black and brown) and they're too small. Very small. They're the same size as the two sets I've been wearing, but they don't fit the same. I wear a size 8 wide and the Crocs size 8 has been perfect. Unfortunately, I've worn them so I can't return them, but if I were to purchase more I'd get a size larger. I hope as I wear these two, they'll loosen up.

Fits small with the back strap -- my toes hit the front. Not squishy or comfortable. Has all these tiny bumps along the bottom that I dislike and my feet feel weird from them after I take them off due to them (kind of numb). I don't understand what's so great about these.

We all love crocs in my family but this time the pair that was marked as a Men‚Äôs Size 8/Women‚Äôs 10 felt more like a Men‚Äôs 7. I compared them to the other pair my husband already had for years and these were clearly smaller. I don‚Äôt know if it depends on the country was made in, these said Made in Mexico and the old ones Made in Vietnam. I just returned them for a Men‚Äôs Size 9.

review_title: "Roomy Fit" according to actual product label, not according to description
review_text: These shoes arrived in a plastic "Crocs.com" clear bag, no box. The shoes look new. The label on the bag says, "Classic slate grey roomy fit 10001-ODA Unisex m10/w12 Made in Mexico" There was no choice selection when ordering for width. These shoes are way too wide. Would not recommend. Very disappointing.

review_title: Do not leave in the sun
review_text: I was never a fan of the look. I bought some for boat shoes. I am a fan now. Pretty comfortable and easy to slip on when needed. However, I left mine in the sun one afternoon and the fit completely changed. No longer comfortable on my feet. So caution everyone, the sun will shrink them! This wasn't dashboard, summer heat, nor Arizona searing exposure, just Wyoming summer afternoon. These are priced more affordably now too, so that helps.

review_title: They were NOT size 6 shoes for real. I ...
review_text: They were NOT size 6 shoes for real. I normally wear a 5 1/2 and this size 6 was so small my feet touched the end of the shoe and NO they are not a classic clog as the classic clog has a wide front. This shoe has a narrow toe section and that also made them too small. Unfortunately, because I have moved and could not get them to the post office, I cannot send them back.

I purchased 3 pair of these for quick trips out of the house, walking the dog, getting the mail, etc. When left on the porch outdoors they shrunk up significantly to the point where they no longer fit anyone except my young son. Material issue, disappointed given the brand and cost, wouldn't purchase again.

review_title: seems like the crocs have changed
review_text: I have always bought the Clog Classic Croc , because I have a wide foot.  They are the only Croc that has the roomy fit.  For some reason, they weren't as roomy as the Croc Clogs that I have been buying, and size for not the same. Seemed like a regular fit, not roomy.  Had to return them.  I normally wear a size 6 1/2 so I order a 7, usually that is a good fit.  I think if I went up from a 7 to an 8 that would be too big.  Disappointed.

Overall our order of these crocs was good but these specific men's pair was defective. My husband wore them a handful of times and even though they say waterproof and good for outdoors (to an extent) they shrunk up so much in the heat that they are now unwearable.

review_title: BE CAREFUL THEY SEND OUT WRONG SIZES
review_text: BE CAREFUL WHEN ORDERING FROM THIS COMPANY‚Äî‚ÄîThey are ACTUAL CROCS and THE PRICE IS CHEAP BUT I ORDERED THESE FOR MY DAUGHTER‚ÄôS BIRTHDAY, I GOT A SIZE 7 IN WOMEN‚ÄôS AND INSTEAD RECEIVED A SIZE 8 IN MEN‚ÄôS WHICH IS A SIZE 10 IN WOMEN‚ÄôS??? VERY AGGRAVATED!

review_title: Fit is a little shorter than usual
review_text: There seems to have been a cut-off when production was moved from one country to another where the molds changed.  My first pairs were just L.  Now they are trying to base it on the shoe size.  I wear a 10.5 normally.  When I ordered the 11, they were 1-1.5 inches too long.  I had to send those back to get the 10.  Now these are a little short and rub against my heel.  I'm so bummed that I can't find the size I had before since I wore those so much I literally wore holes in the bottoms and had to replace them.  The good news is that they are wide enough for my foot.  (All sizes mentioned are women's)  I don't love these as much anymore mostly due to the sizing- but if you can get them in the right size you will love them.

review_title: We all have crocs and they are all different sizes
review_text: The size 7 fits like the 8 and the 8 fits like the 9.  Almost no difference.  Normally we can't wear each other's shoes, but here we can and for the 9 they are all too tight.  and for the 8 they are all a little tight.  So essentially they are all size 7.

Everyone in my family has been wearing Crocs for years and never had an issue with sizing. When my kids start to outgrow their Crocs, I just buy them the next size up. I purchased the 7/9 size in black and they run about 2 sizes too small. My son‚Äôs pair of 6/8 are actually bigger than these. Ridiculous! Very disappointed child at Christmas.

Got my new set of crocs today. I will be using them as work to home shoes, so I don‚Äôt have to put my dirty work boots in my car. Both of the crocs are marked as a men‚Äôs 10, but the left shoe is absolutely a size or more larger than the right. If I was wearing these for any other reason it would be a return issue for sure.

My husband had a size 9 that fit perfect until they shrunk from sitting out in the sun.  These size 10's were HUGE.  No way were they just one size difference.  We love crocs and will buy in store where they can be tried on

I ordered my regular size a men‚Äôs 5 women‚Äôs 7 as I open the box I realize they looked kind of small so I check the bottom of them to make sure it‚Äôs a woman‚Äôs five because it looks like kids shoes sure enough it said women‚Äôs 5 so I‚Äôm not sure what happened...

I'm using these as house shoes mostly. I am supposed to always have shoes on after an injury.The strap is too short and makes the shoes too small. I sometimes buy half a size up on shoes but it was recommended to size down for half sizes so I bought for my standard shoe size. The insides are textured with very high bumps that is painful to bare feet or the thinner socks I wear most.I'm rather disappointed. I wish I had just gotten the knock offs from Walmart.
