Love crocs but not a fan of this color. Not what I expected and have seen in other pictures. too shiny. Also bottom says made in Mexico? My other three pair say made in Vietnam. Not sure if these are legit**reached out to croc and they said as long as says ‚ÄúCrocs TM‚Äù they are legit and can come from China, Vietnam, Nicaragua and Mexico.  Also verified that amazon is their partner, So I feel better about being legit.

My second toe hits the end of the shoe. The color is beautiful - very bright. The insole is all nubby - I like the massaging feel of the shoe. My daughter , who was thrilled with her pair, ordered these for me, but I didn't open it until later and now I can't return them because it has been 30+ days.:(

Decent shoe for walking the dog. It is very grippy which is nice in the rain if I'm not wearing socks. Very unstylish. Very easy to slip on and grab the mail or something outside.Very useful for small outdoor tasks, would not wear in public.

I bought a pair of basic Crocs in black to replace a pair I've had for probably 10 years or more. They are NOT the same shoe! The new ones are MUCH MUCH smaller and very narrow. I am hoping they loosen up with wear, as one reason I loved my Crocs is because I have a wide foot with a high instep.

review_title: Beading inside shoe is very prominent and uncomfortable
review_text: You have to get a larger size than what you normally wear. They have changed from what I had. I had to buy a larger size to accommodate the narrowing at the toe box. Also it quite uncomfortable because of the pointy beads inside the shoes. They‚Äôre more prominent in this pair but because I wore them out I cannot exchange them. Beware of that fact.

They must have changed Crocs which is not a good thing. The last 2 pair I have bought have run smaller although I'm ordering the same size as always and the material is harder and they are No Where near as comfortable as they used to be. This is distressing since I depended on the comfort. I WON'T be purchasing again. Only reason I gave 2 stars instead of 1 is because the color was correct.

review_title: Something not right about the black pair vs others
review_text: Specifically regarding the black pair: they feel harder than the tan pair I bought.  Also, the strap broke off within a few days.  The rivet with the crocodile cartoon printed on it simply fell off.  Are these genuine Crocs or cheap knock-offs?

I believed that when I purchased these croc's that I would be ordering size 7 women's according to their size chart. And the color black. When the croc's arrived they were a size 13 men's but they were black. I called Amazon to find out what happened to my order. I really feel I got the run around with them. They hem-haw about the size and then I was told that they did not come in black. He did tried and give me another type of croc that was suppose to be in women's black size 7. That also was a joke because there was no such number. This is the first time I have had this type of problem with Amazon and I hope that I never do again. I have shopped at Amazon many times before and have never been treated like this before. I suggest if you want croc's some place else.

review_title: Fake product! I Waste my money
review_text: I am given you 1 star because the first week I used them they were perfect, but One of this days I was watering my garden with them on,  after that I left them dry a couple hours outside, but when I came back to them all of the sudden , they were very small!.. like a toddler Size!.

If you buy these don't wear them in water even for a short period. The rivet where the strap melds at the instep rubbed my feet raw. Your feet will sweat in temps above 85 and clammy above 75 and sticky a little bit below that.

These are terrible Crocs. The heals are so low, they won't stay on my feet. I am returning these for a refund. I further asked the manufacturer, Crocs, to recommend a version of their shoes that would match the ones I have. While they were very responsive, they we not able to recommend the correct model, even after I sent them pictures of my current Crocs. I had to do my own research to find a comparable style/version.

review_title: Terrible ‚Äúroomy‚Äù fit for fat feet only
review_text: 3rd pair of crocs returned. Never again. Had this EXACT pr of crocs 2 years ago, fit great. Now ALL crocs are this ridiculously wide ‚Äúroomy‚Äù fit with zero heel support. Way to go Crocs, you have finally ruined an entire product line.

review_title: Not labeled roomy or standard, gamble which you get
review_text: I thought these were original crocs, with the roomy fit so I ordered them. They come and as someone with wide feet these did not fit at all. They were definitely a "slim" fitting croc. I ordered the neon purple and was disappointed with the slimness. Could not wear them. Better to order off crocs website so you know what fit you're getting, as the description doesn't mention what width they are.

Not sure what exactly happened, but I'll try to describe it. Sorry if it would sound weird :)So, first of all ‚àí I ordered Khaki, but received Black color. I actually didn't mind, because black was very good-looking, not dark-grayish, but really black, so I liked it.As for the size, here's where weirdness starts. I initially was happy with the size, it was even a tiny little bit larger than I wanted, but it's good with this type of footwear. Later I felt like it became fit exactly right, so I figured I just "got used to it". Then, after some time (I was happily wearing them for couple weeks, and really enjoyed them), I once found that I literally can't put them on: they are too small. I thought they just deformed a bit because of whatever -- salty ocean water, sun etc., and that they'll get back to normal soon. My wife half-jokingly said that my feet swelled :)Anyway, I tried to wear them for a minute, and it really hurt (I know, I shouldn't have, that was stupid, why would they become large again :)).Anyway, now they are even smaller, I can't even pretend I can put them on. I swear all my other shoes are fine, so my feet didn't swell :)I don't know if this all makes any sense, so I'm putting three stars as a neutral rating.

Our family loves crocs and we have many pairs.  I assumed all crocs are made the same but for some reason these feel smaller and tighter than our other pairs.  Not sure if it is just an off thing or not.  Hopefully they will stretch.

review_title: Size Not Consistent with Previous Same Model
review_text: I had an old pair of Crocs that were the same supposed size as the new pair I ordered (men's size 12). I have a wide foot and the old pair fit extremely well. This new pair (also men's size 12) are significantly smaller and narrower and barely fit my foot. I put the old pair up next to the new pair and confirmed that the new pair is, indeed, smaller and narrower.It's too bad that Crocs chose to change their sizing without letting their customers know. I'm not pleased with this purchase or with the company.

review_title: Wanted to love them but didn't
review_text: Ok, good features, easy to clean, easy to put on,  Bad parts, they are not comfortable and offer zero arch support.You have got to make shoes with a good arch support.  EVERYONE no matter what their age needs some type of arch support

review_title: The bottoms were very smooth and comfortable, but for some reason one of the straps ...
review_text: I have a pair of Crocs I bought at Dicks and wore them to and around Maui, Hawaii.  The bottoms were very smooth and comfortable, but for some reason one of the straps tore and came off so I ordered the pair I'm now wearing from Amazon and they are extremely uncomfortable with nibs so long on the insoles that they hurt and make my feet ache.  Being a diabetic I can't risk the crocs causing problem.  I wondered about the crocs so I took them to an actual croc store in Myrtle Beach and the sales lady assured me they were authentic saying that it depends on what country the crocs are made in as to how the nibs are on the insoles.  She suggested sanding off the nibs with sandpaper saying that is what her Dad did,  The Croc employee was so nice, helpful, and sweet especially when I fell in the store.  She only had one problem:  her name wasn't Amazon.  I wish I had sent the shoes back but for a swap-out but I didn't.  I hoped the nibs would wear down.  They haven't.  In researching this particular order, I discovered the straps on the new crocs are removable, so I am going to look at removing them and placing them on my original pair of crocs.  Croc Corporate is trying to help me and they have been extremely nice just like the Amazon employees with whom I have dealt.  I  guess I am just a balding, fat, Southern old coot who is too set in his ways about what he likes or doesn't.  I look at my wife of 35 years and then at Amazon.  If I was told I had to make a choice between the two, well I just I hope Amazon will be real understanding when I park my motorhome in their parking lot.  Love the place.

Ordered 2 pair, same size different colors.  Blue ones arrived but didn't fit.  Couldn't figure it out since they were both marked with the same sizing.  Turns out, the blue ones shrank or were defective, even the L v R were different sizes from each other.

review_title: Changed design - way too wide now!!!!!
review_text: I bought 2 pairs of crocs and sent them back. The design has changed since the last pair I bought. Much wider fit at the heel and less support. Very uncomfortable!  And very disappointing!  Shame on you for changing a good design!

review_title: Don‚Äôt fit like original Crocs did years ago
review_text: The crocs arrived by Christmas. I could not have the person try them on because they where a Christmas present. What I was the most disappointed about was this are crocs, the same shoes that my children wore 12-13 years ago. I didn‚Äôt see anything different about them other than they are more expensive and now they don‚Äôt fit true to size. My daughter wears a 6-7 in women‚Äôs. I bought the women‚Äôs 7 (37W) and she loved them but she is only able to wear the with the strap up. They are too small if she were to put the strap behind her foot. Disappointed based on the dozen or more I have bought through the years and she is unable to wear them both ways.

review_title: defective heel strap on one clog
review_text: there was a defective heel strap on one of the clogs that caused one foot to fit too tightly.  However, I bought these for indoor around the house use slippers and will not be using the heel strap.

Okay, I just got my first real pair of crocs.  I've been wearing knock-offs for years and have been trying to find more of that brand, but to no avail, so I went with the crocs.  They are rock hard and the soles have little tiny spikes that are not so pleasant!  I wear size 7 1/2, but decided I wanted them a little roomy, so I went with size 8-9 and was surprised that my feet barely fit in them.  I'm dearly hoping they break in because they are really hard and tight on the top.  At least they are super wide (and I have REALLY wide feet, so that's saying a lot!).  Just had to put in my two cents.
Not sure what is up with a Crocs but this pair of size 12's are a little to tight and short? I always wear a 12 in Crocs. Other than the sizing issue they are typical crocs.

These shoes came in an Amazon box, no tags. Which is unusual because I have bought many pair thru Amazon and the come in a bag with the hanger and tags. Makes me question these as possibly fake or used. I will be returning.

review_title: Not like previous models: I feel there is a bar across the heel
review_text: Maybe because of a change of design or foam... I had to order a second pair to make sure I was unlucky with a bad pair, but found the same again:When I stand or walk, I feel there is a hard bar across the mid section of the heel. That makes the shoe irritating for me. I had to return.

The inner sole is too rough to walk in--like cleats in the inner sole, facing skyward, rather that in the sole of the shoe facing downward.  I am a tenderfoot but it is like torture.The attempt is made by making them this way is to keep the foot from sliding around in the shoe box...I guess?
Left in the sun for one day and they shrunk like 5 sizes no kidding they now fit my wife

review_title: but they're just not as comfortable out of the package like my first pair
review_text: There's something about these Crocs that are just different than the pair I had a few years ago. It might be the little knobs in the footbed or something, but they're just not as comfortable out of the package like my first pair. Plus, they're just slightly more narrow. Not so much that it's a problem, and they do give more with time, but it's noticeable. At least to me. I'd probably give this more like 3.5/5 than a 3. I'll kick around in them every now and again I'm sure.

review_title: Day 1 - fine. Day 2 - broken.  ‚ÄúToo late to return, tough luck.‚Äù
review_text: Unfortunately the strap on one shoe broke the 2nd time I wore these. And it says ‚Äúthe return window has closed.‚Äù So I paid almost $30 to wear these durable shoes twice and I‚Äôm apparently stuck with a defective pair.  When did this policy start? Hopefully someone from this company will reach out to offer an exchange.

The pink appears lavender... not what I saw in stores nor what the picture looks like. Obviously crocs and obviously good quality but I had to double check colors available to make sure there wasn‚Äôt a lavender they sent accidentally....

review_title: Sizing not consistent with former Crocs
review_text: Had to return. My husband has worn Crocs for years in a size 10m/12w but this pair in the same size was significantly smaller. His toes hit on the end and comparing then to his old ones, these were probably 1/2" or more shorter and narrower. Also noted, on the bottom of these new ones, is printed made in Mexico, where the old ones show "boulder colorado." Very disappointing. Would not recommend.

If i don‚Äôt wear these with socks my feet just sweat alot. I hate wearing socks, but its gross when I don‚Äôt.I thought the extra vents would help, but in reality not so much. Bummer.Do people wear these mostly with socks in the summer?

review_title: Caved in on the ugly, left  extremely disappointed
review_text: The studs on the sole are very stiff. At first I thought I was being dramatic cause they hurt my feet, but this picture I took was after 5 minutes of wear. I‚Äôm not sure if they‚Äôre fake or defective, but extremely disappointed.

The side of the right shoe had a defect and the rubber split. My husband has had his crocs for years and no issues. I've worn mine around the house for less than a month and its torn on a seem.  I'm soooooo disappointed!!!!!

I have Crocs that are about 10 years old, wanted a second pair.  The size is still visible on the bottom. 7/9.  The new 7/9s I just received are about 1" shorter than the old 7/9 - can't even get my foot fully into them.  Had to return.

review_title: Khaki coloring shown in original ad is NOT the same as I received.
review_text: I purchase these enough that the sizing is what I expected, but for the first time I ordered a different color, the Khaki, and while it looks like the photo to the left of this review, it is not the same color that is shown in the original ad so the color I received is darker than expected, more closely related to the chocolate color than the lighter color I expected.  So this review only gets three stars because of wrong coloring.

I've had a pair of crocs before. But these were kinda tight and narrow on my feet. And the rubber doesn't look like my old ones either, like they have changed the material. Even the pair my daughter has looks different. Probably will not buy these again.

review_title: or it would be best if the buyer of the product can choose the ...
review_text: It seems that the size and toe space is different depending on where the Crocs were produced. The ones from Mexico seem to run smaller with a narrower toe space than the ones from China. This makes it difficult to order because it is not clear as to where the product being sent to me is from, Why should there be a difference in size for the "same" shoe? Are the templates used different in different countries. It may need to be stated in the order guide where the product being sent is from, or it would be best if the buyer of the product can choose the manufacturer of the Croc. All of this is moot if there is still a difference in fit between the same products from the same country much less from Mexico vs China. That's why it is so confusing when I read the critiques of the product where some one would say the size is 1/2 to 1 size larger than stated and someone else says it is 1 to 1/2 size too small. The comparison must also state whether they were discussing a Croc produced in China vs Mexico or where ever.

review_title: It‚Äôs ok, but not what I expected from Croc
review_text: The material it was made of was like cheap plastic from Walmart‚Äôs generic croc-type shoes. I was expecting soft spongy rubber.

review_title: The other pair fits both of us fine. Perhaps one pair is a knock off or ...
review_text: Can crocs shrink? I ordered 2 pairs in the same size and color. One pair for me and one for my daughter. She kept complaining they were too small. When I switched with her they were too small for me as well. The other pair fits both of us fine. Perhaps one pair is a knock off or they somehow shrank.

I am a teacher and I have been suffering with severe pain in my feet, ankles, and knees from walking so much in a day. I figured out that crocs was a great solution and came here to get some more. These Crocs were not soft like a usual pair of Crocs are. The beads in the bottom here extremely hard and rubbed my feet causing them to hurt within minutes of putting them on. It's like Amazon got cheaper versions and put a Crocs label on them. I am very disappointed.

review_title: The key to knowing if they are toxic is a sweet odor emanating from the product
review_text: The sizing on Crocs seems rather variable. Makes it hard to shop them.Also, I once read an article that many cheap shoes and not so cheap shoes are being manufactured with toxic plastics. The key to knowing if they are toxic is a sweet odor emanating from the product. Sadly, this pair had a pungent sweet smell. It's not only the gases which can be harmful to the nose and lungs etc, but also making contact with bare feet is undesirable.

100% sure they sent me the wrong color. I chose pink lemonade put a color closer to neon pink arrived. Also the quality on these aren‚Äôt like the ones in the store..... it‚Äôs not crisp. Like the holes will have 1 mm of extra rubber

review_title: Beware of ladies' vs. Unisex sizing!
review_text: Based on a previously purchased pair similar (but without backstrap) that were a bit snug at the end of the day or on "swollen feet" days, I purchased this, only one size larger. Mistake.  I am SWIMMING in these. I might try them in the fall with socks, but that defeats the purpose of easy rinse off with hose through the holes.  Moreover, since most gardening is done with water, I'll be left with wet, dirty socks each time.  Beware of the difference between ladies', men's, and unisex products.  My former purchase must have been a ladies' shoe (didn't buy online, and there's no indication inside or underneath shoe, just a size number), and these are unisex.  Bottomline, if basing new purchase size on a current pair of shoes, know that unisex is like TWO sizes larger than a current ladies' size.  It would be nice, also, if Crocs would 1.) consider labeling the bottom of their shoes with an L, U, or MN (not just M, or people might think "medium" who didn't know better) before the size number (for ladies, uni, or men) so that  future customers (and current! esp. if received as a gift) know what they own, and equally important, 2.) state how to convert various gender sizing with ordering similar or same shoes--example "Order same size if you want a slightly larger fit, when going from ladies' to unisex."

This really was a bummer. The sizing isn't consistent. I had purchased other Crocs with the Classic clog fit and fit well. This pair ran small and the straps did look a little short that it made my feet roll to the tips of the clogs. I had a much better experience with the Crocs Unisex Specialist Vent Clog. They have a more relaxed fit and the straps neither too short or long.

Unfortunately I purchased these and set them aside while I continued to wear my other garden shoes. I find these short and cut off in the toe box. I can feel my heel pressing on the back lip. Sorry that I am now stuck with them and no option for return...
I know people love these andI know my podiatrist loves them, but they just aren't for me. They were very uncomfortable and hit many delicate spots on my soles in all the wrong places.

I purchase these crocs don‚Äôt buy they aren‚Äôt real and not comfortable at all after wearing  them for a day my feet hurts.. My daughter have a pair she purchased from another store and they are so comfortable.  Don‚Äôt waste your money with this vendor you will be disappointed

I bought these for my mom to wear while she‚Äôs gardening and she left them outside in the sun one day and they shrunk into what looks like a toddler‚Äôs shoe. She wore them less than 2 months before they were unusable. Can not recommend these as even if they fit initially, they shrink significantly in the sun!
I have Croc sandals and love them...but these shoes were not as soft as my sandals are.  Hard as a rock and did not feel good on my feet. I returned them. Very disappointed.

The shoes themselves are fine hence the 3 stars BUT I started with a black pair of size 11 taking a gamble because I wear an 11.5 in all my shoes. They were so large they looked like 13's on my feet. So I thought okay I will return these and get a size 10 which at the time was not available in black just in orange (for colors I liked) so I got them today and my foot barely fits in the shoe my toes are jammed into the front rendering them unwearable. So back they go, not trying a third time.

Cracked and haven't had them a little over 2 months. Seeing as didnt even wear until June wear time is only a month plus. So couldn't return/exchange üëéüò´Bought 2 other pairs from different seller no issues with those.

I read a lot of reviews here before purchasing the crocs. My boyfriend has crocs that I slip on and we both love them so had better get my own! His are comfortable and made in china. Many reviews said the mexican manufactured croc offered less cush, uneven heel straps, and pretend nubs on the footbed. Reviews compared this shoe to the chinese manufactured croc, which was more cushion-y, had even heel straps, and nice nubs on the footbed.Amazon claimed their crocs were Origin: China ( I cut and pasted the last two words from the description of the product in "my orders" section of their website.) I was disappointed when the crocs arrived. The heel straps were even with each other, but at least a half inch shorter than the shoe. The aren't cushion-y at all. The footbed nubs are more like a design. They aren't comfortable, at all, and the heel strap is unusable because it makes the shoe much too small.I wouldn't have bought the shoe knowing it would be from mexico, given the reviews. Apparently they have free returns on some products but it is hard to find if this shoe is one of them. If its not the return cost is half the price of the shoe, so I'm stuck with a mislabeled inferior product.And they aren't even comfortable! So what's the point?In addition, there was trouble with the shipping of this product and two others I ordered at the same time. I've been wasting my time on the phone with generally unhelpful amazon reps for the last three days. The man I spoke with today was extremely helpful, and when I mentioned this to him, he said on the fourth call Amazon directs the caller to a Senior Agent, (aka someone who is helpful) but the calls prior will be directed to someone who is not a senior agent (aka someone who is not helpful). I am always curious to know the whereabouts of the call center, and I feel intrusive asking, but I did ask this time, and the man was in Costa Rica. I'm pretty sure the guy I spoke with yesterday was in India, and I would love to know how many american cents amazon pays him a week. He could be helpful, but he has a lot of "Amazon policies" to stick to which prevented us from getting anywhere.Amazon has lost my favor. We had a good run, though.

I absolutely love the weight/comfort ratio of these shoes!  They're the perfect backpacking shoe to wear around camp and even cross a stream if you need to keep your boots dry.  They weigh nothing but feel wonderful when the boots that have been stuck to your foot for 15mi and 5,000' feel like a million pounds at the end of the day.My only reason for rating this product lower than 5-stars is price.  These have become so popular that they're way more expensive than they used to be.  I can only assume that someone is grinning all the way to the bank on the margins.  I'm certain I've become all too accustomed to cheap products manufactured overseas, but $48 MSRP is lunacy!

review_title: Need a warning label - avoid the sun
review_text: I got these for my husband and he really liked them. Until the day he left them on our back porch and the sun shrank them 2 sizes. They really should include a note to avoid leaving in the sun.

review_title: Not the men's size it says it is
review_text: I wanted to replace an older pair of Crocs with these, but they are not the correct size compared to the size of my last ones. I guess they are a different style and the size doesn't translate as well.  Not a fan, would rather find one like my old ones and the size that fits better (despite being the same number).At least return was easy.
It fit me a little small but still manageable, i left them in my garage a few days and now they shrunk. Like by an inch or so and became so narrow I they look like kids shoes now.
I wear a half size. SO I tired the next size up which was way too bug. Now I am trying one size down. It is OK but for some reason the cut of the toes irritates my third and fourth toe on each foot/

review_title: Material not the same as it used to be
review_text: These crocs seem to be made from a different material than several years ago. The pair I purchased in the past seemed to have more rubber in the material, which was more comfortable and supportive. The new pair seems to be made with a lot more plastic which is not as comfortable.  They also seem to be slightly smaller than my original pair of the same size.

I find the ribbed texture on the inside of the shoe to be extremely unpleasant. The little bumps make every step uncomfortable, and it gets worse with time. I don't recommend these shoes to anyone with sensitive feet.

My first pair of Crocks and it will probably be my last.  Wider than most medium sized shoes. Length is ok.  Don't stay on very well without the heel strap which is not adjustable.  Overpriced for what you are getting.

I love these shoes they are very comfortable but the sizes frustrate me. If you are a half size, sizing down will allow the shoe to only fit without the back strap on and if you size up the shoe will fit only with the back strap on.

review_title: Don't ever buy unisex Crocs for myself
review_text: These unisex shoes don't fit, and I've been trying forever to get a label to send them. I can't because I made a mistake with the white ones(too big) and spent forever trying to get the correct mail label for the black Crocs. What must I say or do to get the RIGHT LABEL? I live 50 miles from the UPS Store. It's not in Washington,NC as your employees INSIST that it is. There's a Mailbox store without the capabilities to aid Amazon's technological way of accepting returns.

review_title: Too big and inconsistent sizing from other Crocs
review_text: Too big and inconsistent sizing from other Crocs

I gave these 4 stars because of the color. The picture looks like a nice cool toned electric purple, but the reality is more like Barney the dinosaur...if anyone remembers that far back in history lol

I'm so disappointed with Crocs - these I got are made in Mexico, and they're so different from my favorites, which were made in Colorado. Those were (and still are, after many years) soft and comfortable. Because of the reviews, I ordered up a size, and they're HUGE. Because I'd thrown away the wrapping, I won't return them, and I might order a smaller size, just to see. But they're hard and shiny - not at all what I want...at least the back straps seem to be the same length, unlike others that were reviewed. I ordered online because the stores are full of other styles that also just don't fit the same. Very frustrating...

review_title: Size difference! But gramps doesn't  want me to send it back! So disappointed.
review_text: I am so disappointed right now. I bought this as a gift for my gramps. So he was so excited when he received the item, used it right away, and then suddenly when we checked the size, it turned out that the other one was bigger (size 11, he's size 10). I know that I can send this back and ask for refund/replacement. But the thing is, my gramps didn't want to do it because it'll take time for us to get the item again. Now, even if I want to send it back, I have no choice but to just let him use a pair of crocks with a different size.
I ordered a woman‚Äôs 9. It says 9 on the bottom but they are two different sizes and  can‚Äôt be worn .  one is at least 2 sizes smaller then The other  Very disappointed
Crocs are supposed to be comfortable but these are quite painful to wear. The massaging insoles are too long. So long they hurt. This is not what I expected, so I had to return them.

review_title: Disappointed that Crocs no longer have consistency in the marking of sizes
review_text: There is no longer any uniformity in Crocs Classics.  I have several pairs of Crocs Classics in size 11W/9M which fit fine.  I recently ordered two additional pairs in the same size, and they are markedly smaller - close to a full size smaller - though they are marked as 11W/9M.  All pairs were made in Mexico, so it is not like different molds in different countries.  There is simply no consistency, and my tendency now would be to NOT buy Crocs online from Amazon or any other retailer but to buy them in a store where I can try them on before buying.  Very disappointed in Crocs as a company for not maintaining uniformity in molds for a shoe that has been around for many years.

review_title: Actual size depends upon country of manufacture
review_text: Recently purchased 2 pairs of Crocs Classic Clogs, both men's size 11, in different colors.  The Red was made in Italy and the Blue was made in Mexico.  The Red Italian fits perfectly, the Blue Mexico is smaller, ok for bare feet but not socks.

Until a couple of weeks ago, I would have given these shoes 4 or 5 stars. However, I found out that if you leave them out in the sun (on a deck, for example), they *shrink*! I can't wear the pair I bought in December, as they no longer fit on my feet. I bought another pair earlier, and loved them. The tread on the bottom had worn down after a couple of years of hard use, so I replaced them with the exact same item. I will still replace this pair with the same thing again, but I certainly will not leave them on the deck when I bring my dogs back in the house..

So I'm not gonna lie, the support on these are pretty good. However, it is very overshadowed by the senesation of countless raised bumps digging into the sole of my foot whenever I walk. It really is such a shame because they'd be so comfortable if they didn't have the bumps. Also, if you have narrow feet like me, this shoe will be pretty wide on you.

review_title: Great shoes...when you get the fit that you ordered!
review_text: I was disappointed in the fit. actually too wide and a little short. I ordered my usual shoe size. Out of three different Croc shoes that I have purchased recently, this was the worst fit. It would help a lot if when ordering, there was more to go on to select a proper fit. Then there is the chance that you did not get the same manufactured shoe as was described. From reading other comments, I feel that my experience in buying  Croc shoe is very similar. Thus my three stars. I love a Croc, when it fits as described. I feel that I will no longer participate in this Croc hunting game in the future. I, unfortunately, do not live near any Croc shoe stores.

I have bought crocs many times on line with great fit. However this time the actual crocs inside the package were a 6/8 instead of the 7/9 that the bag was labeled. Since I had these shipped to my 2nd home where I don't have internet for the info on returning them, they are here starring at me wondering what shall I do with them.I am a croc person and wear them almost everyday ,this is the first time I've had this problem.

I got the crocs and tried them on.  The heel area was my biggest concern because I go to the wound care department at the hospital to get my legs wrapped due to lymphedema issues.  And since they wrap my foot, my heel gets uncomfortable after a while in the wrappings.  So the house slippers that I have don't work out for me.  The heel area was fine, but the length was not.  I am in the process of getting them exchange for a smaller size.  The wideness I will have to take care of that on my own.  With the wrappings on my feet, I will have work on the crocs so that they will fit properly.
I have another pair of Crocs, same exact size, and these are considerably smaller than those.  They hurt my feet.

Why is giving 0 stars not an option? I have purchased 4 pairs in the past 7 weeks for my kids. 3 crocs broke at the straps - . 2 after just a few days of use, the third lasted for 6 weeks. The fourth has been used for about a week. Still working - I give it a few more weeks maybe. So, you tell me, should it be Amazon's Choice? With a 30-day return policy, I was not able to return the pair that lasted for 6 weeks. It cost me  $44. Not happy. I have been buying crocs for my kids for 12 years, no more.
This is the same size as my last pair but the heel band is smaller making the fit very tight. I hope it does not break from the stress on it.
They were too big had to return. My daughter wears an 8 but we should of got a 7. They were out of that size in many of the colors and the ones that were not, were so expensive.
11's sloppy width & length;  10's tight.  product changed from earlier crocs.

These are terrible! Nothing like my other pairs, it felt like i was walking on gravel and left my feet burning and red after i took  them off. Usually crocs feel massaging but the material was way too stuff to feel pleasant, definitely do not buy this expecting them to feel like normal crocs

review_title: One bigger than the other and then not fitting all together
review_text: I bought these as my first pair of crocs, I liked them at first until I noticed one was bigger  than the other .... as time has gone on I noticed significantly that they have shrank to not fitting at all on the left side. I was very disappointed with this purchase.

I purchased these crocs for my 12 year old daughter and she loves them ! We ordered a size up only because I wanted then to fit into the next season and they are actually not to big like we thought they would be

I purchased the white crocs and when they came they were pretty small I ordered a size 8 and it almost didnt fit the other croc on my left foot is also a size 8 that I got somewhere else and it‚Äôs WAY bigger I‚Äôve heard that crocs shrink in the heat and when they came they were hot I don‚Äôt know if that‚Äôs what happened but I would recommend getting a size larger

These are NOT the same crocs you would find on the crocs website or crocs store! I have a pair already that I bought at the crocs store size 8 woman's and the ones I bought from amazon are completely different than the ones I have from the crocs store. I compared them and these from amazon are way bigger, have no arch support and the material is different. I suspect they are the "wide size" because these size 8 crocs are drastically bigger than my size 8 crocs from the store. I would say size down !!

review_title: no half sizes, sole is rigid and hard
review_text: Because there are no half sizes I had to get the next larger size. it was too large. Why can't they be made in half sizes. The sole of Crocs is rigid and hard. So if you need some water shoes with some flexibility in the sole this is not it. I know they have been popular for a long time, but my experience with them was they are not what I expected.

review_title: Chinese Crocs tighter than Mexican made Crocs
review_text: I've been buying Crocs for years, and it seems since they switched manufacturing from Mexico to China, they fit tighter for the same size.

review_title: Wrong size stamped on this pair?
review_text: I already owned two pairs of crocks in size M7/W9, prior to ordering this third pair.  Although I ordered the same size for my third pair, and the size stamped on the bottom says M7/W9, they do not fit like my other two pairs.  They are much shorter in length; so much so, that I cannot even wear them.  They had to be returned.I'm awaiting the arrival of a couple of other colors and hope I do not have the same problem with them.

review_title: Crocs not better that cheaper alternatives.
review_text: These are comfy and cute BUT the snaps that hold the strap break very easily. One of mine broke almost immediately. Some internet postings say that Crocs will replace the snaps but that is not true. Don't pay extra for the Crocs name. It is no guarantee of quality or customer service.
Product arrived broken--- Refund was given within a very short time ---ordered during the tax free weekend and no more are available in the right size and color---

Blisters on the side of my feet after 2 hours of wearing !  Little plastic rivets that hold the straps on stand out and rubs the side of your feet raw ! Reviews are not always right , and i can't find the 40,000 thousand reviews ?

The sizing is ridiculous - it's nowhere near a women's 10 and I can't even squeeze my toes into the shoe.  I'm annoyed that the return window just closed and I've been too busy to pack them up.  Now I'm out $25.  Think I am done with Crocs and will go back to the cheap CVS imitations.
Very disappointed. Arrived with an obvious blemish, Crocs are not suppose to have a blemish.  These might be factory seconds. Crocs need to send me a replacement. Poor quality.
Don't seem to have the quality of real Crocs although they state they are the real Crocs. I like the color but they seem to run big. They are a bit expensive. All-in-all they will do.

The crocs shrunk and caused blisters on the sides of both feet, terrible experience. Did not expect. They fit fine in the beginning, were not tight, but after some time, they became very tight on the sides.  Would like a refund.

review_title: Order 1 size smaller than your normal shoe size.  Ignore the suggested size here on this website.
review_text: They are way big.  I ordered the size suggested here on this website.  Otherwise they are crocs.  If you have ever had a pair, you know what to expect.  If yiu haven't, then crocs are durable and comfortable.  I cannot use the heel strap on crocs, because then the shoes are too inconvenient to remove.  If you walk across lawns or on trails, you will get lots of pebbles and twigs and such in your shoes.

review_title: a solid front would be better. I won't order these again
review_text: Originally ordered the size 10 but it was way too big. Then returned the size 10 for the size 9 and that's a little too tight. It actually is very difficult to wear them with socks. Also the holes in the toes allow dirt and moisture in as you're walking; a solid front would be better. I won't order these again.

I ordered a size 11 because my brother had size 10 that were good but a little snug. When they came they seemed snug but I figured they just need to get broken in.Not the case. They are still smaller than a size 10 after a 3 day weekend of wearing
My daughter has a pair of Crocs same style and these seem to fit smaller. We love the color but feel the sizing did not run the same.

review_title: Good solution but Crocs seems to have a problem with inconsistent sizing.
review_text: I've recently had problems with plantarfaceitis and crocs seem to be an inexpensive solution to the problem. They have a major problem with inconsistency in sizing, however, and their "fit guide" is not particularly helpful. There is not croc store near me so online is the only way to go but it is so frustrating to order two pair of identical shoes and not have them be the same size.  I hate returning things, so much hassle and nothing to show for my efforts, so I am keeping them for winter wear with heavy socks. Wish I could count on consistent sizing and a helpful fit guide.
Was super excited to get these for work and even had them custom painted wore them an hour and the strap broke (can not get it back on) waste of money, will be buying from a store next time.

review_title: A hot day shrunk them into tiny rubber blocks !!!
review_text: These shoes arrived and fit as expected, however last week during a Southern California heat waves, the shoes where on my porch ( along with several other shoes) and they shrunk and curled up . I have never seen a shoe do this, and I have owned other Crocs before . Needless to say they do not fit now and I am 4 weeks past the "return policy " window. Crocs should put a label on their shoes to inform the consumer of this problem>

Purchased the silver Croc and fell in love with them (did not see that coming!).  Sprained my ankle pretty badly a few days later and fortunately had these which were the only shoe I could wear with all the tape and the ankle brace. (Felt fairly stable, too!) Decided to buy some more, so got the khaki. Weirdly tho, the khaki are the same size (per the chart, 10"=9 women)...BUT, the size label on the new package had "roomy" on the size label and the Croc is way larger than the same-sized silver purchased before and had fit just dandy. As I pointed out to Amazon, the "roomy" designation's explanation was nowhere to be found in the description on the web page. Of course (and I may yet do exactly this), I can keep ordering them and hoping I will get a non-"roomy" shoe.  But, it does seem a whole lot messier (more work and time) than the seller being clear about the sizes or at least noting that some of the sizes come "roomy".  Why was there no description on ANY of the Croc shoes I looked at (studied the size chart on every Croc I looked at, so that wasn't the problem) delineating the "roomy" sizing.  It just seems to be common sense.  I know nothing else sized this way and am glad for that.  Imagine a dress or pants that come in a size 9 and a size 9 roomy, but you can't know by the description...  I mean, even then there's designations like "relaxed fit" so you are aware of the difference.

These will probably be great once we get a pair that actually fit. Used THEIR sizing chart and ordered a 7, too small so we went up to an 8 and those felt smaller than the 7!ü§¶üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è So I just ordered a third pair, size 9, so we will see.

review_title: not as high quality as expected
review_text: i‚Äôve owned crocs before and i never remembered them being so flimsy. i‚Äôm not sure if that‚Äôs the right word to use, but these crocs feel like they‚Äôre made of styrofoam. it literally feels like i‚Äôm wearing styrofoam plates on my feet. i know they‚Äôre mainly used as water shoes, but many people also use them before and after sports to keep they‚Äôre sports shoes in good condition. i say for that purpose, that they are good to have in hand, but other than that, i wouldn‚Äôt purchase them.

I Love the slip on and go idea along with their toughness > but they have NO ARCH and KILL MY FEET !!! I only wear them in cases where I don‚Äôt have to put shoes on (to the mailbox, or a quick walk to the backyard).
I had to return due to size.  Return was handled quickly and easily.  I will order in another size because the shoe is well made and perfect for my needs.  Gorgeous color

Unfortunately, I had to return this purchase.  I had ordered a men's size 9, which is is what I received.  Over the past 5 years, I have worn 3 other size 9 crocs of the identical style, and they all fit fine.  With the new pair, my foot was slipping all around and the crocs felt like they wanted to just fall off my feet.  When I held them up to an older pair, I could see that they were about the same length (maybe slightly longer), but they were clearly wider in the heel.  As a matter of fact the heel exterior of the old croc nested beautifully in the heel cup of the new one, but not vice versa.

Shoes fit well, and I believe are helping my heel spurs. The only problem I have is that they have a series of small protrusions over the entire sole of the shoe.  For me it causes considerable discomfort.  Maybe I just have sensitive feet, but I almost can't wear them.  Socks help and time wearing them does too.  Because of the low price I wouldn't send them back.  Again, it might just be my sensitive feet. I guess I'm just disappointed and expected they'd be like wearing pillows on my feet. After thinking about it and looking at other reviews, I've decided to take away a star.  Not that it matters much.

This Classic Croc would have been perfect if the little spikes in the bottom of the shoes weren't there. they make it uncomfortable to walk in because they stick in your feet when you walk. I have to wear socks with the shoes to make it more bearable which defeats the purpose for wanting a cool summer shoe to wear outside.  Everything else about the Classic Croc is okay.
They pull through at the ankle strap connection very easily. This needs to be improved before I would buy again.

review_title: Not sure if they‚Äôre real crocs?
review_text: The inside of the croc is ruff and and actually hurts My feet the groves inside.  when I compared to my other pair of crocs they look quite different in size and the how it feels wouldn‚Äôt  recommend.

These crocs are very different from real crocs! I bought a pair of the same style of the crocs website this week and they were only $5 more than these and are way more comfortable and fit better! These ones are an inch smaller than the real crocs (of the same size too). Don‚Äôt waste your money on these!
I bought this in a white and I was sent a navy blue croc. Kind of disappointed and they fit smaller than expected buy a 1/2 size up

review_title: Disappointed in return fees for defective item.
review_text: Large cut on left shoe. It costs more to return the item than it did to purchase. Sooo I guess I'll just have to deal with it. üò•
I ordered size I always wear and these were way  too short.  They were like kids clogs.Can't return because packaging is gone. Really a disappointment.
Not sure why they put those tiny spikes in the bases. Have to wear socks until they rub down. Have a pair from 15 years ago much better. Quality just not as good as it used to be.
Bad shoe

review_title: no longer Made in USA - Made in China!
review_text: The cayman i received fits fine and works fine.  The details of the moldings, however, were noticeably less defined than the ones i bought last year.  Upon closer examination, i noticed that the words MADE IN USA imprinted on the underside of the crocs on last year's model were replaced with MADE IN CHINA on this year's model.  Perhaps THAT explains the lacking quality difference?  Again it still works fine, but SORRY!  I'm not paying $30 for crocs MADE IN CHINA that look like the cheaper chinese-made knock-offs!  For those, the only things lacking are the cute little croc buttons on the sides.  I'll buy other brands (albeit made in china) for a lot less.

I had tried on my friend pair of crocks and though they were the most comfortable things ever. these not so much for whatever reason. the strap also was too small... i was dissapointed because i really wanted to like them

review_title: Not as comfortable as I thought they would be.
review_text: I anticipated a more cushioned, softer feel. I was expecting to be wowed, but they only decent. Worth the $32 I paid though.

Great product that I thought I would never try and did. They are comfortable and washable. One issue that effects the wear ability and make them stand out as not a shoe. They arrived a pale almost tan color instead of a Chocolate Brown. I would be more inclined to wear them outside of home if the appeared more like a shoe in color.

review_title: 3) I cannot comfortable wear them for more than an hour
review_text: They are disappointing for several reasons:1) The small dimples on the sole apparently intended to prevent feel slipping when the crocs are wet are uncomfortable2) My left foot is hurt on the top when the croc is flexed when walking.3)  I cannot comfortable wear them for more than an hour.Frankly my sandles are far more comfortable.  I tried a size ten croc originally and they were far too long, causing the strap on the back to frequently fall down.  So, overall I am not a happy camper.
The size was supposed to be a 9, in mens, and labeled as such.  However they were so big on my feet I had to exchange them for an 8, which fit a little big but doable.

I will never purchase Crocs online again! I will only be purchasing directly from the Crocs store. These are way too small. I already have a pair of women‚Äôs size 8 Crocs and they fit perfectly. No idea why this pair would be smaller but they were a total waste of money.

I bought a W9 from the croc store and it fits perfect, but the W9 I bought from amazon is slightly smaller and has a tighter fit. So there‚Äôs an inconsistency here. Doubt I‚Äôll ever buy another from here.
At first they were great but after air ik ng in the sun for a day the rubber literally deformed and shrunk making my crocs useless now that they are now a size smallwe

Ran a little small but don‚Äôt wanna deal with sending back. You kind of need to wear socks with them because the wide slots in the front expose the toes a bit! Otherwise they feel nice and will probably hold up nice.

The shoe itself was on sale. There was a defect in one of the snaps where the handle meets the shoe. It would not stay closed. Also, when my foot (which fit the shoe) was in the shoe, it did not look very good on me. They were returned for both reasons. I have had a Croc shoe before (different style), and I can stay all day in them, so I am sure had I kept the shoes, I would have worn them all day. It fits my wider foot just fine. There is a very slight arch support.
These are much more squishier than crocs I‚Äôve bought from the croc store . But other than that I have no complaints

review_title: One shoe has been shrinking to nearly half of the width
review_text: My son with a shoe size of 15 loves Crocs and we by those since years. This year we do have a strange experience after a few weeks one shoe was starting to shrink in the width and this one is now half of the size in the width. The length is still the same but the pair can not more be worn by him. I do not know what to do as Amazon does not offer the box contact the seller

My friend recommended this to me. She brought it 2 months ago. Her label was made in China and my was made in Vietnam. It‚Äôs a little different from hers. Hers was more soft and wider. Feel better than mine. Anyway it‚Äôs was average.

review_title: For $45 buck the tread on the soles should last more than a couple of weeks of intermittent use.
review_text: These are NOT the same quality of Croc's of years past. Literally most of the tread is gone after wearing them on and off for 2 weeks.

These really feel like knockoffs. Classic crocs are made with the small bumps inside to promote circulation in your feet, but these do NOT feel the same as the shoes I purchased directly from Crocs. It almost feels like spikes on the inside rather than the light 'bumps'

review_title: Size 14 is not correct in size/ more like a size 16 or bigger
review_text: Too bad this Croc is sized incorrectly.  I usually wear a size 14 shoe.  While at a local Big 5 I tryed on a size 13 and found that it was too small.  (It was worth a try)  I was excited to find this size 14 on Amazon.  Upon receiving the Crocs I found that they were marked as 14, but were several sizes too big.  I could have left my shoes on and put them inside the Croc.  When I used the printed the return label through Amazon I found that I had to pay the shipping to return them.  I contacted the seller, Surf and Dirt.com, and talked to a helpful customer service rep.  He told me that I would have to ship the item back at my cost and then after examination they would make a determination of whether they would pay shipping.To follow up:  I returned the sandals which were inspected by Surf and Dirt and my money was promptly refunded for the item and delivery.  For customer service I would give a 5.  Unfortunatly the product was way off the mark.

Super disappointed because after one day leaving my crocs in the sun, the left shoe shrunk really small. We have tried all the tricks and nothing seems to work, they are pretty much worthless now. I‚Äôm wondering if these are even REAL Crocs?

Customer service was very good. Shoes arrived as chosen and on time. No issues with the seller. This latest incarnation of crocs, from Vietnam as opposed to Mexico/China/USA,  is substantially shorter in length and somewhat narrower in width. This is my fourth pair and the size difference is readily apparent. If you‚Äôre a half size I would order up to the next full size.

review_title: Cute but got the wrong size
review_text: These are really cute and comfortable to wear on a casual day. But unfortunately I have to give three stars. I got the pepper crocs to gift and when they arrived I didn‚Äôt realize they were the wrong size until the unwrapping! I asked for a size 8 and instead I got a size 6. My mom has trouble fitting into shoes because her feet are kinda bloated, so she‚Äôs need more room to fit in. She say it‚Äôs fine but its disappointing that she can‚Äôt wear her crocs with thick socks because it‚Äôll be too tight.

Too Big! I ordered a Woman‚Äôs 8. They  say made in China on the bottom. They are wider and a size bigger than my other Crocs I ordered from the crocs store. Mine from crocs store are woman‚Äôs 8 made in Mexico on bottom of shoe. And they fit perfectly. Amazon was very helpful in answering my questions about this. They say they are real crocs though.

review_title: No two are ever the same size or shape. EVER.
review_text: Having purchased four pairs, as well as trying on a few different styles at the local Croc's store, it's become painfully clear that the physical size and shape of Croc's clogs varies wildly from shoe to shoe even within the same style (even within the same pair!). Getting really tired of having to exchange these.That said, they are quite comfortable, if hideous in appearance, for most of the two-three months of casual wear you can expect to get out of them before they deteriorate or deform into some unwearable monster that makes blisters.

Inconsistent sizing, at least on those made in Mexico. We were looking for next size up to replace previous pair for a fast-growing teen. The size W9/M7 is identical to W8/M6, both made in Mexico, with the strap being shorter than before. Inconsistent sizing makes it virtually impossible to buy online. This model is called Classic and is supposed to substitute for Cayman, but the sizing is all wrong. The ones made in China seem to run larger, but you do not know the origin of the pair that will be shipped.The actual Crocs store might be currently the best option for proper sizing, unfortunately. The only reason I am reviewing is to spare the same hassle and disappointment to other customers.

review_title: This product came in "roomy fit" the widest fit
review_text: I love crocs and have used them for years.  I just ordered my 3rd pair.  Had to return.  The size that sent was correct in length nut was too wide.  They were the "roomy" fit- crocs widest fit.  After contacting customer service- they told me that they were not able to contact the seller, and that they agreed the size chart does not specify roomy, relaxed, or standard fit.  Too bad.  I will likely shop around to find a seller with the standard width.
These aren't nearly as bright red as advertised.  There more of a tomato orangeish red instead.  I'm pissed I have to waste time sending these back!

Ok first, I looove crocs! I even ordered a pair for myself and they were perfect but this pair that I ordered (for my sister) was completely weird. The pair contained one size 9 women‚Äôs shoe and one size 10 women‚Äôs shoe instead of two 10‚Äôs. It was so disappointing, but I‚Äôm just going to return then purchase again.

review_title: Did not hold up to light use
review_text: Good until they were not. These were a Christmas gift for my daughter. The strap broke two weeks after the return window, just a few months of light use later.

review_title: They rub the instep of my feet raw when walking.
review_text: These rub the instep of my feet raw when walking. I walked no more than a half mile total in them one day at the beach and my feet were red and sore for days after.

I have bought a womans, blue and and mens, black.Both shoes have been worn outside and in the sun to dry.  They have shrunk.  I cant get my foot into them.I thought I wrote about these Sat or Sunday but see no info on line relating.  I thought I might be getting replacements or someone would email me.  Please adviseBarbara Schlauch
They are bootleg they came in a plastic bag that say crocs but I know for sure it should of been in a box like the others we have. They feel real plastic
I ordered these for a gift. I decided to rewrap them before and realized there were 2 different sizes! Would not recommend. Poor quality.

review_title: Okay for city folk, not so good for country folk
review_text: Found the shoes to be rather large, even though they are my size.  Found the sole to be thin--when out walking I can feel stones, etc, through the soles of the shoes.  Like the support the shoes give, and liked the holes along the top and sides.  I wouldn't recommend them for folks who live in the country and walk along rough roads, though.
I'm not sure if these are authentic but I definitely need to size up. I've been buying crocs for years and they've always been slightly oversized. A little disappointed Amazon.

My first pair in the exact same size and color were made in China.  This pair was made in Vietnam and the material was much denser or harder and not as comfortable.  The new pair was also a half inch shorter, despite being the same exact model and size as before.

Bought these for my son and the strap broke after a few days of wear. Disappointed with the quality. Crocs are usually more reliable. I like how they have size 4, as my son is in that in between size of child and adult. Maybe this style isn‚Äôt made for the activeness of a kid.

Bought  the same size that my other two pairs . are, which fit great.  These black ones arrived, looked smaller.  Took out the other pairs, the new black pair where smaller, over half an inch shorter, and narrower. The size that is on the bottom is the same as the other two pairs. I would return, but took to long to find black. Not sure what size to order now, since their molds have changed.
Love crocs...but....I put my size in 10m/12w but it ran larger. All my other crocs I have is of that size and fits nice. Maybe order a size down or a more better fit.

review_title: Not the same quality as in the past
review_text: I have ordered Crocs before (about five years ago) to wear outside while working in the yard. They are great for that purpose - when you get ready to go back in the house you can simply hose them off. My old Crocs had worn down to the point where they were so smooth they could be slippery on a concrete floor, so I decided to order these . Since I loved the old ones, I tried to get the exact same shoes. My old ones were made in Mexico so I ordered the ones that were also made in Mexico in the same size.  The new ones were a lot stiffer and somewhat smaller. I can still wear them but they aren't as comfortable or as well made as the old ones.

You know, these look like Crocs.  Beyond the fact that they are cosmetically blech, being chunky and rubber, they are absolutely the most comfortable thing to wear.  I purchased these as house shoes, and have been enjoying the lovely squishy insoles.  I would not recommend these for any style purpose, and I don't think I will ever wear these out of the house, but they are soooo much more comfortable than flip flops.  For beauty, I would purchase another Croc style, but for just bumming around the house, this style was the best price.

review_title: Sharp points feel like needles on the bottom of my foot.
review_text: My old ones had little nubs on the bottom. I. Do not like the new pointy bottoms. Not comfortable at all.  Won‚Äôt be buying this style anymore. I might try the another Croc with the lite red bottom. It looks smoother.

Fit well however the subtle tangerine color I was hoping for is more like reflective traffic cone orange , attracting that much attention to my crocs wasn‚Äôt really what I was going for. Also my husbands pair was significantly sized wrong , I couldn‚Äôt even get my size 8 foot into his men‚Äôs 10.

review_title: Claims to fotnwide feet; does not
review_text: I picked this particular style because it was supposed to fit wide feet better. Not the case. My boyfriend can't even put his entire foot inside the shoes, so they have become the quick pair of shoes he slips on as far as he can to take the dogs out. His heel hangs off about 2" past the back of the shoe.

review_title: Returned the product but can‚Äôt get my refund
review_text: I returned this item April 23,2020 but still can‚Äôt get my refund.  I have my receipt for the return.  The shoe was too small. Does not fit true
I needed size 11 and I order a size 11 women's that is size 9 for mens and the package was not even open but sent back my mistake I didn't read the direction good enough or correctly.

I ordered three pair of crocs, all with the holes as seen, in three colors. Of the three, this was the only pair that more or less fit my feet. The other two pair were far too tight across the instep (top of the foot) and I ordered bigger than I should have needed. I'd ordered these because friends and co-workers couldn't say enough good things, but I'm not convinced at all. I'm returning the other two pair.
First pair: strap broke after wearing for han hour. Second pair: one size smaller & the strap is ¬Ω" too small. Both pairs made in separate  countries.  üò°

But was traveling and ended up leaving them in my car one day and the left one shrunk (significantly more than the right one). Went back and read some more reviews about this to see if it was maybe a fluke.. nope. Saw some other reviews about same thing happening to theirs. They have a very awkward/small fit now.
I love croc's and with just the two of us at home we probably have 16 different ones. However, the two pairs that we bought this time for our granddaughter did not show up. Very sad.
I hadn't purchased Crocs for a few years since my first Crocs, and I have noticed a bit of a quality difference since the first pair of Crocs.
Two different size shoes were shipped. These were for a Christmas present and it was past shipment date to send back. Disappointed to say the least.

review_title: Not sure of originality!!!! Very dissatisfied
review_text: Shoes arrived, nice color. Tried them on and realized one shoe is slightly larger than the other despite them saying it‚Äôs the same size. Plus the hanger that comes with them say Size 11 and the Shoes both say size m8/w10.
My  bad, I thought I was buying this from a place in the USA (TEXAS) TURNED OUT it came from Europe, didn't catch the part about having to spend so many euros for free shipping  ,live &learn
The selection said women's 10/men's 8, but the shoes were way too big.  I had to send them back.
First off, buy (2) TWO sizes smaller then your tennis shoe size.. Then, if you have an arch in your foot, They‚Äôre going to kill you as they have zero arch support..
:( they‚Äôre too big ! And I ordered half a size smaller . (I‚Äôm usually an 8.5 ) ordered an 8 an they‚Äôre too long

review_title: need to order one size smaller
review_text: 11 US men's is what I usually wear, need to reorder this pair at size 10. Great to wear around the house as slippers, but not sure footing is secure whilst dodging a cab or exiting quickly a robbery in process.

review_title: Men's and Women's size do not  work for me
review_text: I ordered these in my size but it seems crocs will not fit my narrow feet.  The just fall off, they are so wide.  Luckily, the fit my husband or I would have returned them.

review_title: Crushed in packing making it irritate foot
review_text: The product would have fit fine if the way it was packed was different.  One of the Crocs was bent in at the inside of theshoe.  This has caused it to irritate my foot.  I have tried to unbend it to now avail, to wear it with socks in hopes that would unbend it to no avail and finally take it to the cobbler who said he could not do anything for me.  The rubber is bent to stay.I didn't return it when I received it because I thought it would eventually unbend with my help.  It has not.  I will try something else to fix this as it doesn't seem cost effective to return for the price and have to pay for return shipping.  This is the first time I have written a review and the only time I have not been happy with an Amazon product and I make a lot of purchases on Amazon.  Stuffing the inside of the Crock to keep its shape would have made a difference.

so this product is what I was expecting except for the size. it said 13 women/11men, due to the fact that this style is unisex. well, the product I received was size 13 men's. I needed a size, 11 men! unfortunately, the product comes from overseas so to return it it would have cost me more than 2x the original price!
I have had a pair of Crocs for years and it never squeaked....I just ordered three from Amazon and the black pair squeaks.  Didn't wear until after return timeframe had expired......

review_title: Order smaller than your actual shoe size!
review_text: Ordered these just as a little joke, but I have worn them multiple times because they are very comfy. Unfortunately the sizes either run big, or I just ordered wrong. I ordered a size 10 and they are very, very big on me but the strap on the back does help hold them on pretty well which is the only reason i did not return them and exchange them with a different size. If you want to order these and are not sure what size to get, an example of my shoe sizes might help. I wear a mens 9 in converse, mens 9.5 in adidas, and mens 10 in vans. Hopefully that helps you understand what size to purchase.

review_title: Sadly, these didn't work out for me.
review_text: Unfortunately these don't fit my feet and I'll be returning them. I think the problem is that they are a Unisex style which may be wider than a normal ladies medium would be. Also, when trying to use the strap to keep them on my feet, my toes were shoved into the toe of the shoe which was painful when trying to walk.Other friends and family members love their Crocs, I'm just the unlucky one.
If you have skinny feet, these are not for you. I could almost fit both feet into one shoe. Sent them back and the company was great to work with.

I wear these around the house, and have ordered 4-5 pair of these, all the same size.  The pair I just received are at least two sizes too big, despite being the 'correct' size I've ordered previously.  They also feel completely different.  Where all of my previous Crocs feel like rubber/foam, these feel like slippery plastic.These also appear to have been made in Mexico, whereas my other pairs have Made in Italy on the bottom.  Perhaps that's the difference, they are clearly different and that's unfortunate.

review_title: I got sent a knockoff and it didn't even fit
review_text: First of all, they sent me a knockoff instead of the real thing. I know this because it did not have the picture of the alligator on the black pin, on the side. Also, I wear a size 9.5 and I got a size ten and there was about a 3/4-1 inch of space between my heel and the strap. The shoe itself seemed to be very poorly made as well. There were pieces of the croc that were starting to peel off.

I've bought several pairs of crocs off of their website and consistently wear a women's 7. This Crocs which I purchased from amazon were WAY too small, the whole pattern was different, and over all didn't look like a real pair. at least the color was right.
I wear a size 8, but the shoes were too small in this size. I had to buy a size 9 and the fit is better.

I have size 13 (men's) crocs that are wearing out.. When these size thirteen Crocs arrived I though that I'd been sent the wrong size. On the sole they showed 13, however when I held then sole to sole with my current size 13's, they were an inch or so shorter.Obviously I returned then.I guess I'll have to go 18 miles to the "local" show shop that stocks Crocs to be sure to get the correct size, as Crocs are really good footware for me.

review_title: Ok but not buy any more
review_text: They are ok fit good but don't like that the in sole is not smooth it is like walking on little stones

review_title: Pretty on the site not in person
review_text: Size fits comfy and roomy. If you wear a half size go up. Color looks better on the website than in person
Not comfortable whatsoever, fits super loose and even gave me some nasty blisters simply just walking around in the backyard.

I have a few pairs of crocs that I have gotten from different places. I got 2 pairs from Amazon and they fit considerably smaller than the other two pairs I got at an actual store. The ones I received from Amazon are a lot tighter and not as "roomy." I still wear them, but am disappointed that they don't fit the same as the others I have.

I ordered the exact size that I have been wearing for years.  I thought they looked smaller, but figured that the old ones had just sort of stretched out and sagged a bit, but then I compared the length of the sole. Definitely a difference in size.  I'm wearing them for yard work, as I did my old pair, but not sure if that's a great idea, given that they are a little small.  They are soft, so they are not uncomfortably small.Keep in mind when you order that they may be smaller than previous shoes of the same numbered size.

review_title: Appear to have been sold irregulars
review_text: I've always been a Crocs fan and was ready for a new pair.  I bought two pairs around black Friday when they were on sale and they appear to be irregulars. The pair I got, the heel on the shoe is misshapen/deformed and the support band is quite a bit shorter/tighter on that same shoe, making it a bit uncomfortable. The other pair I purchased was not bagged or on a hanger and had scuffs all over, possibly a return. For the price, I'm not too upset but still - I've never gotten this low of quality from Crocs before, and would be much happier with a pair that fit correctly.
Too big and no prepaid return slip so $30 shoes would cost over $100 to ship back to Great Britain ‚òπ
I read the reviews about the Crocs running small but I decided to get my original size anyway. They were too small. I‚Äôd suggest you order at least one size up.

Crocs should go back to making their crocs like they used to years ago.  I do not like the new composite material used and they run small.  These are no where near to the quality of my old pairs and the size runs small even though I ordered the same size as my old ones.  C'mon Crocs - you can do better!

Crocs were way too big even though they said size 9 on the bottom. They were also the wrong color, more a greyish brown than chocolate. Tag said ‚ÄúExtra Roomy‚Äù even though I thought I was getting classic fit. Not like my old pair at all :-(
Disappointed that these Crocs are much smaller than my previous purchase of Crocs that are supposed to be the same size.

This is the first shoe I have ever purchased that didn't have an insert.  I am 74 years old, so I have purchased many shoes in my life.  I want to use these for gardening, but will never purchase Crocs again.  I shouldn't have to supply anything to make the shoe complete!
The right croc is wider than the left croc üòï confused.They're nice but right one is too big üòï
It is best to wear socks, otherwise the soles of your feet will hurt.

review_title: Most Uncomfortable Shoe I ever wore
review_text: The most uncomfortable shoe I ever had on my feet. After two hours my sciatica was worse than it ever was
False advertising! These are NOT Crocs!!! They are a knockoff brand. Very disappointing!

I have three pairs of crocs made in Vietnam where a size 6 fit perfectly, however when I ordered these made in china fit way too small... had to return and reorder on another site :( not sure if there is a difference where they‚Äôre manufactured but these run small

I usually wear a 6 in women's shoes, so that is what I ordered, as most reviews I'd seen said they fit true to size. Unfortunately, however, the crocs I received are a tad bit too small. If you are planning to purchase these, definitely order a size up!Other than that, great quality :)

Disappointed because the wrong size was sent. Received them WAY TOO BIG. The worst part is they were a birthday gift. Tried to reorder so the correct item could be sent, but now price is increased. Very disappointed.

I was disappointed with these but ended up keeping them since I only wear them outside at home. The khaki color was much lighter then the color shown on Amazon. Although they are the right length they are extremely wide. I will be able to wear them with very bulky socks.
I purchased this for my 14year old.  They were little big but he likes them and decided to keep them.  Then the strap broke.

review_title: this is made in Italy, does not compare to standard sizes
review_text: We ordered two pairs one grey and one burgundy. the burgundy is made in Italy. and the size is so different from the ones made in Mexico and Vietnam. My boyfriend's feet are flat and wide, so he was able to make use of the "Women's 10M US/Men's 8". I sent the "Women's 12M US/Men's 10" back to Amazon (with no problem, by the way... "Great return policy on shoes, Amazon. Thanks a lot!")

My husband has three other older pairs which fit properly in a size 8 with the instep and length correct.  Something changed in the manufacturing of the shoes.
These shoes shrunk while in the shade I  1 hour! Super expensive!

He did not wear this pair any different than any other pair we have in our house.  Extremely dissapointed!

review_title: Satisfied, not ecstatic, but I'll continue to buy/wear out of loyalty.
review_text: I started wearing Crocs when I began college in Boulder, CO, which is the birthplace of Crocs.  I'll continue to wear Crocs out of loyalty, but I'm not  ecstatic about these "classic" Crocs.  I put classic in quotation marks, because Crocs loyalists know that they were once made in the USA, and the shoes that were made in the USA were sized in ranges and were made of superior material that was a tad bit softer.  Please know that I'm traditionally not a hooah-hooah "Made in the USA" minion, but there are distinct differences between the USA- and Mexican-made Crocs.  Crocs made in Mexico are made of a similar (but different) material that has a slippery finish, and they are sized in whole-sizes only.  I resisted buying Mexican Crocs because of these material and fit factors, and so I wore down my USA Crocs to the end.I wear a 10.5 running show, and in the USA size Crocs I wore men's XL (10-11), which were perfect!  For the Mexican Crocs I ordered M11, but they were too large: too much play in the toes and too much length between the heel of the shoe and the heel of the foot.  I returned them for Mexican M10, which is what I settled on.  They're good with room in the toe, but I would have liked an extra half-inch on the heel.  This is why the USA sizing scheme was better FOR ME.  I acknowledge all feet are different.Some will say that the changes in workmanship came after the supposed slit of the company's founders due to a nasty divorce.  Search for that on the internet and decide for yourself.Props to Amazon for the consistent Prime service, and this was the first purchased I used the Amazon Locker feature, and that went well.  I appreciated this because I did Airbnb, and I didn't feel comfortable having a package delivered there.

review_title: Size not what advertised - be careful
review_text: I waited too long to try them on and when I did, the time window to return them had expired so I'm SOL and out $35.  I have two other pairs, also size 13, also made in Mexico and they fit perfectly.  The pair that I got in this order are labeled size 13, made in Mexico but they are definitely not size 13.  They are at least one size smaller.  Caveat emptor!

These are the worse pair of Crocs I have ever bought. They were more like a pair of roughly used Crocs. The shoes themselves were poorly made, out of shape, and the toes didn't fit. They were a gift and because of COVID, I lost my opportunity to return them. Always check manufacturer, never buy from China!
Slipped these on real quick go do a grocery run, and what do you know... Two different sizes!
Absolutely horrible. Ordered a 9 and they were too small. I am usually between a 8.5 and 9. Then ordered a 10 and they are huge. Plastic / materials a different on both pairs.
The quality does not reflect the seller. I bought these in April 2020. They are shot. The quality of Crocs is no longer the same. My previous pair lasted a year and a half. Will not buy again.

review_title: You get what you pay for
review_text: I was looking forward to these but was rather disappointed in them. It almost seems as if they were ‚Äúseconds‚Äù or a bad batch. The little nubs on the inside of the shoe that your foots sits in are high and rough. They almost hurt to walk in. While on vacation, I bought another set of crocs clogs and they were completely different in this regard and also had the crocs logo in the inside heel whereas this pair off of here didn‚Äôt.
Received these, fresh out of the plastic with dirty soles.
I couldn‚Äôt tolerate the massaging tips poking me along the entire footbed. It triggered my diabetic neuropathy. I will return them and buy something with a flatter footbed.
