review_text: I order crocs for the entire family for summer and our upcoming camping trip. I had an issue with quality control as one of the straps that was meant to hold my foot in was too long. It ended up being even with the back part of the shoe rendering it useless. The other shoe was fine and was about 1/4 to 1/2 inch shorter allowing for my foot to be secure. Of of the other 3 pairs I have this is the only defect but heard quality had diminished since they are made in Mexico now and not China.

Definitely what it‚Äôs suppose to be. üòÇüòÇüòÇ

review_title: I purchased them as replacement for my (very) old Beach Basics Crocs - and got disappointed. They feel like a cheap knock-off fr
review_text: Uncomfortable. I purchased them as replacement for my (very) old Beach Basics Crocs - and got disappointed. They feel like a cheap knock-off from very comfortable old Beach Basics ones. I can wear the new Crocs only with socks, because of rows of sharp spikes at the bottom hurting my bare feet. review_title: Bought these to replace an identical pair I had bought ...
review_text: Bought these to replace an identical pair I had bought a few years ago.  The new pair was a 1/2 " shorter in length than the old pair, so my toes rubbed the inside of the clog.  The new pair was also narrower in width than the old pair, which I was ok with.  I ended up sending them back.  I would have exchanged them for the next size up, but I didn't want to have to send them back if they didn't fit.

review_title: Consistency in sizing is an issue.
review_text: I have these same Crocs (Unisex Classic Clog M8/W10), but in a different color.  While the size I ordered was marked the same size as the Crocs I already wear and love, the Crocs I received are about 1/2 - 1 size shorter.  I also ordered several other pairs of Crocs in the size I currently have, but in different styles than the Unisex Classic Clog.  I had the same sizing issue with all the other styles I bought.  Has Crocs changed its sizing even though the size chart indicates I purchased the correct size?  Crocs, your sizing consistency would be helpful and appreciated and my review would have been 4 stars if I had received what I was expecting based on past purchases.  I had to return all four pairs of Crocs I ordered.  I'm hesitant to reorder in a larger size, but will try at least one more pair before I go to another brand.

Seeing/hearing all the craze about Crocs I wanted to give them a try as my slippers / around-the-house footwear.  Unfortunately, within minutes of putting them on my feet started sweating a lot (and I was just sitting so it's not like there was an extra perspiration due to some heavy physical activity) to the point of visible droplets on the footbed and the sides.  That was a deal breaker for me (thankfully Amazon has a free return option!)Also - they felt somewhat large lengthwise (I'm normally 12 / 12.5 so I figured 12 would be on a smaller size but that was not the case).Finally - I didn't like the overall loose fit (I guess some would call it "comfortable" but I wouldn't dare to step outside in them; definitely couldn't run in them or even walk fast).Note for reference - I'm not a sandal / flip-flop, etc. person - I always wear regular, closed, well-fitting shoes.

review_title: Great for the yard, But do not leave out in the sun...
review_text: These are what you expect; waterproof, easy to clean and pretty darn comfortable. Great for yard work, gardening and for slipping on and off when you need quick foot ware. In other words, shoes when you're too lazy to put on regular shoes. Better than flip flops when you need some tootsie protection.My only complaint is if you leave these in the sun they will shrink considerably. I left mine on the back stoop where they get direct sun in the afternoon. The rubber shrank a full size smaller so they no longer fit. I live in Massachusetts where the sun isn't intense. But apparently afternoon UV exposure is enough to cook your Crocs. I have never seen this happen with flip flops that I have left outside. It's disappointing Crocs wouldn't have this figured out (i.e. UV resistant rubber, etc.) especially given their practical use in the yard.

I bought these in fall and just started wearing them this summer. I loved them at first and they were so comfortable. Well today when I put them on, one of them didn't fit because it shrunk as seen in the picture. They've been sitting inside and not in direct sunlight so I am not sure why one would suddenly shrink. Disappointed as I have only been able to get a few wears out of them and of course it is too late to return them.

review_title: Does China have separate factories for right and left shoes?
review_text: Of the size 8‚Äôs I ordered, the right shoe was noticeably smaller when wearing. Weird, because other crocs ordered in the past were fine. What to do? Order a 9? Wait awhile? Naturally the yellow was not available in size 8. Good grief I despise 1st world problems.

review_text: My 12yo son wears an adult size 8 but his foot is more narrow than an adult so the crocs really don't fit him as to the width.  They are fine on the length though.

Shoe fits my niece great but the package was retaped and there was a spot on the bottom that looked like it was melted. Her mom said not to bother to send them back but it annoying to be sent an obviously used shoe.

Not sure what is going on but I ordered a size 11 for my husband and an 8 for me as we've worn before (from Zappos). The size 11 fit like clown shoes and the size 8 are short. The cushioning and texture isn't the same. I just ordered an 11 from Zappos and they are the correct size and quality. Will donate theses. Buyer beware.

review_title: I prefer the old style of crocks
review_text: I am not fond of the flexible piece at your heal which used to be firm on the old models. It ends up twisting frequently. My other complaint is that crocks in general expand and get bigger after a few weeks. I have found that putting them in the hot sun helps to shrink them.

Honestly, I'm disappointed.  I've had a pair of crocs duet for a two years now and they are awesome.  Squishy.  Has arch support.  These on the other had are underwhelming.  Less support.  Less cushion.  Less shoe in general.  Maybe I'm not being fair by not reviewing these on their own merit.  But the important point is that not all crocs are the same.

review_title: Little too small. Up a size and they‚Äôd be perfect.
review_text: Way too expensive for what they are but I need them for my lifeguard job. I wear a 7 in women‚Äôs usually with room but these are a 7 and my toe is all the way to the end so hopefully it doesn‚Äôt wear them quickly. They are comfy and do what I need them to do. If you are hesitant on size. I wish I‚Äôd upped one more size.

I have several pairs of older crocs in a couple differen styles. This particular pair seems to be a lower quality. It fits smaller than the same size I already own. Around the heel of both shoes are ragged pieces where it did not separate cleanly from the mold. Also the strap on the left shoe is crooked and doesn't fit over the top. Color is pretty.

review_title: I have a cheap pair of garden clogs that I bought at Walmart about three years ago that the soles are quite worn on but they are
review_text: I based my purchase from the reviews I read on Amazon.com. Although the length is okay the shoes are much narrower that I was led to believe. I have a cheap pair of garden clogs that I bought at Walmart about three years ago that the soles are quite worn on but they are far more comfortable. I doubt that I will buy another pair of Crocs.

Completely outraged!! I just received my order and i have two different sized shoes but they are labeled as the same size!! One is drastically smaller than the other, it is as small as a child size. I ordered two pairs of them.. i will receive the other shipment tomorrow and hope to not have the same problem! I would have given zero stars if possible!
The narrative says if you are between sizes to size down.  I did and the fit was way too short.  I'm an 8.5 so I ordered the 8.  I gave them to my sister who is a 7.5 and they were STILL too small

I finally buy crocs for easy on and off to leave outside my back door. They are not easy on and off, even though these should be too big. I wore them 4 blocks walking and rubbed my foot in several places that it actually caused sores that hurt and had to scab over then heal up. So I would not recommend these for this purpose.

review_title: The correct correlation between centimeters and inches when ordering out of the US.
review_text: I loved the color and style, but the crocs were too large and wide.So I sent the merchandise back to the company. I wanted to exchange for a smaller size, but was not offered the choice. Instead, I was only offered the choice to receive a refund back to my credit card, but I also used my gift card of $11.00 as well.

review_title: I have very bad feet I walk all day on concrete and when ...

I have bought a dozen pairs over the years. This time they seem to be smaller and not as comfortable. The material seems to be harder and slicker. I still wear them but I wish they were bigger and softer like the ones from past purchases.

review_title: They were super comfortable. I ordered a different croc that is ...

wasn't too comfortable so i returned them for refund

Not what I expected, everyone raves about crocs , I am not in love with them, sloppy fit and no very comfortable . Would never buy them again.

We clipped it on correctly but then noticed it had popped off somewhere. Disappointed I have to spend more money.

review_title: Not the same as the old crocs

I have been wearing my old crocs along with my inserts for at least 5 years or better and have always found them so comfortable.  Unfortunately they're so worn I needed to replace them.  I ordered the classic crocs and expected them to be the same as my old ones but they are different in sizing.  The boot is a little too wide and my feet move around too much so I'm not getting the support I need.  I cannot wear them for more than 1/2 hour.
Horrae shoe , to tight and cut my side open .
Too expensive for what you get & how long they last a child but she is lucky we love her.

review_title: WRONGE They are more like size 6 women not 8
review_text: I looked at a crocs pair I own which was size 8 women so I thought they would be the same.  WRONGE They are more like size 6 women not 8.  These run very small. Measure the length of your foot before ordering.  Returning them.  They don't carry the wider size not reordering.

My Crocs are for the garden and back yard. I left them outside the back door in the heat and one of the shoes SHRUNK! I can no longer wear it. WHY is there not a warning on the package or bag??? Not good for anything now.
They were cheap so I will keep them, but they‚Äôre way too big even though the size is the right one.  They will be fine for doing some backyard gardening after a rain.
The navy blue crocs were mis-sized by at least one to one and a half sizes. This was my second pair of navy ones and they were both sized too small! Very disappointed!!!

I have been ordering size 6 for years and they have always fit perfectly.  I ordered two new pairs and they are both too small.  I suggest ordering a size up.  Not as roomy compared to my older pairs.

review_title: Runs smaller than my old pair
review_text: This pair is about a size smaller than the pair I purchased before.The color is very nice and it still fits since my old pair was roomy, but maybe one might need to purchase a size up if in between sizes.

review_title: Too big because they are only selling the ‚Äòroomy‚Äô pairs on amazon
review_text: It did not say anywhere on Amazon that I would be receiving extra wide and roomy crocs. I ordered down a size just like everyone else always says amd they were at least two sizes too large!

review_title: Quality not what it used to be - Keep out of sun
review_text: I have worn many Crocs over the years, but recently discovered that some versions like the Bistro style have started shrinking and warping if left in the sun to dry. I had two pairs that warped after two hours of 80-85 degree heat. I never had this problem before.

Not real sure how I feel about these shoes. They seem fine for going to the beach in or casual running errands but they are not nearly as comfortable as solomons or keen. They are extremely ugly, do not offer alot of support. But the soles feel soft and are comfortable enough to work a few hours in. Soooooo ugly!!

Both shoes are warped and scuffed. They also each have a chunk of plastic on the sole from the injection mold. They are too small but the same size/style/color fit fine at the local store. I am convinced these are counterfeit.
Wished I had known this style ran so large, width & length. Measured my foot according to the instructions for sizing. What else can I say... these are going back.

I bought these for my teenage daughter for her birthday. The listing says nothing about these being wide. They are way too big for her. She tried on her cousins, who ordered his directly from the Croc website in the exact same size and they fit her perfectly. I am questioning the authenticity of these 'Crocs'. If they are authentic but just in a wide why doesn't the listing note that? I would be weary of ordering these shoes.
I purchased these for my husband and one is a size 16 (what I ordered), but the other is size 15. They were a gift and now it says I can't return them. So frustrating.
Received previously worn crocs.... disappointed overall but happy with overall product as Crocs are super comfy!

I have ONLY worn them once, ONLY IN THE HOUSE, out them right back in the bag. They're too big, don't look good on the feet.Just not like the other  CROC shoe products that I have. purchase was disappointing, which I RARELY say, but it's true.Sorry.

review_title: FAKE! CHEAP KNOCK OFFS! DUPES! SAVE YOUR MONEY!
review_text: These are knock offs. Real crocs are made in China. These are made in Vietnam. The feel is different. Real crocs are heavier. Also the crocs on the sides are upside down. It wouldn‚Äôt be so bad if I wasn‚Äôt paying full price for a knock off. I want my money back!

review_title: RUNS WAY TOO BIG!! Like 2-3 SIZES TOO BIG!! üëéüèª
review_text: Great product. Just as described. However, my son wears a men‚Äôs size 11 us shoe and these crocs purchased & displayed as a ‚ÄúMen‚Äôs US Size 11(M) shoe‚Äù, is definitely NOT ACCURATE!Because these specific crocs are WAY TOO BIG!!
I thought I ordered the olive color Crocs but I guess it was my fault for not checking the description and only relying on the picture...

review_title: Beware.  Fit appears to vary depending on the color you pick.
review_text: Beware.  Fit appears to vary depending on the color you pick.  I bought these crocs in Navy last year and the fit was perfect.  This year I bought the same size crocs only in Khaki, and they are way too small.

Like other reviewers, I noticed these were made in Mexico rather than in China. I'm a loyal Amazon shopper and am hoping Amazon will take care of this, because either Crocs has a problem with their merchandise quality online - or these were knockoffs! These shoes didn‚Äôt feel right in general, so like other reviewers, I may decide to shop in a Crocs store instead of online.

review_title: not true to size or past experience

love this clunky little things, however, the fit is SO difficult. Have several different styles and as many of the reviews say, there is MUCH variance in the fit. review_title: Classic crocs still classic but sizing unpredictable.
review_text: I have been wearing crocs for years, and these were just as expected except for the size.  Buyers beware.  I ordered the same size and style of unisex classic  crocs as my old ones. I could not have been mistaken because the size was still visible imprinted on the bottom of the old shoes.  I would give them 5 stars because I like crocs, but feel forced to downgrade because of size inconsistency.  How hard can it be to make a molded shoe conform to size?
My only complaint is that they are VERY small for the indicated size.I usually wear a size 7-7.5 in athletic shoe, so I bought a size 8 for some extra wiggle room.I should have bought a size 9.

review_title: Cute shoes.  But too small or too large if you're a true half size!
review_text: I bought a size 9 (women) since I wear a 9 in a sandal.  I wear a 9.5 in a closed toe shoe.  But there was a recommendation in this description that half sizes should order down.  So I thought a size 9 would be just right for me.  Alas, they are too short.  The end of my toes touches the front of the shoe even without a sock.  So I immediately had to put them back in the box and return them.  According to my experience, one would order a size up, not a size down.  A 9 is too short for a 9.5 foot.  Still, they are very nice and attractive shoes, so I'm ordering a size 10.  I'm giving 5 stars because there was nothing wrong with the shoes, just bought the wrong size and don't think the description should have suggested ordering a size down.Update:  I have to change my rating from a 5 star to a 2 star for the simple reason that they will not work for someone like me with exactly 1/2 size off.  After the above-described experience (ordering a size 9 women for my 9.5 foot), I sent them back and ordered a size 10 women.  They are enormous.  I can't possibly wear them even with a very thick sock.  They fit me like boats.  I really wanted to like these, and except for their being a smidgeon too small in size 9, I really would have liked them.  I guess I have to give up on Crocs.  I would guess there are a lot of people like me in between sizes who can't make them work.  Much of the problem might be that when the size gets larger, both the length and the width increase.  I didn't need them any wider at all, just a tiny bit longer.  Too bad.
Just not as comfortable as I expected, but it's ok especially for rainy season.

review_title: These classics are much narrower than my old ones.
review_text: These crocs are great except they are too narrow for my wide foot. I bought classics madeIn Mexico because I read somewhere that they are wider. Not true here. These are much narrower than my old ones. I like a loose fit for my arthritic feet. Waste of money for me but otherwise nice crocs.

I was incredibly disappointed with the quality of these shoes. The arrived with scrapes on the bottoms and sides of the shoe. One shoe also had a puncture hole that went almost all the way through the sole. They were incredibly beat up. Not impressed.

review_title: It's Good That Returning Items to Amazon is Easy

Returned this item -- will shop locally for all footwear in the future.

review_title: Simewhat large. If no socks are worn, they ...

review_title: Not what they used to be

Very poor quality as far as endurance. Grand daughter (13) wore less than a dozen times and strap broke. Company would not replace. Would not recommend!

I recommend that if you are buying this item, order a size larger.  This was in no way a size 10.  I took it to a shoe store and even they said it was not a true size 10. review_title: New Crocs not like old style !  : (

review_title: He just received them so it is a bit early to tell but he thinks these will work better. Too bad you do not have 1/2 sizes

review_title: I am extremely disappointed in the sizing of these Unisex Classic Crocs
review_text: I am extremely disappointed in the sizing of these Unisex Classic Crocs.  There is a severe size distortion between the M7 and M8 sizes; the former is far too short and the latter is far too long for my foot.  The M7 is three times longer than the average difference between sizes!  Dear Crocs: please fix your quality control program!1. My shoe size is US 8 ¬Ω or 9 ‚Äì none of these Crocs sizes approximate a normal US shoe size.2. I ordered three pair in order to find the right fit.  None fit!  I compared these three sizes (all made in Mexico), with my wife‚Äôs  (made in Italy).  The current old pair that I wear, which fit perfectly, are ‚ÄúM6/7.‚Äù  The length differences between the four new pair is telling: M5 to M6*:0.3cm; M6* to M7: 0.7cm; M7 to M8: 1.7cm; M8 to M9: 0.3cma. M5 (Italy) 25.4cm (9 7/8in) long, 10.7cm (4 3/16in) wideb. M7 (Mexico) 26.7cm (10 1/2in) long, 10.7cm (4 1/4in) widec. M8 (Mexico) 28.4cm (11 1/8in) long, 11.2cm (4 3/8in) wided. M9 (Mexico) 28.7cm (11 3/8in) long, 11.2cm (4 3/8in) wide*mathematically extrapolated

I told myself I would never buy this style of Croc, but I figure as a house shoe, I could make an exception.  I have hard wood floors and am super pregnant, so every step was beginning to really hurt.  I've heard good things about these, so I bought the cheapest color in size huge because my feet are in fact, huge.  They fit fine and have definitely eliminated a lot of my foot pain, however, my feet are sitting in a sauna.  I have to wear socks with them and I still have super sweaty (and not to mention, stinky) feet. I'm not one to have ever had a sweaty or stinky foot issue, but in these I'm queen gross foot.  I knew this would be an issue to an extent, but wow, this is ridiculous.  I'll switch between these and my gel flip flops (which don't do much for me) throughout the day, just to give my feet a breather.  Are they comfortable?  Yes.  Would I have bought them if I knew how my feet would handle this material?  Nah.

My old crocs were unisex also with a mans size and womens size printed on the bottom of them. Since the womens size was out of stock at Amazon I decided to order the men's size. It's a bit small, can't wear socks with them but ok for in the house as a slipper. Next time I'll know better.

I am not at all impressed with these shoes. Like a few others I always thought they were pretty ugly. But I needed a new quick slip on to run to the bird feeder, run garbage out etc. So I thought what the heck found a good deal so decided to try them. They feel like hard plastic. Wore them for less then an hour and my feet were getting sore (had socks on). If I had paid more for them I for sure would be sending them back. But for under $20. they'll suffice. Good for when I need to wash garbage bins. I really don't understand the great reviews they are REALLY cheap shoes.Update: Couldn't stand them anymore. Glad I was still in window for return and that's what I did. Thank you Amazon

If you have wide feet like me, go for the size you need in length, not width.

The Caymans are narrower than the Beach sandal and they do clean up nicely, but my feet swim in them, and I have worn them for a while now, and they do not seem to be conforming to my feet, as I thought they might.  In sum, if you have narrow feet and are seeking a softer shoe, you may not care for these.

review_title: Sorry system for sizing on this description
review_text: If sizing on the order screen and description matched exactly what is on the shoes, it would help. I love the shoe, and the low stars are about ordering from this Amazon seller.The shoe itself reads M5 W7 has a tag that says "M5/W7" and is clearly labeled Made in Mexico. I'm returning them for another size up, hoping I don't get US sized ones which will then be too big.I've worn Crocs for years, and the way sizes were listed on this item description was confusing, as it did not match the ones I was wearing when I tried to place the order - which were made in the US - read "W 8-9 M 6-7". These were not an option. As a result, after measuring my foot, using the chart Crocs provides, etc etc I have a pair that is too small. I put a lot of thought into it and did not just push a random button.Ideally, the top and sides should not touch your foot when you are standing. They are supposed to fit that way....and so if you find them hot, it may be you are not in a large enough size.Annoyed that I now have a wait for the right shoe. Wish the brand would standardize the way shoes are labeled and that people selling it would then follow that method...and not lie about where the shoes are made, as in putting US in the title.

One issue I'd to resolve is that many styles of Croc run big. And that's true of this one, the Classic clog, so order down a half-size if your normal size happens to be one that Crocs doesn't make.It's important 'NOT' to overestimate which size you'll need is because the strap at the back will fall down if they're too large, causing your shoes to fall off, thus being essentially unwearable.LATE EDIT: After a month of wear, I decided to revisit my review. Part of my reason for reexamining my initial review is a change I've noticed is the rubberiness or softness of the material now used in my Crocs clogs. Besides their (apparent) tendency to wear out quicker, I now have problems with stability in them, which is a very important issue for me because of health issues.In all fairness, I have other Crocs, some sandals, which aren't composed of such soft material, but I'm not trying to analyze the decision-making process that led to the change. However the change came about, the newer clogs are now made of a poorer quality material. Moreover, the issue of stability is something I've monitored because of its importance to me. I've been chastened in my past experiences with Croc imitators, only to go back to Crocs once again. And now I find myself having to look elsewhere once more.
These Crocs are OK, but beware.....the sizes run big.  For example, if you normally wear a 13 buy a size 12.

What they sell you is not what you receive. I was buying these as a gift and the box contained an entirely different type of shoe - like a loafer style (?)  Since I was mailing them overseas, I had no time to return and order again.  Just be advised they're selling you something that is much different from what is displayed.

review_title: Don't leave them in the sun they will shrink!
review_text: I have owned a pair of crocs for about 8 years and wanted a new style so I bought these. The old ones was made in China and the rubber is a lot different than the new crocs that are made now in Mexico. If you leave these crocs in the sun they will shrink a size down. My old crocs I store them on my back porch and they get full sun and have never shrunk. I left these new ones from Mexico in the sun for only a few hours and they are at lease 1/2 size smaller now. My big toe hits the end now as before it didn't. My husband bought a new pair last year and told me they are a lot different than our old pairs and he swore they shrunk when he left them outside but I didn't listen and when I got my new pair it did the same thing. The rubber on the Mexico one's is like a shiny rubber as the old one's from China is a dull rubber. The China ones seems a little thicker also. I don't know why the company started using Mexico to make them but I wished they would go back to China because the old ones are a lot better. I went to a store that sells them and checked them all and they are all made in Mexico. I think the old ones are more comfortable also.

If this is the new Crocs then I will find another brand and shame on the company for ruining a good product. If these are counterfeit, then shame on the supplier.  As always Amazon's return policy is quick & easy, however I  will still be paying $5 shipping. In the future I will purchase such items locally and restrict my Amazon shopping to other categories.

If you are replacing a pair of old Classic Crocs today, be aware that the fit is much smaller. The length is 1/2 inches shorter. The width is narrower.  And, the strap is no longer flush with the back of the shoe, but 1/2 inch shorter. Result, a very tight uncomfortable shoe.The material of construction is also more rigid and less pliable.  New Crocs are more like Walmart knock-offs than like the original Crocs.I returned mine.  Will shop locally since sizing is now problematic. If shoes are rigid, will just wear my old ones into the ground.

At 8 lbs a pop, I have what you might call fat feet. My whole life has been spent in envy of those endowed with more normal locomotory appendages. I can't wear sneakers, sandals, or loafers; sock after sock has split after insertion of my foot therein; each of my footsteps is a distinctive *splat* audible over a 100 meter radius. I thought that maybe, just maybe, Crocs would help me "fit" in. I've seen plenty of people wearing them around the trailer park - just once, might I be able to look like the cool kids? I was dead wrong. With the XXXL Crocs on my feet, I understood what Chinese foot binding must have felt like. Blood flow to the foot region slowed to such a trickle that each foot turned a mucous green. I had to use a steak knife to get the things off, cutting myself in the process, so that what little blood remained in my feet spurted all over my den and onto my adjacent daughter. I walked to the ER barefoot, cutting my feet yet further on the broken glass that littered the freeway shoulder. The nurses on staff snickered at me from behind their COVID masks. Moral of the story, you ask? Keep away from "Crocs" at all costs.

review_title: Don't Buy If You Have Sesamoiditis
review_text: As the title states, don't buy these if you have sesamoiditis. I tried to walk in these things and my foot, which wasn't hurting before after walking barefoot around the house on wood floors, started to get stabbing pains on the first step.They are also way too big. I'm a size 9.5 men's and depending on the shoe, regular to extra wide width. I ordered these in a size 10 men's and they were huge all the way around, about a 1/2" on every side and nearly an inch too big front to back. It would probably take a few layers of thick socks to fit correctly. I'd say a size 9 men's would fit fine.

These Crocs were definitely smaller.  I thought I could make it work but then decided to return.  I was not offered to exchange for another pair.  This made me think that they know that this color in their Crocs was mis-sized.  If they would have offered another pair sized correctly, I would have definitely exchanged.  The color is really nice.

review_title: Not all crocs are made equally
review_text: I have gotten two pairs of crocs off of the actual website and I was pleased with them. When I saw Amazon had some at a cheaper price, I decided to try them using prime wardrobe. As soon I got them and tried them on, I immediately noticed a difference. The toe box was a little smaller and my feet would slide out when I would walk. I compared them to the crocs I got on the website, and the ones from Amazon definitely looked lower quality. The "crocs TM" logo across the strap wasn't as defined and the edges along the sides of the shoes weren't as smooth. The grips on the inside of the shoe weren't as defined either which is probably why my feet would slide out.. I looked at the tags and the ones I got from Amazon were made in Brazil while my other crocs from the website were made in Vietnam. I did research online and found that Crocs indeed has multiple factories across the globe, so the ones I were sent were likely NOT fakes. However, I am not the first person to note that the factories in Asia use a different mold than the ones in Brazil. Other people have also noticed a higher quality from the ones made in Vietnam. I TRIED to get myself to like these ones, but I just couldn't. Even if they were cheaper, I could TELL they were cheaper just by looking at them. I had to send them back. It's a shame that Crocs doesn't require the same mold and quality at all their locations. The lack of consistency is disappointing.

Will be returning.  And wasted a $10 coupon on these that I won't get back.

review_title: now I've got a pair too
review_text: I finally bought a pair of Crocs after finding them for the reasonable price of $19.99 on Amazon. I like Crocs, but I refuse to pay something like $30 to $45 for what essentially amounts to a pair of plastic slippers. I was skeptical of their usefulness, but they fill the niche (for me) between slippers and clogs pretty well.The fit was surprisingly small. I mean they are wide and clunky, but seem to run a bit short; I bought the 9 for my 8 1/2 foot, but there is not as much room in the toe-box as I expected. Despite being plastic, the shoes breathes very well and are comfortable enough for extended wear. Running to the mailbox or cleaning the house is an ideal use for this type of footwear. Beware taking out the garbage in the morning as the dew seeping through the holes will come as unwelcome surprise.Not that I knew I needed them, but Crocs are popular for a reason.  They are great for lounging around, but I am skeptical at the touted advantages of some of the more specialized models. Now, having bought a pair I feel existentially complete.Update 10/12/2012I am writing this review after about a week's worth of wear. The fit was simply too small and I had to give them away. I am trying the men's size 10 to see if they will be more comfortable. In my case it may be a matter of going a full size up.

I've bought & loved Crocs for many yrs but now suddenly the sz I always buy is not the same.  VietNam made.These are like the cheap knockoffs in dollar stores.Crocs are now a shoe of the past for me.

I've had multiple pairs of Classic Crocs over the years. They all quickly develop a hole right under my big toe. I only walk in them. No running or walking on anything other than my paved street and concrete walkways. I've duct taped the hole, siliconed it, and nothing works. The heel also wears quickly. For the price I'd expect them to last longer or use a more abrasion resistant rubber. Other than that, they're comfortable.

I am a woman who wears a size 10. The length is exaxt, and while I do understand the sizes were unisex, these are extremely wide for a normal sized ladies foot. My foot slides side to side in them. I also thought there would be at least a 1/2" lift from front to back since there appears to be deep sole, however it is actually totally flat because your heel sits lower than the top edge of the heel. There are air holes that go around the front and sides of the shoe, and one in the front is in the exact place that my second toe sticks through it and debris gets in. The strap can swing frontward or backwards, however when it's backwards, it barely touches my heel since it's so long. It's not as cushy soft as other crocs I've tried on. They are something to kick around in, but nothing I would have bought had I tried them on at the store. I think I will stick to the ones made specifically for women.

review_text: This is my third pair of the original style crocks, but obviously the mold these are made from is a new one, because these don't fit as well as my others do.  They are almost too large, especially in the width of the heal and the length of the strap.  My foot will barely stay in these if I rely on the strap.  I quickly compared these to my older pairs to verify I'd ordered the same style and size. They are all made in Mexico and were the same size and style, but there were several differences in mold marks that made it clear these were made from a different mold.  If I had ordered these to serve as anything other than a pair of house shoes, I'd return them.  There's no way I could wear these all day and feel comfortable.

I'm not sure what happened but this has been incredibly disappointing. I needed to return them because there was no way they were going to properly fit my foot. I still want a pair but I am worried that the next size up will not fit correctly either.

Citrus is NOT yellow!! It‚Äôs green!!!

review_text: made in China now used to be made in Mexico. they seem narrower and the inside nubs are different,  material seems different.. switching to sandals

review_title: These are not real crocs. Real crocs are made ...

review_title: Fit is great and comfortable until it gets wet
review_text: Fit is great and comfortable until it gets wet. I went with a larger size(I feet are 10 1/2 and I always buy size 11)  than my feet and slide around ALOT, in these, when wet.
They should make a narrow version for women's feet.  These were meant for someone with insanely wide feet and that doesn't need any arch support.  Disappointing.

review_title: Wears out on the inside and the soles much faster ...
review_text: Wears out on the inside and the soles much faster than crocs we purchased previously. Will no longer buy crocs.
The product was much smaller than anticipated. I wish I could return, but it is too late.

review_title: A little disappointing for a long time crocs wearer..
review_text: I've been a dedicated crocs wearer for years for both work and play. I probably haven't bought a new pair for a couple years but finally decided it was necessary for safety reasons (when the tread is totally worn off they can be very slippery). The pair that I purchased was an A+ for comfort, as always. However, the construction of the shoe has been cheapened considerably. The straps spontaneously pop off, requiring that you realign and replace the heel strap to the croc. Have crocs become a victim of their own popularity..?
the box

My Crocs arrived with a slippy oily film in the inside of the crocs also they ran smaller than the other ones i own... Same size... Both are the clog style. The crocs are also not as soft as my other ones.. I wonder if the material is different. They still are good... Hopefully they feel better after i wear them for awhile.

review_title: Nice clog but they rub the top of my foot.
review_text: These crocs are extremely practical despite the way they look. Feels like you are walking on air.  They are great when I wear socks with them but when I go without socks, they rub the top of both of my feet in the same place (where you would normally have shoe laces on a shoe) causing blisters/cuts.  Maybe I just need to get used to them, not sure.  Anyhow, these are great clogs with one major drawback.

review_title: The sole is a bit slipper but fine if you work out in a gym
review_text: Forgot this brand runs small. The sole is a bit slipper but fine if you work out in a gym.

review_title: Need to exchange for smaller size but cannot reach Amazon to do so
review_text: Need smaller size

My crocs r great but when I first received them in the mail I pulled them out of the box and the tops and back foot bands were all crunched up and was kind of uncomfortable but after about a month wearing them here and there. They went back to there original shape. So all worked out and they fit great

Recently I purchased a new pair of crocs as I need a choco color.  I have had a pair for several years.  I sent the new pair back as they were uncomfortable, stiff and hard.  What happen to the soft rubber soles that soften each step.  I wish products that were good to excellent would not use lower quality material that changes the comfort level they once had.  I will not purchase crocs in the future. There is a huge difference. My four dollar off brand for gardening felt more comfortable than those new shoes.

Got these for my gf, on crocs website says to size down if u are half size... she wears an 8.5, but the 8 was too small. Had to return, which sucked Bc it was one of my gifts to her for our anniversary.

review_title: Crocs has horrible customer service and does not stand behind their products
review_text: Rivets that hold the straps to the shoes broke a month after the 90 day Crocs warrant was up. Crocs would not send a replacement rivet. Shoes were barely worn. Crocs has horrible customer service and does not stand behind their products.
I purchased my crocs and liked them very  much. However,  keep in mind they run bigger than your actual size. I had to buy a new pair 1 size smaller so I won`t look like a cat with boots!!
My feet sweat while I'm wearing those.Comfortable, yes, but makes my feet sweat very heavily.
They are fine the only problem was they came in a plastic bag and my husband got the package and knew what they were. No surprise for Christmas.
I ordered a size 11 and got a size 13 - In Afghanistan, so it's not like I can just return them.... booo - clown shoes

review_title: I like how they feel on standing and walking a lot
review_text: I ordered these when I was in clinical, I didn't have time to exchange the size, they are ok. I like how they feel on standing and walking a lot. They inspired me to buy another pair.
One pair I ordered fit, the other pair was too small. Sizing was confusing.
They fit me too small

Everything was fine but my strap was broken when I got them
I need to return and then replacement

I was very surprised and disappointed when I received these crocs.  I have worn crocs for about three years and when these arrived I couldn't believe how much smaller they were than the ones I already have even though they were marked as being the same size! Rather than bother to return them, I am going to give them to Goodwill and hope someone can use them.
it's a little big but it's comfortable
Comfortable for long shifts, but get warm, feet become sweaty sometimes, I ordered white, so naturally they are dirty quickly

I wear a size 8.5 to 9.0 men's shoe. I read the reviews on here and people said to round down,so I did. I ordered a size 8 croc. The shoe arrived on time,actually early. But! Rounding down one size was incorrect,these shoes are HUGE. My son wears a size 10 and they fit ok on him. I received them today and they are being returned today. Even with socks they are so big they will not stay on my foot. That includes using the strap,they are just to big. I have no idea who measures the size of these things but they really need to learn how to read and measure. They are way off. Now to top it off I am being charged to return these.

Crocs Cayman Shoe for Adults:  This was the 2nd pair of Crocs Cayman shoes that I bought on line.  The first pair was perfect.  This pair was made out of hard rubber and had no give to them at all.  They are not able to be worn.  Also, I felt the shipping charge was excessive.  The first pair of Crocs I ordered were the exact same price and included free shipping.  I will not be doing any more business with Amazon, unless you people resolve my complaint to my satisfaction.
Not a good fit for my feet, which are long and thin; my toes scrubbed against the front of the shoe, so I had to send them back :(

I thought I was duplicating what I have worn for 2 years. And it may be so, the older pair spreading somewhat over time. Yet the size spec seems to suggest the manufacturer has shifted the designation too. I would probably have fit a half or full size larger better.

review_title: It was recommended if you wear a half size to order the ...
review_text: It was recommended if you wear a half size to order the smaller whole size so it is a little tight in the toe.  Also, found the same shoe on eBay for three dollars less with free shipping.

It seems the sizing is way off on all crocs.  I'm usually a 9.5 mens in almost all shoes but a 7 just barely fits.They're tighter then i would have liked and the strap is not really comfortable.  I flipped it out of the way so they're usable.For around the house shoes, they're ok.  Not great, not bad.As for foot protection, i like them.  So far they have saved my toes from a chair leg, door and a piece of glass.That‚Äôs pretty much what i bought them for.  When these are worn out, ill probably get an 8 but they really need to do something about the sizing!.

Despite the product has a good quality, i am not satisfied with the sizing, because it dosn't seem to be standard, i tried the same model before i buy it and when the product arrived was sligthly smaller, dosn't fit as i wanted

review_title: I am not satisfied with the received
review_text: I received the product in good condition but not the size I ordered. Buy a size 8, size 8 woman and sent a man. I am not satisfied with the receivedCrocs Classic Clog,Khaki,Women's 8 M US/Men's 6 M US
The fit was actually ok. the problem was one heel strap was longer than the other. It hung over the end of the shoe making the shoe a clog.
Received 2 different sized shoes so pay attention when they come.  Shoe is great quality

I ordered these shoes for my 28 year old son.  He had worn the shoes about two weeks when the strap on one of the shoes came loose and of course, not in a way that could be repaired.  I would think that what I paid for these shoes they should have been better constructed than that!

Received them on time, just a little big, thought they would fit like my other pair that are an XL- 10-11 men. I ordered 11 men, should've went 10 men, oh well, they will still work for what i'm using them for.

I used to love Crocs.  My first pair were the Classics then I got the slippers then the Yukon Sports and told everyone how great they were.  I could not have been so far from the truth.  These shoes keep podiatrists in business.  After 3 years of wearing my Classics nearly every day of the summer and spring I started to feel a growing discomfort in my knees when walking and especially when going down steps and began to suspect the Crocs when I noticed uneven treadwear.  I went to a podiatrist and he said the Crocs due to their spongy sole where not providing support or stabilizing my knees correctly.  He said I was experiencing pronation as a result which explained the uneven tread wear. He recommended Keen shoes instead.  I tried them on and it was immediate relief.  I could literally feel the pressure redistribute in my knees.  It felt like someone opened a pressure valve within my knee joints!  I also learned Crocs act as isolators and cause static electricity buildup which explains now why I regularly would get shocked when stepping out of my van.  Lastly, they are slippery as snot on wet concrete.  Almost went down several times.  They may feel soft on the feet but these things are the devil in disguise.
they fit slightly loose compared to the same size I have in a different color; other than that, they are made very sturdy

Received the size 9 croc sandal but my toes hit the op of the shoe uncomfortably. Obvious no half sizes. The right shoe strap on the inside is not connectred well and keeps falling off.  I will not buy another pair.  Beverly Covington
The unisex clogs are too big for a women's foot. Much too wide. I don't know why they think men and women's feet are the same wide. Some of us have narrow feet

This is the second pair we ordered.  The first pair came quickly and was a true womens 8m.  We ordered a second pair, a women's 9m,  it has that size on the shoe but it is the same size as the first pair we ordered, which was very disappointing
Ordered a size 9 like I normally wear in sneakers and they are two large should have gone with 1 size lower
Not like the old Crocs. The back of the shoe is wider than the same style used to be.

The Crocs came packaged appropriately and in due time.  The size was way off and was 2 sizes smaller than what is said on the bottom of the shoe as well as on the tag. They said made in China.  I bought them for my husband to replace the same pair he owned-same style and size and color but his old pair said made in Canada.  So buyer beware.
I wear a size 4-6 in crocs m, how do I know what soze fits me

I ordered these crocs over the summer for my day camp job. But what I did not know was that they run big. I got a size 7 in this color and a size 6 in the purple. When I tried at least returning or getting Amazon credit I was told no because the deadline date had passed. But I don't get if it is in it's original packaging. HORRIBLE!!!!!! review_text: I BUY THE WHITE COLOR BUT SENT ME THE COLOR BLACK, VERY BAD, THANK YOU.I BUY THE WHITE COLOR BUT SENT ME THE COLOR BLACK, VERY BAD, THANK YOU.

Crocs are marked M10 / W12.. Since when are women's sizes LARGER than men's.  Had to return them since I was looking for an actual men's 10.. These were way too large.Amazon said it was my mistake for orering the wrong size.  Ha.

I ordered two pairs of Crocs - one pair of thongs and one pair of cayman crocs. I used the sizing chart provided and ordered both pairs in M5/W7. However, when they arrived, while the Thongs fit perfectly, with room to wiggle, the Caymans were way too small (I'd almost say a full size too small). The Thongs were "made in China" and the Caymans "made in Mexico". I went to my local store and discovered that they receive Croc orders which are often made in multiple countries. It would appear to me that there is no "standard" mold used. So beware - just because you have tried them on in a store and think you have the correct size - you may end up getting a larger or smaller size, depending on where they are manufactured.
Need to be more hand free equipped
I ordered this slip-on shoes and the shoes is really comfortable. I like it.
Sucked - not sure if these are knock off crocks or what
I'm a size 5 in mens and this might as well been a 4.5. The width is good and it has nice support but it has absolutely no toe room for me ;(

Wir haben gleich 3 Paar dieser Schuhe in unterschiedlichen Gr√∂√üen und Farben gekauft. Da wir diese Schuhe im Garten und auf der Terrasse benutzen wollten, lagen sie bei uns immer drau√üen. Nach einigen Tagen in der Sonne sind sie so eingeschrumpelt, dass man unm√∂glich noch seinen Fu√ü hinein bekommt. Die schwarze 43/44 passt h√∂chstens noch jemandem mit Schuhgr√∂√üe 36, und die dunkelblaue 42/43 kann niemand mehr tragen, da sie sich zus√§tzlich auch noch vorne extrem nach oben gebogen haben und jetzt gute Clownsschuhe beim Kinderfasching w√§ren. Das dritte Paar hat sich nur ein wenig verzogen, vermutlich weil es die hellblauen waren und da die Sonne nicht so draufbrezelt. Geht jedenfalls √ºberhaupt nicht f√ºr den Preis! H√§tte ich bei 5‚Ç¨ Schuhen erwartet. Wenigstens ein Hinweis, dass man die Schuhe nicht in die Sonne legen darf, w√§re wichtig!

Die Schuhe passen gut und sind bequem. Da ich sie haupts√§chlich im Garten und auf der Terrasse benutzt habe, standen sie logischerweise auch mal in der Sonne - mit dem Ergebnis, dass sie nach nur 3-4 Wochen mindestens 3 Gr√∂√üen geschrumpft sind! Im ersten Moment dachte ich, dass ein Kind seine Schuhe aus Versehen bei uns stehen gelassen hat, weil ich mir gar nicht erkl√§ren konnte, wieso ich pl√∂tzlich nicht mehr in die Schuhe passte!Dabei wirbt der Hersteller mit "der perfekte Schuh f√ºr Strand oder Boot!" Nur darf die Sonne eben nicht l√§nger scheinen. Amazon hat kulanterweise den Schuh zur√ºckgenommen und den Kaufpreis erstattet, obwohl die Frist zur R√ºckgabe bereits verstrichen war.Da bereits mehrere K√§ufer von demselben Ph√§nomen berichten, sollte man den Schuh auf keinen Fall kaufen, wenn man vorhat, ihn auch drau√üen zu benutzen. Sehr entt√§uschend.

Finger weg, Schuhe schrumpfen bei W√§rme. Verk√§ufer lehnt Gew√§hrleistung mit folgender Begr√ºndung ab:"Wir entschuldigen uns f√ºr Ihre schlechten Erfahrungen. Leider ist das Schrumpfen der Crocks jeden Sommer ein h√§ufiges Problem. Wir verstehen Ihre Unzufriedenheit vollkommen und es ist unsere Politik, jeden Kundenanspruch zu untersuchen, aber in diesem Fall k√∂nnen wir nicht viel tun. Die Garantie von Crocs deckt keine physischen Sch√§den ab, die durch Missbrauch und falsche Handhabung durch den Benutzer verursacht wurden.Einige F√§lle, in denen Crocs-Schuhe wahrscheinlich schrumpfen, sind:- wenn in einem hei√üen Auto gelassen;- wenn in der Sp√ºlmaschine gewaschen;- wenn drau√üen in der Sonne gelassen.Dies ist kein Herstellungsfehler.Im Internet finden Sie verschiedene Tutorials, mit denen Sie Ihre Schuhe reparieren und wieder anziehen k√∂nnen."Die Schuhe wurden -naturgem√§√ü- draussen gelagert, da sie als Gartenschuhe Verwendung finden sollten. Bei der ersten Hitzeperiode (35 Grad) sind sie geschrumpft und passen -vorher Gr. 46/47- nun noch Gr. 40. Wir haben seit vielen Jahren viele Modelle an Crocs, aber diese "Qualit√§t" ist uns neu. Keine Kaufempfehlung!

Crocs sizing drives me mad. With both UK and US sizes and then even the UK sizes are incompatible with my feet. Normally a size 8 and knowing they're always on the large size I ordered a UK7 and this is still too big.

They have changed the shape and feel of Classic Crocs which I think is a shame. I prefer the rounded wide front and squishiness of my old style crocs, these are considerably narrower at the front. I'm sure they have done this to try and make them less disagreeable to the anti-croccers, but actually they look more silly in their new slimline shape. They are also firmer- I preferred them soft.

I ordered these for my husband as a Christmas present.  He is size 7 so clicked on that size.  When they arrived they were good quality but looked too big, so Christmas surprise spoilt for him as I had to ask him to try them on just in case they were OK - but no they were much to big.  When I checked to bottom of the Crocs it said size 8.When you order the sizing chart shows mens size 7/women size 8 which I presume is wrong as generally women have smaller feet but quite what determines which size you get who knows a crystal ball maybe. I have had to return them so a complete waste of my time and a Christmas surprise spoilt.I now have a dilemma,  do I re-order size 6 hoping to get size 7 or just forget the whole thing.I noticed in the reviews that the quality is not generally in question but that wrong sizing  is a frequent complaint so maybe time the production information was corrected and customers stopped wasting their time..

Others have commented on the strange sizing of Crocs, which seems to depend on whether they're made in Italy or China. I already had a pair of size 7s, which are roomy, so I only wear them round the house and garden.  And my son wears them (he's a size 9).  I needed something big to wear following a broken ankle so ordered a pair of black size 7.  They arrived and were visibly much smaller than the ones I already had. Small pair made in Italy, large pair made in China, both purporting to be size 7.  Really annoying.  I exchanged for a size 8 which is about the right size on my 'normal' foot - but I'm not usually an 8!Surely such a well known brand should be able to get its sizing right!

The soles inside most Crocs have very small, slightly raised bobbles, presumably to invigorate one's feet, except these can cause nerve damage over time to diabetics' feet like my husband's and he has many various wide styles of other shoe makes bought from Amazon and been very satisfied. Eventually after only a fortnight, his Crocs were causing considerable nerve pain, so he bought gel insoles to prevent further discomfort.Otherwise Crocs are very comfy. They come in a variety of great colours and whose straps help keep one's feet safety inside the shoe.I wrote to Crocs many times, only to receive no reply.

Sadly, I cannot get on with these crocs. I persevered for 2 days as I have used crocs every Summer for at least 20m years.I cannot wear these however as I think that the raised areas on the soles are too high.  The bottoms of my feet were too painful to persevere and further.By the raised areas, I mean the many bumps in the shoes.I printed a label and sent these crocs back to you last week so you should  have received them by now.  No sign of a refund to dateThese were returned via hermes on 26/05/2020. I guess hermes still has them.

I normally love Crocs but these were huge on meI‚Äôm UK Womens size 4 and that‚Äôs what I ordered and they are much too long and much too wideI also ordered a lovely pair of Crocbands for a bargain price from Amazon and they fit perfectlyThey are still a nice lightweight shoe that‚Äôs ideal for nipping into the garden etc but just too big for me

Such a shame I was really looking forward to these - desperate for garden clogs! They are like boats.... I measured my feet and used the sizing guide but it's not worked out for some reason.  I went half a size larger to allow for the shrinkage that many reviews mention, but the crocs are more than an inch longer than my feet!  Sadly I need to return them.

I am a normal mens size 8, so ordered what was listed as "mens 8/womens 9" (whatever that means?). These were from Bosnia and much too big. Sent them back and re-ordered "mens 7/womens 8". The new ones came from China and have size 8 mens/10 womens on them!. Quite crazy, but at lease they fit better although still a bit big. Bosnian ones were noticeably better quality too.

I usually buy Croc lookalikes (or mock crocs as I refer to them) from a well known high street shoe shop, but they seem to wear down on the heel quite quickly, so I thought I'd try the branded one's. I have wide feet, so purchase men's size 7 in the mock croc version. Other reviewers stated that sizing depended greatly on where their Crocs were made, but as I had no idea in advance which version I would receive, I thought I should stick with a size 7. I have to say mine are a little on the small side - not only narrower but also shorter in length. I wear them instead of slippers, so during the summer months they fit fine, but I cannot wear them with socks once it gets cooler - there simply isn't enough room in them. I think in future I will stick with the 2 pairs for ¬£8.00 mock crocs, and just replace them more often. I find it rather ironic that a cheaper high street pair, is more generously sized than the expensive branded version.

Bought a Womans size 6 to replace my girlfriends identical size 6 Crocs which are stamped Made in China.On arrival they are visibly smaller and stamped Made in Bosnia.Tried them against my mum's identical size 5 Crocs stamped Made in Italy and they are the same size.Size 7 made in Vietnam too big.So, check your sizing before buying

Bought size 11 for our son, now they are too tight even for my feet - and I'm size 7.  Nothing like that happened to us before - not to Tesco's, Lidl or IKEA pairs. Waste of money.

Usually I wear a UK 9 in normal shoes, but as I‚Äôd ordered a UK size 8 for crocs last time, that‚Äôs what ordered this time.The crocs that arrived claim to be an 8 but they‚Äôve got to be closer to an 11 in normal shoes. I fully undertand they are designed and purposefully and made to a style " loose fitting" for comfort . But the one thing for us "inbetweeners", and I have experienced this with plenty of other footwear design/manufacturers is that it would be extremely useful if our Italian cousins who apparently made them (unless their plant is with our Far Eastern Cousins?). Would it be possible to suggest that theythey consider makig  a (1/2 half size ) through the perceived popular average range for for UK market feet i.e. some half sizes from 7 through to 11 1/2Love the Colour ,love the design the grip underneath,would just preferred a half 1/2 size bigger (8&1/2) ,would have been totally  satisfied. Wish I read the reviews. Sizes are too big. Definitely go a size smaller.It‚Äôs not the end of the world as I can still wear them but it‚Äôs annoying that they don‚Äôt fit as well as they would if I went a size smaller than my usual fit.

Ordered an 8 ( men‚Äôs ) but says a 9 on the bottom. They‚Äôre also very wide!! They were a present ( early Oct birthday ) plus I‚Äôve missed the return window so I‚Äôve had to pass them On to someone with with wider feet. Don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll be ordering a new pair as I can get the same for cheaper elsewhere. But the quality looked good.

I have a pair of Crocs exactly the same size.so felt confident buying on line , but these are totally different, If worn as flip flops they are fine if you want the ankle strap on they are way to tight.Returned

I have purchased about ten pairs of these crocs over the last two years and by using the size chart provided.It's hit and miss whether you will get the right size to fit it's either too small or too big.On the very rare occasion, you will get a pair to fit me. So, as a result, I have about six pairs never worn because they are too big such a waste of money so I would be very reluctant to purchase another pair going forward.Don't get me wrong I love the comfort of Crocs but I'm not going to waste any more money it's just not worth it!!

Well what a shame, my first pair of Crocs and I have had to return them as they are waaay to big. UK size 9, Euro size 43 is my size and this is the size of Crocs I bought and ended up with but I'd say that they are more like a 10 if not 11... even with socks and having rather wide feet these things flopped about on my feet.Every other shoe I have ever had, from Ecco and Clarks to all makes of wellies I have always fitted a 9 or Euro 43, but not these. I guess it may be a Crocs specific thing but i wish someone had told me!Lesson learnt, despite the speedy delivery and hassle free return procedure with stuff like shoes and clothes it's just easier to go and try it on in a good old shop.

I normally wear a size 8.5 - 9 in UK shoes so I bought the size f9/m8 in UK sizes for these thinking they may be a little snug but being rubber that they would stretch over time... OH.... MY..... GOD!!.... Massive or what!? I can step in and out of them without touching the sides, I gave them to my dad and am gonna reorder in the size f7/m6 (that's TWO sizes smaller than the first pair and 3 sizes smaller than my actual foot size).

These Crocs have shrunk by 3 sizes (!!) from being left out in the sun in the garden in Belgium. I‚Äôve bought size 43 for my husband and after few weeks they suddenly shrunk to size 39-40 from just sitting on the terrace in the sun! My son has size 40 and they are slightly small even for him. I doubt these are genuine Crocs as the previous pair bought in the brand store never changed in 4 years of our life in Africa. Do not recommend them and highly disappointed!

I bought these because they were recommended by a physio who was treating my plantar fasciitis.  However, these shoes although seemingly very comfortable, provide no support at all for the foot.  I soon realised that my PF was getting far worse whenever I had worn the crocs and my ankles became incredibly sore.  I found the best shoes to wear are FitFlops which provide more support and give your calf muscles a workout which helps in the alleviation of PF symptoms.

Ordered size 10, as my husband has always taken size 10, and these were ordered as a replacement for existing pair. The Crocs that arrived were much too big and would not stay on, so we had to return them for a refund.

I take a Size 7 (UK).  I ordered UK7 from the initial drop down size options.They arrived and were huge the numbers on the sole of the crocs were M8  W10I get the impression the M and W refer to men and women.It is safer to use EU sizing if you take a size 7 (UK) I ordered EU39-40 from the size chart.  The chart row detailsM7  6UK  39/40  9.625  24.6unfortunately the EU size is not visible until you place the order!

The button on one of the straps has come off and so the strap hangs/drags off the back of the shoe. The Crocs have hardly been worn as they are only used for popping out to the garden (infrequently). Would have expected these to last better. I'm not sure if they can be replaced at all please? I am happy to send photos if need be? Thank you, look forward to hearing from you.

Firstly Crocs appear to have come down in price. Probably because they are less hard-wearing than they used to be.Size wise these are collosal even on my size UK 13 feet.Were the cheaper versions available in my size I wouldn't buy these again.

Way to big . Ordered my usual size and they were huge , to long and too wide , ordered the smaller size and they were to small , there was a big difference in sizes . I know loads of people love these but they were not for me . Also felt the hard raised nodules on the soles were very uncomfortable. They did come on time and well packaged .

This is unfortunately the second pair I have ordered from this seller. First paid had bent straps which did not sit correctly at the front of the crocs. This replacement pair has the same issue but even worse than the previous one. The crocs seem to have been put under some form of pressure maybe in the warehouse and therefore they have deformed shape. I will be returning this pair since I have seen a functional pair I know that the straps are not meant to be like this.

I ordered size 9 (UK sizes).  This i received, and the paperwork confirmed Size 9;  BUT after i'd worn them for a while, i discovered that they are in fact Size 10.  Which is OK, but it makes it easier to stumble

I had a pair of cheap Wilko clogs and as i leave them outside, with time they have become tight.So I decide to buy Crocs. Cost me 3 time as much and, although they feel much softer they become so smaller inside a week by more then 1 size. Now I cant get inside. I'm size 10 and I bought size 11, should have bought 12.very annoyed
Good product but sizing a little confusing which resulted in ordering a size too big.

I must have five or six pairs of these. I have worn the soles out on my navy ones and they are very slippery in the wet so treated myself to a new pair. These are smaller than the last pair. I have read that you can put them in the tumble dryer and warm them up by wearing them while hot. I also found out that leaving them in the sun or in a hot car can make them shrink a couple of sizes. They don't all do it. They seem to think its the way the % of ingredients in the plastic are mixed. Have just bought a larger pair ;-)

I found these shoes were a little too big for me.  I was certain that I ordered a size 13 but the shoes I have received are a size too big.I cannot return them as I do not have any packaging with a return address etc.  I guess I must put them down to experience!

The product was as expected, but unfortunately they sent me the wrong size and labelled it the size I had ordered. I spent the afternoon wearing them and ended up with 2 small blisters on the arch of my foot. I have attempted to process refund but as there is no way to contact seller directly I wont be able to. I will be buying a new pair that actually fit, but won‚Äôt be hosing this seller.

I've ordered many crocs before for work, but never this style, because the toes are so bulky they cause you to trip up a lot, that aside, the strap snapped off of my pair within the same day of receiving them, I wore them for the rest of the week but with the toes tripping me up and no strap, I had to order new shoes. I was quite disappointed with these crocs, and I thought I'd never say that as I'm a big fan if my crocs.

Crocs are the best of a poor choice. The soles wear out in about 3 months so the real price is much higher. However they are amazing at keeping your feet cool and they're very comfortable. If Crocs could actually produce some modern progressive Clog designs they'd get five stars but their design or possibly their marketing department lets them down. Hire some good designers and let them do their job. We don't need wacky shoes with crazy two tone color schemes, just well designed ones.

Unfortunately despite me returning the first pair which were far too big and asking to be sent an actual UK size 10, the same size was sent back to me. It's a shame because they are decent crocs. I've asked for a refund because I can't risk having to send a third pair back.

Crocs arrived in good time, only problem was the size......They were HUGE. I returned them the next day though.Just a shame I couldn't exchange them for a smaller size but had to return them and then order a new pair.Great Product though, just an issue with the size.

I was slightly disappointed by these. The insoles did not feel as comfortable or supportive as I'd hoped, and the size of the shoe was almost too short for my feet- it felt like my heel was hanging off the end of the shoe. However, width-wise, they felt too loose around my foot and wouldn't stay on unless I used the strap, which then pushed my foot forwards and squashed my toes. I wanted to use these as shoes/slippers to jump in and out of around the house, therefore they are no good for me and I will be returning them.

The bag they arrived in might have been correct...but the crocs weren't...I couldn't sort out the sizing on these...its a toss up between uk, us, chinese, korean and maybe eskimo.. i could almost get both feet in one croc, and I'm not small. Had to return them...

I bought these as advertised size 6. When they arrived it said on the sole, women's size 8 and men's size 6. I am keeping them as they might be better with socks, in winter. However, if this had been clear on the advert, I would have bought a smaller size. It didn't say on the description on Amazon that it was Unisex and gave absolutely NO indication that size 6 meant men's size 6 which is different from women's size 6!! Size 6, to me, is unisex as in all other shops/shoes, a men's (or boys') size 6 is the right size for me.I am keeping them as I needed them urgently for work and it's too much hassle to return them as I will have nothing to wear at work in the meantime but PLEASE in future make this sizing VERY clear!!

I have bought at least 20 pairs of Crocs and these are the first that don't quite fit. I would much rather have paid the extra ¬£10 and had a normal fit. The ones that I took off were sized 6 - 8 and made in Italy, just exactly the same as the new ones, but the new ones are slightly wider and have slightly bigger holes. Not happy, but these were the only Crocs on Amazon so no choice either.

Gave these to my mother as a gift - bought at the same time as another pair for me which are perfectly sized. She has only just told me (as she didn't want to offend me) that she can't wear them as they are too small. On comparing them, although both pairs are marked Size 5, this pair is at least 2 sizes smaller and therefore unusable. Most disappointing as it's now too late to do anything about it.

Ordered size UK7. When arrived, package said UK8 and sole said US8. After two replacements found I out that in 2015 Crocs changed size classifications and US8 on sole is equivalent to UK7. There is obviously an error on package label. These are genuine Crocs and exceptional value for money. Just be aware, as in other reviews, of size classifications.

Okay, so far two stars as: I ordered the UK M5/W6 (my feet are 5.5-6 women) and these were too bloody big! More like a women's UK 8! Really disappointed. Sending these back but no idea whether to get a smaller size from this seller, may just pay twice the price at a Crocs shop! Not totally convinced they're the real deal anyway.
Be careful when ordering, the size is men's first, womens second, picker will choose mens size even for women.?????

I was quite bewildered by the sizing policy but eventually took the plunge and ordered size 7M / 8W which seemed to correspond with a pair I have already. When I received the order I tried the Crocs on and was disappointed to find that they were too large. It was only when I checked my order, the label on the shoes, the label on the bag and the size on the bottom of the shoe that I realised that Amazon had despatched a size too large. I may take the risk and re-order..........

My son love Crocs and his we‚Äôre getting really worn and scruffy. So I ordered him a new pair of UK size 12. However, when he received them and tried them on, they were too big. The packaging stated size 12 but the size on the Crocs were 13. I had to return them.
I ordered 2 pairs . one red they were perfect. but the blue were to small.

I bought these Crocs because I have other colours which I love, but these black ones appear to be of inferior quality.  The plastic is a lot harder and ungiving and therefore not nearly as comfortable.  Maybe they will soften in time, but I see no reason why a different colour should be any different in quality, especially as the price remains the same and I suspect these are manufactured by a different company, using cheaper materials.

the size chart is confusing...I ordered a 10 M thinking the M stood for men....obviously doesn't. I got a 10 M women 8 M for men. Do something to simplify the size chart. I gave the small crocs away. Too much hastle to repackage them and send them back. Turns out they have become way too expensive! Bought another pair..and hopefully this time the right size
I‚Äôve never known this problem with Crocs I‚Äôve worn in the past, but the bed of these have raised nodules so big that they actually caused my feet to hurt!  Sent back.

Oh dear.  Why oh why is it so difficult to get the correct fitting crocs?  I ordered the same size as my old ones (which fit perfectly), new ones arrived promptly  :-)  BUT they sent a different size to the one I ordered!!!!  :-(I love Crocs - use them instead of slippers all the time around the house.  Desperate to get another pair, (as lost one when took my previous pair out the house).  Will order again.

I read various reviews about crocs before ordering, and gathered from most that the sizings can be hit or miss. I therefore ordered two different styles and two different sizes.Jolly glad that i did. My normal size is a 6, but the size 6 that i ordered looked more like a childs shoe. There was no way my feet were going to fit into those. The pair i ordered in a different size and style fitted perfectly. My advice for this product would be to either order two pairs in different sizes or go for 2 sizes bigger than you would normally wear.
If you have a number 10-11 feet as me, it is too large. I struggle controlling my feet And hit corners.

Order a pair of UK 15 EU 51/52 but when they arrived these were clearly children's Crocs.Although the sticker on the bag did specify UK15 EU 51/52 they would need to be built to the same specification as Dr Whos' tardis to fit my feet.

I bought these for my sister they arrived very quickly even with the terrible weather conditions. The crocs were bought to replace an old pair made in Italy that fitted perfectly. It appears Crocs  are made in different countries and this pair looked perfect but were made in China and  at least a size too small. My sister returned the crocs and decided not to take a chance on the next size being a better fit and buy locally therefore able to try  on and save the possibly of having to return if wrong size. My advice  see if you can find out where they were made before buying and if China take a bigger size.  difficult to give a rating as the product is good but incorrectly sized.
terrible fit loose, not safe! unfortunately discovered that when it was too late for a return.. very fit than your actual size. avoid.
There are small bumps/points on the sole of these shoes which are PAINFUL!Couldn't wear more than a few minutes even round the house

These crocs were physically much smaller than an identical pair of crocs bought previously, of the same size. They were too small, and had to be returned. Interestingly they were made in Vietnam, whereas the original pair were from China.

The sizing of these seems wrong.  I ordered size 10 men/11 woman not fully understanding why it came in 2 sizes and looking for them to be size 10.  The ones delivered had the same size descriptions on but were at the very least a sizeable 11, maybe 11.5.

Weird fitting, make sure you‚Äôre getting a woman‚Äôs size not a men‚Äôs. And I would get a size smaller.Also the arch support is not great, wearing all day in hospital setting and when I take them off I feel such relief to put on a pair of trainers.
The strap around the heel disintegrated in a few months.Not made how they used to be!

Disappointed in the fact that these have come in a bag instead of a box, this has clearly led to them being crushed and warped out of shape.Both loops for heals also do not stick in top position. Also down to being warped I assume.

It's a mistake to assume the size of the croc's, as marked on the pair you already have, is specific to the UK.. The 'size selection table' has a lot of detail, but the  size on the croc's you have is just a number. Whether it's UK, USA or European is not included.
Can't comment a christmas present

Had to order twice and both times the shoes wouldn't fit - were too small. When I got it it was good but with in a month it started to become very hard and shrunken. The heel support is very bad as well it started to make sounds ! I will not recommend this product at all.

I ordered a UK 9 and the pair I received had 10/12 on the bottom.... I sent them back asking for a 9 and got an identical pair back! This then happened again when I returned the 2nd pair! I finally got the correct fit with a UK 8 even though I'm a standard UK 9 (43/44 European sizing)‚Ä¶ the actual Crocs themselves are good/good value.

Do what they do, only for house/garden work so I haven't bothered to send them back but 'UK men's size 10' were definitely size 11. It's literally stamped on there.And if they are size 10 (stamp may be American size) then it's the biggest size 10 I've ever known.

These are Crocs, so you know what to expect ; comfortable, nice silly colour, ugly, and so far they seem to be as hard-wearing as my previous pair of Crocs. They sent me 'roomy' fit last time so I returned them. They were the right size but I have normal, standard feet. They‚Äôre Crocs. Not comfy but useful for garden in the winter!
Too big, unfortunately I‚Äôd kept them to long to send back.
OK FOR QUALITY BUT SIZING IS LESS THAN GENEROUS - THIS WILL BE THE THIRD PAIR I'VE BOUGHT THAT THE SIZING IS "NEAT" - TWO PAIRS I GAVE AWAY TO PEOPLE WITH SMALLER FEET!
Quite soft material, not as supportive as previous purchases.

The sizing of Crocs seems to be rather a random business these days.This is the third pair I have purchased over the internet in the past year all three have failed tofit as expected. I future I will use a high street shop for my purchases of Cros shoes
God they're ugly.  I mean, crocs are ugly anyway but this khaki army green type colour just made them look even worse!  Returned.
I ordered a size 4 for women, but it is really small than usual size 4, I'm normally wear 3.5 and this pair feels a bit tight! Although it is quite comfortable and really beautiful.
