Great gardening shoes, however they are too small. I take a Doc Martens UK and these don't fit OK. I am re ordering 2 sizes up because honestly who wants a tight rubber shoe? Ugh.
Reviewers said these where big......What An Understatement. Couldn‚Äôt believe what I was looking at. Totally unfit for purpose if you have human sized feet.
My husband is a chef and bought these to wear in the kitchen as the old crocs he had were steady. These are slippery when wet.

These were enormous I had to send them back. I ordered a 4 and got a size 5 which stated roomy fit. My sons a size 3.5 so I bought a pair today from a shop still crocs in a size 3 and they fit him perfectly. Go for a smaller size if in doubt.

They are crocks. I bought them to potter around in the garden. They are very comfortable and easy to put on and take off. My only criticism is my wife bought a cheap version - not crocks - and we couldn't tell the difference. Nevertheless I wanted Crocks and was happy to pay the extra money for the name
I had to buy due to needing to protect my feet But they are ugly uncomfortable and you look like a total idiot in them . I will probably never wear these ugliest pieces of plastic ever
They seems comfortable but the wrong size was sent me I ordered size 10 and a size 11 was sent to me and it was a ball ache to return and then have to order more

The size of my existing Crocs is 8-9 men's whereas the size on these were just men's size 8. Although the style appeared the same the fit was overall too large, more like a men's 9. Not as described.  Wrong size
I thought I was buying a product that was for men and women. They are marked the same size as my last pair, but they are smaller.

All the sizes are messed up at first I ordered the nxt size up but got sent a size 12 so I sent them bk and ordered again and guess wot got a size 12 again so then I ordered a smaller size this size and they are a little tight but I'm hoping that with time and keep wearing them they will stretch I would have given 5 stars if it wasn't for size as they are really nice.

The holes around the sole let in stones, so OK for beachware but not so good around the garden. I've bought lined ones which are much better in this regard as they don't have the holes around the sole. Having said that, the design of the Croc is brilliant and it's a very easy and versatile "utility" shoe.

Big dissapointment, This is a replacement pair of crocs for a pair bought 2yrs ago.This pair are small (a chinese 9?) and also made in china not in europe where my first pair were made.I think that product source should be made compulsory and sizing should be checked.Not my best buy. For 2 pins I would bin them but they were not cheap!
ordered size 8 mens. recieced size 9 -too big!

It's the same old same old with crocs. ..either a bit tight or too big.....wish amazon would sort out their  sizing references  otherwise a very good shoe.there are differences in Croc sizes .eg  UK 12  and UK 12/13 ...M For the slightly bigger size they're called' roomy'

I bought a lapis pair of the classic clogs however to my surprise when they arrived they were more of a lilac colour than the darker lapis tone that was depicted. The crocs work absolutely fine but the colour is off.
Bought as a gift. Too big. Would recommend buying a smaller size than usual.

Somebody needs to get sizings sorted out, as I ordered exactly what it said on the underneath of a pair of crocs I already own and which fir perfectly. I received a pair in the next size up!

I knew sizing might be a problem from other reviews, but I thought it had now been overcome, so that UK size 9 meant just that. I was wrong. UK size 9 is much smaller than Croc 'UK size 9'. Bought for my wife and the size is way to small for what was suppose to be her size.  Be aware of the sizing as its inaccurate.

I ordered w8, which according to size guide is equivalent to UK 6. I received w10, which is too big.I've worn crocs as slippers for years, and find them to be really comfy. I'd hesitate to buy online again.5 for the product, 1 for the sizing :(
Far far far too big. Ordered the size bigger as I usually do with crocs but these were massive. Will be returning.
I'm sure the crocs are fine if your a size 10 however I ordered a 9 and looking on reviews it's not the first time its happened apart from that yes they are fine if they fit

These purchased to replace some old pre-bankruptsy and selloff size 13 original Crocs which were made in China. These new made in Italy size 13 Crocs are AT LEAST a size smaller than the original crocs. With the eye of faith following wind you could just about call them size 12. Doh!

I've bought several pairs of Crocs previously and have had no problem with them.  However this pair are a poor fit and far too squashy. correct size but inside grip of croc very sharp or pronounced and not as comfortable as the blue pair I also purchased but as I has walked in them not sure what to do

There's nothing wrong with the crocs it's the sizing. I ordered a 9M, I need a 9M but have been sent a 10m. Apparently the sizing has changed but these are too big so in the end I returned them for a refund, despite them being a fantastic low price, and I shall shop elsewhere.

I was sent the wrong size otherwise the score would have been higher.  Very comfortable if you are sent the correct size and there are so many colours that everyone should be able to find a pair they like
Sizing is very poor. I ordered a women's size six and they are way too small and narrow. more like a child's size!
Great product, but took 3 attempts to get the correct size. It's US sizes and a "roomy fit". Surely they must sell enough of these one the UK to market them with proper UK sizing?
they were unfortunately too big, not sure how because my shoe size doesnt ever change in other brands

Great shoes. Super comfortable

As a few reviews have alluded to: order UK Size 11, receive size US size 12 which is huge.......Officially there is a 1/2 size difference between US and UK, so Amazon seem to have rounded up, which is not genius.Order one size down...
Ordered size 10 and size 11 arrived. Even if we had got the correct size they still would have been too big as they are extremely wide. Seem wider than normal for crocs.
They are wrongly sized now. A six is now a five and a half.

The shoes are fine, but Confusing sizing. The package we got said UK size 9 US size 9M.  EU 42-43. These are not the same!. I am reliably a size 9 uk, and this is an EU 43, but these are not the same as a US size 9, so why do crocs return something smaller then label it as "UK size 9 US size 9M.  EU 42-43"?

In some places I have seen crocs advertised as fitting 10-11 or 11-12 so chose 11s, my feet having been recently measured as 11.5 after years of me buying 10.5 extra wide. Along with the confusing sizing chart, just be very careful to buy from Amazon so that, if you're not quite sure that you will like them and that they will fit, you can return them without cost.

Another reviewer expressed frustration that a company like Crocs cant get its suppliers to produce to a consistent size standard and I agree. You might as well buy locally - there are plenty of Croc lookalikes to choose from at a much lower price and they might not last as long but at least you know they fit

I suffer from plantar fasciatis in both heels and was recommended these crocs by a friend who had suffered from the same ailment and got great relief from this type of shoe.  Within half an hour of putting them on I was in complete agony and spent several hours afterwards off my feet as I was unable to even hobble, never mind walk.  Needless to say I was very disappointed as I expected to be able to walk easier and relatively pain free once I wore them.  However, they did arrive in excellent time and were comfortable once I put them on, shoe size, width etc. was spot on.  My problems only began once I actually started to walk in them.  Perhaps this type of shoe helps mild plantar fascitis but it is definitely not good for the more debilitating type.  I would recommend these shoes only for people who do not suffer from pain in their feet.

This Anomaly is confusing, particularly for online purchases.When I tried for return / cancellation option, the refund is limited to basic cost (Rs. 1764/- in this case) and balance Rs. 1300/- towards import / freight is to be absorbed by customers - which is a unfair burden.On screen the price indicated is Rs.1764/- but when you place order the cost comes to Rs. 3056/- which should be indicated initially. Overall you feel let down on a good product - first time Buyer need to be vey careful about size unless you have tried with friend or acquaintance and are very sure.To avoid hassles of import / refund you may buy online from shopcrocs.in - you wont have to take a financial hit.

These genuine Crocs were not a UK size 12 as advertised and as per the Crocs label.  I have been buying my Dad size 12 Crocs for years without any problem with the sizing.  His Crocs that fit have the number 12 on the sole.  These had a number 13 on the sole but the label clearly stated "UK 12".  They were too big.  My Dad has mobility issues and having shoes that fit is imperative to his being able to walk safely and confidently.  Unfortunately I could not return as I trusted the label which I had removed and had written my Dad's name on (he lives in a care-home).  This has put me off buying genuine Crocs on-line.

This is the 3rd pair of Crocs I have bought online. Always same size, for my father and myself. However, this time, although the specs are exactly the same (as shown on the soles) the crocs are 2 cm shorter than previous pairs. We only noticed this fault when I gave the crocs as a gift to my dad, who lives overseas. It is frustrating and embarrassing. Also, it is very inconvenient to bring the crocs back to the UK, ship them back, etc. Very poor experience due to these nonsensical, inconsistent sizes. My advice: buy your Crocs in a normal retail store, as Amazon has proved unreliable in relation to sizes.

Per qualche motivo [probabilmente economico] Crocs ha cambiato il disegno dell' interno delle scarpe. Io ho un paio di Crocs Classic Sabot che ho comprato 5 anni fa e sembrano imbottite in qualche modo. Sono morbide e molto comode. Pero' le suole sono consummate e quindi sono molto pericolose sul bagnato. Adesso invece le scarpe dentro sono dure e dopo poco tempo danno fastidio al piede. Sono diventate come qualsiasi altra imitazione delle Crocs che si trovano in giro per meno della meta'.

Apres verification il s agit bien des miennes la taille est indiquee dessus. En prenant la marque CROCS je pensais acheter un produit de qualite.Je me demande s'il ne s agit pas de fausses CROCS, bien que inscrit dessus.

I will admit, I once was a hater. I lived a hateful negative life where I truly despised this footwear. But recently I've made many drastic life changes and these shoes have helped me see the light. They have helped me to see the beauty of the world and give me the confidence to face whatever obstacles life may throw my way. I can now walk outside with confidence. These shoes, these marvelous shoes, help me to live my life to the fullest not only in style but with such comfort no amount of words can begin to describe. I will now continue to live my life with an open mind to such fashion statements. No more will I live with my head hung low, but now I wear my crocs with pride. Sports mode empowers me while relaxed mode truly is the epitome of serenity. Crocs have also been the glue that has bonded me and one my best friends. Crocs truly change your life and bring people together. I will forever be indebted to this spectacular shoe.

I LOVE THESE THINGS!! They're stylish and functional. These shoes are the future. It is not hard to pull them off with any outfit. Wear them to school, wear them to run errands, wear them to church! I sure do! Nothing can compare to these wonderful shoes.These shoes really show individuality. With a variety of colors and endless shoe charms, you can express who you are in a unique and fashionable way. Be a trend setter with Crocs, the shoes that should have never gone out of style!

I own 2 pair of Crocs women's Freesail and figured I'd try a pair of the classics.  The Freesail are much trimmer & narrower in width than the  women's Classics.  I love both.  The Classics are quite a bit boxier and wider in width  than the Freesail and the Classics seem to have a bit more  cushioning on the bottom.  Both work well for my problem feet which are usually sporting the Alegria brand shoes/sandals  for work.  However, on weekends and downtime, I prefer Crocs.  I have hammer toes  and deteriorating foot joints and have lost most of natural cushioning on the bottom of my feet making it feel like I'm walking on marbles. I typically wear a women's 8/12 or a European size  39.  In Crocs, I always  go a size 9 for the length.  I love both the Freesail and Classics and would urge anyone with "touchy feet" to give these a try.

review_title: Cutest Comfy Ugly Shoe You Can Buy
review_text: I bought this classic fit (wide) shoe in size 6 men to get a size 8 women's.  It fits perfectly.  Most comfortable shoe or clog ever.  They are also ugly but they are so ugly that they are cute. To be clear, I bought these to wear with fluffy socks so I have the room I need (my feet are not wide) when wearing the fluffy socks. The strap can be in the back or in the front.  I like having it across my heel when wearing socks.  Feet don't sweat thanks to all of the vents.  You can also put cute little Jibbitz on them that people will notice and take their attention away from the ugly shoes.  You can wear these things all day, 10-12 hours and your feet and legs will hold out.  I got the original classic style because so many people online complained about the soles coming apart on the newer style.  So buyer beware, if you try them you will love them.

review_title: and we like how easy it is to get them on
review_text: I never, ever thought I'd wear Crocs, but here I am.Our 1.5 year old daughter loves her Crocs, and we like how easy it is to get them on, how we don't have to fuss over socks, etc. They're great summer shoes for kids. After a while I started thinking about getting myself a pair just as yard work/grilling/fishing/etc. shoes for the same reason. Which is what they started as, but during one Home Depot trip I realized I never took them off and was wearing them out. Fair game, I guess I'm living the Croc life now.Regarding sizing, I saw some strange advice all over. And perhaps it's different between colors, so for clarity's sake I got the Khaki color. Anyway, I saw some people talking about sizing down, but I really don't think that's the right way to go. Crocs do feel loose on your feet, but just wear them around a bit and you'll realize that they're just fine and very secure. The bottom "floats" a little bit so you don't develop blisters, but the strap holds them to your feet pretty well. If this were a normal shoe, then I'd size down. But it's not, and it doesn't wear/stretch/weigh the same, so I recommend getting your true size. I'm a 12D, sometimes 11.5 or 12.5, and once in a blue moon a 13. Size 12 works fine for me here.

review_title: I have avoided crocs because they are big clown shoes in appearance and I didn't want look like a.
review_text: These are my first crocs.  I have avoided crocs because they are big clown shoes in appearance and I didn't want look like a ...you know.  I finally bought a pair because I am now swimming regularly and needed shoes that could get wet at the pool.  I hate flip flops, which abrade the tender area between big toe and second toe.  Well, I bought the crocs and they are awesome!  Very comfortable.  I have arthritis in my feet and the crocs are surprisingly supportive.  I wear them for long drives.  They are great at the dog park or in the back yard where I am likely to step in something that is very difficult to clean off sneakers but comes off easily with a hose or a wipe from my clogs.  Best of all, I look cool in them, and I know this because the younger generation is impressed.  Not the 20 somethings, who tend to roll their eyes, or my contemporaries who look askance and ask if I have been gardening but the stylesetters of tomorrow.  I wore them to the beach and a toddler and a four year old both patted my shoes. Now I want crocs in every color of the rainbow.

review_title: Never thought I'd buy but very happy now
review_text: Never thought I'd buy a pair of crocs. I've been making fun of them for the past decade but when we moved into a new place with hard floors, I needed something to wear around the house. I stand/walk a lot at work and wanted something that was very comfortable.Got these bad boys and couldn't be happier. After a long day in dress shoes I look forward to wearing these when I get home. Great for working around the house and going up and down the stairs on hard flooring. I flip the strap up and go for the clog configuration. The look better that way and stay on fine without the strap behind your heel. Also nice that they are pretty grippy. I wear them cooking in the kitchen and don't have any issues when I spill stuff on the floor.I would definitely recommend these to anyone. They don't look the coolest but I'm a dad now so I'm fine with that. They are a much more comfortable upgrade from flip flop or slipper for wearing around the house. My only regret is not getting a cool color. If you're gonna get crocs you might as well go big!

review_title: Comfy but there are size inconsistencies
review_text: I ordered 2 pairs of these crocs classics, cerulean and pepper. Pepper is a true red (I was worried it might look pink) and the cerulean is very blue, not purple at all. I usually wear men's size 8.5 shoes and an m8/w10 fit when tried on in a store. However I read lots of reviews that said the sizes were very inconsistent. I need these soon so don't have time to mess with exchanges so I ordered m8/w10 and m9/w11. They were exactly the same size. Width, length, everything was the same, it was weird. I think they fit more like a m9/w11 but that's fine. I wanted/expected these to be pretty loose like my old ones from over a decade ago. These are pretty comfy like I remember and hopefully they last like my old ones did. I didn't find them shiny, uncomfortably small/narrow or the nubs inside to be too painful, which were all common complaints. Overall I say try them on in store first especially if you're in between sizes. I have high hopes for these. (These are the made in mexico ones by the way)

Because of wide feet, I've been afraid of ordering these popular shoes.  Over the years I've had to return or give away shoes I carefully chose, cos only the front of my feet are wide (like a duck). Have to have some sort of strap, or tie on.  My siblings would urge me to try them, so I took the plunge. The 1st pair had to be returned because of a simply mistake at the factory; the wrong size was put in the box.  The replacement arrived yesterday, and I could turn cartwheels, if I could. So comfortable, roomy, and no breaking in period. With regular leather shoes, the little toe on my right foot is still squeezed; with the Crocs, no problem!  And it keeps my feet cool! These are officially my fav shoes. Plan to buy more in diff colors.

these just arrived not even 10 minutes ago and i'm already writing a review ! such a cute colour (pink lemonade) and they came brand new with all the original tags. didn't get a fake or damaged pair. also, i was VERY worried about the fit because the reviews were all over the place and i haven't worn crocs since elementary school lol my left foot is also a size smaller than my right, so finding shoes is a struggle to say the least. BUT. these fit PERFECTLY (on both feet !) i've never had a shoe fit so well before. i got a size 6 and believe me when i say i spent DAYS looking through reviews and debating between sizes and i'm glad i didn't size up. they fit very true to size. also, my adidas superstar's are a size US 4.5, sperry's are a size 6, nike air force 1's are size 6.5, and hollister/abercrombie flip flops/sandals are a size small (6-7), etc. only putting these for reference because i know that's one of the things i always look for in reviews. kind of unrelated but useful info in some cases.

I will admit, I once was a hater. I lived a hateful negative life where I truly despised this footwear. But recently I've made many drastic life changes and these shoes have helped me see the light. They have helped me to see the beauty of the world and give me the confidence to face whatever obstacles life may throw my way. I can now walk outside with confidence. These shoes, these marvelous shoes, help me to live my life to the fullest not only in style but with such comfort no amount of words can begin to describe. I will now continue to live my life with an open mind to such fashion statements. No more will I live with my head hung low, but now I wear my crocs with pride. Sports mode empowers me while relaxed mode truly is the epitome of serenity. Crocs have also been the glue that has bonded me and one my best friends. Crocs truly change your life and bring people together. I will forever be indebted to this spectacular shoe.

I LOVE THESE THINGS!! They're stylish and functional. These shoes are the future. It is not hard to pull them off with any outfit. Wear them to school, wear them to run errands, wear them to church! I sure do! Nothing can compare to these wonderful shoes.These shoes really show individuality. With a variety of colors and endless shoe charms, you can express who you are in a unique and fashionable way. Be a trend setter with Crocs, the shoes that should have never gone out of style!

I own 2 pair of Crocs women's Freesail and figured I'd try a pair of the classics.  The Freesail are much trimmer & narrower in width than the  women's Classics.  I love both.  The Classics are quite a bit boxier and wider in width  than the Freesail and the Classics seem to have a bit more  cushioning on the bottom.  Both work well for my problem feet which are usually sporting the Alegria brand shoes/sandals  for work.  However, on weekends and downtime, I prefer Crocs.  I have hammer toes  and deteriorating foot joints and have lost most of natural cushioning on the bottom of my feet making it feel like I'm walking on marbles. I typically wear a women's 8/12 or a European size  39.  In Crocs, I always  go a size 9 for the length.  I love both the Freesail and Classics and would urge anyone with "touchy feet" to give these a try.

review_title: Cutest Comfy Ugly Shoe You Can Buy
review_text: I bought this classic fit (wide) shoe in size 6 men to get a size 8 women's.  It fits perfectly.  Most comfortable shoe or clog ever.  They are also ugly but they are so ugly that they are cute. To be clear, I bought these to wear with fluffy socks so I have the room I need (my feet are not wide) when wearing the fluffy socks. The strap can be in the back or in the front.  I like having it across my heel when wearing socks.  Feet don't sweat thanks to all of the vents.  You can also put cute little Jibbitz on them that people will notice and take their attention away from the ugly shoes.  You can wear these things all day, 10-12 hours and your feet and legs will hold out.  I got the original classic style because so many people online complained about the soles coming apart on the newer style.  So buyer beware, if you try them you will love them.

review_title: and we like how easy it is to get them on
review_text: I never, ever thought I'd wear Crocs, but here I am.Our 1.5 year old daughter loves her Crocs, and we like how easy it is to get them on, how we don't have to fuss over socks, etc. They're great summer shoes for kids. After a while I started thinking about getting myself a pair just as yard work/grilling/fishing/etc. shoes for the same reason. Which is what they started as, but during one Home Depot trip I realized I never took them off and was wearing them out. Fair game, I guess I'm living the Croc life now.Regarding sizing, I saw some strange advice all over. And perhaps it's different between colors, so for clarity's sake I got the Khaki color. Anyway, I saw some people talking about sizing down, but I really don't think that's the right way to go. Crocs do feel loose on your feet, but just wear them around a bit and you'll realize that they're just fine and very secure. The bottom "floats" a little bit so you don't develop blisters, but the strap holds them to your feet pretty well. If this were a normal shoe, then I'd size down. But it's not, and it doesn't wear/stretch/weigh the same, so I recommend getting your true size. I'm a 12D, sometimes 11.5 or 12.5, and once in a blue moon a 13. Size 12 works fine for me here.

review_title: I have avoided crocs because they are big clown shoes in appearance and I didn't want look like a.
review_text: These are my first crocs.  I have avoided crocs because they are big clown shoes in appearance and I didn't want look like a ...you know.  I finally bought a pair because I am now swimming regularly and needed shoes that could get wet at the pool.  I hate flip flops, which abrade the tender area between big toe and second toe.  Well, I bought the crocs and they are awesome!  Very comfortable.  I have arthritis in my feet and the crocs are surprisingly supportive.  I wear them for long drives.  They are great at the dog park or in the back yard where I am likely to step in something that is very difficult to clean off sneakers but comes off easily with a hose or a wipe from my clogs.  Best of all, I look cool in them, and I know this because the younger generation is impressed.  Not the 20 somethings, who tend to roll their eyes, or my contemporaries who look askance and ask if I have been gardening but the stylesetters of tomorrow.  I wore them to the beach and a toddler and a four year old both patted my shoes. Now I want crocs in every color of the rainbow.

review_title: Never thought I'd buy but very happy now
review_text: Never thought I'd buy a pair of crocs. I've been making fun of them for the past decade but when we moved into a new place with hard floors, I needed something to wear around the house. I stand/walk a lot at work and wanted something that was very comfortable.Got these bad boys and couldn't be happier. After a long day in dress shoes I look forward to wearing these when I get home. Great for working around the house and going up and down the stairs on hard flooring. I flip the strap up and go for the clog configuration. The look better that way and stay on fine without the strap behind your heel. Also nice that they are pretty grippy. I wear them cooking in the kitchen and don't have any issues when I spill stuff on the floor.I would definitely recommend these to anyone. They don't look the coolest but I'm a dad now so I'm fine with that. They are a much more comfortable upgrade from flip flop or slipper for wearing around the house. My only regret is not getting a cool color. If you're gonna get crocs you might as well go big!

literally best purchase of my life. Everything went well was packaged very nicely. They looked great with my prom dress. I couldn't have asked for anything else

I am so GRATEFUL my sis got her Croc‚Äôs for work and then I thought to myself those are super comfy looking. Well yes they are comfy and easy to clean. I‚Äôm basically wearing them anytime I have to run outside to do gardening or pick up dog poop üí©, I‚Äôve also worn them out running errands as well. I love the bright blue color I got. I had to return the first pair I ordered since they were too large. So I went a size down and they fit perfectly! I couldn‚Äôt be happier with this purchase! Oh and I‚Äôve stepped in a massive pile of GSD üí© and it washes right off these adorable shoes. Perfect function so easy to clean. I‚Äôm literally hooked for life and I don‚Äôt know how I never bought üêä Croc‚Äôs before?!?!My order came in the time frame they said it would. It took about a week, with Prime. Worth the wait. I love the fact that they look good with everything I wear. I don‚Äôt dress up much so I wouldn‚Äôt recommend wearing them with an evening gown üòÇ but they are breathable and my feet don‚Äôt stink in these either. They were in new packaging too. I will get lots of use out of these for sure. They are super comfortable and actually feel great on my feet. All and all my new favorite house shoes üíØ!!! I definitely recommend this purchase to anyone out there who hasn‚Äôt tried these out before! They are amazing! Stay safe out there!

My husband wore crocs on our first date and I honestly almost ended it then, but I decided what the heck. Who cares what he wears on his feet?? Then he revealed that he usually wears his crocs with SOCKS. It‚Äôs freaking hideous and I have made fun of him for YEARS. But recently, I needed a pair of shoes to toss on to take the dog on quick walks or just run to the mailbox and he surprised me with a pair of these bad boys (in mint, my favorite color). I swore I wouldn‚Äôt wear them.. and yet, Here I am! Wearing them every stinkin day now!! These shoes are not stylish. They make your feet look like gigantic doll feet. But they are THE most comfortable and convenient shoes I‚Äôve ever worn. They are easy to clean, breathable and great for days at the beach or river. If my husband sees this, I admit I was wrong. I still won‚Äôt say that out loud, but here ya go.

review_title: Get them on sale! Worth every penny!
review_text: I‚Äôve actually always disliked crocks for some reason but something sparked inside my head while in quarantine and decided to give them a chance since I wouldn‚Äôt be leaving my house any time soon and no one would see me in them and honestly It was the best decision I‚Äôve ever made!I actually got them on sale $10 off so I only paid $32 bucks and I love them! The insole was a little uncomfortable the first few days of wearing them, they poke and feel wired and itch your feet s bit after you take them off but after wearing them a few days , I don‚Äôt even wanna take them off! Lol‚û°Ô∏è Sizing!!! ‚¨ÖÔ∏èI was skeptical about ordering them online because I don‚Äôt know my size in there size but after much research and reviews I figured out that crocks are more comfortable and suppose to fit big!I wear a Size 9.5 (men) and have a pretty wide foot and everywhere said to size one up so I got size 10 (men) and they fit perfectly and comfortably!Over all I would recommend a pair for everyone ! Went outside did some grading stuff rinsed them right off looked good as new!! Can‚Äôt wait to Customize them! 10/10 recommend!

Where do I begin. If you do not own a pair of crocs by now, you need to buy yourself a pair right now. I used to buy ‚Äúcrocs‚Äù from the 99 cents store because I was on a budget, and by budget I mean absolutely broke. It wasn‚Äôt until I got my first job two years ago where I bought my first real pair and mannnn when I tell you that these are the most comfortable shoes ever, these are the most comfortable shoes ever. I can‚Äôt believe I was walking around in the knock off ones with no support, no wonder my back hurt so much. Well here I am two years later and I own 18 pairs of crocs. Everybody used to make fun of me but now I have people asking me for croc recommendations. If you are worried about looking dumb because these aren‚Äôt the cutest foot wear out there, these shoes are made to help you come as you are. If you are confident, it shines through. I almost have every color in the classic clogs and I am now going to invest in some bayaband, lite ride and bistro clogs. Crocs are an everyday, every moment type of thing for me and I am so glad that I am able to truly express myself through my beautiful crocs.I WILL SAY AS A SIDENOTE, those who experience discomfort, it may be because you have a flat foot as those with flat feet are better of wearing shoes like vans, converse, etc. (shoes that have no arch support)

My chiropractor recommended wearing crocs since I started having plantar fasciitis problems. I usually wear woman's size 8 shoes, and got these in size 8. They seem a little big but it's actually more comfortable to wear that way, so I think these fit me perfectly. I like to life up the back holder part and wear them around like sandals. It's also nice when it's cold cause I can just slip them on with my socks on. As for dealing with my plantar fasciitis, it ended up working for me! I wore these every day, and at first I didn't notice that much of a difference and my feet ached in the morning for a while too, but around a year into wearing these, I have completely recovered from plantar fasciitis!! It's like I never even had plantar fasciitis before! I think it took a while for my feet to heal since it's something we use every day. Now I am able to wear normal flat sandals too and my feet are fine in the mornings. I still wear crocs and their brand sandals for my main footwear though, cause I think it helps to prevent plantar fasciitis from happening.

review_title: Husband Hates the Look, LOVES the feel
review_text: My husband has Plantar fasciitis (as I also have) and he has tried different inserts, balls to rub his feet on, exercises, etc.I have been wearing Crocs for over a year and they have alleviated my pain significantly, but he didn't like the way they looked.So, I decided to buy him a pair for Christmas, told him to just wear them around the house. He LOVES them. His feet are so much better, he takes his work shoes off the minute he gets in the house to put these on. I am so glad I bought them for him! He has actually talked to a couple of friends at work who told him they have been wearing them for years for the same reason!

review_title: BABYYYYY My feet are in Heaven
review_text: So full disclosure in this review so please don't judge. There aren't any Crocs stores in the area I live in but I heard they were really comfortable and good support for people who are on their feet all day. I have issues with my arches and typically wear arch supports in my shoes so that I can both walk better and so my feet don't hurt. When I don't wear my arch supports, my feet hurt and the pain radiates up to my knees and higher. I love to wear flip flops but if you are like me, your doctor told you heck no that's horrible for your feet.So, I purchased a bunch of "garden" shoes or fake crocs. Don't get me wrong these are amazing and I wear them all the time I just had no idea that they weren't real crocs. Let me try to explain.I saw the yellow colored crocs in DSW about 3 weeks ago and fell in love, but of course they didn't have any more even online in my size in yellow. I come to trusty old AMAZON and they are selling for more than $40. No thank you I will wait. I check out the CROCS site and with shipping its more than that. So I wait. I wait and wait until they drop down to $31 and change and I get em. Now you guys don't know me but I am just excited to add another color to my collection so I thought.I sprayed them down with Lysol after I open the zip lock bag they were in and sat them on my back porch you know for safety and all that good stuff. So I take the trash out and remember that they are out there so I bring em in and wash em off again because now they have outside germs even though no one has been on or near my back porch. I dry them off and put them on my feet.HALLELUJAH!!!!I thought I had ascended to heaven! You don't know the struggles I have with these here size 8's. The support I felt, the cushion I felt, the prinkly things in the shoe that massage my feet while feeling slightly weird when my toes touch them when I am sitting, it all was surreal. I woke up my brother. I went outside and screamed YES YES YES like I was a WWE wrestler. I immediately came back to amazon to look and see what color shoe I didn't have to order more.Needless to say, I look at price too and I can't afford any of these colors at this time but I LOVE MY YELLOW CROCS. I prefer crocs over sneakers or tennis but I wear tennis to protect my foot in case I feel like jogging or running.Buy you these shoes. Don't have any yet? Ain't nothing like the real thing is all I have to say.TRUST ME ON THIS ONE!Signed,A Satisfied customer

Ordered a W8. This is my first pair of Crocs & I‚Äôm not sure whyyyyyy I waited this long to get a pair. Now I see why ppl use it. Very comfortable. I‚Äôm flat footed. I was able to wear it barefoot & also w| thin socks (tester around the house). The strap part to keep your feet in, it‚Äôs actually shorter than the actual length of the shoe (it‚Äôs not lined up with the heel part . Around a quarter of an inch or so from the heel) so when it goes around the back of your foot, it actually pushes your feel more inside the shoe. This isn‚Äôt a big deal for me as I‚Äôm actually a 7.5 women‚Äôs. I always love ordering any shoe item a half size bigger to have the extra room for thicker socks if needed. My Crocs were made in Mexico. I‚Äôve seen some complaints about sizing issues when it‚Äôs made in different countries. Anyways, I would recommend a pair to anyone.

We love crocs- all of my kids have a pair as their summer play shoes! We have a small farm and these are perfect- they can step in anything and hose off without a problem, wear them to play in the creek or the pond (if they come off in the pond they float and are easily retrievable!), and the versatility of wear with the heel strap makes it great for super active kids that like to run. I purchased this pair for my oldest, and as usual they are slightly bigger but we expected that. Great product.

review_title: The advice is to go a size down, but I suggest going a size up!
review_text: I love these shoes! Crocs are silly looking yes, but that is what I love about them! I'm writing this review mainly just to note that in the description, it advises that if you're a half size to go a size down, since crocs can be large fitting/wide. However, this wasn't the case for me. I'm a size 7 and 1/2 in womens, so I chose a size 7, but I had to return it as I found it too tight fitting. If you fit size 8 converse just fine, then you most likely have feet similar to mine, so I'd recommend going a size up! Even without socks, it was uncomfortable enough for me to have to return it for a larger size.Besides the size issue, the shoes are wonderful! The coupon is also a great deal.

I ordered the yellow (beautiful , bright color by the way) ! The shoe itself fits PERFECTLY!! I ordered my regular size and the fit is right on. My only concern is (after reading previous reviews about counterfeit shoes) after comparing them to my other CROCS (whom I know for a fact are authentic) , things does seem a little off. I‚Äôm not sure if it means anything . But my other crocs read ‚ÄúMade in Vietnam‚Äù and these read ‚ÄúMade in China‚Äù ... which has me a little confused. Again , IT MAY BE NOTHING !! I just had to point out that fact . Which that may be why these looks a little cheaper than my originals . They look kinda like they were RUSHED on the assembly line when you‚Äôre looking at them closely  . Other than this . They‚Äôre great ! Great color , size , fit . I‚Äôm definitely gonna keep them !

review_title: Caved and bought a pair. After this review, you will to
review_text: Anyone going on deployment needs Crocs, so I got these for $30ish. They came in a plastic Crocs bag in new condition. I put them on and immediately felt weird, but you eventually get over your loss of dignity, as everyone else owns a pair. When they‚Äôre new, they have these nubs that you put your feet onto that stab you with every step, but in a good way. Every other shoe brand says I‚Äôm a 9M, but Crocs think I‚Äôm a 10M, so make sure you get a size up for anything from this brand. There is no slip resistance, so watch yourself in the shower. The Off-road ankle strap seems durable and the whole shoe feels like it will hold up to any challenge. The top is flexible and will stretch.

review_title: Perfect! Order up a size; especially if you wear a half size!
review_text: *I bought the charms separately on amazon; highly recommend(never too old for charms!!)**I normally wear a size women‚Äôs 9 (sometimes 9.5) but I bought a size 10. I ALWAYS recommend going up a size in crocs. These are not sneakers that need to be snug. You don‚Äôt want these to be tight at all! These are relaxing shoes. If they are snug, your feet will rub, get smelly, and create sores from the rubbing. And my foot just barely hangs over the edge when I bought a size 9 a while ago.They have a strap on the back to help keep your feet in place (I call that putting them in 4 wheel drive), or you can flip the strap to the front (shown in my picture). I prefer it that way because it‚Äôs easy to slide on and off like slippers.I personally wear this pair to work.I bought different colors for day to day wear.They are SUPER easy to clean! I typically use a disinfectant wipe; but you can use all purpose cleaner a towel, spray Lysol, wash them in the sink with dish soap, etc. But do NOT use bleach!

I didn‚Äôt want to love Crocs. They are so boxy and ugly, but that ugliness grew on me really fast once I started wearing them. I bought them because I needed gardening shoes. My other shoes were constantly having soil and other yard debris packed into the treads and it was way too much work to clean them out. So, I decided to give a pair of Crocs a try since with the holes they should get decent airflow and I could hose them off or toss them in the washing machine as needed. So, I reluctantly bought a pair of very purple Crocs.After a week of wearing my new Crocs, I can say I totally get why people love these things.They have NO arch support, which for me is generally horrible but they‚Äôre so roomy that it‚Äôs more like walking barefoot than it is like wearing bad shoes.With as roomy as they are, not at all form fitting, you‚Äôd think your feet would slip and slide all over the place and you‚Äôd have to work to keep them on your feet. But they don‚Äôt. My feet stay in place and the Crocs stay on my feet just fine.Nothing sticks to them. Dirt and soil get in through the holes, but also go right back out through the holes, just leaving behind dirty feet. And nothing has stuck to the treads: dirt, soil, mud, dog poop, compost‚Ä¶ nothin‚Äô. They also don‚Äôt stay wet long at all. I had to go out in the pouring rain and they were dry by the time I walked through my house.And, with all the holes, there‚Äôs great air circulation, just about as good as sandals. This was my first pair of Crocs; I doubt it will be my last. They‚Äôre too comfortable and convenient not to love them.

This is the second pair of Crocs I bought in the last month. Never owned a pair and always thought they looked ugly, and never understood why there was this attraction to them.I have wide feet, 12 4E, I was skeptical the 12 M size was going to be too tight.  They fit perfectly, I guess because they are wide to start off with, although if I had narrow feet I probably wouldn't be too happy with them.The things are super comfortable and around the house, I wear them with strap up front so I can just slip them off and on like a pair of slippers.  When I go out I wear the strap in the rear to secure them completely on my feet.They may not be the most beautiful pair of footwear, but I have worn them out dancing, even playing golf. They're great, that's why I bought this second pair.I was also skeptical about the little knobs on the inside of the shoe, but these I found kind of massage your feet and make them feel good.

review_title: Raised letters that say Hecho in Mexico on strap hurt the backs of my feet, this is new
review_text: I have been wearing crocs for years. I have had many pairs of this kind that I ordered. However, this time I bought them, I put them on, and wore them for a few hours. And I was like why are the backs of my ankles hurting? It felt like something was rubbing the backs of my ankles. I tried to ignore it, but ultimately I became worried it was going to rub the skin off my ankles so I took the shoes off and looked at them. The reason why the strap hurts is because it says "Hecho in Mexico" in RAISED lettering!! The letters on the inside of the strap are raised and keep rubbing the backs of my ankles as I walk. So I have concluded that the only way to wear these shoes safely is to move the strap from the back ankle area to the top of the shoe, which I don't like. Why did you have to do this, Crocs??? Please stop putting the raised letters of Hecho in Mexico on the inside strap because it hurts my skin. I want Crocs to stop making the shoes like this, because it sucks if my shoes hurt because of this. Why?? Please remove this lettering off the inside straps because you're causing pain to your customers.

review_title: 13 year journey from 2007 to 2020 achievement unlocked
review_text: In 2007 I really wanted a pair of crocs but we couldn‚Äôt afford the name brand so I got purple air walks instead. Most of my life has been that Clover Valley or Great Value edition. Flash forward to 2020, I bought my first pair of crocs in my mid twenties. I‚Äôve been preparing 13 years to experience this moment. Do I have regrets for purchasing hole shoes? Probably. Do I have an insane amount of air flow for my toes? Most definitely. Am I posting a ridiculous photo review on Amazon about my journey? You bet. I was not prepared for the true power unlocked through wearing crocs.

I got these for my husband, he is a size 10 to size 11 in men's shoes, and I bought a size 10 and it fit perfectly.From my experience these shoes always have an extra wiggle room in the back so if you're in between sizes going down one won't hurt.Also, it is the authentic Crocs brand and is great quality. It's light to walk with, not heavy to the foot! üëû‚ô•Ô∏è

Love these crocs!!  Family planned a vacation to Disney and we heard that to avoid blisters we should purchase a pair of crocs.  Needless to say, they saved our vacation.  I wore nothing but the cros while we were there.  I didn't want to take the chance of getting blisters walking 25,000 steps a day for 10 days.  They are quick and easy to dry after getting wet, can be worn with or without short socks, are very comfortable to walk in, cushioned and arch support.  Toe width has enough room for comfortable spread with no rubbing on sides or top of toes.  I wouldn't recommend any other shoe for Disney or for sore tired feet.  Just love them!

review_title: Not the nicest looking shoe but the most comfy.
review_text: As much as I'd love brown leather wingtip oxfords, they're impossible to find in womens size 5/6 in Wide Width. or anything nice looking for that matter. and I got tired of looking. When you have Cerebral Palsy, dressing is a struggle. I got to a point where I wanted something that I could put on without help, and comfortable with or without socks. Are they kinda ugly? Yeah. But it's worth it. I plan on getting two in black so they can blend in with my pants, but sometimes I enjoy colors. So far I own a Slate Grey and Navy. Both pairs were the right size (I ended up getting Womens 6. A little roomy but not too much, and i have tiny feet) Obviously they're snugger when I wear them with fuzzy socks.  These shoes are also great toe box wise. My heel is very narrow and my foot widens up to my toe box. The toe box is wide enough to where I don't feel squeezed at all, even with thick socks.When I'm travelling and the hotel doesn't have a shower seat I can wear these in the shower since I can't go barefoot. They are very easy to rinse out and dry.Even with my issue with dragging my left big toe, they're pretty sturdy. Most shoes after half a year would already have a hole and need to be replaced. I plan on getting second pairs just to have just in case, but I don't think my left shoes will wear through soon. They're not extremely supportive, I wouldn't recommend them for running, but as someone with chronic pain and weak ankle/foot muscles, these are great for around the house and walking through a bookstore.

review_title: Decent support for around the house
review_text: I got these on a friend's recommendation after avoiding Crocs for years. I never understood what the hype was before, but my friend insisted that if I wanted something to support my feet while doing things around the house, these would be a good choice. I am glad I gave them a chance, and am now debating on getting a second pair for wearing out.While the arch support isn't spectacular, it's a massive step up from trying to shove insoles into slippers like I was doing before. They hold their shape well so far, they fit comfortably, have a little bit of shock absorption to them, and best of all they are EASY TO CLEAN! Also if you're a bit clumsy like me, the roomy toe area makes a great buffer to prevent you from injuring yourself by stubbing your toes.They fit very well without being too tight, and stay on my feet with or without the heel strap, so I've taken to keeping the strap folded up over the front to get in and out of them more easily.I'm definitely a fan now that I've tried them.

As strange as crocs look, they sure are comfortable. I wear these bad boys every single day. If I know I‚Äôll be walking a lot, I‚Äôll pull the heel strap back and kick them into 4WD. 100% worth buying.On a serious note, I love my crocs. Perfect for every day wear, and even better to wear at the beach. The holes around the toes allow a lot of ventilation, and easy to shake out the sand.They‚Äôre lightweight and extremely easy to clean. They are also able to withstand different environments, whether you‚Äôre walking on sharp surfaces such as rocks or glass. I‚Äôve also tested them on slippery surfaces, surprisingly haven‚Äôt fallen yet!I get a lot of compliments on my crocs, especially when I‚Äôm wearing my scrubs. The color hasn‚Äôt faded, and I‚Äôve put them through a lot since I got them. If you‚Äôre debating whether or not you should take a chance on these bad boys, here‚Äôs your sign saying you should.

review_title: Order a size down if you like a normal non-loose fit...
review_text: Overall, I've been very happy with my Classic Crocs.  I wear a size 7.5 shoe and I own several pairs of Croc Flip-Flops/Sandals which I ordered in a size 8 (happy I did for those).  However, many have said the Classic Clogs run large.  After sizing my foot according to the chart it still said for me to order a size 8.  I went against that and ordered a size 7 based on the reviews saying they run large.  I'm so glad I ordered down a size! They fit how my normal shoe would because I do not like any loose feeling when I'm walking.  Even with my socks on they fit great and are surprisingly comfortable.  I can walk long distances without any foot fatigue.  Only minor negative I would say is my feet get warm in them.  I don't notice it until I sit down when having them on.  Other than that I'll definitely be purchasing additional pairs and love how easy they are to clean!

review_title: Heavenly Feel. Massages the soles of my feet and keeps them from itching.
review_text: My first pair of Crocs just arrived and after wearing them one day, I am in love!I got these shoes because my feet itch in other shoes during the summer time. The cloth interior  of regular shoes trap sweat and bacteria. It  is just not sanitary.I can wash, wipe and sanitize the inside of my Crocs every day if I want in order to avoid that issue.I intend to wear these barefoot, outside, after the shower and anytime I want because I can still keep them sanitary.Now, for the feel: Ooh, la la! I love the textured insides. The little raised bumps and spikes inside the shoes poke the bottom of my feet, giving them a massage and relieving tension when I walk. This feels so good!Often my feet are tired and stressed and I have to press them against something or do exercises to relieve them. But now, Crocs can destress my feet for me while I walk.Also, I like that I can wear the straps over the top of my feet like a slide-in slipper or behind my heel . It's so convenient to have two types of styles.  When I put the straps behind my heel, I can feel the spikes inside the shoes better so that is my preferred style after a long day.These shoes are very roomy. At first I thought they were too wide, but I like that there's so much room.The only concern was that one strap is a little looser than the other. Since most factories have standardization, I questioned whether I was sent a knock-off or the real thing. I hope these are real. Either way, they feel super good and I intend to get several pair.Now, let me get off the internet and go walk in my Crocs because my feet want to play!

It doesn't say so on the description here but these crocs are labeled as 'Roomy Fit' so they are huge.  It's a little weird but it seems like Crocs fit differently depending on where they are made. I'm a 7.5 and initially opted for a 5/7 but found that it was too tight for my toes when I put the strap on the back of my heel. This was on a pair made in Mexico. However I have a 5/7 that was made in Vietnam that fit fine with or without the strap. So for this one I decided to order a size up to make sure that it will be comfortable no matter where it was made. The pair I received was made in Vietnam but since they are 'Roomy Fit' they are way too big. The color is gorgeous so I'm going to return these and order my regular size again and hope for the best.Update:I received the 5/7 today and they‚Äôre perfect! Leaving the review at 4 stars because it really should be in the description that these are roomy fit.

Crocs were born in my hometown, well the town I lived in the longest, I should say. At first, I thought they looked hideous, kinda still do, to be honest. They make people's feet look huge. Yet, when I tried a pair at my daughter's house, because she insisted it was like walking on clouds, and I had a very sore, broken foot, I couldn't believe how comfortable they were. I began to sing a new tune! I became all about comfortable shoes. And this ics coming from a woman who's family owned several chains of shoes stores for 77 years! High-end fashion shoes, mid-range casual boots and shoes, and lower end shoes too. We never had anything like these in our stores though (they hadn't been invented yet). We did sell Jellies (remember those?) in the summer in the low-priced shops, but Crocs are so much nicer.I have owned and worn out 5 pairs of the classic Crocs in various colors, as well as 2 pairs of the winter lined ones. I just bought more classics, in more colors, because why not wear comfy shoes? I wear them gardening and when I'm being super casual. I keep a couple pairs as indoor slippers too. Will have to order a new pair for winter soon.

A little about me so you can categorize my review:  I live in Hawaii where Crocs and Bermuda shorts are de rigueur.  I wear dress shoes at weddings and restaurants, but I have seen people wear them there without being asked to leave.I go through about 2 pairs a year (yes, Hawaii, ha ha).I actually expected to buy a pair at our local slipper shop where I normally get them, but I was shocked to find they had gone to $45/pair!  I whipped out my phone & showed the lady they are $26 on Amazon.  She smiled and said she would help me find a good fit so I could order from Amazon (Hawaii has pretty girls with pretty manners).I was apprehensive because of other reviews, but my pair fit as well as any, and the rubber seemed about average.  The toe box and width were a little more generous and the arch support was a little flatter, but overall, fit is as expected.  The tread on the new Crocs is more robust.  That is a plus for Hawaii because it rains everyday here, and slippery footwear are dangerous, especially on steps, sidewalks, and roads without dedicated walking paths.  My previous pairs were made in Mexico; these were made in China.  (Maybe these were made more with Haole feet in mind.)  The pic shows my existing (Mexico) Croc on the left, and the new (China) Croc on the right.Good: price, fit, wear, appearanceBad: (none)Summary: II like them. I am going to order another pair for our other house.-Larry

For the last 4 years my feet have been blistered, over callused and in severe pain by the end of my shifts! This was to the point that I almost decided NOTHING would help and that after 40 years on my feet in the restaurant industry, I was destined  to a future of crippling pain. Everyone was telling me that Crocs were that answer but, I was thinking how could a shoe for such a little price help my feet? After all I had spent hundreds on different shoes throughout the last four years... Finally I caved and figured at the price, I could just throw them away like the rest of the EXPENSIVE shoes I had purchased. Let me tell you what a glorious feeling right from the start!!! My feet and back no longer hurt even after 8 - 10 hour shifts! They feel like wearing nothing at all, so naturel and comfy! Do your self a favor and try Crocs!!!

My husband and I love crocs and have used them for years. I had terrible pain in the heel of my foot and crocs has completely cured it. Fit true to size in my experience. Colors pictured are navy, pepper, neon magenta, camo, purple, khaki

These guys are amazing.  For years, I avoided them despite of the hype some time ago.  The funny thing is that I was always looking for a shoe that can work as a slipper because that would be so practical for traveling.The regular clogs don‚Äôt have enough backing on the heel to be a shoe.  I got these slippers once and tried to use them as shoes but they have no soles and so very uncomfortable to walk on hard surfaces and got really wet when it was raining.  The soft shoes have too much backing on the heel and so cannot be used as a slipper.Enter the Croc‚Äôs innovative design that has a movable heel strap so it‚Äôs a slipper when you‚Äôre at home and a shoe when you‚Äôre moving around.In the picture, they look solid so you know they will work on hard surfaces.  My concern was if they are comfortable because it looks like hard plastic but it is really some rubber or silicone material so quite soft and comfy.The only thing is the sizing is off.  I wear 9.5 and got a 10 but I should have gotten a 9.  It is loose but not really an issue except if you plan to drive wearing them.  I have a manual car and I stalled the car when I drove it wearing these for first time.I don‚Äôt think looks is a problem and very subjective.  In this case, they become so iconically ugly that many ppl think they‚Äôre beautiful now.

I'm a pretty average looking dude, but now that I have these Crocs‚Ñ¢ I am easily the sexiest person I know.Seriously though --  they are convenient, they are comfortable, and they are awesome.  My wife hates them, but I just can't give them up.  They are the fanny pack of shoes: crazy convenient, but everybody makes fun of them for some reason.  Don't care.  I'm a middle-aged fat guy with three kids.  I don't have to care about that stuff any more and that's freaking rad.  Wear these Crocs‚Ñ¢ and be awesome like me.[I know the product description says "Women's Crocs" but they are being worn by a dude just fine. No idea what that's all about.]

review_title: Never bought Crocs  befroe they are worth the money
review_text: Was looking for a new pair of Crocs to replace my older pair and after going to the outlet store and finding nothing i decided to just order them from amazon found the style i liked and a color and they had them in my size ordered them i have had other pairs of Crocs in the past and knew what i was getting so didn't think twice about not getting them after the first week of getting a new pair of Crocs and telling myself im going to keep them i take and remove the straps and side buttons to get them to fit the way i like them and they are mostly my house shoes and as of lately i take them to work and switch out of my work shoes and into them for the drive home overall they are comfortable to wear the colors pop and they are true to size and you dont have to go up a size which is what i do when i am looking for regular shoes but not with Crocs they fit right and i love the feel

review_title: OMG, I am now a total Crocs Convert !!!
review_text: A friend bought me a pair, and I was HOOKED.  So I ordered this pair via Amazon in the Ice Blue color, in my normal sneaker-size women's US 7.  They fit true to size.  I'm so glad I discovered Crocs...  They are so comfy, light & airy, with great cushioning for walking all day long.  I used to think they were just plastic gardening shoes, or just comfy clogs for nurses & doctors.  But NOW I am seeing Crocs everywhere.... They have become a highly sought-after fashion item!  I also ordered the medium pink color (via Amazon), so now I have 3 pair of Crocs.  The bright fun colors make me smile, they are actually "in fashion" right now, and my feet couldn't be happier.PS... I advise to google them & check out the prices from various department stores, shoes stores, etc, & compare those prices with Amazon's pricing.  Although I must say this seller shipped pretty fast, had a competitive price, AND has the largest assortment of colors to choose from!  Great purchase.  -- Thank you :)

review_title: Needs a little break in time to get a great fit!
review_text: Ok, so I never thought I would wear Crocs but after years and years of hype through movies, online, word of mouth, internet, and personal friends, I figure I'd try them.  And they were all correct! These really are great feeling things for my feet.  They aren't cool looking (at least not for an American non-hipster male) but boy are the nice feeling and functional. Specifically on function, I was looking for a camp slipper that I could slip on around the campsite/RV/Campground/lodge/cabin and walk outside without putting on boots or sneakers.  Sandals are ok if you're a boy or when on an island beach but anywhere else, nope.  Moccasins are ok, but typically they do not have a hard sole.  So camp slippers with hard soles are becoming a thing but they are typically over $80 and at that point they are just a really cheap boot.  So Crocs help fill the void and niche for a camp slipper.  Of course, Crocs are not insulated but inside I usually have socks on so these are perfect, esp in non cold months or climates because with socks or no socks I can slip the feet right into these things. And so far, without socks these things do not make the feet hot (at least not mine) so not a lot of foot sweat and the resulting stink.  What I have learned is that these things do stretch, at least a little which is good.  I ordered a size 9 ( i wear a 9.5 in boots/drewss shoes [Danner, Allen Edmonds, Sperry) and tennis shoes are a 10 [Nike, Adddis, Chucks]) and when they first arrived, the left one fit perfectly but the right one seemed a tad small since a couple of my toes were just barely bumping up against the front of the croc.  Plus I kinda thought my heals were right on the back edge of the croc but despite this , they were still pretty comfy but not great. Plus,the first few days of ownership and wearing without socks, the tops and sides of my feet were getting a few hot spots from rubbing. But nonetheless,  I continued to wear them and powered through hoping they would get better and rather quickly (within a couple weeks) with casual wearing these feel better (my right toes no longer barely touches the front and no hot spots) but I still feel like my heels are on the back edges of the crocks so I think they maybe too short.  But I really like that they fit snug and never feel like a flip-flop that could slide right off my feet, even when barefoot in them. Plus the nubs have a great massaging effect - super sensitive feet may not like it but the nubs are soft and with socks i can't feel them. But because of how good these feel, I want to believe the size 10 will feel better and as a result I have a size 10 on the way.If you can find these in the store, I would try on several pairs of the same size just to see if they fit slightly different due to variances in the QA/QC.  I think a person would be able to find the perfect fit in the store, esp. if they are between sizes like I am.  if my size 9 were just a tad larger they would be perfect.  As it is, I'm expecting the size 10 to be a little too big and slip around but I'm hoping they will work and not slide around but I expect them to feel just a little bit better, otherwise I'll stick to the smaller size due to a potentially better fit.

review_title: ugly as all get out, but so comfortable you just don't care
review_text: I know, I know... they are the "Given up on life" shoe.  They are ugly as sin.  I know this.  But I also know that when I am in hour 16 of standing for the work I do, they are a lifesaver and I'm not thinking about my feet hurting.  I'm thinking about how much I doubt my career choice at that moment, but my feet are fine.  I'm thinking about crying as the sun is coming up and I still have another two or three hours to go, but my feet are good to go. And when I finally crawl into bed, every part of me is calling me names, but my feet are still my friend.Still not as bad as wearing slippers to the grocery store....

review_title: Better Than My Old Ones, But....
review_text: These are the genuine Crocs clogs, and are better than my old ones, which I purchased at a famous discount store chain. (Take a look at my photos.  Depending on what device you are using, the photos will show up in a different order.  I have two photos of the Crocs by themselves; one shows the excellent tread on the sole, and the other shows the bumps/points inside.  Two photos show the Crocs side-by-side with my old worn-out store brand clogs.)  But the Crocs are not an entirely unmixed blessing!  First, the Crocs cost over 3x the price of the chain store clogs.  Winner: chain store clogs.  Second, the Crocs are made in Vietnam,  while the chain store ones are made in USA. BIG win for the chain store clogs!  But the Crocs have advantages, too.  First, the Crocs fit as advertised. If you wear a size 11, order a size 11. (These do not come in Wide width. If you need a wider width, consider ordering the next 1/2 size up.  For instance, I wear a men's 10-1/2 Wide in a regular shoe. I ordered these Crocs in men's size 11, and they fit perfectly.)  The chain store clogs run small, so I had to get a size 12 of them. Winner: Crocs. Second, the Crocs sole has better tread and therefore better traction.  (See photos.)  Winner: Crocs. Third, the Crocs come with a strap that you can put around your heel to keep them from slipping off (see photos again).  If you don't want to use the straps, simply fold them up over the front, out of the way.  Winner: Crocs.  Fourth, Crocs have little buttons (or points) molded into the insole that massage the soles of your feet. This may or may not be an advantage, depending on your preference. Hint: if the points bother you, try wearing socks, or thicker socks if you're already using socks. For me, the points only took about 20 minutes of walking to get used to.  NO clear winner here; which is best depends upon your preference.  The Crocs appear well made, fit well, and are very comfortable. The next question for me is, will they outlast my chain store clogs long enough to justify spending more than three times as much money, for a foreign-made product?  The main reasons I bought these are: 1.  I could not get clogs in black anymore from the chain store.  They only come in an ugly brownish-green color that is patterned to look like dead leaves! (If you are a gardener who wants your shoes to blend in with your mulch, you might prefer the chain store clogs. Me, not so much!);  and 2.  I have always wanted to try the genuine Crocs product.  Time will tell whether they were worth the extra investment.

review_title: If you aint CROCIN', then you aint ROCKIN'!!!
review_text: Alright guys, I'll admit it....I've been out of the Croc game for a good while, now. I needed some comfy shoes to wear around the house and to the lake for boating/other activities where i could get my shoes wet and not sweat it. I used to wear these bad boys in high school non-stop (yep, you guessed it...graduated a virgin, but things took a turn for the better quickly after - MOVING ON! lol). Amazon was the only place that carried a 14 like my gargantuan feet need....so i copped em up on wardrobe, just because i was skeptical about falling back in to my old ways. Oh you best believe, the second i put them on i ripped up that return label! Who could deny their ugly, all-day comfort and goodness?!?! Long story, short....haven't stopped wearing them since. They gone from "around the house and on the boat only" shoes to "fine dining, church, barbeque, errands, anywhere that would make my wife embarrassed to be with me, etc." shoes. Currently, fearful that my wife is packing her bags....may be single and alone real soon, idk....but at least i'll be comfortable in my solitude, right?! 10/10 would recommend.

review_title: Lemon Yellow Crocs.... Now I own 3 pairs in 3 fabulous colors!
review_text: I started with the electric pink color, then the ice blue, then a lighter pink, and now these sunny-cute Lemon Yellow ones.  I never thought I'd like Crocs, but OMG they are so comfy & so cute... I have officially fallen in love with Crocs!  I wear a women's size 7 in sneakers, so that's the size I buy in Crocs, and they fit me perfectly.  I have looked at the Crocs in the shoe stores, and these Crocs from Amazon are indeed the real deal -- and the price is the same on Amazon (sometimes even lower).... plus Amazon usually has a much better selection in available colors, too.  ------  I live in S Florida where it's almost always hot and humid, so my feet love the air conditioned holes in these shoes.  I have loads of sneakers, dressy shoes, and flip flops. But some days you just wanna wear something totally cute & colorful, and comfy.  -----  Btw...  I've noticed that Crocs have become VERY fashionable & "on trend" lately.  I see teenage girls & grown women rockin' them in all sorts of colors.  I'm really enjoying them, and so are my grateful feet.  I can wear them 24/7 and be so comfortable.  I've gotten so many compliments on the Lemon Yellow ones already, and that's from teens to women in their 30's, 40's, 50's and up!  Apparently everyone wants to own a cute pair of colorful Crocs these days.  --- This vendor mailed mine in a hurry & they arrived fast.  I definitely recommend Crocs, and this vendor on Amazon!  And PS... Fashionable guys are rockin' Crocs too these days, and in all the colors !  It's apparently the new big thing. :)

I‚Äôm a size 7.5. The 8 is too big. The 7 had to be broken in for 2 weeks, because it was definitely a bit small at first and the outer edge almost touched the back of my foot.But here‚Äôs the thing about Crocs. If you get them too big, the arch support won‚Äôt work. Your foot isn‚Äôt supposed to swim in these. It‚Äôs definitely up to the user to decide their fit preference.As for my opinion: If you want a bigger fit, go a size (or in my case, a half-size) up.If you want a more ‚Äúcustom‚Äù fit, order true to size (or in my case, a half-size down) and break them in. The rubber loosens up a bit and conforms to your foot.I do think that this model of Crocs has gotten progressively smaller in fit over the past 4 years. So the Crocs of old are a darn sight bigger than today‚Äôs sizes.I have wide, duck feet, and the normal width was fine for me.The interior rubber ‚Äúspikes‚Äù inside have also gotten stronger and more effective. So much that it did take me a few weeks to break them in, because the spikes were QUITE spikey for my taste. It calms down after some wear.My husband couldn‚Äôt handle the spikes because he has soft feet with zero callus (lucky duck). So if you have sensitive feet, these might need to be worn with some socks until things soften up.

I needed a new pair of Croc's and when I read the reviews (one star) some people thought that these might be knock off's...fake imitations..and I was a little concerned. But mine arrived today. They are exactly the same as the pair I have (minus the paint spills).. Like exactly. There was concern about these not being as soft as the "Original Brand.".. but what I can tell you is...they are the real deal..they are soft like my old pair. So, for what it is worth I am glad I bought them.

review_title: Perfect fit with plenty of width!
review_text: I‚Äôve waited years to finally spend money on foam shoes. Now that I did, I don‚Äôt know that I‚Äôll ever be without a pair again! I checked the fit style on Crocs website before I bought- they have fit descriptions in each style of shoe which described the general feel and how ‚Äúroomy‚Äù or relaxed they are.These are the most roomy shoes they offer. I typically wear a 10.5 men‚Äôs, but usually need a wide size. I ordered the 10 size and these are a very comfortable fit. Plenty of room, without feeling too loose or like they‚Äôre going to fall off my feet.I wear these around the house for added support, and will wear them out fishing when the weather gets warmer.Tip: I have worn them with some thin socks and I find that keeps my meet foot bottom from getting sweaty in them.

Your browser does not support HTML5 video.  ¬†Ok ok, I know what you are all thinking... "CROCS ARE SO UGLY THEY LOOK LIKE CLOWN SHOES!" It is no secret that for years crocs have been violated for being big and a but um, unique to say the least but these shoes are super super comfortable! Staying home I realized my chanclas were not making the cut and decided to shop for new stay at home footwear, leading me to buying crocs. The ones in the video are ice blue, they are beautiful and comfortable! As someone with arched feet, you will not go wrong with purchasing these. After wearing them relentlessly for weeks it was super noticeable just how unsupportive other brands are with feet arches. Crocs though, they've got your back. They are of a rubbery plastic, so your feet will sweat at first, but after a while, at least for me, they'll stopped sweating. Overall this was worth the purchase since they serve as stay at home, out door and water shoes. They are true to size, however, you may consider sizing up if you want them to be roomy. Overall they're good. (as a size reference I used my Nike slides), I hope this helps!

I made fun of my husband for wearing them but then I tried his and they seemed comfortable. Low and behold I got mine and these are glorious. I don't care if people think they are silly. I'm rocking them out because they work for what I need. These are like slippers but much lighter. I can slip them right on super easily. I can wear them with or without socks. When I want to go out to the shed outside or to the mailbox I just throw these on. If it's rainy outside, no prob! They stay on really well but if I need a little extra security I just simply throw the strap to the back around my heel and put them in what my husband refers to as four-wheel drive. Definitely recommend these but not if you're lame.

review_title: They are smaller than my old ones of the same size
review_text: I love the ones I bought several years ago. The problem is, the old ones are a very comfortable fit and say 45 on the bottom. The new ones say men's 11 which is supposed to equate to the European 45-46 so I assumed that they would be the same. they are visibly smaller and fit tighter. I may return them and get a men's 12. When I saw the Men's 11, I had reservations but figured the European number stamped into the shoe would be  a better gauge of size. Not so.

When I first saw someone wearing a pair of Crocs, I remember thinking, ‚ÄúI would not be caught dead in shoes that ugly.‚Äù  However, after borrowing a pair to walk home from the beach (my fabric river shoes are impossible to wear if they get sand in them), I was sold.  I have bunions the size of walnuts on both feet - plus the sores from the fabric shoes - and was able to walk the mile home from the beach in the Crocs with no trouble.  The pair I borrowed were a boy‚Äôs  Junior 5 and they fit like the Women‚Äôs size 7.  I will not make fun of Crocs ever again.

review_title: I wear an women's 8 or 8.5, Purchased size 9
review_text: Really great for the tropical areas of Hawaii.  Constantly getting these wet/ full of mud and rinsing them.  Also good for Hawaii because everyone takes their shoes of to go indoors - they slip on easily.  Not super comfortable, as people often say of Crocs, and not very supportive at all.  I might think of buying these again to wear in Chicago, because of ease of use, but not sure.  If you wear an 8 or 8.5, I'd definitely suggest following other reviewer's recommendations, and sizing up.  A 9 worked perfectly for me, but at first even the 9 felt a tiny bit short.  I think they do stretch, but like I said, I wore them constantly in wet weather, which I believe helps with the stretch.

review_title: Great deal on an extremely practical piece of ugly footwear!
review_text: Rare to find this brand at the Amazon price I paid - wanted a clog with heel strap so I could safely drive back & forth to the local aquatic center.  I wasn't excited about the glossy black appearance, but since I only wear them to drive from my garage to the pool, walk about 200 feet across hot concrete, stick them in a locker while I swim, then reverse the process to go home, I can overlook my own fashion faux pas.  The heel strap keeps them properly positioned on my feet while driving, and the drain holes in the toes make them great for poolside.  I have falling arches & these make the walk from car to poolside & back so much less painful than foam flip-flops - and as stated before, I feel confident driving my car (automatic transmission) whereas with flip-flops, I'd change in & out of socks & shoes, while my kids wait for me to get the car started & the A/C going.  If these last half as long as my old Crocs Mammoth clogs (10+ years so far & still have a little bit of tread on the soles), then these are the best deal in footwear for my Fashion Tone-Deaf Curmudgeon Community.  (Life Member since 2013.)

As I said on the recent purchase review of this wonderful shoe, I can't wear any other.  Most ALL other shoes I have ever tried give me back, hip, knee, ankle and foot pain after wearing them for as little as an hour or two.  When I slip into a pair of these, it's like a miracle.I love the color Garnet.  It's actually rather classy looking.  Just purchased a gray pair for my husband, and they look really nice on me, too :)  Might have to order myself a pair of gray soon :)It fits perfectly, except the opening is a little bit smaller than the pairs I bought about 10 years ago.  Yes, I stocked up on them, back then, when I found the white ones locally.  BUT, the good news is, if I order a size larger, it's now a perfect fit.  Found that out when I ordered that pair for my husband, after he saw my newest pair.I also love the fact that you can just wear them in the shower, or throw them in the washer to keep them clean.It's a WONDERFUL shoe_like none other !

Who could say anything bad about a croc? It's one of those shoes where I feel like a significant number of people know what size they are in crocs, but just in case: I am usually between an 8-9 in shoes.
