These run about half a size larger, although I can wear both an 8 and a 9 in crocs, I like the way the 8 looks better. If you have wide feet and that's a deciding factor for you in getting the larger sizes, you don't have to worry about that because of the wideness of crocs. I'm so glad these are back in style. The white ones especially are a perfect staple shoe for summer. I wouldn't hike in them, but they would be fine as an everyday shoe for sure. They also make a good house slipper for going inside and outside too. we stan

So my dad had a pair of these years ago and I found myself putting these on for household tasks whenever I went over to his house.I got married this summer, so now that I can start letting myself go I decided to order a pair for myself. They're great. Super lightweight and comfortable. The only gripe I have is that they run a little big. I wear a size 10.5 and, based on other reviews, I ordered a size down. Even the size 10's fit best with socks. Still very comfortable though.If you find yourself at a point in life where you want comfortable shoes and don't have to impress anyone - I highly recommend these.

FIRST- Hot tips for my Amazonians:- Get Prime. Buyer protection. Sort by ‚ÄúPrime‚Äù when browsing. Buy with confidence. Two day shipping and NO HASSLE free returns without worry. Don‚Äôt like it? Return. Doesn‚Äôt fit? Return. Broken? Return it!- Sort by MOST RECENT reviews when looking at an item. Click on reviews at the top - click on reviews again. Sort by Recent instead of Top. You‚Äôll thank me!- Research, Research, Research everything you buy here. Mainly pricing. May be way better somewhere else but watch for added shipping cost if you‚Äôre a Prime member. Many items are marked up here to compensate for shipping.- Watch for knockoffs! Believe the reviews that are heavy on the negative. Don‚Äôt trust reviews that say ‚ÄúGood product‚Äù or ‚ÄúWill buy again‚Äù only. They are bought. Look at the pics!NOW - On to the review for these Crocs!Kids LOVE these. My 12 and 14 year old girls wear them out and WEAR THEM OUT. Crocs have been around for years but it‚Äôs now a ‚Äúfashion trend‚Äù with the teenie boppers.But don‚Äôt let that fool you! Adults are obsessed too. They are super comfortable and long lasting. Great for quick trips to the store or longer walks.Tons of colors. True to size. Get you some!If this was a helpful review, thumbs it up so others can see it too!

review_title: Crocs are currently on trend, plus they're soooo comfy!
review_text: I love my Pink Lemonade color Crocs.  (they are a true pink, as compared to the ballerina pink which is a very pale pink)  I also bought Lemon Yellow,  Electric Pink, and Ice Blue -- all from Amazon.  I wear a women's size 7 in sneakers like Nike & Adidas, so that's what I buy in Crocs, and the fit is perfect.  I never thought I'd be rockin' Crocs, but here I am... and I'm loving them.  PS...  My shipments have all been shipped & received very quickly.  PPS... these are the authentic brand 'Crocs' shoes, and the Amazon price is comparable to the shoe stores, except Amazon has many more colors to choose from & you don't need to leave your house to get them.  If Amazon don't have your favorite color in your size today, just keep checking back.  PPPS... I can't believe how many compliments I've been getting whenever I wear my Crocs -- or how all-day comfy my feet are!  Apparently, Crocs are the hottest "it" shoe to own in your fashion wardrobe these days.  Hard to believe, but true. Lol

I love my crocs so unbelievably much. My poor husband absolutely despises them, but too bad! I've got bad fibromyalgia and also lingering foot issues from a fracture a decade ago. I bought the crocs because I can't stand the pain from going barefoot all the time. Let me tell you- If I wear these all day, there's no pain or it's largely decreased. They're so comfortable, supportive, light, and handy! I can wear them out to the garden and then just hose them off. They're quiet enough to wear around the house while the kids are sleeping. I have such bad joint stiffness and pain in the morning, it can be hard to get going...but if I put these on right away, I get right to whatever I need to be doing that day! Now I just need a pair for camping and a pair for at work and an indoors pair and an outdoors pair. Lol. LOVE THEM!

I have steered clear of buying crocs, as I assumed it would "show my age" but, having just turned 43, I think I no longer care. I am outdoors working in the yard many hours per day and my pale skin was cooking in my regular uncomfortable $4 flip flops. That, and needing arch support, my feet were aching. Now, my gorgeous grass green crocs protect my fragile skin. The crocs are SO comfy and sturdy I've begun wearing them on the regular for NON outdoor gardening and pool cleaning activities. Even as I precariously balance on the slippery rock formations around the pool, the crocs grip and keep me from sliding into the pool hilariously. 10/10 will buy more. Perhaps a rainbow version?

I was pretty skeptical about purchasing this shoe, due to the conflicting opinions in fashion.  What is more important, style or comfort?  Well, if you were to ask me that question two weeks ago, my answer would be style without a bit of hesitation.  However, after working eight-plus hour shifts, five days a week, standing only, my mindset ‚Äì and answer to that question ‚Äì has definitely changed.  I thought my Nike sneakers would cut it, but I soon realized they provided no support, no natural curvature for the foot to follow, no air circulation.  My knees and feet began to kill, and I decided it might be a good idea to do some research.Clogs.  Clogs?  I know I wanted more practical shoes, but clogs are just not suited for my nineteen-year-old self.  I mean, I still wanted something relatively cute.  But was that possible?  I kept scrolling through the shopping tab of Google, until I saw this pair of crocs.  Now, I remember I sported a bright orange pair in middle school, but I think I outgrew that stage.  Wait, they have a white pair.  Much more mature color.  I decided to take the risk, after all, my I owed it to my feet.Not only did these crocs pull my whole scrub uniform together ‚Äì I mean what screams healthcare more than scrubs and crocs? ‚Äì but I managed an entire shift with 99% less foot and knee pain than my previous sneakers had caused.  Another plus, they are ‚Äúnot only the most comfortable shoes, but also easy to clean just using soap and water and allowing for a quick dry.‚Äù  Because one of my duties as a pharmacy technician is to pour liquids, it is easy to spill on your shoes.  But, because of the synthetic material, I am able to grab a wet paper towel and wipe the mess right off.  But wait, there‚Äôs more.  I‚Äôm sure everyone can relate to their feet getting sweaty in sneakers, especially if you are moving around all day.  Well, crocs solve that problem for you.  The holes provide circulation and leave your feet as dry as ever.I totally agree with and support this review!‚ÄúThere is a moderate arch support. I have low arches and my sister-in-law has extremely high arches; neither of us feel like more support is needed‚Äù As arch support was one of my main concerns, I can assure that crocs also leave me feeling like my feet are supported properly. I highly recommend purchasing this product, as it has changed my work day experience.  I no longer suffer with severe feet and joint pain that is caused by flat shoes.  These crocs provide just the right amount of support and maintain comfort with the foamy cushion.  If standing on your feet sounds like the majority of your days, then crocs are the shoes that will change your life.  Especially with the color assortment, there‚Äôs a shoe to match every outfit!

review_title: Excellent for pool deck, locker room, and at home!  Good arch support.
review_text: Excellent sandal for walking on the pool deck and in locker rooms!  Good arch support!  Very comfortable. Easy to slip on and off while standing. Nice big toe box. I also wear them at home as slippers, as shoes in warm weather, on grass, on docks, and for canoeing, and kayaking. Lift your foot up and the water drains, out so your feet do not stay wet. On colder days I wear them with socks. I have worn them for many years and I keep buying more of same. Their usefulness and comfort wins out over lack of beauty due to bulky look. I hope they keep making this same classic sandal.  I have to replace them because extended wear on the pool deck concrete smooths the bottom making them slippery. Otherwise they last a long time. I wear them 5 or 6 days a week for hours at the pool while teaching swimming, life-guarding, roving, and while showering in locker room after swimming.

I was so excited to get the cyan blue crocs on super sale. These are the comfiest shoes ever. The dots on the soles massage your feet, they provide great arch support, they‚Äôre such a cute color, and it‚Äôs finally long enough past the initial croc trend that they‚Äôre ironically stylish again. 10/10 recommend for beach days, days at the pool, rainy days, regular days, lazy days, winter days with socks, or whatever else to want to wear them with. They definitely run large, so try on a friend‚Äôs or try them on in the store first if possible. But snag yourself a pair, you won‚Äôt regret it!

I needed some slip-on shoes to wear while working in my garage (woodworking).  I don‚Äôt have a lot of shoes because I have long, wide feet and I have trouble finding ones with a comfortable fit. I had been wearing my work tennis in the garage, but then while I was at my job I would look down and notice sawdust under the laces lol. So, I ordered these and they are really perfect:Easy to slip on and off.Durable.Super lightweight.Waterproof. I can hose them off.And so comfortable! I forget that I‚Äôm wearing them. I‚Äôve actually finished shopping before and then realized that I went to the store in my garage Crocs lol.I have huge feet and I wear size 11 in all shoe styles so that‚Äôs what I got for these. They are a bit roomy in the width and length, but they still don‚Äôt seem bulky when they‚Äôre on, my foot does not slide around inside the shoes, and it means I can wear my thick comfy socks under them!I want more! Maybe one pair for working out in the yard. And maybe some lined ones to use as slippers. I definitely want some in cooler colors next!

Ok so I've had a pair for myself and bought pairs for friends they run big & they are actually awesome but the "melon" color looks yellow & its lime green. Not even close to the picture. so bad because of that. It's important to represent accurate description & photos for each.But let's talk about how much puss you'll get with these. If you think these are ugly or bad it's because you ain't got fashion or game. Overall I've bought 8 for different friends and now they are drippin in the streets. If you want a girl to recognize you toss those flowers & buy some crocs. If she doesn't want to be your wife after that then she ain't the one mister. If 2020 wasn't the year of Corona it'd be the year of crocs. Trust. Don't sleep.

review_title: These are now my favorite kick-around shoe - even went shopping in Walmart with them and they turned out to be comfy.
review_text: Where have these been all my life?  I first discovered a cheap copy of these at Walmart, and I loved how they fit and how easily they slip on and off.  So I was pleased to find the original brand here on Amazon.  I live in the desert, and our home is kept on the warm side too, so I definitely need models (like this classic model) with the holes in the side and top - the one thing I didn't like about my cheap knock-offs is they didn't have those holes, and my feet (with or without socks) were uncomfortably hot and clammy inside the house.  Another good feature is being able to toss the shoes into a bucket of soapy water to clean them after slogging in the mud outside.For me, the strap is crucial.  If I fold the strap up to the front out of the way, my heel sometimes slips out over the back end of the shoe, so I hope they never eliminate the strap!My feet are 11 1/2, and very wide (12 4E New Balance 408s fit well), and the size 12 Crocs fit good - I am going to try a size 13 next for kicking around the house and see if they are even easier to slip on/off.

I know what you're thinking, these things are ugly and look ridiculous, and you're not wrong. What grown man would wear these. Well, turns out, this grown man would. When these things first hit the market, I was with everyone else making fun of them. But here's the thing, my brother is a cook, on his feet all day, and he wears crocks for cooks (don't worry, they're different than these, not open, so no foot fungus in your food) and he convinced me to try them because he swore they were the most comfortable pair of shoes he's ever had. So I finally broke down and bought a pair, and you know what, he was right. These things are great. I slip them on when I've got errands to run, light yard work, or sometimes when it's nice, just out and about, and they are very comfortable, and durable too. Get em wet, no problem, wear them with or without socks, still comfortable. Yes I look like a goof with them on, and I thought that would bother me, but it turns out my sense of shame is way lessened by how comfortable they are. If I thought I could get away with it, I'd wear them everywhere during the warmer months.

review_title: Just do it, they‚Äôre pretty dang comfortable.
review_text: So I‚Äôll admit I always felt crocs were ugly & ridiculous. I thought no matter how comfortable they may be it just wasn‚Äôt worth stooping to that level... but then I reached the age where comfort & convenience became more important than vanity. I needed something to wear during the summer that he slightly more protection from itchy grass than flip flops but was cooler & didn‚Äôt require socks like tennis shoes so I caved and bought these crocs. Vowing to never wear them in public.Well I‚Äôm here to say I freakin‚Äô love these shoes. They‚Äôre comfy and surprisingly durable. They have enough support that my feet aren‚Äôt sore at the end of the day even after walking all over our property doing chores. They exceeded my expectations and I will probably buy another pair when I wear these out. But just for the record still not wearing them to town.

review_title: Better than flip flops in the garden!
review_text: I'm a old lady, concerned about falling or slipping outside working on my farm.  I have been told to buy Crocs for years, but as usual, I'm the last one to catch trends.  These shoes are easily hosed off if debris gets inside, and they are light weight and very comfortable.  I call them my new Bozo the Clown shoe because they are so wide, but I wear an 8.5, and the 6 -8 fits perfectly.  I just ordered another pair that may be less wide.  I cannot wait!  I'm a 64 year old lady chicken farmer with a closet full of fancy shoes that are going to be leaving!  I'd rather have Crocs for every occasion!

My old crocs finally came apart after many years of use, and I decided to invest in another pair to wear to the pool and around the house. These fit just like my old ones. They are snug enough to stay to on without the back strap down and loose enough in the toes to be comfortable. The nubby inside is not really uncomfortable, but not as nice feeling as a smooth insole would be. On the other hand, my bare feet would stick to a smooth plastic sole. . I do like that I can put my wet feet into them when I get out of the pool and I don't slip around in them. I love the color (turquoise)! While crocs aren't really a fashion statement, they are ok for a quick, casual trip to the grocery store or the postoffice. I'm happy with my purchase.

review_title: Got tired of my wife stealing mine
review_text: Crocs are not the fashion statement of the decade, this is true. However(!), their staying power has everything to do with how functional and durable they are. Going out to get the mail, take out the trash, quick walk with the dog, they are quick on/quick off and more comfortable than they should be.Mine kept disappearing so I bought my wife her own pair. Problem solved. Sidenote: Mine are probably 6 years old and have been used far, far harder than any pair of shoes should be. They have paint on them, gouges from who knows what, are faded and don't look very good at all, but they strap is still completely intact and they are still very comfortable. I keep waiting for them to die so I can spring for new pair but they just keep going.

The product arrived on time and appeared to be good quality.  Unfortunately, the size 9 I ordered fit smaller than the size 8 I tried.  I will say I was pleased at how easy the return process was and would give the seller 5 stars for that.

So many knock offs of crocs that it's easy to confuse them for the real thing. I've picked up the fake ones, even though I've had the real ones. But maybe your old ones wore out and you're at the everything for $5 store and you buy the crappy ones, and you just end up forgetting how great and different real crocs are. If you need extra room in the toe area to use toe separators, or you have wide feet, and/or you have some foot issues with pain, CROCS can be a saver for your feet. When I put mine on today, after having worn the crappy ones for a while, I was excited to have them again as I felt the little nubs inside stimulate my feet. They will help your circulation. I just love them!

review_title: Now I can be like Mario Batali...
review_text: With these shoes you too can be world renowned cooking stud Mario Batali...that‚Äôs COOKING stud, not creepy, fat ginger, who can‚Äôt keep his hands off the ladies ‚Äústud‚Äù...But these shoes won‚Äôt make you cook like Batali, but they will make you unattractive like Batali!!! BELLISSIMO!(Honestly, these things are ugly with anything you wear, BUT they are completely kooky and comfortable! I was wearing my kids that were a size 9 men‚Äôs with very little problem, even though I am a size 11, which I bought instead. I like the smaller nome look of the 9‚Äôs, but I was worried that another pair might be truer to my correct size of 11. I wasn‚Äôt taking any chances on them not fitting at all....I probably should have gotten a 10 because even though these fit, they just look clumsier and EVEN more outlandish. I kinda look like Batali!!Ewwwwwwwww

review_title: Used for a goose costume. Ran a mile in them. New favorite house shoes.
review_text: I've always made fun of crocs. Several years ago, I began to see their utility when it comes to camping. They are lightweight, easy to put on, easy to wash off, and most importantly... compatible with thick socks. But I still didn't buy myself a pair.I've been through 2 or 3 pairs of Croc Sexii flip flop sandals in the last few years, and I love them.So when Halloween rolled around last year, instead of ordering or making some silly one-use shoe covers for my Untitled Goose costume, I bought some bright orange crocs. It took a while to get used to the feeling of my foot being encased by solid plastic, but they're pretty comfortable.I had 2 pairs of flip flops break recently, and my crocs have since become my house shoes. Also one of my younger co-workers (who is all about fancy sneakers) is now wearing white crocs n socks to work every day, so... maybe they are cool now? Maybe?Also I ran a mile in them once at the end of a 5k fun run.

I purchased these for easy slip ons to go outside with my toddler.  We are usually in our backyard playing with water.  THESE ARE AMAZING FOR THAT!  I am so happy I joined the crocs club and I can't believe I didn't join the club sooner.  Below are the pros for these:1. They are great for people who have wide feet (like me)2. Perfect for easy slip on and run outside.3. Great for the beach, pool, any water activity.4. You can easily slip them on and/or you can put the back strap down and your foot is a little more secure.5. Easy to clean - If you have a colored pair (like me) and they get a little dirty you can use soap and water rub on them and they look brand new again.Cons -1. If you bend your foot and/or crouch down they can leave a little crease in the shoe.

review_title: Had to give the Crocs a chance.  Glad I did.
review_text: I‚Äôm a late adapter to Crocs.  Arrived yesterday.  Initial reaction was the shoes were too long and wide, so I reluctantly put them back in the bag and started to return them.  Something urged me to actually try them on again.  I used the heel strap, walked around the house, then the yard, and next thing I knew, I wore them the rest of the day and long into the night. Eventually, I tried them without the heel strap and found they were just as secure and comfortable. I canceled the return request. Crocs are just different beasts; like Birkenstock‚Äôs or my K√§lso Earth Shoes.  For me, there was a brief learning curve/familiarization period.  I‚Äôm pleased with the Crocs.  Totally what I expected.  Comfortable.  Like walking on my Gel-Pro kitchen mats wherever I go.  I just didn‚Äôt appreciate that it would take a bit to get used to a new (to me) style of foot wear.  They seem like the Volvo of the shoe world. Happy with my purchase and got a nice deal on Amazon.

I bought 2 pair of crocs in two different colors. I wear size 6 1/2 shoes and the crocs are a size 7. They just barely fit, they are almost too small. I have a pair of crocs, this exact size, bought about ten years ago, and they are about a half inch longer and a bit wider. I was hoping the pairs I bought would be that exact size. The old pair says "Made in China" and the new pairs say "Made in Vietnam" and "Made in Mexico". I'm happy with the looks and quality of the new crocs, just wish they were a tad larger, more like a size 7. In the photos, the shoe on the left is the new croc, the shoe on the right is my old croc. Note the size difference.

I bought these to wear in our boat to save my flip flops. We live on the beach and I wear flip flops pretty much all year long. I decided to buy my husband a pair of these because he was always getting his shoes wet (he refuses to wear flip flops) and thought I would get myself a pair as well. They are good for taking the dogs out in the rain, quick trips to the store, etc. I like them much better than I thought I would. I ordered a size up after reading reviews, but could have gotten my normal size and been fine. If I get another pair I will order my normal size. They clean up quickly and so far have been durable as my husband has been in pluff mud with them and they held up with no problems. I would definitely recommend these crocs

These shoes are not attractive at all, in my opinion, but they serve their purpose very well.I needed a pair of shoes I can just slip on and off to run out to the mailbox or take the dogs out.  I also wanted them to be easy to clean after working in the yard.  These shoes fit those needs well.I also like that there is an adustable heel strap to keep the shoe on even more securely, or it can be flipped up over the top of the foot to allow easy off and on.So, as long as no one is looking at my feet, these shoes are great.

review_title: Easy to modify for plantar wart relief, treads wear quickly & are then slippery.
review_text: Use a Dremel type tool with a 1/2" diameter coarse sanding drum to carve out a relief for a plantar wart- otherwise the "nubs" inside will greatly pain you!  (See pic of hacked Croc)The soles on my 2018 vintage classic style Crocs wore out relatively quickly and these 2020 ones are of the same design and appear to be of the same material.  Once the treads are worn away, they are REAL slippery on smooth wet or merely damp surfaces.  I used the above Dremel rig to cut new grooves as treads in my old ones.Without socks, your feet will sweat a good deal, or at least it is more noticeable to me.  I just slip then off if I am stationary, so,  driving is the only time it bothers me- YMMV..Overall, they are a great value unless you go with sandals.

review_title: Life changing. Get a pair ASAP
review_text: I haven‚Äôt worn crocs since I was 5. I got the ballet pink ones because during this quarantine, I am tired of wearing uncomfortable shoes. I mainly got these to wear to take my dog out, cause they‚Äôre quick to put on and easy to wash if I step in something :/. But these arrived and I HAVE WORN THEM NONSTOP. Socks with Crocs is my new look. They are the quickest slip on shoes, they are just so useful! I wear them everywhere. When I‚Äôm cleaning the house, going to the store, to my parents- everywhere.Sizing: I am a women‚Äôs 8.5 and I have pretty chunky, wide feet. I got the women‚Äôs 9, men‚Äôs 11 and it actually fits perfectly, wouldn‚Äôt have changed a thing. Feels fairly true to size for me, because it does fit like a size 9 shoe would. Get yourself a pair of crocs!!

review_title: Finally got a pair. Not disappointed
review_text: Been wanting a pair of these especially with my buddy hyping them up. Waited til prime day to get them on sale and have to admit that I love them. Am a huge fan now. Only down side is they don‚Äôt offer many in size 14 that I need so I miss out on the American flag ones or other cool designs. They feel a little loose but when you put em in sport mode (aka put the heel strap down) they stay put. Got them to wear on a my new boat but am using them everywhere. Will honestly admit I thought they‚Äôd be a tad more soft/comfortable. I have a pair of oofos slides that if they made crocs with the same softness would be game over. They just slip too much so they need the heel strap that crocs have.

I have been wearing Crocs clogs for so many years and my first pair I got in 2002 finally wore out completely after 18 years of pretty constant wear. They are so comfortable to wear all day long with no problems. I do not wear socks with mine, just bare feet. Size is "true to fit/fit as expected". It seems every time I get a pair of Crocs, they are made at a different place. The 4 pairs I now got are either made in Mexico or Vietnam & are all comfy. The newest pair I got today was the white Crocs....made in China & they seem fine so far. For about $37 a pair, these Crocs will last so many years, be comfy and go thru mud, water, crud or whatever just fine....easy to clean for sure. 5 stars for these Crocs.

This is my 3rd pair of crocs all size 12m.  I got navy, then white, then khaki.  Oddly enough each color is a different size- khaki is smallest, navy is in the middle, and white was so big and klunky they made me look like an idiot.  All of them say size 12m on them so the factory must have standardization problems.  Good luck getting a pair that fits right.  My first pair, navy, fits better than the white and khaki so I kind of regret buying the white and khaki ones.  But crocs are the best.  I have been wearing crocs for a long time and they never stink and never make my feet stink and they are durable enough to hike or run or fight in self defense and I can kick them off when I go inside easily and slip them on when I go outside easily.  I just wish a 12m is always the same size no matter which color.

I‚Äôm working as a frontline worker and these are ideal! They arrived in 2 days. I‚Äôm a 7 1/2 so I had to side down to a 7 they fit good but if I put the strap on the toe is a bit snug. But I‚Äôd rather that than them be too big! And shockingly my feel look small in them oppose to looking like duck feet. Now some of my coworkers are buying a pair

review_title: Loved them but reluctantly had to return
review_text: With a heavy heart I had to return these.  I purchased them because after shattering my ankle in Jan. my ankle/foot remains so swollen I can't get my old shoes on.  Was thrilled to find these shoes accommodated my left foot and thought all my problems were solved.  Unfortunately after a couple of hours of wearing I discovered I was in deep trouble with my right foot.  Years ago I had a hammer toe that the surgery did not repair.  That darn toe sticks up.  The clogs are molded, don't "give", and I was in trouble.  Needless to say this would not happen to a normal person.  Were I normal I would have kept them in a heartbeat..  The lime color was perfect for Florida.

I've been on the fence about Crocs since the chef guy who was famous for wearin'em ... wore'em.but after a couple of friends and coworkers gave such enthusiastic thumbs ups on their own, I grabbed these.I wore them to work for about two weeks straight, around the house as slippers and I ride my bike in them.if you work in retail on your feet all day, you may be like me, blowing out shoes left and right. I've got some high hopes based off of first hand accounts of friends and their own crocs. I'll likely follow up from time to time here! So here's hoping they last a good while! Who will wear out first? The Casio or the Crocs?!

Get these now. They have always spiked my interest but I finally broke down and bought a pair. I usually always wear flip flops but wanted something a little bit different for when I‚Äôm out walking in the woods etc (taking pictures/magnet fishing) I just pop these bad boys into four wheel drive and get stepping. They are great for just lounging around the house too. I‚Äôll put them on around 7am and will basically forget they‚Äôre even on most of the day. The first day or so they felt a little different but after they broke in a little bit it‚Äôs almost as if they‚Äôre molded to my feet. Highly recommend them for anybody on their feet a lot or if your weight is pretty hefty. I‚Äôm so glad I bought these

Crocs will never be the most comfortable shoes.  They are an utility shoe for those of us who like to go barefoot around the house and need something to slip on to check the mail, grab the paper, put out the trash, or brave the harsh and hateful sun long enough to yell at the little jacktard from down the street who is letting his dog crap in your petunias for the 3rd time this week.  No, we don't wear them because we love the way they feel, we wear them because they are cheap and get the job done, and aren't all furry on the outside which attracts hair from the shedding freeloading bastard laying on the couch.

I had planned to use these Crocs for yard work, however, once I put them on and realized how comfortable they are, I decided to make them my run about shoes.They are stylish, comfortable, sturdy, and provide sure footing. Can wear with the strap across the back of the heal or pushed forward, out of the way. Either way, the shoe is very comfortable. I like the portals, since they keep my feet cool. Nice design.

review_title: Comfortable, and easy to get on
review_text: People laugh at Crocs until they buy a pair. When you slip into these and walk around in them, you know then why so many people tend to buy them over and over. The support is exceptional, and they‚Äôre easy to clean. I got these for my husband because he kept slipping on his bedroom slippers to go out and get the mail, set out the sprinkler, etc., and it was driving me crazy. The nice thing about this pair of Crocs is that you can either slip right into them, or take an extra second and use the back strap. If you don‚Äôt use it it slides right on top easily. If you‚Äôve never worn Crocs before, give them a try. You‚Äôll love them.

review_title: Comfy, easy to clean, multi purpose shoe
review_text: A men‚Äôs size 12 in white is very hard to come by. I checked several times and finally found it available here. Typical loose fitting crocs. My son loves them, they are all the rage on his college campus. He was glad I finally found him some white ones vs his old black ones. Apparently white is ‚Äúthe thing‚Äù there. He is a shoe hound, and ecstatic they are the only white shoes he has that are easy to keep clean and white, lol. He usually wears a size 13 sneaker but the 12 in crocs fits him best. So if you‚Äôre iffy or half size, I‚Äôd say go down a size.
Who doesn't know Crocs? The pair I purchased for my mom arrived in excellent condition and are as solid as one would expect from Crocs. Shipping was handled by Amazon and arrived as expected.

review_title: Fabulous replacement for my 13 y.o. Crocs Original Clogs
review_text: These are a fabulous replacement to my original Croc clogs from 2006. The fit is more streamlined than my old pair. Not as wide from side to side. No pinching, slipping or stubbing. The ice blue color is exactly as pictured. It's not Turquoise or Aqua Marine blue. I wear size 8 medium (a 6 medium in mens). This clog is unisex. So glad I didn't have to buy them more expensive elsewhere. If you have very wide feet, I would consider ordering a different Crocs clog. Did I mention how comfortable and supportive they are? Important for bad backs, necks, foot problems. I wear mine as house slippers.

review_title: Shoulda listened to hubby years ago about these Crocs
review_text: So my husband has been trying to get me to buy a pair of Crocs for years. He practically lives in his. I just couldn‚Äôt get past the looks of them. Well I finally gave in and bought this pair. Oh my what have I been missing? They are so comfortable, and easy to slip on. You can get them as dirty as you want in the garden and then you just wash them off.  They provide good air flow so your feet don‚Äôt get sweaty. What more could you want in a pair of shoes? Ok so I probably couldn‚Äôt get away with going to a wedding in them, but wish I could, cause I‚Äôd have the most comfortable feet on the dance floor! I love my Crocs and are starting to actually think they‚Äôre kind of cute. I shoulda listened to hubby years ago!

I was worried based on some of the reviews. But I‚Äôm happy with the purchase. My daughter loves them. And they fit her perfectly. He typically wears a 8.5. I purchased the 8 and hoped for the best. When they arrived, she tried on immediately and they fit her perfect. I bought some croc charms from amazon as well which were affordable and fun to place on her new shoes. Will buy another pair for sure.

review_title: Must have investment for any wardrobe and feet care/relief
review_text: These are so so comfortable - as recommended.  A great purchase and investment for any person.  I would and will buy more.  I was given a word of mouth recommendation for Crocs from a woman with feet problems from years of work on her feet.  I hesitated at first thinking do I need these given flip flops, sneakers etc.  I was not prepared for the little massage/stimulation like nodules inside which are great too.  I can't think of how anyone would not get a lot of wear and relief out of these shoes, particularly anyone who works on their feet.  At the moment working in long shifts on concrete these are like a little foot massage and relief in between.  TRUE TO WEBSITE IMAGES FOR SLATE PURCHASE.

review_title: sigh. I guess I‚Äôve seen the light.
review_text: Yes, I used to hate these and thought they were the ugliest shoe ever. Swore in high school that I would never get a pair. I‚Äôm now 26 and now that I‚Äôve hit my quarter life crisis, I found myself ordering a pair. Saw my hubby wearing them and made fun of him every time I saw him wear them. Then one day I needed to put them on to grab something outside (seeing that those were the only ones near me lol). He is a size 12 and I‚Äôm a size 6.5 so you can only imagine how huge they felt. I saw the light that day and ordered a pair of crocs.ANYWAYS here‚Äôs what you ladies wanna know about the fit:- I‚Äôm a NARROW 6.5 in women (can fit 6 in heels and 7 in Nike‚Äôs)- the site says to size up if you are a half size BUT these are already ugly enough so I took my chances and sized down.- ordered a 6 in women (Army Green) and they fit PERFECTLY.- the shoe feels SLIGHTLY tight when I put it in ‚Äú4x4 mode‚Äù (as my hubby calls it lol) but it‚Äôs not enough to bug me.- hubby says they stretch out over time so there you go.I got these the day they were expected and I unfortunately have not worn any other shoe since receiving it. Who have I become? :(

These are my first pair of Crocs. I only bought them because I needed easy slip on shoes for the summer for fishing that wasn‚Äôt open like sandals or flip flops but still breathable. And can I just say how absolutely happy I am that I bought these! I LOVE them and def will be buying more pairs now. (Never thought I would say that lol) They are so comfortable and I love the color. I‚Äôm usually a size 7-7 1/2 in shoes so I bought size 8 and they fit perfectly!

I have seen people wearing these for years and always thought they look ridiculous and couldn‚Äôt imagine how foam rubber shoes could be comfortable or durable. It‚Äôs obvious they aren‚Äôt stylish. After buying my very first pair of grass green size 15 crocs here for a crazy pre Christmas sale price of under 10$ with the free prime shipping, I‚Äôm amazed. After trying them on I no longer care how they look and I now get why they are popular. They are light durable and super comfy without feeling like you‚Äôre walking on marshmallows. In fact I was shocked how firm the foot bed is without being hard. I no longer care how they look. Not sure I would wear them to a wedding but for around the house and yard they are perfect.

The Classic Clog line of Crocs serves my needs perfectly.  I can no longer wear normal shoes because my feet require more oxygen than those of most people, but I hate slippers and sandals (or going barefoot).  The Crocs Classic Clogs provide the ventilation I  need while still feeling like shoes, they're also very comfortable with cushioning thick soles and they're durable, lasting for a long time with no damage even after 3 years of daily use.  They're also cheap compared to others.  Yes, they're ugly, but you can get them in pretty colors to compensate, like these bright yellow ones.  For die hard Crocs fans like myself, buying one pair may lead to buying a dozen or more so be warned.  Emphasis on Classic Clog line.  The other models of shoes Crocs makes provide less ventilation and my feet aren't as comfortable in them.

So I'll be the first one to tell you that I thought Crocs were the ugliest thing ever.My sister ended up getting some because she needed something comfortable and told me "they had cute colors". After a week she told me I should definitely get some since they truly are comfortable.I was skeptical but I took the plunge. I ordered the cherry blossom color and when they arrived, I immediately tried them on. They are super comfortable!I now wear them all the time. The cherry blossom color is super cute and I definitely am alleviating my feet pain walking around the house now.Strongly recommend these!

review_title: Treat yourself to another Croc color.
review_text: Great house slippers. Just read reviews that mention this. I wear a 10  EEEE, so these were perfect. I ordered the 10, and the classic crocs width was an excellent fit. If you have a narrower foot, D size and below, check out reviews on other Croc models that are narrower. Just pay attention to the number of reviews that mention whether the length is too short, this you may have to order one size larger, but the decrease in width should not be a problem for those with narrow, D and bellow. Crocs are so comfortable and easy to slip on and off I ordered another pair. And because they come in so many colors, you can order another color that pleases you, something to treat yourself to, as they are reasonably priced. Amazon‚Äôs selection is hit or miss, with many selections not available in all sizes and colors. So try Zappos. Amazon owns them anyway. And they always have free shipping and free returns.

review_title: Hubby didn‚Äôt want any but now wears them all the time!
review_text: I ordered these crocs for my husband. We live at the beach and have a boat and he‚Äôs forever getting his shoes wet and/or leaving them outside. He swore he would never wear crocs. Well, he loves them!! Other than while at work he won‚Äôt wear anything else now, lol. Even went fishing on the boat with them and said that was the best thing ever! He‚Äôs so happy that I bought them for him and ‚Äúencouraged‚Äù him to wear them. They fit true to size, and he has plenty of room in them even though he has wide feet. He even loves the little ‚Äúmassaging things‚Äù in the soles. üòÅ So glad he no longer leaves any shoes outside!!

This is my first pair of crocs; never had the desire to own any. But now, can't imagine being without them! I needed something easy to slip into and take off when I'm down at the horse barn, feeding and cleaning corrals. Also nice that they are waterproof, unlike my old leather clogs. Excellent price, too . At first, I thought they were going to be floppy on my feet; I did purchase the size I usually wear. I wear socks with the crocs, sometimes two pair in the cooler months. They still fit just fine. I have narrow to medium width feet, wear a size 10. I like the orange because they're easy to spot wherever I've left them. Easy to clean off the dirt, either brush off or hose off; I understand they can be thrown in the washer, too. And, best of all, these crocs are as comfortable as my slippers I wear around the house. Sometimes, I forget I wore my crocs in the house, noticing sometimes hours later! Love them! And convinced my husband to order some, too! He loves his, too!

You know the drill--They're comfortable but so unstylish that they're stylish. Well, I don't think this classic style of Crocs will ever be stylish, to my eye, but we buy them for comfort and versatility, right? My old pair were so worn that they started to slip on wet surfaces so I knew it was time for replacement. These fit well, though the rear strap is now tighter than the originals I got 15 years ago. The upside is they'll stay on better than the old ones--the downside is that if you plan to use the strap, you'll have to reach down and use a finger to stretch it around the back of your foot. It's fine--just different than the old looser strap.

My wife has to put in 8 hour shifts on 2 feet that are suffering!!!  17+ hour shift working for REGIS many years ago tore her Plantar Facia & a Ankle tendon or ligament & these are the only shoes she can wear along with tape & ankle support that can see her through a shift!!!  You might be wondering why Doctor's haven't helped her? Well we live in Wisconsin where the compassion goes as far as your money!!!!!

I have a pair of original Crocs that I bought 15 years ago and absolutely love them.  But the soles finally wore through and I needed to finally get another pair.  The size stamped on the bottom says W6-7.  I started looking on Amazon and couldn't believe how many styles of Crocs there are.  All I wanted was another pair just like my old ones.  I saw these Crocs Unisex Classic Clog and they looked almost identical to what I have.  I got a size 7 in Pepper and they are perfect.  I plan on ordering a couple more pairs.  Not for when these wear out (they seem to last forever) but there are so many great colors now.

review_title: Functionally great. They're basically flipflops with better functionality.
review_text: I was going to buy slippers to wear in my yard and patio since it's been annoying to put shoes on whenever taking my dog outside or to take the trash out. But I went with Crocs since they are just as comfortable while also allowing me to run around if needed (ie. dog randomly feels like running around the backyard).It does its job and is comfortable enough. If anyone thinks Crocs are ugly or think they are bad purchases, they should relax. They're functionally great the way one would wear "fat pants" or an old t-shirt around the house. I'm not planning on wearing this to a Michelin Star restaurant.Things to be aware of:1. Seems to run half a size large.2. Not as cushioned as expected.

LOVE LOVE LOVE!!! I am a 7 1/2 so i went with an 8 and it fits well enough. Sometimes it feels like its a little big, if i went a size lower, I think it would be too snug. I may get a size 7 next just so i have a snug pair lol

I'm simply hooked. I'm currently training for a very strenuous distance running challenge (fingers crossed it still happens). Plantar fasciitis slowly crept up on me, and these are one of the top solutions I've found. Yes, they are an eyesore, but that doesn't mean they can't be the most versatile eyesore in the house! I have used them for years to help with low back problems from walking on concrete floors in my college dorm to having a carefree solution for gardening. Oh! And I've been known to use them for their intended purpose of fishing on occasion. They are the best. Do yourself a favor and grab a pair.

I‚Äôm using these as house shoes for when I move to Japan! I am a true to size women‚Äôs 9.5. I always get a size 10 on Crocs. I‚Äôve never had classic crocs before, but I‚Äôve heard that these feel a little big on the feet. Since all the crocs I‚Äôve worn have been 10‚Äôs, I just got the 10 anyway. When I first put them on, I thought these were going to be too big since I have narrow feet, but once I started walking around in them, they never slipped off my feet with the heel strap. I don‚Äôt really use them without the strap. They are roomy and comfortable! I think you should try getting your regular size before thinking of sizing down. See how they fit you personally before deciding to go a full size down.

Love My Yellow Crocs I‚Äôve owned a few pair and there are exactly the same super light weight and comfy.True to size and came so fast I usually wear a 7 1/2 but the 8 was fine cause sometimes I wear socks with them Again Love Love Love üíõ‚ú®

review_title: Super Comfortable Waterproof Shoes For Around The House
review_text: Croc‚Äôs are super comfortable shoes for messing around the house and outside.  My wife bought an off brand as a second pair for indoors (no outside shoes in our house) that looked like Crocs but hurt her toes.  I bought her this pair of black crocs and she loves the feel, although she hates the black color as she has others in pink,  but black was the only color in stock.  We highly recommend Crocs for bumming around the house,  or going to a water park or beach.  They are not stylish,  so probably wouldn‚Äôt recommend wearing outside of the house other than the beach.

review_title: Half-size ordering down isn't perfect for me but going up to next size would be way too big. What to do!?
review_text: They arrived today and because I wear a 9.5, I ordered a half-size down but with the strap around the back of my foot, my toes are hitting up against the front too much. I'm a bit bummed as I ordered exactly as this site and the Cros.com site said to do with half-sizes....order down!  BUT I have to say that going to a 10 would be ridiculous as I only need about 1/2 size more & I don't want to fall out of them = tripping potential. Now what? Do they stretch out a bit. I hope so as I ordered a white pair in 9 from Crocs.com too as I was so sure after trying on my friend's size 8's. We both agreed to order one size up for me. I can wear them, and will but my idea to order a bunch more in different colors went out the window...

As expected, this is my son's 3rd pair same brand and color, I keep getting a size up toward the middle of every summer, he wears them quite a while that way. These are great for running in the sprinkler or playing in a sandbox or working in a vegetable garden, or for a rainy day or sand dune trip or beach trip. They can hurt the arches after a while so I don't recommend them for amusement parks or hiking.

Do crocs even really need a review anymore? We all know they‚Äôre great. I‚Äôm 9-9.5 in size so I got the 9 and they fit perfectly with plenty of space to wear thicker socks if you want. Not sure why people hate on these things - they‚Äôre comfy, water proof, they slip right on... already got them dirty, they rinse right off...If this helped ya - click helpful :)

Our near-two-year-old has been sporting several pairs of crocs for the last year and loves them. Eventually my wife got a pair, and now I have them, too.For home use they are absolutely fantastic. It feels like walking on clouds or something. The arch support is surprisingly good, too. They fit just enough but have just enough space to feel easy to slip on and off, but have enough traction to keep your feet in them if you are wearing them like slippers.Easy to wash. Comfortable. Light weight. Etc.Couldn‚Äôt be happier!

review_title: Another trip to the Emergency Room prevented
review_text: I wear these a lot for summer time creek fishing. I have harmlessly removed 2 fish hooks to date and I'm sure I have been unknowingly saved from countless sharp metal or glass unable to get though the think soled Crocs.They make perfect wading shoes offering as they soak up zero water, are durable and easy to clean and offer really good protection for your feet when compared to sandles and thin soled "water shoes" .Love or hate the look you can't deny their comfort and usefulness.

review_title: Perfect for picking up my kid!
review_text: I often wear thick fuzzy socks in the house I needed something that I could slip on really quick on my way to pick up or drop off my kid at school. With flip flops I have to take socks off and I'm self conscious about if I have to make a quick stop and having ashy feet yikes! But these will allow me keep on my thick socks and run out the door plus winter is coming so the thicker the socks the better. I love that they have holes too so I dont have to worry if they get wet. The fit was perfect and I have a wide foot and wear a size 10 in womens athletic shoes for reference.

These Crocs are the real deal. Unsurpassed comfort and quality in a variety of colors. Do not be enticed by look-a-likes that only look comfortable.I bought several of these shoes are Christmas gifts and everyone that for them have had nothing but praise.The nearly perfectly match the American size standards so they fit exactly as labeled.  Don't get bit by other brands that look like crocs, but are really just alligators (hard and uncuttable).I highly recommend Crocs in any color you like!

review_title: Let me be honest: I LOVE THESE SHOES
review_text: So, prior to looking on Amazon, I had only owned and purchased garden shoes from my local Ollie's. My feet felt good but I never knew there was a supportive sole like CROCS until these came in the mail. I have poor arch support and my feet literally hurt all of the time unless I am wearing a supportive sneaker or tennis shoe. These shoes do not hurt my feet and I can walk a few miles in them. My feet fit snuggly in these shoes and they are my go to when I am not working out. This was a great deal and I am looking to purchase more in the near future. Great comfortable shoe!

These are my first pair of Crocs, and they will not be the last.  Comfort level is absolute bliss & wonderful, and the bright color keeps me from tripping over them in low light.  The bright yellow color might keep me from wearing them in public, but the comfort level at home is just wonderful since we are supposed to be staying home now anyway.  Highly recommended & super comfy!!

These are my first pair of crocs and I am blown away by how comfortable they are! I expected a hard plastic clog, but these are so flexible and comfy. There are tiny little spikes on the foot bed and feel like an acupressure massage. I bought these to put on when I am working around my backyard, but I may get another pair just to wear regularly. Get a pair, your feet will thank you.

review_title: A little expensive, but they are addictive and I just can't get enough
review_text: These are a 5 star product, but I really wish the Amazon pricing was more consistent. One day and one color might be $45, then you might get a $10 off coupon on an already lower price in a different color.Overall, these are:- Super comfortable- Easy to clean- Saves on washing socks (unless you are that person that wears socks with them)- Don't slide around like flip-flops- Fit my abnormally wide feet- Great colors- Perfect for gardening, yard work, and the pool.I've purchased multiple pairs since last year. I just can't get enough.

review_title: These Crocs fit great with the usual great Croc comfort
review_text: I reordered these Crocs a full size larger than my previous Crocs, going up one size to 9-11.  When they came they fit perfectly, being the same size that I'm used to.I had previously ordered my old (5 - 8 years old)  croc size, which was an 8-10.The crocs that came were from heel to toe a full inch shorter.The current size crocs seem to try to math you shoe size better.  I'm an 8¬Ω so using my experience as a guide, go up a little rather than down.  However, some peoplelike them snug so they may want to try the opposite strategy

I have a size 8 foot and I like my shoes a bit loose so I ordered a size up, expecting that loose fit. I tried them on and they are very small. Almost a size smaller than my normal size, and I ordered a 9 womens/7 mens size. I suggest to order yourself two pairs just to be safe and save yourself shipping time and return the one that doesn't fit. I will update this review once the second pair come in.

Crocs.... oh man.... I once hated them and all of their glory. But... now I see the passion and light of the croc. I found out I owned crocs in 2010 and had tons of jibbitz. I was a croc enthusiast. (I even had multiple pairs of the same croc just because I guess). ‚ÄúWhy the croc‚Äù, they ask; and to that I say why not the croc.Now I have changed my eyes and I see the past me was correct and that being a croc enthusiast IS my passion and will forever be my passion. Once my crocs arrived I immediately opened the box and started decorating. Me and my mother have the same shoe size so we are ‚Äúsharing‚Äù them even though they are mine (she agreed).If you don‚Äôt own crocs I recommend that you immediately purchase a pair (or more if you are smart).The beautiful lavender color suits my skin tone very well. I will never be the same without my crocs by my side. Buy a pair of these crocs now. Sports mode is comforting knowing that your croc is safe and sound on your foot. While Relaxed mode gives you the comforting sensation of at home or taking the trash out ùïßùïöùïìùïñ.Thank you for your timeAnd crocs please sponsor me I love you and I‚Äôve loved you since I was two.:)

I never thought I would be a Crocs lover.  They are not my style and thought heck no, not gonna wear those.  One day my son asked me for a pair and I got the wrong size, I missed the return date and had to keep them.  Boy was I happy that I still had them when my feet had swollen up like the Pillsbury Dough Boy and these were the only thing that would fit.  They are SUPER comfortable.  The swelling in my feet have gone down and I've since bought a pair that fits me.  I wear them all day (I work from home) and highly recommend them.  I also had a plantar wart directly on the heel of my foot and these were almost the only shoe that was comfortable until it went away.  Buy these shoes. I was not paid to write this and have no benefit of anyone buying them.  I read all the reviews for items I buy and hope this helps someone else who is on the fence.

review_title: Get them u won‚Äôt regret it!!!!!
review_text: I love these!!! I use to bag on crocs all the time because of the looks but I bought 2 pairs one for work (these ones) and one for home (same color but with the fuzzy inside). Omg I can‚Äôt get over how comfortable they are!! I wear scrubs all day so I always feel like I‚Äôm wearing pjs but these just bring it to a whole new level!! I usually wear a 8.5 in women‚Äôs shoes so I ordered a size 8 and they fit perfectly for me! I would say with ur normal shoes if ur a half size like me and have a bit of wiggle room at ur toes then size that half size down if u are a perfect half size like no wiggle room at all at ur toes then half size upüëçüèª

I never thought I would ever own a pair but I gave in after my sister bought some. Keep in mind I made fun of her for wearing them because I didn‚Äôt understand what the hype was about. But honestly after trying hers on they where so comfortable and I just had to own a pair. I love all the colors and they are great for around the house and walking my dog, especially after a long day at work wearing my flats. Trust me if you are having second thoughts about these you need to try for yourself. The fit is great too! I‚Äôm a solid women‚Äôs  7 1/2 and I purchased a women‚Äôs size 8. My foot fits perfectly inside and they are wide so your foot feels free inside. The heel of my foot has a little room from the back of the shoe. I was worried about that but from what it seems if you‚Äôre a half size get the next size up!

I have to be honest. I've never been a fan of the way Crocs look and have never given it a chance. I added this to my dad's collection of shoes for him to pick from. He suffers from gout so I've been buying tons and tons of shoes, trying to find him the perfect pair to alleviate the pain as much as possible when he walks. I have to say, these are quite comfy. They're waterproof, super flexible, and made of great material. I won't deduct any stars for the looks since it's a subjective matter. While these are not my dad's go-to shoes, they definitely surprised me at how nice they feel. My dad fits a size 9 and the shoe itself is true to size.Value 5/5 *****. Comfort 5/5 *****. Fit 5/5 *****. My Recommendation 5/5 *****.

review_title: Crocs and Rainbow flip flops are only two summer sandals I like
review_text: Probably hands down the most amazing thing I have put on my feet. I thought at first when I saw them they were ugly. Now that I have I pair I love them yea they are not the nicest looking. That don‚Äôt matter the arch support is great much better than most flip flops. I don‚Äôt think I will ever buy another pair of rubber flip flops. These have replaced all my sandals except for rainbow flip flops.

You will not regret buying these!Bought the Khaki in my regular size 7 and they fit perfect!Had no clue that Crocs updated their shoes. There‚Äôs litto nubs on the inside of the sole that feel really nice. The bottom outside sole is also pretty slip proof.Can‚Äôt wait to rock my Crocs! It‚Äôs cole rn but they are comfy for house slippers or going out to run errands in as long as it‚Äôs not raining. It‚Äôs cold rn so I may pair with fun socks and leggings for a casual look but they def look better with shorts.Looking forward to getting more colors!!

review_title: Crocs Classis Clogs are the best for summer
review_text: I love the class Crocs clog.  My feet swell in hot, humid weather, and these are the only shoes I can tolerate.  I also walk several miles a day to and from work, and these are the best.I buy wear a size six-and-a-half, and I order the Crocs in size seven to give my feet room to swell.  In cooler weather, I wear socks; hot weather, no socks.  Also, putting the strap on the back of my heel holds them on when my feet aren‚Äôt swelling.  When they swell, I push the strap up to the top of the shoe.They provide excellent arch support.  I have very high arches and a very high instep and I am very comfortable in these shoes.The main drawback is that if it is raining and you walk into a store with smooth floors, swoosh, slip, slide.  You have to be very careful.  Usually, there is a mat to wipe your shoes at the entrance.  Use it.Also, I have a friend with MS who tells me these shoes do not provide enough lateral support, so if you are unfortunate enough to share that need, these shoes are not sufficient.  For everyone else, they are terrific, very, very comfortable.You can wash your Crocs, best to use a damp cloth, but you can put them in the sink if they get filthy.  Most of the time, an occasional swipe along the inside with damp cloth or paper towel is all you need to prevent them picking up odors.  If they start to squeak, put some vegetable oil on them overnight and then wipe them off in the morning with a paper towel.If they are too big, put them in the dryer with a damp towel for a few minutes.  If they are too small, do the same, but take them out and put them on and walk around in them to stretch them.

I bought these as an alternative to house shoes because I couldn't find any I liked the texture of on my feet.I was skeptical of these but honestly I wear them all the time around the house! They're pretty comfortable and easy to slip on.My only small complaint is that they are a little big but I was too afraid the size down would be too small, so I just stuck to these.

I ordered the 'Pepper' colored classic clog. The pepper color that was advertised in the images was this blueish blackish shade croc sort of like the navy color that is advertised but a shade lighter. The actual pepper clog is a bright red croc, but not necessarily neon red its kind of like the color of a pepper. I'm not really upset with the actual croc but more so that I didn't get the product that was advertised by the images. So I guess buyer beware and look up the colors on google images beforehand to make sure that you're getting the color you actually want. I'll add more to this review if there are any further issues down the line.

If you are in the reviews you have come to terms with looks. So are they comfortable you might ask, OF COURSE THEY ARE! Would they still be around if they weren‚Äôt?The little knobbies feel like a gentle massage with ever step. A feather lite cloud of fairies gently stimulating your feet, bringing comfort and relaxation with their sweet embrace. While a wide toe box gives ample room to stretch your sweet little piggies.Wish I had done this years ago, but alas vanity got the better of me. So get over yourself and get into these clogs baby!

I bought for my daughter because she works retail and they stand all day. The first time she wore them to work, she texted me and said her feet was comfy. I was so happy because my child is so picky and particular on everything.  She wears a 8 and that's what I bought and she said they didn't really slip off... So I think that means because she was wearing socks, she didn't feel the slipping and she said she changed from sports mode back to non-sport throughout the day. She said she mostly wore sports mode because she walks alot on her job.

review_title: First time and I fell in love
review_text: Someone recommended Crocs to me as I had a pretty recent hip replacement. At first, they felt a little weird because I never wore some, but after a couple of days of wearing them, my feet molded with the shoes making them highly comfortable. They are now my to go shoes, I thought they were going to be a little small, but no, they fit perfectly, and have enough breathing space, my feet don't feel crammed in them. I would say to actually get used to them, wear them daily for long periods of times. I love my Crocs!

review_title: My daughter loves the shoes - go figure
review_text: Despite my objections my daughter just had to have the shoes LOL to me they are super ugly but she absolutely loves them and if a teenager wants to wear them who am I to say what‚Äôs in style!? She has flat feet and is able to wear these shoes without any issues. The kids all seem to be wearing these right no despite my objections my daughter just had to have these shoes LOL to me they are super ugly but she absolutely loves them and if a teenager wants to wear them who am I to say what‚Äôs in style!? She has flat feet and is able to wear these shoes without any issues.  I‚Äôve even flip them on a few times to take the trash out and other quick things and they are pretty comfortable I must admit.

I have converted to the croc side and I am a believer.  They are so ugly!!!! But good lord they are the most comfortable shoes. Great for walking in wet grass believe it or not. I come home from work throw on my crocs and am ready to walk my dogs. They stay on your feet rather well too w.o the strap i don't know what magic it is but I love it. Even bought my boyfriend a pair and after weeks of fighting me he now wheres his even more than I wear mine. Id recommend getting a neutral color of you think they're as ugly as i do.  Draws less attention.

My hubby purchased these for his size 13 feet. They feet well and he finds them comfortable. They are worn around the house while he is doing work. We have a new construction house built by the worst builder ever. We've had a lot of things we have had to fix ourselves and these make comfy and affordable shoes to be worn while doing these house fixes. They are as described and pictured. Fit as expected. I also have a pair to wear around the house because I like to wear shoes. We both would highly recommend crocs for this purpose.

review_title: Love these -- from a croc convert
review_text: I have long been a croc hater until I bought them for my daughter a year or two ago and realized how easy and comfortable they are. Then, I bought myself a pair. I wear them everyone. I get shamed by my boyfriend, but these are extremely comfortable and super duper easy. They're easy to clean, easy to slip on, great for gardening and outdoor work because they basically don't stain or scuff. I've also noticed that since I've started wearing them around the house, I don't wake up with plantar fasciitis anymore. I'll probably buy a few more pairs so I can have some color variety.

review_title: A little smaller than my old Crocs
review_text: Although I love having a new pair of Crocs, and these look great, these are just a wee bit smaller than the same size I bought some years ago.  Those were 5/7, and so are these.I can wear them, but right this moment, sitting down, the top of my left foot is hurting.  I have had them for three days. Same size, but years apart, and the original was made is Mexico, these in Vietnam.If I didn't dread the whole RETURN issue, I would trade them in for one size larger....sigh.

If you ever have to go up a half size (especially for sandals, or fear that the back of your heel will hang), just order the next size up. I am glad that I did, as these fit my feet perfectly, with little to no room once I push my feet all the way in the shoe. I would imagine that had I ordered a size down, these would have been a horrible fit. (Normally can order down on tennis shoes and they fit fine).These were a little wide, but  I sometimes feel that's how CROCS made them to either feel/fit. I think they are the perfect outdoor shoe for rainy weather. The Lavender was an excellent color choice. I would highly recommend these shoes to anyone.

I bought these because the reviews said it helped people with their plantar fasciitis pain and I was suffering a lot every day. My daughter had raved about hers. It took me about 2 weeks to decide if they were helping. When I woke up one day and had no pain at all I realized they had worked all along but it took my body awhile to feel the effects. I think it took awhile to get used to the feeling of this type of shoe also. So far I am loving them. I also noticed that all of the cracks I had around my heels and the ball of my feet are now gone. They are completely healed in just a few weeks that I have been wearing these. I have used so many lotions etc with no success and wearing these shoes for just this short time took them away. I don‚Äôt understand how but that is an amazing bonus. for anyone that has experienced painful, cracked skin on your feet you will appreciate these. Wow is all I can say!!

I‚Äôm not one to like wearing shoes,  I always thought Crocs looked hideous.One day I had to go outside in a hurry and the quickest thing I could grab was my sons crocs.They felt so nice even a few sizes too big at the time. I started wearing his to walk the dogs and decided it was time to get me a pair. I haven‚Äôt taken them off since except to sleep! I have plantar fasciitis and have had no problem since buying these. I did buy a size up so they are loose fitting. I tried a pair of my daughters after purchase and they fit snug and perfect at my normal size of 7 1/2. I do not believe you will regret buying these.

I destroyed my ankle 3 years ago and have been living in chronic pain ever since. I've tried everything known to man. Even those super expensive shoes where they scan your foot. And yet still, pain. Working on my feet for 12+ hours a day didn't help. I came home every night a cripple. There have been days I have crawled from my car to my door. I've worn crocs every day for a solid week and it has been the first week since my accident that I have been almost pain free. I wear these suckers hard. Working 12+ hours in a hospital, on a concrete floor, running around like a chicken with its head cut off- AND THE CROCS MADE IT. I came home and cleaned my house after working a 13 hour shift because my ankle didn't hurt. I'm a believer. Thanks Crocs!

Classicly ugly, weird looking clown shoes that everyone - including me - loves to make fun of.  And yet, within five minutes of getting home for the night, I'm wearing these.They're comfortable, are well ventilated enough to let my feet air out (foot funk is truly nasty) and don't slip off as easily with the strap in back.  They're also durable, I've had this pair for 5 years and while they show some wear, they're still comfortable.  In the house.  With nobody looking.

Crocs are not going to get you noticed by the opposite sex, but they are comfortable and they last forever. Whether you are going to the grocery store, the garden, or the pool, you can't go wrong in Crocs. My kids are even asking for Crocs now, so I guess they are cool again. So, no worries if you buy them and they are not cool....just wait a while and they will come back in style. If they get dirty, hose them down. Do not leave in the sun, though, unless you need some shoes for your child's doll.

I have very wide feet so this is the perfect shoe for ultimate comfort. The cool blue color is super cute and it was discounted so I got over $11 off the original price! Perfect shoe for working on my feet all day. Probably could have gone with a size smaller because my there‚Äôs too much room in the back but it might‚Äôve been too tight in the toes that way. Overall very happy with my purchase! I know crocs get a bad rep for ‚Äúbeing ugly‚Äù but you can‚Äôt knock ‚Äòem till you try ‚Äòem

You either love or hate these types of shoes. I'm a fan of them, and they're especially useful for quick visits outside or around the pool. They're quality, and you can expect them to hold up over time as long as you're not overexerting them. In terms of comfort, it's what you'd expect, so if you have overly sensitive feet or something that requires specific support, I would look elsewhere.I recommend staying true to your size when looking for a pair.

review_title: They are lightweight, comfortable and true to size ordered.
review_text: After my Orthopaedic doctor said my professional orthotics will take a few weeks to get, I ordered these; his recommendation. Instead of wearing no shoes around house, these provide comfort & support for my flat feet, need for an arch and there‚Äôs some give when walking to help with arthritis and plantar fasciitis. Very glad I ordered these. They‚Äôre lightweight, waterproof and easy to wash. You can travel with them, wear them in the shower, hotel rooms and air your feet out in the summer months. The strap is a nice option you can use or flip up and not use. Lov‚Äôem‚Äô

review_title: Buy These To Become A Sex Symbol
review_text: Best sexual aid I have come across. Single? This is the best (legal) seduction tool on the market. Married? I can guarantee these shoes will bring passion back into your relationship. No one can resit the pure sex appeal offered by these crocs. While not using them as a pure sexual stimulant, I employ them as camp footwear (only while camping alone, for obvious reasons). Not that it will matter to anyone, but I used these throughout the Tahoe Rim Trail, and my only complaint is that my hiking poles broke while trying to fight off the many admirers.

Just bought my second pair. Have tried the cheaper brands and they don‚Äôt measure up as far as cushioning and foot grip. The cushioning is wonderful with crocs if you have foot pain. They also stay on your feet without any feeling of tightness. I‚Äôve lived in them since the pandemic started and because of heel bursitis clog style shoes like these are about the only thing I can wear.Great product particularly if you get them for $30 or less.

review_title: SO FAR VERY DURABLE FOR WHAT THEY ARE PUT THROUGH AND SUPER COMFORTABLE
review_text: A little expensive, but I guess that's what you have to pay nowadays for quality Crocs. I love them, I wear them around the farm and I have had them for about a month and they have held up nice. In fact my horse stepped on my toes today and the Crocs kept him from slicing my feet up. They are super comfortable on my feet, my mom put them on and said they felt like a massage for your feet. So, mom approved. I've used these Crocs for anything and everything, doing hay, working with animals, mucking out stalls, lots of moving around and they still look great. Highly recommended so far.

review_title: Great casual clogs, but they run quite a bit bigger than normal for the size.
review_text: I had Crocs and loved them several years ago, but these newer ones seem to run quite a bit larger than I remember them, and I'm not fan of the addition of the textured area that comes in contact with the soles of my feet. Still a very good product, but beware of ordering down a size, and if you plan to go barefoot rather than wear sox you'll have to deal with a very noticeable and slightly irritating "pimpled" contact area where the soles of your feet rest.

review_title: Comfort at the cost of style.
review_text: Honestly, I never thought in a million years I would wear Crocs, let alone actually enjoy wearing them. They are actually a daily driver in my shoe repertoire. I pretty much only wear them around the house but for a house shoe, they are just too comfortable to give up. It's been around 9 months since I got them and they are holding up amazingly well. I still wear them around the house daily. One con I can give them is that you HAVE to wash them at least weekly otherwise they will absolutely reek. I'm not sure what causes it since my other shoes don't smell at all but these get ripe really easily.The shoe, in general, is bigger than what the packaging says just because they make the width a little bigger so make sure to measure your foot (there are guides out there to figure out your croc size) before you buy.

review_title: Comfy but came in a box big enough for 4 pairs.
review_text: I got these as shower clogs, and they work fine, I do find the bumps in the bed of the shoes are a little annoying right after putting them on, but the odd sensation seems to fade.I gave these five stars. but the crazy box they came in was absurd.  Seriously 1  pair of size 10 shoes in a box that was 3 to 4 times too long.When the husband brought the box in from the porch, I hadn't a clue what was in a box long enough to have housed a 4 person tent.I guess they must have been out of shoe box size containers that day.  Crazy.I wish I had taken a picture!  but alas, it was recycled before I thought about it.Bottom line the Crocs are great though.

review_title: Dorky as expected but super comfortable!
review_text: Crocs are dorky but keep your feet cool, great on wet days, very comfortable, easy to get on and off and last.Although I swore I wasn't going to buy shoes on the internet due to the hassle of getting a good fit, I did it again. Even with free returns a one hour shoe buying trip can take weeks to get the size right online due to the shipping back and forth. Why did I do it? Crocs closed all of their retail stores near us. I tried looking in the larger retailers that Croc says carry their shoes and found that they didn't!These were to replace an identical pair I've owned for 6 years. The tread was gone so it as time. I checked the reviews and the Amazon shoe sizer and decided to go 1 size smaller than my old pair which were comfortable but a little large. Not knowing whether Crocs had changed/improved the last for their shoe after a few years even getting the same model can be a guess on size. These are also comfortable but the smallest Size 11s I own. Overall I'm happy.

review_title: Don‚Äôt knock it till you try it.
review_text: Ok...:not gonna lie...I‚Äôve hated crocs for years. They aren‚Äôt exactly dress shoes nor athletic shoes. They always looked uncomfortable to me and no one could convince me otherwise. Until now. My wife had an emergency c-section and was in the hospital for weeks. My baby is in the NICU right now. I‚Äôve been walking these hard hospital floors for weeks and thought my feet were going to fall off. Enter my brother in law who brought me a pair of his crocs. At this point I was willing to try anything. They were absolutely amazing!! Not just comfortable but the arch support was amazing!!! The width is perfect so that your feet aren‚Äôt squeezed in and it‚Äôs honestly like getting a foot rub with every step!!! So yeah....I‚Äôm the proud convert and owner of crocs.  Love these things!!!

review_title: Go with your gut. If you wear a half size go with the bigger size.
review_text: This is my first pair of crocs and I really didnt know what size to buy since I have a high instep and I can wear really anything from a 8 to 9. I bought the female 8 size and they are the exact size of my foot. If you want something loose go with the size up for sure. Very happy with my purchase and I'm a believer now. These are awesome!!!!

Not sure what the "Crocs with Socks" fad is, but my tween son loves his.  Might have to rename him "Matt".  If a sink-hole opens somewhere nearby, I'm sure they'll be interviewing my kid and his smoke-show of a wife.Seriously, he's comfortable in them and wears them through all four seasons.  As long as he's happy, these are worth the buy.  Threw in some shoe charms so he can keep up with the local trend.  They're durable and easy to get on and off, so he's ready and out the door before the rest of us regular shoe wearing neanderthals.

review_title: The design is just right including many different colors but subdued enough that you don't feel like you have clown feet
review_text: These Crocs are so cute! The design is just right including many different colors but subdued enough that you don't feel like you have clown feet. The background shade of blue is a little lighter than it appears on my screen. Goes perfectly with my jeans.I highly recommend these shoes, and all Crocs for that matter. Most comfortable shoes possible for everyone, but especially if you have any arthritis in your feet or knee problems etc.Another great feature with Crocs in general is that they weigh almost nothing. This is very helpful when packing for traveling.

I have hammer toes and the previous type of Crocs I got, although more, shall we say, fashionable, hurt my toese because they didn't have enough height.  These are perfect, with sufficient height so my toes slide right in.  They are comfortable, and do not slide off.  I usually don't use the heel catch, but when I need to (outside), it helps keep them firmly on my feet.  They also seem to be long wearing: I have a much older pair that I use for yard work, and they are barely worn.

review_title: Great Shoe ( even if mom thinks they're hideous)
