review_text: I have no idea why the trend of Crocs has returned, yet my 15 year old is completely obsessed! She had her friends love Crocs and these white ones were the top item on her birthday list. We've had them since the end of June and today  continue to be in great shape even though they've been worn pretty much every day. They are sturdy and easily washable. The bottom line is I might think they are hideous, but she is thrilled with her shoes and her friends are jealous.

i wear a 10.5 shoe- ordered these in a 10 and they fit pretty boxy and loose. i left them out in the sun for a while until they had shrunk up enough to fit perfectly (shrunk in both width and length).wearing them with socks isn‚Äôt comfortable bc the material pulls your socks all over the place but they‚Äôre great barefoot- perfect for trash runs, taking the dogs out, after mountain biking- however, i could never imagine wearing them in public.

Great shoes, fit as expected. This is the second pair we've purchased, comfy, convenient (really ridiculously convenient) and great for nature walks/river days!I started using my crocs as water shoes on accident, on that day I discovered that my crocs were wildly better water shoes than my actual dedicated water shoes.Weird, but awesome. I couldn't kick them off of my feet as hard as I swam, and they did a great job protecting my whole foot in the river. Highly recommend!

I'm on my fourth pair in this style and love these Crocs. I wear them every day around the house. Three pairs I bought  a size larger and I feel like I'm not wearing shoes.  The fourth looks more dainty for travel. The inner sole features textured nubs that massage my feet. They feel fantastic, last 1-2 years of daily wear, and are easy to clean!

review_title: Wore out my old pair, new pair is stiff because they need to be broken in
review_text: The longer I wear each pair of Crocs the more comfortable they become.  I've worn many different styles and colors of Crocs, the khaki classic clog is my timeless favorite for most every season but bitterly cold.  They are ideal for every day wear around the home or town, at the pool or even for basic farm chores. Fit is always true to size but be forewarned, black tends to shrink in sunlight whereas I've never encountered this problem with other colors.

The perfect upgrade to my crummy old house slippers! I have gone through several pairs of ‚Äúmemory foam‚Äù house slippers... they never last me more than a few months before they go flat and become practically useless... no support, get dirty fast, and then they don‚Äôt wash well. These were the perfect solution. SO comfortable, easy to slip on with or without socks, easy to clean, and they actually keep my feet a bit warm! LOVE them and I get sad to take them off when I need to leave the house. I‚Äôm between a 7.5-8, average width, and the 8 fits great.

review_title: I wanted to find these classic ones because I loved to wear them around the house as indoor slippers
review_text: I couldn't find the classic ones in the stores around where I live anymore. They all have adopted the newer hard bottoms. I wanted to find these classic ones because I loved to wear them around the house as indoor slippers. Just for some context, I'm Asian, and we don't wear shoes into the house. Partially to keep the floors clean, but probably some other cultural reason that I haven't looked into yet. We have specific indoor slippers. I haven't looked too much into slippers, but I know these are good in the winter time because they can keep my feet warm and are easy to wash if they start to smell.The only problem I have with these are that it's hard to know what size to buy without trying them on, but that's just me.

My feet hurt all the time.  I bought these to walk around the house.  I have to wear shoes doing chores around the house or my feet are killing me in a few minutes.  I can't get over how comfortable these things are.  I wish I bought a pair years ago.  I got them yesterday and wore them all day cleaning the house.They fit me really well.  That makes me think they might not fit most that well.  I have very wide feet and a high arch.  I usually buy New Balance extra wide athletic shoes.

review_title: So comfortable and great arch support
review_text: Ok, I am not a fan of crocs because I‚Äôve always thought they were ugly.  I bought a pair to wear around the house because I read they have good arch support and my arches were cramping a lot. Put them on and thought, holy cow.  I get it now.  They are extremely comfortable.  They have great arch support and a large toe box to allow wiggle room.  After wearing them a few days, I decided that they are so comfortable that it outweighs the beauty factor.  LOL.  I could wear these all day, easily.

My 30-year old wife said she would never be caught dead wearing these "ugly" things... which is true: she can be caught alive wearing them now. After her ankle injury, even her "Zen" activities (cooking and laundry, no joke: she forbids me from taking them from her) would became agonizing after ten minutes of standing on bare feet. But these squishy shoes have brought her renewed hope that life moving forward isn't going to be chronic pain on her feet.

review_title: Made for very wide feet. Great for CHP
review_text: I love these shoes. I use them as slippers around the house. I also use them in the public pool (before covid). They are so easy to slip on and off. They are made for REALLY WIDE feet. For those people with swollen feet and ankles like congestive heart failure etc THESE ARE PERFECTHowever, I have VERY NARROW feet and they are still fine for me except they fit best with socks. I wear a Womens 7.5 or a Euro 38 and I believe the size 8 was perfect

Super comfortable and lightweight. I normally wear between an 8-9, and purchased the 8 after reading the details saying they are made to be very roomy. I planned to wear them without the strap, so they were perfect. I think I would've needed a 9 if I wanted to wear them comfortably with the strap or thick socks. Sadly, my cats got ahold of them a couple hours after they got delivered üò≠ so I won't get a chance to see how they feel worn in.

I've tried for years to avoid Crocs and I've finally given in. These are by far, THE BEST camp shoes (walking around your campsite for car camping OR backpacking). They're also fantastic for gardening. Lightweight and very comfortable. So happy I finally swallowed my pride and got a pair.

review_title: Exactly the size and fit!  BEWARE HALF-SIZE ADVICE!
review_text: These fit my daughter's foot perfectly. She likes to say that she has 'narrow' feet, but these fit perfectly with or without the heel band.NOTE: Amazon says to go a size down if you want a half-size fit, but the 7W/5M proved much too small for my daughter, who wears a 7.5W.  The 8 fit perfectly, though!  So one, purchase, one return (totally hassle-free), and one replacement!

I have a very old pair of Crocs that are the MOST COMFORTABLE shoe ever. In this time of Covid I wear them a lot. In fact I wear them most of the time. They were wearing out and I decided to order another pair. This new pair is fine really but nothing like the just soft enough, just firm enough old pair that I still have. I slip my feet into that old pair and my feet stop barking and start purring. They are a treasure. If my life was a nation they would be a National Treasure.So I was very sad that these new ones were not exactly like my old ones. If you didn't have my old ones to compare to you might not know what you were missing. I did not post a review at the time of purchase as I was too busy worrying about Covid and life and survival. I wonder if these are the real thing or a knock off. Again, they are fine but just not quite the same.

review_title: We are now a Crocs family!
review_text: After a lifetime of saying I'd never wear Crocs, we finally purchased them for our whole family to wear out in the back yard and while walking to the beach. These are very comfortable, and much easier for my daughter and husband to wear than flip-flops. They slip on and off easily, wash very easily, and are durable. We now have them for everyone! At first, they feel huge, but once you get used to the large toe box area, they are comfy.

Could not find classic crocs in pretty colors nor at a reasonable price locally.  Took a chance even though some reviews were pretty negative and except for getting 2 different sizes pretty minor as to the complaints.  They fit fine and I can‚Äôt come up with anything very negative beyond I couldn‚Äôt walk out of a store with them.  On the positive side, they were only $20 less than the store that only had a muddy green color so the 2 day wait was totally worth it.

review_title: Crocs with socks the new fashion trend
review_text: When I was searching on Amazon wardrobe to find Crocs or flip flops for my husband I came across these beauties.  I am one of the people that your own a pair of Crocs. My husband felt exactly the same however for some reason I was able to convince him that these would be perfect for him. I mean heck Deadpool wears them so surely he must know that they're comfortable.ever since I've got these for him he has for gone his flip-flops and he also likes and where's these crocks almost every single day. Much to my mortification occasionally he put socks on with the Crocs.

This was my first purchase of Crocs and might I say I'm hooked! They fit perfectly. I have a narrow/wide foot which makes it almost impossible to wear slip on shoes, these fit perfectly! I'm never going back to flip flops! Hope these images help!

review_title: I have these in blue too
review_text: I love these shoes.  I have bought them before and they last forever. I like them because they are easy to put on and easy to take off. I buy size 6 because I have that size already and they are a bit big but still work. I can't find the other dark blue one but I am sure it will turn up soon. These tan ones will go great with all of my clothes through out the year and while the color is not the brightest, it is the color which I prefer. Don't want the fish to see me now do I?

I grew up in the front range in CO, where these originated, and remember seeing their kiosks in all the local malls. I bought a pair for my garden center job and really liked them, but ultimately sold them because FASHION! Now I'm older, live in the mountains and needed a pair of shoes that i could hose off and bought a pair of Crocs! They're still comfortable, still not my style, but they certainly are functional.

review_title: It really irks me when my sister is right... LOL
review_text: Living out in the country I needed a pair of shoes to keep by the door that were easy to slip on and off. My sister has sworn by her Crocs for years. I finally broke down and decided to give them a try. They‚Äôre perfect to wear outside to fill bird feeders, hike out to the barn, take out the trash etc.  The heel strap on the back is a great feature and ensures that you do not pop out of them accidentally.

I brought these crocs for my grand-daughter for her 14th birthday.  I ordered them "kinda" last minute but they arrived exactly on her birthday (yayyyy!). She loves everything about them (because she LOVES crocs).  But, I was slightly disappointed (just a lil') because of the color. I thought they were a brighter red but they are not as bright as I imagined.  But, I could have clicked on the wrong shade of red.

I have held an anti-Croc position with much color and fanfare, for years now. Making fun of them and the wearer whenever I could. Then I finally got a pair two weeks ago. And not just any pair, bright yellow. If I'm gonna hate on Croc's why not do it loudly. I just so happened to be on vacation last week, which required 10+ miles of walking per day. I wore them like my life depended on it. And alas, I find myself begrudgingly a fan. They are really well designed, so simple, but so effective. Everywhere slippers, and when I say everywhere, that includes lobster boats, scaling the rough coastline of Maine, walking endless long dirt roads, outdoor showers on the beach. I am a Croc convert, but now make fun of myself.

I had a pair which I got over a decade ago. Until recently I had kept them by the door for quick trips outside. Then I got planter fasciitis, and they became my everyday shoe. This replacement is not as soft and comfortable. Maybe it is because the older shoe was of aged material, is was softer. I wish they were still wearable. These replacements are still better than any other option though.
I love these shoes!! It‚Äôs like walking on clouds. The only thing I‚Äôd change is getting a larger size. They fit perfectly, for me personally I‚Äôd like a little wiggle room.

These Crocs are softer than I imagined, fit a bit wider than I was hoping for, and the arch support is not there for me, but I have high arches.However,  They are amazing in comfort!  Personally this is not something I would want to wear on a day with a lot of walking, but I may try a 1/2 size smaller (if they make them that way).I am normally a 6 in everything so I bought a 6.they are too wide for my feet and I cannot walk in them without the heel strap or my feet come out of them.with the strap they're great.I have told others to try them for their amazing comfort.I just need to find the right size for my feet.I wear these every day since I got them so they're not so big I cannot use them.I definitely recommend these to family and friends.

review_title: The comfortable hot girl summer shoe üíÄ.
review_text: Listen, this is a comfortable hot girl summer at its finest. It is way too hot to be out here in sneakers, so slides and crocs it is. Depending on what color you choose, you can get them to match with anything, or just get two pairs. I loved them so much that I'm going to get another pair.My only thing with these is that I'm a half size. My feet are a size 9.5 (ik the small feet girls are scared rn). The size 9 don't fit me, but the size 10 are a slight bit big for me. It's not like they're dramatically big, just more wiggle room than expected. But who cares, they're cute! Go get some, sis.

review_title: Crocs are nearly perfect for me
review_text: I've been wearing Crocs for over 12 years now and they don't cost much, easy to clean up, durable, comfy to wear and lasts a long, long time!! Size is "as expected" I get their basic or classic clogs and flip the strap up so I can just slide them on/off my feet & wear them nearly everywhere. They may look dorky, but they are about the most comfortable shoes I have ever worn in my life....so far!! 5 stars!!

I finally bought my teenage daughter some crocs of her own. I‚Äôve worn them as slippers for years. They were recommended from a podiatrist for my plantar fasciitis. Now She doesn‚Äôt have to steal mine to walk her dog. I never thought she would even like them, but she loves them! They‚Äôre easy to slip on over her slipper socks and they‚Äôre a cute fun color!

review_title: Great Product with Great Customer Service
review_text: The customer support was great! I originally purchased a size too small, and they sent me the correct size a day later. I was blown away at how quickly the replacement came. The sizes are true to form. I was originally worried that the next size up would be way too big, but it fits great. The ankle strap works great for this. So far the shoes are real comfortable, and I'm very excited about wearing them in the future.

Our podiatrist recommended Crocs for our 94 year old father who needed more padding for his heels as well as a shoe that would be easy on his bunions. I was a bit hesitant thinking the popular slip on would fit too loosely and that my father would have a difficult time adjusting to this style and fit. I was wrong! Crocs are easy to slip on and off.  He‚Äôs using the heel strap and they fit perfectly. He‚Äôs the coolest great granddad and now has us wanting a new pair!

I've had a couple pair of Crocs.  Previous pair was a little big and sloppy.  I ordered the next size smaller and these are a bit too tight.  I could slip on the larger ones without touching them and they'd stay on most of the time with the strap slipping into place.  The smaller ones require a quick finger to pull the strap and then they're a little too tight at the toes.  I wish they made half sizes, but I just fall between that jump in size.  Otherwise, they're good as a slipper and a deck shoe.  They require no care and last a long time.

I work in aquatics. I'm around pools all the time and pool decks are hard - tile on concrete or concrete. These shoes save my knees. Others must like them as deck shoes too because I see black ones all the time (I've owned 2 pair in black), but I get tired of almost putting on someone else's shoes! So, Yellow it is. I can find them easily among all the other "men's deck shoes" and their fun! In my job I work with a lot of kids, and they really like them too.

I had to go through three rounds of purchases before I got the right shoe. The first time was my fault, my boyfriend wears a 10.5 so I sized up to an 11 and that ended up being too big. So I exchanged them for a smaller size (a 10). Instead, I was given a fur lined croc (I had bought the original croc) and it was a different color. So I had to send those back and order yet another pair of crocs. They came and were the right size, color, and style. Just the same as you would buy in the store.

I remember a friend of mine hopped onboard with these YEARS back and I completely made fun of him constantly because thats what friends do. After a few years and tons of thousands of people were wearing these things everywhere I figured they had to be good or just crazy hype. I had to try em so I grabbed a pair and I have to say they're very sturdy, comfortable, and theres better arch support vs a pair of slides. Its pretty much like boots combined with sandals? Anyways yeah I like them.

review_title: Short in the toe but Oh So fun
review_text: Crocs are crocs, right? I finally, after years, sprung for a pair of classic crocs. I am spending time on the farm, and these are great for gardening, checking on the horses & chickens etc. so easy to clean. And in this incessant rain (thanks Harvey) I need a waterproof shoe. Size wise.... I wish  they had half sizes. I wear 8.5, but ordered 8 as suggested. Maybe I have weird toes (I admit to have broken 2). Although the toe box is roomy, my 4th and 5th toes feel uncomfortably squished. I hope that, with time, the Crocs will mold to my feet. A size up is not an option, they would be floating on me. In short: I love the color (pepper, not too red but defnitely cheery!) and the functionality.

My mother took a bad fall on cement as she was walking with slippers/flip flops.  The flip flops folded under at the top which made her trip.  My sister bought her a pair of crocs which she uses in the house, so I bought her this pair for use outside.  She is pleased with the fit, and the color, and I'm happy that she's more secure walking...no more tripping with floppy flip flops.

review_title: Light and Comfy. Do Not Leave out in the Sun!
review_text: These a very light, which was unexpected. I thought they would be like the old, heavy, rubber ones, but these seem to be silicone-based and are pleasantly light, bendable and comfortable. They are good for letting the errant water flow through during gardening, but of course, the open side holes also allow lots of dirt to get in, which is not as easy to get out without taking them off. That said, how hard is it to take them off? They do what they are supposed to.A word to the wise: Do not leave your Crocs out in the sun. They will shrink. These are a replacement for a men's size 9 that shrank to a women's size 7 after being in the hot sun all day. No amount of internet home remedies would fix it.

I love these shoes so much!!! Only reason I‚Äôm giving them 4 stars is because they didn‚Äôt come in an authentic crocs box they came in a plastic bag which was really disappointing. I have all my shoes organized in their original box so other than that great buy. *All charms were purchased on amazon separately* but they do make the shoes extra funky and stylish. I highly recommend üëçüèΩ

review_title: I don't care if you think they're ugly
review_text: Crocs can be life changing. They're amazing on airplanes when your feet swell on long flights. They're ridiculously comfortable. They have great arch support.  Sometimes after wearing regular shoes for a few days straight, I get really bad arch pain.  Wearing these for a day or two fixes me right up. Love them.  Note that the arch support wears out a little faster than the shoe itself, so since I wear these around the office every day, I replace them about every 4 months.

It's true to size I am a woman's size 10 and it fit perfectly. I got the light blue color and it is exactly as pictured. I think the little bumps will wear down with time. I know these are ugly shoes but they are perfect for wearing poolside and in the lake in upstate New York where we have zebra mussels. these are literally my go-to outside shoe in the summer and I'm happy I finally have a pair of my own I used to steal my husband's all the time.

Was concerned that the crocs wouldn't support my feet well enough since I have bilateral plantar fasciitis. been wearing them for about a week and so far they offer ok support for both feet. Super light crocs, well made and worth the cost.  Wouldn't buy them for yeeeeeeaars because the shoes are butt-ugly...but now that I'm older and I don't care anymore, I'm glad I went ahead and bought them.

review_title: The ultimate shoe for changing terrains!
review_text: Bought these amphibious assault shoes to craft a raft on the shore of a river out of old, downed logs. These bad boys kept my feet safe from rocks, spiders, bamboo (which would normally puncture straight through soft flesh), and broken glass. Crocs are top notch when it comes to aquatic adventuring. I highly recommend them. Not for their looks, as they're no prize pony, but for their extreme utility.

I love Crocs, and now that they're "in fashion," I've been buying them for all my nieces when I find their fav colors at a good price. I had to watch these ones for a little while, but I managed to get them at the right time, because an extra $11 was taken off at checkout!! Literally the cheapest I've ever gotten brand new, authentic Crocs, and I get to keep my "Coolest Aunt Ever" standing with my 13yr old niece because she was so stoked on'm!

review_title: My friends can make fun all they want.
review_text: This is my first pair of crocs. I always thought they were kinda ugly (I mean, let‚Äôs be real, right?!?) But I‚Äôm redoing an old building and my feet were hurting all the time and I kept stealing my son‚Äôs crocs at home. He suggested I get my own size 8‚Äôs instead of wearing his 12‚Äôs. So I swallowed my pride and got me some crocs.OMG I sleep in them. They have become my work shoes- I paint in them, climb on the roof with them, garden in them, and cook in them. Why have I just now discovered Crocs?!?My friends make endless fun of me. They send me croc memes. I don‚Äôt why they are so tickled at my crocs, but they don‚Äôt know what they are missing. One day they‚Äôll wish they were like me, and had their own.

review_title: LOVE THEM SO MUCH but slightly big
review_text: I literally LOVE crocs so much. I bought a grey pair last month and having looked back since. They are slightly wider and larger than the normal shoe but it‚Äôll be great for the winter and thick socks. You do have to get used to the little beads on the bottom of the croc but honestly soooooo comfortable. Btw sport mode all the way. Get yourself a pair and be ready for the judging comments. Don‚Äôt worry, it‚Äôll be worth it.

I wear these around the house b/c I have high arches and am not supposed to go barefoot very much. They don't have much arch support, so I added felt arch cookies and now they provide better support. They're a little loose but I like that, since I'm using them as house slippers.

I normally wear size 8.5. Usually when I get footware such as this they only come in whole sizes, so I have to choose between 8 and 9 (US). My experience has told me to go with the 8 (flip flops, muck boots, etc). It held true for these, I ordered the size 8 and fit is just what I wanted. Overall love the design, there is a bit of arch support which I want, very comfortable. I wear these as "house slippers" all the time I'm in the house, I live on a farm and wear boots most of the time outside, so out in the garage I leave these while stepping into my boots, and vice versa. I probably wouldn't wear these out anywhere, but you certainly could. I don't use the straps, just leave them in the out of the way position, forward, but if I did wear them any place but in the house I'd probably engage those straps.

I had a pair of Crocs as a kid, but never got another pair once I grew out of them. Like so many, I fell into the "Crocs are the worst" mindset (where it's fashionable to hate them). Having a two year old, I was looking for a pair of slip on shoes that were more comfortable than flip flops. After hours of searching, I remembered my childhood Crocs and decided to give them a chance and I'm SO glad I did. I don't even care that they look a little silly (but really not bad!) because they're so stinkin comfortable. Now I can slip them on to play outside with my daughter, run to the store, or play in the lake. They're awesome!

I work as a volunteer with puppies, with a hygiene routine that requires me to change footwear inside and outside their pens. These are perfect for the job, being (very) lightweight, easy to disinfect and slip on and off. The back strap is useful to give added security if needed. I am an 8 1/2 (US), 39 Eur or 6.5 UK and I bought a size 9. They are easy to wear and keep on, particularly with socks, and I'm not swimming in them, as I had feared I might be. Buy up, not down, if you are a half size like me.

review_title: Not What They're "Croc"d up to be.
review_text: Purchased for husband who wears a 12 extra wide. First pair I ordered were 13 because some said they were on the small narrow side. Whoops! Way too long and too wide! Next were size 12, and again no winner. Too long and too wide. Third time,(size 11), they fit! He says they are comfortable and not too long or wide, but he needs the heel strap for best fit. So... 4.5 stars for fit,(finally), and 1 star for too many trips to UPS to return. PS. All 3 pair are made in Mexico. So much for jobs for Americans! Really should deduct a star for that.

I purchased these crocs in September 2020.  Just started wearing them today.  I assumed they would fit like the last pair I purchased because they are the same size.  I found this pair to be a little shorter ad not as wide.  I noticed this pair was made in China where as the last pair was made in Mexico.  Disappointed that this pair doesn't fit as nice ad the last pair.

If your favorite color is green then you will love this shoe and even if it‚Äôs not you will still love it ! The green is much prettier in person. It‚Äôs like a jade/emerald green. As far as sizes go I always order a 9 but Crocs do stretch after you wear them for a while so now the shoe is more roomy! I would still recommend buying your regular size ! Because when you wear socks it will feel snug NOT tight.

review_title: Great for gardening & around the house
review_text: I have worn these since I got my first pair for 50¬¢ at a garage sale! The price on Amazon was not quite that good, but it was on the low side. I did have to return mine though because my size was not available in my desired color of khaki. Zappos had them (free shipping and free returns). As always, Amazon is my first choice, but even having to pay $6 more on Zappos.com I got the color I needed. Crocs sizing can be confusing: the bottom of each shoe list two sizes:  M (men) W (women). So when looking for your size, look for your gender size. The shoes should fit roomy at the toe and at the heal - do not let them rub anywhere (as advised by crocs). You will get used to the loose fit after a while - or just use the back strap for more stability. I ordered M 8/ W6 and it was to small (short: toe & heal touched ends) My normal shoe size is women's 8 and on rare occasion 8 1/2. My foot is narrow to med. width. The size I needed from crocs was M7/W9 (so the women's 8 was too small/short). Amazon showed my size of US7/9 (way down at the bottom of the scroll down drop-list), but did not have my color available. Thought I'd take a chance (to save $6) and try women's 8. Zappos, like Amazon, delivered quickly and the shoes in the proper size 7/9 fit!

I work at home during this Covid and I wear these Crocs 12 hours per day with or without socks... They are so comfortable it's like wearing nothing. It protects me from our cold marble floors. My feet never sweat in them. This is my second pair after 3 years and I just love them. For $30 it's the best way to pamper my feet. The old ones I use to go outside and they have the same comfort level, except a different color

review_title: Cool but these spikes on the insole are a bit annoying
review_text: I love everything about this product except for those little spikes inside. I thought Crocs were supposed to be smooth on the inside or something? Everything else is spot on. That's why I can only give 4 stars. I usually wear a size 8.5 men so I ordered an 8 and they fit perfectly! Everything else is great though. I knowwwww theses are going to bed a great investment for my knees and the little spikes inside will wear down eventually.

review_title: So comfortable! Use as house shoes while pregnant
review_text: These are my favorite house shoes in the world! I‚Äôm 22 weeks pregnant and started to get some serious back pain as well as achey feet. My heals would kill me at the end of the day just walking around my house since we have wood floors and tile plus our carpeted areas do not have really good padding underneath. I got these and they helped me tremendously. Sure they‚Äôre not the most appealing or fashionable.. but I still think they‚Äôre cute. The color is nice and it actually has like a pearly finish to them. LOOOVE THESE shoes!

I returned the first pair of Crocs (unisex) that I purchased because they were ginormous. They were not only large but very wide. That said, they felt good on the sole of my arthritic feet. I went on-line again & search for a pair that was described as "women's" because other reviewers stated there was a definite difference in the width, ie, women's were narrower. Not so. These are just as wide. I normally wear Danskos so I'm accustomed to a shoe that fits loosely but I feel I could almost get both feet in one Croc.If you have wide feet, order the B(M)--Do NOT size up. These are really comfy but they are so wide I'm hesitant to wear them out & about.

review_title: Always will have them and more than one
review_text: I love crocs. Have owned many, many pairs for years. And tread lasts years. I went by the chart and ordered the size it told me to, but it seemed to run larger and loose. So it's a shoe you need to first find the right size and go for it. Great slip on shoe for those of us who like to be bare footed but terrain doesn't protect the sole of your foot. Example: rocks...

I was buying crocs for my grandkids along with the charms, so wanted a pair for myself.  These are the perfect background for the charms.  They are a fun shoe and perfect for summer, to just kick around in.  With Crocs, you always know what you are getting.  Perfect.

review_title: Never thought I'd say this, quarantine has changed me, I actually love them!
review_text: I love these, super easy and comfy. Perfect to throw on in the morning and water my plants. The little bumps on the sole are "massaging" (but wearing too long can kind of hurt a bit). Great price too compared to other outlets. I am normally 9-9.5 but tried my 10 year old son's (which converted to a 7) and that fit, so I opted for an 8 which is actually perfect, so maybe go down a size. Can't walk super far, tried wearing these out and had sore feet for a couple days, maybe not used to them though. Otherwise definitely glad this quarantine let me to trying them!

review_title: I'm now a croc fan for LIFE
review_text: I've had so many foot issues, including persistent bursitis in my toes and now plantar fasciitis from wearing birkenstocks 24/7 (to help with the bursitis). As soon as I put these things on, I finally found shoes that don't hurt my feet, I LOVE THEM. My wife tried them on that night and immediately ordered them for herself in tye dye. I swear, I'm so mad at myself for resisting crocs all this time. That was dumb.

Having kids, my feet have changed a bit so sizes don't really match up all the time. These fit perfect! When the straps are in the upper position, its a little loose but I don't mind it. Doesn't make my feet super sweaty and way more comfortable than a different style of Crocs I have. I wear these all the time now, around the house and outside.

review_title: Went from avoiding ever sporting to loving them.
review_text: We needed a good tough camp/shower shoe. What we got was a great shower shoe and they are so cutie that they look great as a summer shoe matching them to my outfits. My feet feel protected and they are very comfortable. I got the tie die ones for my son also and now he wares them all the time. Much lighter then I thought they would be. They stay on my feet really well even without the strap. Very happy. I would order more colors in the future.

review_title: I think they seem fairly well-made and hold up well; but the recipient has mixed feelings about them
review_text: Technically, these were a gift to someone else.  He likes the convenience of a quick slip-on, and likes that they are more stable and supportive than any of the verious "flip-flop" type slip-ons, but he doesn't like that he "can't" wear them with socks ((says the socks catch on all of the openings)), and that therefore, his feet sweat.That being said, from *my* point of view:the previous pair held up to a good bit of wear-and-tear.  And the covered toe keeps them from catching is things ((which is always *my* problem with flip-flops - the toes catch and I trip)).  The back-strap is optional, but there if one needs it.  They cushion well.  They also fit his EEEE-width feet.

I am a Croc lover.  I don't wear anything else.  I bought these for my husband because he wanted to try them.  He has very bad feet and he said they are very comfortable.  He likes that you can wear them in the river to protect against rocks and then just leave them on and wear them all day.  He says they ain't the prettiest shoes he's ever seen but they do what he needs them to do.

Cheapest pair I could find on Amazon for a first time purchase of Crocs, I got the brown pair. They were made in China, I dont know if that makes a difference to anyone but I've noticed small difference in my pair from other friends Crocs that were made in Mexico or Vietnam. But overall I'm super happy with my purchase, they came a day faster than expected and I've worn them about everyday since recieving them.

review_title: Money well spent for durable comfort that will last and last.
review_text: The classic Crocs shoe....excellent in all areas of fitment, quality and comfort. Size is dead on and that Crocs cushiony support feels like walking on clouds! Perfect for walking your favorite store (wearing your mask, gloves, gown and GPS 6ft distance alarm) or the beach! Built from the same durable material we've come to trust from Crocs...invest in foot comfort and buy these classic Crocs. It's money well spent.

This was for my teenage daughter. It‚Äôs all the thing for girl wrestlers to wear crocs or slides when not wearing their wrestling shoes. My daughter loves these. Very light and clean looking. We went to a shoe store where she tried on for size but they didn‚Äôt have the color she wanted. This was cheaper than any other store listed online including croc store. We also purchased some jibbitz which fit in the holes of the crocs for added decoration.

This is my first time ever getting/wearing crcos and I am hooked. I have high arches so I was worried about standing all day in these since my fit get sore a little more easily. I am so glad I took the chance though, there isn't a whole lot of arch support, but the way the crocs absorb your steps makes them so great! I have little to no foot pain after 8 hours of standing. Also, the color is beautiful (I got the sky blue).

You‚Äôre not the ultimate dad until you own Crocs and/or White New Balance Sneakers.Since my family already thinks my husband is the ultimate dad, this year for Father‚Äôs Day I decided to get him the Ultimate Dad Shoe - Crocs!I purchased his normal shoe size (Men‚Äôs 10), and I had to exchange them twice. Ultimately, he needed a size 8 for them to fit. That would be a Men‚Äôs 8, Women‚Äôs 10

review_title: Perfect fit - but actual color is different than described
review_text: I bought the "chocolate" Crocs size 12 for my boyfriend because he desperately needed a new pair lol (I know they're described as women's Crocs in the title but they're really gender neutral). The fit was perfect, he absolutely loved everything about them and really enjoyed the feeling of new Crocs compared to the 10 years old pair he had where there was no texture to them anymore lol. Only thing I think people should know is the color is definitely NOT chocolate, they are more of a slate grey color. I mean honestly I prefer the color they came as rather than a chocolate brown color, but just know they definitely aren't brown. Still perfect though!

review_title: True to size. Good for wide feet.
review_text: Obsessed. These are amazing. I have a wide food and high artch, these are amazing. My aunt uses hers as house shoes. I use mine for any water outings. Especially great for want butts like me who are afraid of stepping on anything in the lake or ocean. Haha.Huge fan of the range of color choices!I got a size 11 woman‚Äôs in purple. They are VERY Comfortable. Huge fan!

Well they are crocs. They fit well. Are comfortable as they shod be. Have been buying crocs since they came out years ago. The price is more- but so is everything else ! Will continue to buy the original crocs - they last for ever. Would have given 5 stars is the red was really red.  It is more rose than red. SO if you like the colour rose these are for you....

I never expected to love crocs or even own a pair. After slipping into my son's beloved crocks to run out to the back yard, I was hooked. I ordered a gray pair and am very pleased with how they fit. Comfortable and functional, especially for fishing and yard work. I've also converted my mom to a croc enthusiast. She was on the fence about getting a pair, even after my dad and I told her how great they were. I surprised her on Mother's Day with a pair of her own. She was very happy with them.

I think these things even float! These are hands down one of the most if not the most comfortable shoe I've ever worn. No outgassing from the materials used, thankfully the company seems to be making them in a safe way with good materials (don't stop!). I no longer care if I'm teased, I love wearing crocs. Any time I do, my feet thank me for it. So let's make them hip as we de-stress & dance all day.

Finding shoes that are comfortable for me has always been a total disaster due to my feet condition I was born with. My feet are wide and my Achilles tendons are not as long as they are supposed to be. My room mate suggested these crocs and while I admit I was a bit skeptical, I bought them anyways and they are literally the most comfortable thing I've ever worn. I wear them pretty much 24/7. I love them.

These badbois are what dreams are made of. Like walking in a gardenhose-green cloud all day.Great for kickin' round the yard or garden or simply engage 4WD and take them on rougher terrain.Love them with socks as house slippers, and after a long day of adventuring to soothe yo' barkin' dogs.You won't regret these.If you got sweaty feat... maybe not for you though.

These are the old original Crocs they've been selling for many years now. It was about 4-5years ago when they started making some newer Crocs with a newer type of plastic, I've bought a few pairs of those and they've all had problems with shrinking, which eventually causes them to rub and blister your foot in different places, to be expected when you buy shoes that fit, which then proceed to shrink! Don't know why they sell those ones, the material is clearly defective imo. These originals might wear out a little quicker but they're comfortable and don't shrink.

I got three different crocs. I am usually a size 7 but I got an 8 based off of the reviews saying it comes small. I got one for myself in a size 8 and it was roomy which I like. Especially if you plan on wearing socks. I got a size 7 for a relative of mine and when I compared it with my size 8 it was extremely small! So I would recommend getting a size up. Maybe it was defected but I would rather be safe than sorry. /:

I bought the Croc brand because I know they are good quality footwear. The burgundy pair we received look great. My wife says they fit perfect..not to wide..not to long..and the size is correct for the size she wears. It's hard to actually review these. She loves them and says they are very comfortable on her feet. If she wants another pair of a different color we'd order a pair of Croc's again.

I love these! When I first got them I was concerned because I thought they were too big, but found out crocs are supposed to be bigger on you! What a relief. They are so cute (I got the pink ones) and I've gotten compliments about them many times already. They are so comfortable and easy to slip on really quick. I've been wearing them every day nonstop because I LOVE them. I plan on getting more colors later on. Comfy, and cute! Totally worth it. And my package literally came the very next day after I ordered them. Super quick.

I originally purchased these for my girlfriend for Christmas. We use Crocs to go kayaking in since they're rubber and clearly don't hold water. The only downside to using these for something like kayaking is that when the surface you're stepping on is slick, don't expect Crocs to have a firm grip - they'll make you slip easily (only downside but not enough to give 4/5 stars). We also wear crocs to go out in the spring time when the yard is just mud. That way, we can just hose the crocs off and our feet off before we go back in the house.I ordered the size shoe she usually wears and it fits her perfect without any issues. We wear these around and they are very comfortable for hours. They may not be the most fashionable shoes, but they sure are comfy.

I bought these because I have a broken leg and I needed shoes that were easy to put on and take off.  These fit the bill!  I bought two pairs:  one for indoors and one for outdoors.  They are comfortable, provide good support, and provide good traction.  I wear them with and without socks.For years, I hated Crocs because I thought they were a fad.  Now I'm a convert.

No joke... I‚Äôm a first time croc buyer here, and they are so awesome!!! I broke my foot 4 months ago and had surgery and a screw put in, and once I was out of the boot I tried FOUR different styles and brands of tennis shoes, and immediately after putting them on I felt pain on the outer edge where I had surgery on my foot. Excruciating pain most of the time... I decided to try these and NO pain at all!!! I never thought I‚Äôd like crocs but I am so grateful for them now. To be able to comfortably walk is so amazing! Buy these if you have pain in your feet!! The only downside is that there aren‚Äôt 1/2 sizes..

review_title: First purchase of crocs, didn‚Äôt disappoint!
review_text: Love the color! I was scared to order crics without trying them on first and honestly I am glad I made the choice of buying them! They fit good and are comfy too. My first pair of crocs and I love them! I got my husband a pair in a different style (realtree camo) and he likes them too. He says they are comfy and fit nicely. The little bumps in the shoes freaked me out but it‚Äôs meant for grip when you‚Äôre feet are wet or even sweaty lol. I definitely recommend!

A few years ago I purchased a knock off type clog croc for working in the yard.  it lasted many years and I needed to replace it.  I decided to buy the real thing this time.  It didn't disappoint.  So comfortable.  I wear them as slippers because I can go outside without having to change shoes.  Usually I wear a 7 1/2 shoe so I bought size 8 and they are perfect.

review_title: Great arch support for such light footwear
review_text: I only wear them around the house or yard.  I would never subject them to hardcore walking about town.I like the convenience and the arch support.I love the lightness of the Croc while wearing them, but putting them on hands-free (I'm old) is frustrating - the shoe keeps sliding forward.  I have to find a solid object (wall, stair tread, post, etc.) to stop the shoe from sliding.Trying to 'slip into' them with socks on is double-hard, since the socks snag on the little dimples, which makes the shoe slide forward that much easier.

I absolutely LOVE the Crocs classic.  They are basically all I wear, whether I'm at work, going to a wedding (YES), gardening, at the beach, I mean:  once you go Crocs, you never go back!!!I have a C width foot, which is just a tad wider than what the shoe industry considers "normal" (namely a B), yet really it is right in the middle of the width spectrum.  I love that the Crocs Classics are the perfect width for me.  I love how much cushioning is between the sole of your foot and the sidewalk or whatever you are walking on.  I love that, years ago, they cured my plantar fascitis or whatever it was that caused my feet so much pain for so long--GONE, once I started wearing Crocs Classics (which were then called Crocs Caymens, but I digress--same shoe).  I love how long they last.  They are my favorite shoe on this or any other planet.

These are the most comfortable shoes you could buy! I read mixed reviews about them and was a little worried about how they would fit considering I stuck to my actual size and didn‚Äôt go up/down a size. I‚Äôm a size 8w and ordered just that and they fit me perfectly!!! I also read how some people received fake ones but the ones I got are the real deal. I compared them to my friends crocs and lucky me, I received the real ones. As soon as I got them I wore them out to the store and the arch support is perfect for me because I have flat feet and wear arch supporters in my sneakers anyway. The fact they have arch support makes them 10/10!  I definitely see myself ordering more and more!! If you‚Äôre thinking about getting these, just do it! You will not regret it I promise you.

review_title: These Shrink considerably if left in strong sunlight; buy 1-2 sizes larger.
review_text: Mostly I wanted to note to others that if left or worn a lot in the sunlight, THESE WILL SHRINK CONSIDERABLY.I first bought 14's,  but at season's end, they were too small for me to wear.I bought these 16's and at the end of this hot Summer, they are just about right for me.One of my feet is a 15, the other a 14.Takes some time for these to shrink, so you'll have to suffer through some floppiness, or wear thick socks until the shrink to fit.

We all know Crocs are silly. I bought these sort of on a whim as a joke. But now that I work from home a lot, I wear them every day. Good indoor shoes, good outdoor shoes. And they are very comfortable. I don't wear them out in public, but I have a feeling one day I'll stop caring what people think and just go for it. When they wear out, I'll probably buy some more.

review_title: People will make fun of you
review_text: Let's be honest, you have to have some kind of sense of humor rocking these shoes. The main thing, these are the most comfortable shoes ever and can I mention safe?! I was hanging at the river and one of my gal pals was really giving me a hard time about wearing crocs, meanwhile she blew out her old navy flip flop and rocked her face on some ground and all I had to say was how sturdy and waterproof these crocs were on my feet as I blew past her for another beer.

review_title: I'd no idea how important it was to have these.
review_text: One of my sons had a neat pair of some inexpensive rubbery shoes and I asked him to get me a pair. Dissatisfied with them I bought myself some Crocs instead. Thinking I'd have them by the front door to slip on when I got the mail or took out the trash, which usually mean walking out in the rain, and the Crocs were a decent no slip foot gear. But I'd no idea that I'd suddenly be hit by major emergency surgery and couldn't bend, and my feet swelled up! The Crocs were very important, heck, are still important in getting to my medical appointments during recovery!

My wife has had a pair of crocs for 10 years and I never considered joining her.  I have never liked sandals.  I like flip flips even less.  Crocs looked uncomfortable to me.  I finally gave in because I needed something on my feet that could get wet.  Boy was I surprised at how comfortable these things are.  What looks like hard plastic is unexpected cushion.  Pressure washing, cleaning pool filters, or just taking out the trash is easy and I'm not worried about the mess.  I should have bough a pair of these a long time ago.

review_title: Lightweight, Comfortable, Runs About Half Size Small
review_text: I ordered these to use on my deck, filling bird feeders, etc.  They are perfect for this purpose.  Easily washed, and super lightweight.  If you think you will have a decent walking shoe, not so much.  There is just about no support whatsoever, but I didn't expect it.  I normally wear a 7 to a 7 and a half in women's, and I guess right in ordering an 8.  These are made in China, and so run smaller.  Order carefully!

Love crocks!  Everyone in my whole family wears them but you must buy a smaller size.  If you are a 1/2 size then order a size down for sure.  My boyfriend is size 10 1/2 and we got him a 9.  I am a 6 1/2 and a 6 works for me.  If you are ordering on prime then perhaps get 2 sizes and return one of them.  Other than the size being large, these are great shoes for lounging.

I know this fad is probably already over, but I just decided to finally buy a pair in anticipation of a cruise. I'm not crazy about the texture that you put your feet on (a little spiky), but I got used to it. I am picky about my footwear, and there are few things I can wear without the soles of my feet hurting. These things are SO comfortable! They are super lightweight and seriously the only footwear I needed for the entire week on the cruise. I wore them in the room, walking around the ship, walking around ports, to the beach, to the pool, and even to dinner. The last is maybe not recommended, but you can definitely get away with it. :) I even tried to continue wearing them once I got back to the Minnesota snow (although that did not work out so well). I like the black color because they blend in a little bit more than the brighter colors. They do get crease marks on the top of them, but there's not really a way to prevent that. You might lose a few style points, but they are so comfortable you will not even care!

review_title: Love y‚Äôall s delivery and product‚Äôs  through.  I had a couple of problems I hope you check it out
review_text: Like we shall see if if they fit. But, please follow where to put them we live on a very busy road and could be taken if there not put in the right area. Thank you very much and have a great Christmas Day!üéÅü§∂üéÖüèªüôè Mr. and  Mrs. Woodward Love y‚Äôall s delivery and product‚Äôs  through the year.  I had a couple of problems I hope you check it out because one hair product was not in the bag thanks for caring.

I am a shoe size 8. I bought a size 8 and it fit my foot exactly. I returned them and bought a size 9 instead because I wanted to have a little extra room in my Crocs. I will be wearing them doing work in the garage and in the yard. I like shoes like that to fit a little bigger. Keep that in mind when ordering if you like your shoes to be slightly bigger.

review_title: Size up, fits differently than the average crocs.
review_text: Overall a really great and sturdy product. I noticed that these crocs were a tad smaller than the ones I‚Äôve actually purchased in the crocs store. I don‚Äôt know why I felt this way, but something about these and the other ones I‚Äôve purchased; even though they‚Äôre the same size, seemed smaller. I would definitely recommend sizing up. If I could go back and do it again I know that I would size up.

review_title: Not just shoes but a gift from god.
review_text: When I first got these I knew there was going to be great performance. Exceptional versatility. Superior comfort. I thought I was prepared for all of that. Man, was I wrong. These far surpass, well, not only my expectations but my own ability to preform yard work, my own versatility around the grill and yes my ability to be as comfortable as possible. I hope I can live up to the demand of my crocs because I know they‚Äôll live up to what I demand from them.

review_title: Rock out with your crocs out...
review_text: This is my first pair ever. Very comfortable. I normally wear a shoe size 8-8.5 would have preferred a size 9 BUT they still are incredibly comfortable and cute. I wear them around the house & out and about casually, as my boyfriend also has a pair. The textured sole work well for grip and feel like accupressure massage while wearing. They‚Äôre comfortable with and without socks.

I looooooove my crocs. I will be a croc fan until the day I die. So easy to slip on, comfortable and waterproof. Great for a quick trip to the store, a long day kayaking on the river, or an evening spent on the boat at your favorite lake. These stay by my front door most of the time and when these wear out, another pair will take their place.

I bought these because my current pair, the first pair I ever bought, many many years ago, were showing wear and tear.  But I wanted to replace them with something just like them and these are it.  I also matched the color to brand new outdoor chairs we just received as a gift and these were a great match.  Would buy again or even just buy again in another color.

Purchased my first pair at an Outlet Mall about 5 years ago and paid almost twice the amount for the same thing.  I used to wear them around the house inside and out.  They finally needed replaced after a small hole got worn into the sole.  They held up very well for a long time.  Probably should have been replaced a year ago but even 4 years of wear and tear is pretty good for rubber shoes.  These new ones fit just like the old ones.  The only noticeable difference is the back heel portion is a bit shorter than my original pair.  Excellent Product.

I have worn these Crocs since 2008. Absolutely love them. Just be careful they're dangerous if it's wet out, very slippy. Crocs and socks is a winter fashion statement.The last batch I bought though seriously shrunk. I don't know how. They fitted and then they got super tight and had visibly shrunk. I have had to buy another pair and threw those away after not wearing them. Mentioning it here in case others have experienced that.

review_title: Cute, comfy shoe, but very roomy fit. If you are in between sizes, I would suggest to size down.
review_text: I‚Äôm a big Crocs fan. Normally, I order off of the website but I decided to order through amazon. I ordered the chambray blue color in a size 9 (I am in between sizes so I sized up since my other crocs were a 9). I could have easily worn an 8 and I kinda wished I had ordered an 8. My other crocs fit very relaxed and tight to my foot which I like. These crocs, however, are much roomier and a little hard to walk in. All in all, good shoe and cute color. Just make sure that you know ahead of time that these are extremely roomy.

This is my third pair.  I wear them until they have no more tread -- that takes about 5 years of daily wear.  The only time I don't wear them is outside in the winter.  To clean them up I shower with them.

review_title: Cant Go Wrong with Black Crocs
review_text: Once you try Crocs you will have many, many pair. I ripped a previous paid (it got caught up under a chair with a screw) so it is time for a fresh paid. I forget how massaging they are when they are new. I always buy 1 size up (I wear a 10 so I buy 11). These look great with boot cut jeans, quick slip on with a pair of shorts or whatever the occasion.

review_title: Well made one pair lasts quite awhile so comfy.
review_text: I‚Äôm a huge croc fan. Live in them in the house and will even run local errands. Can wash easy slide on and off. Probably have 30 plus pairs. Just be careful ifYou walk on wet tile you are likely to slip. Done it many times. Croc lites super comfy.  Travelled across country in them. Easy on and off at security and we comfy socks. I live in Bombas socks. LittleMore pricy but comfort isWorth it. Especially when traveling. Great colors and alsoWashable.

First time croc buyer...pretty much what I expected. Not a ton of support, my feet were a little sore after being on them all day at work, but that is typical with a new shoe. I bought these due to swelling feet during the end of this pregnancy, and these are perfect for that. Lots of air flow to keep my feet cool, but still a closed toe shoe that is required in my medical office job. I bought a 9 US Womens, I usually wear a 8.5 (39 euro size) but my feet have definitely changed during this second pregnancy. Lengthwise I feel like I would want a little more room, but width wise they are plenty big and I know I would swim in the next size up.

I wear a size 13 wide and a size 13 fit was perfect. Love the color Blue not too bright. Plenty of tie room. Love the little dots inside the shoe. Massages the bottom of your feet. I wear them all year summer and winter. Love the Air Holes on top and Cut Outs on the sides. I bought from Amazon the American Flag Charms. The Rubber is Not too Soft and Not too Hard, Perfect.

review_title: Rocking the crocs, what can I say
review_text: I know they're supposed to be considered ugly, and I know they're not "in trend" right now, but all I can say is they're comfy and easy to slip on to go outside. No complaints here!

review_title: What can I say, my 18 year old loves them even though they are somewhat style challenged shoes.
review_text: My daughter wears these almost constantly. She has extra wide feet & they are one of the few shoes she actually likes & that fit. Her friends give her grief about them but, since she is a strong individual, she has never let that stop her from doing exactly as she pleases.She also is following in her stepfather's footsteps & going to school to get her RN degree so they are somewhat apropos, all things considered. She wears Birks all summer but, come fall, these are her jam for the rest of the year.For her, comfort beats style so you'll never catch her in a pair of heels like my younger daughter wears constantly. If you're like her, you'll love these shoes. Have a great day!

Crocs are so comfy and cute. I was so excited to see I could get them cheaper on Amazon. I tried them on in the crocs store and was a 9 so I ordered size 9 and they're perfect. I tell people about them all the time and wear them to work on casual days.

review_title: Reunited and it feels so good!
review_text: When you grew up in the 90‚Äôs and you died a little inside when crocs were no longer cool. Well, jokes on them cuz mama got a new pair and I‚Äôm so happy to find that they are the same soft foot loving shoes I recall. My life is now complete. Thank you Amazon!

Just what I thought it would be. I've been wearing my brother's Crocs that are too big and decided to buy my own. I bought a women's 10, and normally I'm a women's 10/11 depending on the shoe brand and style. I should also mention that my right foot is slightly bigger than my left. Other than that, these fit really good and once I break them in a bit more, my foot will fit even better.

Our 9 year old LOVES his Crocs.  He is never without at least one pair that fits him.Sure, they aren't he most stylish things (though maybe they are coming back as our VERY fashion conscious 14 year old just asked for a pair), but they are so comfortable and offer a bit more support than flip flops.I love the bright red color on these , and the strap that can be worn around the ankles or pushed up and out of the way to simply wear them as slides is great.  We've taken our Crocs to the beach and they made it through-waves and all!

This is the 3rd set of Crocs I've purchased over the past 8-10 years.  We have a 8-month urban home and a 4-month summer/fall home in the Maine Woods. Crocs are wonderful in so many ways--for a quick walk to the water's edge for swimming, as a bedroom slipper, as an around the house casual cushioned shoe.  In cold weather they provide very good insulation against a cold floor. Super comfortable all around.

This was my first pair of Crocs and was not sure what size to buy. I generally wear an 11.5 gym shoe but with the Crocs the men's size 10 fit perfectly. If you wear a thick sock these would be snug but with a light sock or barefoot these fit great. I tried the next size up and they were slightly too loose for my liking. Very happy with my purchase.

This is your standard croc. If you've had them before, you know what you're getting.  If you haven't tried them yet I might suggest, before online buying, going to a brick and mortar store to try on a pair as I wear an 8 in every other shoe but I wear a 7 in crocs. I have wide feet and these are roomy enough to not need to size up.

I personally don't like crocs...I think they're not flattering looking at all.  BUT, I have plantar fascitis  which brought me pain that was excruciating.  I needed something to wear that would offer some cushion.  It works!  And the look is growing on me!! I bought a fun color and only wear them inside the house as my slippers and they are really helping a lot.  Go for it!!
My old ones had worn down to flatness. Very dangerous on a wet floor. Yep. Almost did the splits... Don't wait as long as I did and replace those worn down crocs! Nice new colors too!!

These were my very first pair of Crocs. Im sure there isn't a better pair of shoes out there. They are perfect for hiking, the beach, rough terrain, hills, disc golfing, camping, taking the dog out and so much more. Oh yea and THEY FLOAT so I've even worn them on the boat! These are absolutely a new staple in my life. Everyone should have a pair of these incredibly convenient shoes. Don't wait another day! I want them in every color because thats a thing. Also the charms that you can personalize your crocs with ar

These aren't my first pair of Crocs. I wear out a couple pairs every 2 years. I have a pair for gardening, and a few just to wear casually around the house and wherever. I've tried other similar shoes, but none fit my foot as well as Crocs. Guess I'll have to pay the higher prices. I justify that by saying my body's alignment is worth it.

review_title: Except for the knife blades on the bottom.
review_text: Bought these for my Wife because she likes to run around in clogs, without socks. I picked these because they look exactly like the clogs she has been wearing....except...these have little ridges on the bottom that cut into her heels. She won't wear socks, so I blew it. I could not find her a comfortable clog. The ones she wears must be made somewhere on Mars, as I can't find them anywhere on Earth.

I've been wearing this Croc Classic Clog style since 2007 and continue to enjoy the comfort and durability of this shoe. I've practically lived in these during the 2020 pandemic wearing them exclusively as I worked from home. Easy comfort is the watchword. Easy on, easy off and easy to care for and keep clean. Highly recommended!

These are the real deal. They are Crocs. We ordered up a half size based on reviews and I'm glad we did. They fit perfect. My daughter loves them! Prime delivery was not available when I ordered, so it felt like it took a long time to get them, over a week. And in 2020, 10 days to receive something is way too long. But overall, very happy with the purchase... Cheaper than Crocs.com üòÉ

Good except fits small.  I have other Crocs shoes that are size 7 and they fit way looser.  These fiot more like a 6 I have to push the ankle strap forward on these size 7 Crocs in order to feel more comfortable  They are a bit short.  i like the color its cool looking but I think the Baya Croc clogs are sturdier and better quality and the 7 fits way looser in that style.  The material on this Croc is softer than the Baya so not as sturdy for outdoor walking etc.  in my opinion.

review_title: Why haven‚Äôt you bought these yet?
review_text: This is my go to choice for footwear. I‚Äôve worn these to work, to fish, to hike, to kayak, trips to Walmart even playing in the yard with the dog. Honestly if you‚Äôre one of those people that question if these are worth the money... odds are you are missing out on a lot of other aspects in life. These are an all around shoe, that will float if lost in the water AND you can wear them in the shower to clean them! I plan on buying some fuzzy ones as well as flats for church.

I should have bought two pair for when the first pair wear out.  Unlike most Crocs I wear, people do not look at these disapprovingly.  The style of these has gotten a lot of positive attention and feedback.  More than one person has said, "Are those your Pink Floyd Crocs?"  LOL!Anyway, although they're just Crocs, the stylishness of these tends to kick things up a notch from just plain 'ol solid colored Crocs.  In other words... I'm almost afraid to say it... they're a little more fashionable than regular Crocs.  Other than the style, they fit and function just like standard Crocs.

Crocs dry very quickly because they don't absorb water as many neoprene water shoes do.  This is important to me because I go five times a week to aqua-aerobics exercise programs and I need the shoes to dry before my next session.  I also like the color selection of Crocs.  I was able to get a color to match my bathing suit.

These are GREAT. Don't know why I resisted getting crocs for so long... I guess I thought they were ugly, but man, are they ever comfortable!! And I've gotten to the point in my life where comfort trumps style. (That being said, they aren't THAT ugly... Or maybe they've just grown on me!) I had an old pair of slides that I used for quick indoor/outdoor shoes (to take out the trash, etc.), but they developed holes in the soles, and needed to be replaced. These fit the bill perfectly! I can quickly slip them on to go outside, then slide them off in my foyer when I come back inside (especially with the strap swiveled up an out of the way, they function like clogs).They fit as expected (sizes run true).

I love my crocs. I bought them to have an easy pair of shoes to slip on when going around my dorm building and they are perfect! They are amazing. Just be aware that if you for whatever reason may want the back support in the back and not the front that they may be a little tight. I personally do not wear them that way but when trying them out I figured out they were a little snug on my feet if the back part was in the back and not the front.

I‚Äôve been wanting crocs for years and I am a 10 in women‚Äôs. 8.5 in men‚Äôs. I don‚Äôt play with my feet. The crocs 8/10 that I have tried on always seem like it‚Äôs a 9.5.  So  i broke down I went with the 9/11 which is a 9/11. Bc it‚Äôs too big for me.8/10 is in accurate but I love crocs. I have a pair of wedges which are cute and crazy comfortable

True Croc! The first thing I noticed was that the inside sole is textured with soft bumps that massage the bottom of my feet. They are just so comfortable. And this green is true green. I really wanted to get the tie dyed, but when I read the reviews I was afraid it was just painted on. The green is solid, not painted, like John Deere Green...I love em!

review_title: Mom loves these! They are cute and comfy :)
review_text: Was looking for some comfortable slip on shoes for my mom who is a little older, at first I wasn't sure these would be good for her but she tried mine on and mentioned how she would love to have a pair of these.  She purchased some similar off brand but they were not what she wanted, I ended getting her two pairs and she absolutely loves them.

Love Crocs sandals. They're super light weight and fairly durable considering they're just made of foam. They're some of the more comfortable sandals I own, since they have some arch support and whatnot in them. I still couldn't wear them for a whole day, or even several hours at once, but for brief periods, like to run outside or wear at the beach, they're great. I only have 1 complaint, they tend to run about 2 sizes too small. I wear a 9- 9.5 regularly, but had to order a 12 in Crocs so they'd fit comfortably.

They‚Äôre dorky, but wow my feet have never been happier! There‚Äôs a reason they‚Äôre so popular. I‚Äôve been happy with my Crocs for years and glad I no longer do off brands that don‚Äôt last nearly as long.I have an indoor pair and outdoor pair and if I‚Äôm not wearing shoes, I‚Äôm wearing Crocs! They literally help me walk and stand for long periods because in normal shoes, my pinched nerve in my back acts up.

I can't believe the shoes are back "in style"....my husband and I can't believe we paid close to $40 for our child to wear plastic (Thermoplastic) shoes. That aside, my daughter loves them and wears them everywhere and cleans them nightly and they come clean easily. I like the color for her and she loves it....just can't believe the price for what they are....it's like jelly shoes from the 80's on steroids....and way higher priced than they were for their time period.

I have been wearing Crocs for years. I have several pairs now - different colors for different wardrobes!They are the most comfortable footwear I own. Easy on/off is a plus. I even have pairs lined with "faux fur" for winter wear. Easily a 5 star rating!

I can‚Äôt believe I waited until I was 28 years old to own a pair of these majestic feet cushions. My slippers kept wearing out so I wanted to treat myself to something slip-on and comfortable. When you have hardwood floors, cold tile, and dog hair everywhere, bare feet is not a good option. These Ice Blue Crocs are the answer to my feet woes and happily squeak around the house in them.

review_title: Quality you would expect from Crocs!
review_text: These are exactly what you expect them to be, I use these to mow, take the trash can down, or simply just outside in the yard. They work fantastic for many reasons and one of the main reasons being that they are impossible to stain. They have great airflow and definitely recommend these for the ultimate around the house shoe!

review_title: Great for RA Comfort and Protection
review_text: I bought these for a family member that has RA that primarily affects their feet. They are always looking for a house slipper type shoe that offers support, comfort, and protection, but is gentle on their feet. These shoes fit the bill! They LOVE these and say that their feet feel protected and comfortable. They fit true to size and have been very durable (they don't wear them outside though).

review_title: My sore feet thank these atrocious clown shoes
review_text: I usually wear a womens 8.5 in regular shoes but after reading reviews sized down to an 8. The 8 fits perfectly without looking too big or clownish. While my co-workers mock my clown shoes, they are the only thing saving my feet from burning after 8 hour shifts of standing and running around. Would recommend to anyone who has to stay on their feet a lot or simply wants comfortable shoes! :) They do feel better if you wear thicker socks. Thinner socks can make the rubber feel uncomfortable against your feet after standing for an hour or two.

I got these simply because they were on sale and I wanted something I could slip on at home and wear around the house.These are super comfortable. Everyone knows that Crocs are comfortable. That‚Äôs the whole point of Crocs.Since they‚Äôre super ugly, I wouldn‚Äôt wear them around town...but I knew they were ugly when I ordered them. They‚Äôre perfect for what I need them for. I love these ugly little fellows!

These are my first real pair of crocs.  Never had the need for them as I don't work in health care.  I do however run my own printing business of which I am on my feet most of the day and with my sicatic nerve issues, I was looking for something comfortable.  These did the job!  I even have arch support which is crazy!  Will be buying another pair soon.

Update: a week later I definitely just need to wear them for a little while and they are perfect definitely the best pair for the priceThese are my first pair of crocs so I was not sure what to expect as far as sizes for. I have been told that they run smaller or true to size, so I just went with my normal size which is US Women 8. They are a bit small length wise maybe I just need to break them in or I possibly just have too fat of a foot. Bright side they are comfy and true in color

Let's be honest, these things are hideous, even though they are the cutest shade of pink ever. I only wear them when gardening (in the Texas heat). They are easy to slip on, clean, and are sturdy enough to go trekking around in the grass. Very supportive, and have had zero complaints so far. I hose them off at the end of my gardening sessions and store them in the garage.

review_title: YOU CAN FEEL IT IN YOUR SOLE!
review_text: The Croslite Polymer rubber-like material is extremely soothing to your feet. I use these as slippers indoors. They keep your feet cool in the summer and warm in the winter. As soon as I walk in the door, I step into these. These shoes RELAX your feet big time! You can wear the strap in the front or the back. I wear it in the back to secure my heel. You can also use them at the beach to protect your feet from glass, rocks, & sea weed. These Crocs are the first item I put in my suitcase no matter where I'm going. You can throw them in the washing machine and they quickly air dry. You can also hose them off. They are my 2nd feet! I wear them all the time I am inside my house (except when I'm sleeping) because they feel so comfortable. These Crocs last for years! The value greatly exceeds the price and you will save hundreds of dollars on slippers if you use them in their place. I highly recommend them!

I LOVE my crocs! It‚Äôs been hard to wear other shoes lately haha I find myself just wanting to throw these on every time I leave the house! I‚Äôve had these for a couple months now and they have held up great for me! I saw a lot of reviews say the quality isn‚Äôt as great as it once was but I was satisfied with the product I received! Just ordered a pair in a different color!

For me these fit great and are super comfortable. I have very wide feet. I wear an 8.5 4E and have so much trouble finding shoes that fit but these are just right let alone that come in so many cute colors. I have moderate arch and these provide great support. I have worn them walking and on bike rides and my feet have been very happy.

review_title: Comfortable and protects my feet from our killer attack kitten.
review_text: Bought these to protect my feet from the killer attack kitten we recently adopted. I forgot how comfortable Crocs are and I‚Äôve been enjoying wearing them around the house. I do have a medical issue that causes my feet to swell so these shoes do accommodate for the swelling. I love the color and have been enjoying rockin the Crocs again!

My daughter plays high school softball and these are the go to shoes for after and before games. They do not come in half sizes as my daughter wears size 7 1/2 shoes, but just order up and it will fit. These are well made and durable to sports. Great price too!

Fits well, first time Crocs owner so will try to do an update in a month or so after they are broken in. After reading the reviews I was hoping for American made but got "Made in Vietnam". Other sites said that's a good thing, we shall see. So far they fit perfect, a little room for the big toe and both my feet are surprisingly comfortable being they just came out of the bag. Feels like a slipper and the motion of my feet react just like they do with slides, however when I pull the Crocs strap back, both feet are snug and grip the ground firmly much more than I anticipated. Will test on wet floors, beach, hot tar, and concrete. Any other tests anyone wants done let me know and maybe I'll experiment with them. I'll do an update review in a month or sooner if they wind up being my summer go to shoe. Giving 5 starts because so far everything promised was given from quick delivery to a proper fit. Will change if things don't work out, but for now Crocs is living up to the hype.

review_title: My feet thank whoever designed Crocs!
review_text: I have wide feet that spread out at the toe.  Therefore, Croc's roomy toe area is just perfect for me.  They are VERY comfortable and I would recommend them to anyone.  If you get a pair you'll be doing yourself a favor.

review_title: All I wear now. If you think they're ugly, give them a chance!
review_text: Thoroughly impressed with these. I didn't have a strong opinion of these before I purchased (most people think ugly). I was looking for something to wear anywhere and everywhere, which these are fantastic for. They stay on my feet and don't flop around, slide on easily, lightweight, comfortable, breathable, easy to clean, the list goes on and on! Also worth mentioning, I suffer from Lupus and wake up in the morning stiff as a board. These make my mornings so much easier not having to bend down and fuss with putting shoes/slippers on. As far as the aesthetics of these, doesn't bother me at all! The benefits far outweigh the appearance of these so just give them a chance.

I used to have the Baya Clogs and those were definitely more wide and sort of more comfortable for lounging around. These regular clogs are great if you‚Äôre gonna do some walking. They are more slim so if you have a more narrow foot get these but if you have a more wider foot I would say get the Baya clog. Overall great quality :) just don‚Äôt leave them out in the sun because they WILL shrink, learned my lesson haha.

review_title: Ugly shoe that I had sworn not to wear but bought and now wear anyway!
review_text: Our adult son showed my husband his Crocs and then he tried them on.  My husband then bought them and loves them.  Then I had to go outside to get the mail and I didn't want to go back into my closet so I wore my husband's Crocs out to the mail box.  Oh my gosh, they were comfy for these flat feet, so now I own 2 pair.  This one and the winter ones that have fuzzy material inside them.  I wear them with socks on so that the soles don't smell and will keep longer.
