These are a must-have for me.  After my husband threw my old ones in the dryer ( I wash them with the rags), they shrunk too much to be able to wear them.  I had to order another pair right away as I love these for slippers after being on ladders all day.  The cushioning is just glorious and makes my feet feel so much better.

I was hesitant to buy these for a couple of reasons.  First, they're...you know--rubber? Plastic? Something like that...  Second, they're...you know--not masculine? Kind of sissified? Finally, the picture makes them look flimsy. So okay. Yes--they are some kind of man-made rubber/plastic/neoprene/something, but that makes them waterproof meaning you can leave them out on the deck after you've been working in the yard and you don't have to worry about them getting soggy and ruined. No--they're not the most masculine shoes I've ever seen, so you have to be pretty confident in your manhood if you wear them out on the town but I got them for yard work which is a fairly macho enterprise. And no, they're not as flimsy as the pictures look. I don't know how long that heel-strap thing will last, but I don't use it half the time anyway and for some reason, your feet don't slip out of the shoes without it, so if it does break--Super Glue and duct tape. THEN they'll look masculine!
Great fit and so comfortable! I was having a problem with pain in my heel and these shoes was the perfect remedy. I will be ordering more in several different colors.

I bought the USA women's size 8. Normally I wear an 8 1/2 shoe. This clog fits snug but not too tight. I like that the back strap can be worn over your heel or flipped up to the front out of the way. This does have little knobby things inside but I wear low ankle socks with mine so I don't feel them. The soles are very cushiony and have good tread so I don't slip on uneven ground. Very pleased.

review_title: Like a Foot Massage Every Time I wear Them
review_text: I purchased these to wear around the house because I have been having lot's of heel pain and can't walk barefoot anymore.  These shoes are a life saver.  I never owned Crocs before.  My son purchased a pair with the fussy liners and he really liked them.  I didn't want the extra warmth so I purchased these.  I am so impressed.  And I can go outside in them if I want.  Part of the reason for my headline about "foot massage", is the soles have small ridges of dots that actually massage my foot.

I love my classic crocs, I have VERY flat feet and am troubled by foot pain, these shoes are the ONLY kind I have been able to wear for a long time now.  I have at least 10 pair of them in several different colors, they may not have always been the most ‚ÄúFashionable‚Äù shoes to wear but I‚Äôm still able to keep going because of them!

review_title: Don‚Äôt tell the homies I Croc.
review_text: Well well well... look who‚Äôs reviewing a purchase of Crocs. I‚Äôve been a lifelong hater of crocs, it‚Äôs true. But as I‚Äôve gotten older I‚Äôve seen the time and place for them (newsflash it‚Äôs not everywhere). Power washing patio: yup. Walking out to the garage/yard to do some stuff: yup. Basement: uh-huh. Welding/grinding: negatory. Leaving the house to go into public: still a big nope... for now.

review_title: Make sure you look at the color!
review_text: Great crocs. Just not the yellow I was expecting. I ordered the citrus yellow thinking it was the lemon yellow but it was my own fault so I‚Äôm still giving a 5 star because they look fantastic . Anyways, easy fix - sold them to my sister LOL

Brought this my daughter, she love crocs wear them all year no matter how cold, or hot it is outside. So they must be very comfortable.  She was missing a few colors so we got the colors she didn't have, and she love them. Great prices as well, she wear them enough so for that price I get as many as I can .

review_title: The website is nice and there are all kinds of options
review_text: I used to have heel pain --  plantar fascia.  I stretched a couple times a day and that mostly kept the pain at bay.  Then a friend suggested crocs.  Pain gone.  It has been 10 years since I have worn anything else -- or stretched.  I used to these shoes direct from Crocs.  The website is nice and there are all kinds of options.  Almost all of the styles that I tried were narrower.  My 'real shoe' size is 11 EEE.  Crocs Mens 12 work in this style.  If they feel a little tight at first, keep wearing them.  They stretch and, like fine leather shoes, mold to the feet.  Amazon Prime means free shipping, so I can buy one pair at a time without paying shipping and for the same price as the Crocs website or the local box store.And if you take a worn out pair and slice them up, they make fine sanding blocks.

You know you've gone full adult when crocs are super comfortable and you wear them around the house.  Normal cruise mode is great, I haven't flipped the ankle strap back yet for sport mode but I'm sure it works flawless. 100/10, would croc again.

review_title: The perfect gardening shoes for plantar fasciitis inserts
review_text: These are exactly what I needed them to be. Comfortable,  waterproof, easy on/off shoes for me to wear when doing yard work. If they were a half size larger I would say they're perfection. Other than that, these are wonderful.  I need to always wear shoes or inserts for plantar fasciitis,  and the heel bed in these shoes is deep enough for me to slip some right in and they stay in place. I've now tossed out my old tennis shoes I was wearing for garden work.

review_title: Like that they haven‚Äôt changed a thing in the design
review_text: Bought this pair to replace the ones my dad has had for 8 years and they are exactly the same as far as fit, design and comfort. He has wide feet and this style fits him perfectly. I‚Äôm glad to see that this design has stayed the same over the years. I tried his on and didn‚Äôt realize how much better these (comfort and tread) were vs my slippers for around the house. Needless to say, I‚Äôll be purchasing my own.

After a month of mandatory COVID work from home my lower back would kill at the end of the day from not wearing shoes all day. I hate wearing shoes when I‚Äôm home but needed support for my back. These did the trick. They are loose so you don‚Äôt feel like you have shoes on but give my lower back the support it needs. Got a fun color cus heck I‚Äôm in quarantine. Why not?!

I have purchased Crocs for a long time.I have 4 pairs at home.These are great slippers and this one is as good as anything I have had in the past.The quality of Crocs slippers is amazing. These really help you if you have a habbit of hitting your toes in walls, doors and bed bottoms.Crocs is the best. Period

They provide reasonable support and are slip proof.  The size 7 I usually wear is slightly snug with these; I would be happier with a 7.5 if they had half sizes.  The holes are nice because they let your feet breath.  I wear socks with them because the inside feels slightly prickly (little nubs).  (Note:  I edited my review and gave it a higher rating after a few days because they are very different and take some getting used to.  For standing and doing chores, they are pretty comfortable).

My daughters volleyball team wanted matching crocs for the upcoming season. She wears a size 9.5 so we originally ordered a 10, but after trying them on we sent them back and went with the 9 which fit much better. She is very happy with them.

I was the type of person that believed Crocs were very uncomfortable, so I never bought a pair of Crocs. However, a friend of mine owns about 7 pairs of Crocs and swears they are the most comfortable pairs of shoes. I tried on one of hers, and they were extremely comfortable, so I bought a pair of my own. I am very impressed with the price, comfort, and ease of these shoes. They are perfect for slipping on and going, and if they get dirty from being outside, they wipe clean very easily.

I made fun of my daughters white crocs SO MUCH until I put hers on jokingly and was like WHOA WAYAMINUTE. They are so comfortable. I bought mine in black so that I can wear them at work. Only one of my coworkers has made fun of me so I'd say its a WIN WIN! I am a total old lady tho and I keep the backs on mine. My daughter calls that "sport mode". Keep your crocs in sport mode for easier wear.

I really like these for my yard work. They have good support and are comfortable to wear for the day. I did go for a 3 mile walk in them and it gave me little blisters on the top of my foot as crocs are not designed to be form fitting and so they rubbed a bit...so I would just wear socks with them if I plan on walking a long time in them. I really like them regardless.

Well... I never had a pair of Crocs before. Somebody told me they used to be softer. I like the Crocs a lot. They are a tad wide but I expected that. They are my new go to shoes this Summer. I have a size 15 foot. I was just amazed that I could get them in a size-15 for $30. I bought my daughter a pair and they were $10 more for the same basic style. .. Go figure? Glad I got them. They will be a great Summer/house shoes for me. Flip flops are not made for guys with a size 15 foot. These crocs have got to be the next best thing to flip flops..... maybe better.

These are the most comfortable ugly shoes I've ever had! I have high arches and find it so hard to find a comfortable shoe with enough support. These I can wear all day long and I don't feel like I need to put more comfortable shoes on. I love them! Ment to get the black but accidentally ordered navy blue. That's ok, should go good with my hean shorts.

For the longest time, ever since they came out really, I thought Crocs were the ugliest shoes. I couldn't see why anybody wore them. However, my boyfriend owns a pair, and I had to wear them a few times (granted his feet are quite bigger than mine). They. Are. Comfortable. As. Heck. It took a while, but I finally decided that I needed to buy a pair of my own. My feet hurt all the time, especially my heels because that's where I put all of my weight when standing. Let me tell you: I can walk around for hours wearing these shoes, and I don't feel any discomfort. Even after a 9-hour shift of standing and walking around at work, I can put these on, and my feet already feel better. Do yourself a favor and buy yourself a pair. I wear 8 1/2, so I dropped down a half size as recommended, and they fit perfectly.

At first I had an issue with actually getting my item which worried me a little bit because it was supposed to be here and then it wasn‚Äôt but they ended up sending me another pair so that was wonderful. I love crocs I have a few different colors and pairs of them already, they are very comfortable true to size with them and color. I think they are great for multiple reasons and purposes. Definitely buy some.

review_title: Good versatile shoe around the house
review_text: I'm using these for my indoor slippers and they are great!  Supportive, comfortable, breathable and not slippery on our kitchen floor.  They are easy to clean and the little grips on the inside are not bothersome at all.  The fit was true to size. When a product like checks all the boxes I consider it a great value!  Love the color as well!

review_title: Keep wearing it to loosen over time
review_text: I love these clogs!!! I still have my old pair since 2004! I bought a new pair just in case my old pair might fail.I was reading some of the reviews here stating that the clog is a tight fit. It's only tight because it hasn't been worn and it's brand new. Once you keep wearing it, it'll loosen over time.

I wear a size 9 1/2 in women‚Äôs ordered a 10 in the Navy and they are perfect. These are my third pair along with the Croc sandals. All of my crocs says they were made in Vietnam if that helps anyone.  I have flat feet (fallen arch) and scoliosis (curvy spine), Crocs help with my back and hip pain. I got Prime so they were delivered the next day.

Got it for a friend of mine. She loves the color and the fit was all right. She did tell me that sometimes her toes would occasionally touch/hit the toe part of the crocs, but if she goes to a size higher, it would be too big for her. She doesn't mind it too much though! The price is good for the fact that crocs are $50+.

Pros-  Good in the water. really comfortable, no pain in your foot, you can decorate themCons- A little roomy, I personally don't think its a problem but some people don't like that. it sticks to your feet if they get sweatyIn conclusion, great water shoes for the beach or good shoes for chilling around at home. 100% recommend for anyone looking for a multifunctional pair of shoes that they can decorate

I had a pair of these that I had worn almost every day for 6+ years that somehow got lost during a hospital stay.  I was so sad ... and immobilized, as these shoes are what I wear around my house every day while I chase my kiddos and do chores!  If I don't wear them my feet hurt so badly.  After a week or so of going barefoot and not wearing them I ended up with a full limp and a sore knee (from walking funny because of my foot pain).  My husband couldn't stand it anymore and told me to order another pair PRONTO!  I did, and within a day my feet felt great again!  I have incredibly high arches, and these are one of the few types of shoes I can wear for extended periods of time without any pain.  I loooove my crocs!!

Very comfortable footwear that is perfect to have by the back door of you go in and out of the house frequently. They feel good on the bottom of your feet because of the bumpy pattern of the shoe that contacts your sole. They stay on great, and if you need more security you can flip over the strap and put them in four wheel drive mode. I typically wear a 13, or sometimes a 12 1/2 of a shoe manufacturer even makes it, but in these I wear a 12. If your feet sweat, you might find they sweat more in these. However, my feet seem to be getting use to them and seem to be sweating less the more that I wear them. They are a great product, designed well, and seem robust enough to last for years. I would definitely recommend.

I always thought crocs were goofy. But I'm the kind of person whose feet feel better if I wear shoes in the house, especially if I'm standing in my kitchen cooking for long periods of time, or doing other chores around the house. These are excellent for that. So comfortable and cushy. Love the purple color too.

Brought these to slip on if I need to run errands quick and for the summer to wear when I go on a boat or to the beach. These are perfect for all of those things. You won‚Äôt be disappointed. Even though I would have liked if these came in half sizes due to the fact that when you put the strap on in the back, your foot is pushed literally to the top of the shoe which to me isn‚Äôt uncomfortable, but I know for some individuals it may be. I also like a little bit of a looser fit. But other than that, I couldn‚Äôt be happier with this buy!

review_title: Crocs are wide and fit well. They are true to size, though, and last forever
review_text: Living on an island just 60 feet from the water, my everyday shoes are flip flops and Crocs!  My feet are wide, so Crocs are perfect. I bought blue and also red, but they offered multiple, unusual colors. Plus they were on sale. Crocs are also perfect to use in any body of water, especially the ocean.

review_title: Who knew comfort could be such high fashion?
review_text: I wear these out to nice dinners with friends and they all comment on how good they look. I think they are jealous of my fashion sense. I feel like a runway model in them.Surprisingly warm - no really, been wearing them in sub zero weather with no cold feet issues.

I had a pair of these in middle school and didn‚Äôt appreciate them as much as I do now! I bought a pair in the gorgeous Ice Blue color in size 8. My shoe size ranges from 7 to 8, so the 8 is perfect. My feet hurt when I walk around barefoot in the apartment since we have hard floors, but wearing these has alleviated the pain of weekend chores!
Hello,The size is accurate and the color is a bright pink.  The shoes arrived on the date indicated and are so cute on!

review_title: They make great house shoes, not work shoes
review_text: Bought these because I work in a warehouse and my feet have been bothering me. Many people recommend Crocs. Unfortunately I don't enjoy working in them, I do not find them comfortable for standing and walking all day.I do find them comfortable for house shoes though. I do find them comfy wearing them on and off throught the day. I do like these and would recommend, but not for what I intended.

If you are in between sizes, size down. I am a women‚Äôs 9.5 and I have wide feet. I originally bought the size 10 women and they are really wide and I trip over them constantly. I bought the 9 and while they felt snug at first as soon I walked around they fit much better. Beautiful color. Also look out for the coupons!

Nothing says relaxing at the house like a good pair of crocs. I would not suggest pairing them with a suit and tie but for passive walks through Walmart and Dollar General they cannot be beat. Easy to clean with a water hose. Haven‚Äôt had to put these bad boys in 4x4 yet but I have no doubt they will perform as their predecessors have.

Finally gave in, and I love them -- I have resisted crocs for many years, because they look, to be brutal, stupid.  But we spend the winter on the beach, and I got tired of ruining at least two pairs of white sandals a year by getting them wet when I was totally sure I wouldn't.  So: crocs.  The reviews left me frightened of mis-sizing, so I shot an arrow in the air and ordered an eight, which fits perfectly.  They are comfortable on the beach, comfortable around the house, and comfortable when we go out on errands.  Mine are white, and they have stayed dazzlingly clean looking.  On the downside, they do accumulate debris, and the do look -- stupid.  But noone is asking me to wear them on Madison Avenue, and for a beach community, they are just great.

review_title: Great gift for middle school boys & girls.
review_text: I really don‚Äôt understand why these out of all of the things us 90s teens wore have came back into popularity with vsco teens but besides that they fit the kid well & she says that they are comfortable. They run a little big but she‚Äôll be wearing them with fuzzy socks ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è & they fit fine with those on. I wish they weren‚Äôt made in China b/c I believe they used to made in the USA.

I love to wear these in the house. They are extremely comfortable, and the lavender color that I got is super cute. I don‚Äôt think they‚Äôre as ugly as people say, but that is just my opinion.I don‚Äôt wear them outside though, because they do not give me adequate high arch support. So these are just my leisure slippers.

review_title: Ordered for my elderly father with swollen feet
review_text: I ordered this pair of crocs for my 80 year older father as a safer and more supportive option to slippers for those days that his feet are swollen.My father's legs and feet swell, so he tends to wear open back slippers because of the ease of putting them on when his feet swell, however, there is no support and they are a fall risk since they can easily fall off his feet.  The crocs on the other hand are a roomy, solid option for when his feet swell and the air holes help to keep his feet cool, unlike shoes. The back strap keeps them on his feet, thus keeping him safer.

review_title: Huge Khaki Croc Men' 7/Women's 9 more like Women's 10  Wear socks!
review_text: This Croc's sold by Croc not Crocs khaki Men's7/Women's 9 is huge!  They are -much- larger than the Men's7/Women's 9 live leaf Crocs I bought at crocsdotcom. I'm keeping them because I like the color and I'll just wear socks to take up room. I don't understand how the same brand, same size can be so different!

I will preface this by saying that I have always made fun of Crocs‚Äîthey‚Äôre such ugly shoes. My opinion on this has not changed, although I have grown to appreciate the rubber aesthetic because holy heck, are they comfortable. Seriously, SO comfortable. I‚Äôve been converted. Catch me with my traffic cone aesthetic shoes, yeah?

These are of course super comfortable but beware the strap (see picture) makes them about a size smaller than my normal croc size. For some reason with the white crocs the strap comes in almost a whole inch from the back of the shoe. So if you rock socks and crocs and/or like the strap down to lock in the shoe, your toe will rub in the front if you get your normal size. Which I found uncomfortable. Thankfully Amazon has great returns and I was able to get the best fitting size. Normal size men‚Äôs 11 I went up to men‚Äôs 12 and fit great.

Fit perfectly, I'm really impressed with the comfort level. I was tired of wearing out slippers and my feet were killing me, so I Googled top rated comfort shoes and these kept popping up. I can say I completely agree!! I definitely will buy more for outdoor use as well. I love the custom buttons too!!

I have 3 boys (Ages from 19 to 15 yrs old) they all have a pair. This exact pair I bought for my younger, Boy who uses them for travel from the car to the dugout before and after his Baseball games . At this point in time one of the shoes has already broke at the part where the "Sports Mode" ...( The back ,heal strap)  attaches to the top part of the shoe.. so with that ... they can't be used like that anymore. But otherwise all is good üëç

review_title: Extremely comfortable! Good Purchase! Happy Feet
review_text: I love these shoes. I bought them for work. I work 12+ hours a shift and these shoes keep my feet happy. The width is perfect! No more toe pain. The toe box has plenty of room. I usually wear a 7.5-8 In sneakers so I ordered the 8 in these shoes. As long as I don‚Äôt wear them with the strap around my ankle they are a perfect fit. With the strap, my big toes are right up against the top. If I ordered again, I might consider a 9 so I can wear them with straps.

I'm a converted Croc hater! My son and his wife got some a few years back to wear out and about on their property and so I thought I'd give them a try - wow - was I surprised at how wonderfully comfy they are!  I'm on my second pair now and still loving them.  I'm a size 9 and these fit true to size for me.

review_title: If you want happy feet Crocs are the answer!
review_text: This is my third pair of Crocs because they are crazy comfortable.  I suffer with metatarsalgia capsulitis and if you know that name you know how painful it is.  I can no longer walk bare footed and  I was upset about this until I was reintroduced to Crocs which make this much less of a hardship.  I have convinced my family to try them and they were instantly hooked.  If you care about foot comfort, I cannot recommend them highly enough.

Usually I buy crocs in black and use them as house/garden shoes. Decided to spend a bit more and get them in lavender. They don't heat up as much in the sun as black ones, which is very nice, but also look very pretty. Don't expect a lot of support for your feet, but if you need shoes that you can just hose off, these are great. Will buy them again.

i bought these for my job ( nursing assistant at a nursing home) and these were the best decision. i wanted something i could easily hose down if i got urine, feces, or food on and something that was comfortable for an 8+ hour shift for standing. i love these so much that i wear them even when i‚Äôm not working. if your facility doesn‚Äôt allow crocs with holes, look into the specialist or the bistro crocs

review_title: Worked well on military deployment. Durable and comfortable
review_text: I wore these at least once a day for 9 months on my last military deployment. I highly recommend them if you need "shower shoes." I wore these in the shower, in my berthing, and even walking through the Kuwaiti desert to get to the bathroom. They've been folded, smushed, and packed multiple times in my pack and they don't seem to show any signs of breaking. One thing a lot of people might not realize is that they're thicker than regular flip flops and will protect your feet from bacteria better. I seriously think everyone should use these instead of those cheap, black $1 flip flops you get at the PX. I wear a size 11 in most footwear, but these were maybe a half size too big. I didn't really mind this because they were easy to slip on and off.

review_title: True to size and wide enough!
review_text: This is my first pair of crocs. I heard they have arch support which is exactly what I need. It‚Äôs winter now, so I can only use them in the house. But they seem to be fairly comfortable and true to your normal shoe size. I was skeptical bc I have very wide feet, but they fit pretty good. They won‚Äôt be my daily shoe choice, but I look forward to putting them to use! Vibrant colors also!

After hurting my back a few years ago, the permanent nerve damage in my leg has left me unable to wear a lot of footwear that I used to love.  I ended up trying a pair of Crocs and they were life savers.  They are so comfortable and cause no discomfort.  I can walk all day in these.
I've been wearing my crocs around the house (but never out to clubs) for years, and the last pair just wouldn't wear out! I did need something with tread on the bottom.

review_title: Why didn't I buy these years ago?!
review_text: Okay so I always swore I would never wear such a hideous looking shoe. After I bought these to wear primarily around the house when I have to let my dogs in or out, I realized they are THEE MOST COMFORTABLE shoe! I mean I still wouldn't wear them in public and my family judges me for wearing them even around the house, but WOW these are seriously amazing!! (still ugly though!)

Good color (see purple comparison).  I bought these for work and so far I love them. I wore crocs when I was in nursing school 13 years ago and swore them off as clown shoes, but honestly, they are super comfy especially with thick winter socks.I typically wear a 7.5-8 in shoes.  I got an 8 and they are a little large bur that's the style.

We had to return it and order a size larger, but other than that, these were great. Got them for my sister for her graduation, and she's been wearing them all the time since. Apparently these are very comfortable shoes and they fit very well and are great for walking in the summer and for wearing into water

I've never purchased Crocs before, but I needed something comfortable to wear in the house.  These are fabulous!  They have some cushion to them, fit well (I ordered size 9 because I'm an 8.5), and once broken in they mold to your feet which makes them almost perfect.  And the color is awesome.

Bought these for my husband who had a non name pair of imitations. Sadly our puppy had gotten a hold of them twice so extra holes were added. In addition they had been worn through on the soles.The first moment he put them on he was so happy. The crocs actually fit extremely well no looseness although I had ordered a size 11 and he normally wears a 10.5. There are bumps\ridges on the inside that massaged his feet.He took the dog on their usual walk 2 miles wearing the crocs.When he returned the shoes had become his new favorite shoe instead of hiking boots or anything else.

Fits true to size. Nice light pink color, I love them! Glad I found them here, they‚Äôre cheaper than buying from the Croc store, so definitely a good deal. I‚Äôd recommend to anyone looking for a light, comfortable pair of shoes. I‚Äôve had mine for over a year now and they are still in good condition, very easy to clean.

review_title: what have i been doing for the past 25 years?
review_text: locked up in quarantine and thinking about what could get me through the next 2 months. my wife and kids are wearing me out, im not smart enough to homeschool my daughter, and i vacillate between hopeless despair and crippling apathy.but since getting these crocs im a new man - a dad reborn. the titallating spikes keep me on my toes, the sport-mode heal flap allows me to relax and chase my kids without having to swap shoes, and the overall comfort keeps me sane during the dumpster fire that is america's handling of COVID-19.11/10 recommend and will likely be purchasing all colors and accompanying jibbitz before my wife is allowed to leave the house to find a lawyer.

What can I say...crocs are life. I‚Äôve ordered 3 pairs of size 8s off of Amazon so far and these and one other pair are smaller than the first pair I bought. They were made in different countries though so I‚Äôm pretty sure that has something to do with it. These still fit fine they‚Äôre just a tighter fit.

Shopping for shoes can be hard because I fit anywhere between 9/10. I bought the nines and I‚Äôm happy I did. They could be a tad bigger but if I got the 10 I‚Äôm sure they would have been too big. They‚Äôre wide so a 10 would have made them slip right off with every step. True to color and comfy for work

Liked the free return-The first pair was a size too small, the Clogs I ordered as a replacement fit perfectly. A comfortable size for me turned out to be 1/2 size larger than the fit I like for a shoe. When first wearing I thought the loose fit would be a problem with the Clogs slipping off as the back strap is not adjustable but due to good design by Crocs the Clogs are completely secure and do not slip off. My advice is to go for the loose fit as it makes for a very comfortable fit.wd

I bought a pair for work and purposely needed up buying a size bigger so I could use the strap on the back. The size 8 fit great without using the strap but while working and moving around the strap is beneficial so I got a 9. A little big but for my needs. They are easy to clean!

I use the Crocs as camp shoes on my hiking trips. They provide protection for my toes when walking around camp and for water crossings.  I wear a Woman's 8.5 shoe but this size (Women's 8 M/Men's 6M) works for me. They are a bit large around the toe box but is doable. I do like the movable strap which a nice option.  These are light weight compared to the other shoes I have tried.  They weigh around 10 ounces.

As a swimmer, my daughter is obsessed with these shoes. Oddly, or not, the white Croc is one of the most elusive colors to come by, and Amazon delivered. I don‚Äôt think she‚Äôs taken them off. Side note: And the magic eraser (from a major brand) cleans these up beautifully.

review_title: Happy to find the basic Crocs still available at a reasonable price. Worn them for years.
review_text: Worn these for years as house shoes. Happy they still make and sell these. I developed neuropathy in my legs and it effects my feet too.I use cotton socks with these and the design allows air and room but still gives to support and cushion needed (even if a lil large) for people also susceptible to painful mio-facitis like myself. Don't want that again! I am happy they still sell the basic ones that are less expensive than some of the others. Even though I do own several of the more expensive stylish Crocs sandals and shoes. Mostly for comfort.

These are my second pair of crocs. I love how comfortable they are. I run errands with these and they make me feel like I‚Äôm walking barefoot especially because of the holes. Love! Will recommend and buy again :)

review_title: They're exactly as expected except for the weird insole "mini-spikes."
review_text: Got them for my 12-year-old along with the little charms the kids stick in the holes. She immediately put them on and skip away, only to shriek and stop in her tracks due to the unexpected little mini-spikes that are all over the insoles. I guess you get used to them, but I'm not sure of their purpose, especially for the soft skin of kids. But she wore them - with socks this first time, which was nuts. But I don't ask questions.

Bought these for my wife who is 9 months pregnant. I knew she needed something for the hospital and she was surprised with how comfortable they were. Crocs knows what they are doing when it comes to shoes. They fit awesome for her and she‚Äôs excited to not only wear them around the house but also at the hospital.

I live in Central Wisconsin. On many mornings, I walk about 50 yards to open up my chicken coop to let them free range. On many mornings, there is dew on the ground. I no longer wreck my shoes with water stains! They slip on and off very quickly and are more comfortable than boots. Easy to clean with a garden hose.

review_title: Great shoes for around the house.
review_text: Absolutely love these crocs. I was just looking for something to wear around the house so I picked a bright color to keep me from wearing them outside. The color is really nice and as pictured. These fit true to size. I wear size 9 wide with shoes. I bought the regular width size 9 and they are comfortable‚Äîfit perfectly.
i already own a pair that I use to go to my yard but because we are all doing changes with this new way of life, I decided to purchase new ones just to use inside the house, lovely color!

review_title: Size 8 US Men - Good fit on a slightly wide foot
review_text: I have a slightly wide foot, size 8 men's, and they fit comfortably in the size 8 US Men's Classic Clog (the standard size, not wider model). It's roomy, but not to the point where my foot flops around feels insecure, and there's enough room to wear the clogs with socks on. I like that they're easy to slip on and off and have good traction on wet surfaces. So now I just have to see how they'll do over time. They're replacing a pair of sandals that I bought in Hawaii thirty years ago and are still wearable, but I like the fact that the Crocs have a little more toe protection.

review_title: Don't think about it. Just do it!
review_text: Crocs have been super trendy lately so I just decided one day, why not? Best. Decision. Ever. They are SO comfortable. Not to mention I can wear them with anything. I mean literally anything. Jeans? Yes. Sweats? Yes. Pajamas? Yes. I chose white so they go perfectly. I was worried about the size because I'm usually a 6.5 but it was either 6 or 7. I chose 6 and I was pleasantly surprised. They are the best go-to shoes I own!

review_title: Comfy....handy and great for stepping outside or a cruise through the grocery store!
review_text: Some say Crocs are ugly......well they've never worn a pair! So comfy and enjoyable to wear...I use them on the farm when I go feed our animals in the warmer months...and use them around the house and the occasional trip to the store!  Comfy..non slip and a great alternative to traditional sandals, flip flops or slip on shoes! I'm on my second pair now!

Fits nicely just like the old pair of size Medium Crocs which I have been wearing for 20 years.  The old ones are now  getting worn at the bottom and I thought they might fall apart and I won't have a pair of comfortable Crocs to wear.  But the old ones are still really comfortable.  Now, I wear them both - alternating the old and the new Crocs after each wash.  Am really surprised that the old Crocs are still in excellent condition after 20 years!!

This is my second pair. I purchased this second pair as I can‚Äôt find my original pair and still have one foot that is very swollen post broken ankle surgery. I should have purchased a larger pair for the duration of swelling but didn‚Äôt think about it. So not working like I wanted them to but LOVE the color and will wear once the swelling goes down.

Our third pair. Perfect 4 summer. Better than house shoes for retrieving morning paper on wet grass. Great for yard work; just hose them off or take them in shower and rinse them off.Great for shower room at ‚ÄúYMCA‚Äù or all gyms and public shower stalls where the floor is suspect or college dorms, etc.  Ashame they have to be importedüò±

review_title: Why did I wait so long to try these?
review_text: I have been having some problems with ingrown toenails (related to wearing a very expensive pair of joggers) and needed something comfortable and wide enough to give my toes some space.  These have been on my feet every day since I received them. They are HEAVEN!!! Nice soft soles with great shock absorption and good support.  Just LOVE these!!

review_title: and we absolutely love them! They are super lightweight
review_text: I got these for me and my husband to walk the dog, and we absolutely love them!  They are super lightweight, provide perfect stability and comfort, and you can stick them under a garden hose and they look brand new.  Honestly never had crocs before, but these are truly something spectacular.  I like the look of them, my husband thinks they are ugly, yet he wears them everywhere so that must tell you something about how comfortable they are :)  We have not had them for very long yet so I cannot speak on the durability and longevity of these shoes, but I will definitely be back to update.  Thank you!!

Ordered Ice Blue. A beautiful color.I LOVE crocs. I wear a 10 womens, ordered a 10 . Perfect fit. Croc classic are the most comfortable clog ever.  I own 4 pair, bu I want more. I love the colors, the comfort,  everything about crocs.  My next color are going to be grass green. Lol

I‚Äôm not gonna lie I used to make fun of these shoes all the time. Then I tried a pair on and omg so comfy! I purchased hot pink and they came exactly as that. I love to wear these anytime and anywhere. I have flat feet and they are super comfortable. I‚Äôm deff going to be buying more colors.

Does fit a little on the big side. They are quite wide and roomy but I believe that helps your feet breath as well as leaving plenty of room to wear socks if wanted to. They are very soft almost squishy material. But comfortable and durable material. I ordered a size 7 in women‚Äôs I only have about a half size of room left. I would order the size your normally are don‚Äôt size up or down.

review_title: You can‚Äôt really go wrong with Crocs!
review_text: Can you really go wrong with crocs?  Sure, they are ugly as dried mud, but oh are they sooo comfy!!  My podiatrist suggested them to wear instead of slippers and said they are one of the best things you can put on your feet. This is my 4th pair.  I do really love the dark gray, but I still won‚Äôt wear them in public, lol.

My kids love crocs. I don't know if this was a fluke or not but this pair ran small. This is a woman's 9 and it fits like a women's 8.  I previously purchased a women 8, and when I received it I held it up to my daughter's women's 7 and it was the exact same size.

Just what I was looking for, something easy to slip on when I walk the dog. When it's early in the morning or middle of the night and my canine wants to venture out, sometimes it's not easy to affix my shoes to my hooves when I'm half asleep. I can just slip these suckers on without even trying. They're ugly but in a charming way. They are moderately comfortable, though they do make my feet sweat. Not really a problem though since I plan on wearing them even when it's cold outside.

review_title: Finally broke down (literally) and bought a pair
review_text: I bought these while I was in the hospital recovering from an ATV accident. I was at the beach with my family and friends and had to be life flighted, in the process - my shoes were forgotten. At the hospital they kept giving me these nonslip socks to wear and I decided crocs would be easy to slip off and on in the hospital room as I did my PT and they are comfortable enough to use with a walker or in the shower. Amazon Prime had them here in 2 days, they were cheap, and they were exactly what I needed.I wear between an 8 and 8.5 in women's and these 8's fit perfectly.

I spend 40 hours a week on my feet on concrete floors. And I walk a lot. I have a very difficult time finding shoes that I don't ache to take off before a couple hours have past. I have wide feet, tall feet, and have a heel lift I wear in my left shoe (which creates its own shoe criteria). I need slip resistant ventilated shoes. These classic crocs fit the bill. I will always be wearing these with socks. They are wide enough for my feet, tall enough for my instep (even with the heel lift) and are quite comfortable to wear all shift. These are not fashion shoes and I don't expect them to be that, but for all the rest of the times, these will be the shoes I wear. My only caution would be that these shoes have little cushion. The rubber does have some give but it is not the same as a well padded shoe. For me this is acceptable because they don't hurt my feet to wear. Other's may find that to be a turn off.

I have been on the hunt for comfortable work shoes for years and I can‚Äôt believe I never tried crocs. My feet and knees are finally happy. I work 40+ hours a week and I have finally found relief from my constant foot pain. And they are super cute. Can‚Äôt wait to order more!

review_title: I've bought cheaper immitations - don't bother - they hurt my feet.  These Crocks are comfortable.
review_text: After owning one pair of Crocks which I loved, I tried to buy something cheaper just for gardening.  Actually I tried a couple of imitations and only ended up with painful feet.  Finally, I bought these and I'm back to walking in comfort again.  Crocks are worth it.

review_title: You need at least one pair
review_text: Everyone should own at least one pair of crocs!!! They are comfortable and like walking on air. Working long shifts at an ER, my feet used to hurt wearing any shoes but wearing crocs my feet never hurt again. Now I wear them everywhere and got so many people wearing them. You won‚Äôt regret having a pair.

These were a birthday gift (by request) and they were a hit!  She normally wears 8.5, so since they don't come in half sizes, I ordered a 9 - which was TOO big.  However, the return was easy, I quickly ordered a size 8 and it was perfect.  Plus the Ballerina Pink was a great color choice!

review_title: Comfy shoes, bit of a friction issue
review_text: These things are super comfy and fit my feet perfectly, only issue is when worn without socks the rubbing between the clog and my foot creates hot spots. As i get used to them this goes away, but definitely worth thinking about if you are buying them and planning on a lot of walking right away.

This was a requested gift for our granddaughter's 13th birthday!  She had to have white, which is a little more difficult to find during the "Age of COVID".  It is VERY important to measure the foot!  She usually wears a size 4, which was impossible to find, after her dad measured her foot, it said a size 6...which fit perfect!

Great crocs quality but fits too small. This is the next size up from my son's current size and when they were delivered we held them side by side and they looked like the same size as the old ones although the size on the bottom said differently. Unfortunately we have to return and order 2sizes up this time and hopefully those will fit.

review_title: Where have you been all my life!?
review_text: This was my first pair of crocs, after poo-pooing them for years.  Now I regret waiting so long!  These shoes are perfect for something quick to slip into to run errands, walk the dogs, or head to the park.  AMAZINGLY comfortable (think walking on clouds comfortable), durable, and light-weight.  My sandals, that I've lived in for years, are taking a back seat to my new croc beauties.

review_title: LOVE LOVE! Comfiest shoes for around the house and errands.
review_text: Yay!! My summertime clogs came in! I've been using the winter Crocs and felt like they were too hot for the warmth that's going to come. I decided to switch it up a bit since I know my 9 WOMENS run big which is perfect for winter and fuzzy socks... but for summer I decided to size down for just the perfect fit! I'm an 8.5 and ordered an 8 WOMENS 6 MEN and don't regret it at all.

I'm having new problems that has caused my feet to swell.  These shoes are great due to the ample foot-bed, wide and very roomy.  I have bought 4 pairs for summer, one size bigger than usual.  They are esp. great (esp. during pandemic) because you can throw them into the washing machine.

Let's face it. Crocs are ugly. Having said that, I bought these and wear them constantly - they are like walking barefoot with rubber bumpers. I had to re-learn my natural gait after hip replacement last year and Crocs were my go-to shoe during that time. I've recommended Crocs to friends having knee surgery for the same reason. These classic style black Crocs are the same size as purple classics I've had for years but these fit the way shoes should - I didn't realize how loose and big the older pair were. I believe they were manufactured in different countries which seems to make a difference in sizing. Go Crocs!

review_title: Great for watering the yard and backpacking!
review_text: I am not a crocs on the street kind of gal but I needed a decent shoe for watering my flowers and weeding in the yard. I had bought the more expensive Birkenstock garden version but they were too stiff and uncomfortable. I knew from backpacking that crocs can be quite comfortable and a life saver when crossing creeks etc so I decided on these as my garden muck shoes! They work well but look goofy!

If you've never owned crocs before I really highly recommend them. Don't get me wrong I do not wear these to work or to social events. I don't buy them because they're cute. I buy them because they're practical. I can wear them in the river or when I'm gardening. They also are great to take hiking in case you don't want to jam your feet into your tennis shoes when you have to get up and out of your tent in the middle of the night. I imagine if I lived on a beach I'd wear them there too. They are super easy to clean and I honestly could wear them for days on end I think they're so comfortable.

review_title: best buy of my life. MUST HAVE!!
review_text: wow. what can i say. it's been a few years since i got these crocs and they have been with me through thick and thin. crocs are a HUGE thing at my camp so it was imperative that i buy a pair. the only problem was what color to get and where to buy them from??? i found these on amazon and fell in love. the color is sososo pretty. i got so many complements. also if you are buying crocs you MUST buy JIBBITZ!!!!!!!!! really important. all of my croc holes currently have jibbitz in them and it makes them 100x cuter.

I'm so happy these are coming back in style. They're super comfortable and the bright colors are so much fun. I'm old enough  to be a grandmother and I like putting the little decorative Jibbitz in the holes.  I like having several pairs in different colors.  They're so comfy I don't care if people think they're ugly.

Great fit for my size 10 feet, and the best part is that these cost MUCH less than they do at the store. I've purchased cheap knockoffs that cost almost as much as these, and they werent half as good. I've worn these every day and the soles dont show any wear. More importantly, they are soft and comfortable, while the knockoffs are stiff and uncomfortable. Some people like to wear these barefoot or with socks, while I prefer to place "Oder Eaters" or some other foam in them.  Very good quality and price!

Love my Crocs! I have always loved Crocs but haven't purchased them in the past with my shoe size being a true 7.5. I've always felt the 8 was too floppy/loose and 7 was snug and unable to use the strap if wanted/needed. But, I love the feel of wearing Crocs so I went ahead and bought the 7's. Yes they are snug, but they are so comfortable I don't mind! Plus I never wear them with the strap down anyway. Recommend!!

review_title: Adequate replacement; okay arch support but not as flexible as I wanted.
review_text: This style was the closest I could find that resembled my crocs that finally wore holes through the bottom after 12 years. The arch support is okay; my older ones did have more arch support & fit me better. The older ones also had more flexibility because of the material they were made from. At the time there was only one kind of croc. Now there are so many styles,  so I may have to try other styles to find a completely satisfying replacement.

I bought two pairs of the same black crocs a day a couple days apart, and one pair is from the distribution chain in Mexico, which are a bit more tough and fit more true to a shoe size, and the other pair came from the distribution chain in China, which happened to be a bit softer and roomier pair. Both look pretty much the exact same, but there's slight differences based on which country you get yours from. Overall not a big deal, I love mine and prefer the ones from China honestly.

review_title: Once you wear Crocs you wont go back to other sandels.
review_text: I've been a Crocs fan forever. For sandals, they are the best. Super comfy, light and long lasting.Just be careful to not leave it out in the heat. It will shrink. We live in the valley in LA and they have shrunk when left out side in 90 plus Fahrenheit weather.

review_title: Soo comfy especially w socks (in the privacy of your home)
review_text: What can I say it‚Äôs a croc shoe. Fits and works as expected. It‚Äôs a replacement pair for a pair I had for 9 years that had finally worn down - I only use them in the backyardIf you are new to crocs; a nerdy piece of advice, if you wear them with socks you‚Äôll be sooo comfy like you‚Äôre wearing those adult onesies Amazon sells & any cool factor you had is gone but you won‚Äôt care because you are that comfy.

These are so cute! They are a bit snug on my feet, I wear a 8 but got a 9 just for width, however that didn‚Äôt make any difference for width. I can still wear with socks just but not thick socks. I suggest if you have a wide foot, go up a couple of sizes. Although I got a 9 they do not look like boats on my feet, which is positive. These came much quicker than expected and I will buy again.

I‚Äôm definitely a croc girl now! I bought a pair with the fur on the inside for winter while I was pregnant and they were soo comfy. I now ordered these for summer. Wore them kayaking and they obviously work well in water. They dried really fast after getting out of the water.

review_title: Affordable and Comfortable Slides in Style
review_text: I own a black pair of crocs and I love them. I wear them when I am cleaning or doing something outside. I bought these white crocs for my daughter. She wears them for style and are easy to slide on and they fit comfortably. She wears them out a lot and around the house. Amazon has them for a great price. Much cheaper than buying them from the store directly. I bought my son a pair too!

review_title: really comfortable but can be sweaty and get pebbles
review_text: i ordered several crocs (diff styles) - all clogs1- sizes are inconsistent from color to color and style to style2- left in the heat they will shrink and distort - that being said i needed to return 1 pair as the shoe was severely deformed- probably in the shipping3- therefore - make sure return shipping is free4- i do find most of the crog clogs to be INCREDIBLY comfortable5- they make your feet sweat  - the kinds without holes are worse - BUT they are easily washable6- front holes suck - pebbles often end up in the shoe7- once the sole wears down  they are INCREDIBLY slippery - anywhere a parking lot is painted is particularly dangerous8- i think they make the best slippers ever as the support is awesome9 - i love the fact they weigh almost nothing10 - i also got the styles without holes for colder and wetter weather11 - dont leave in the sun or heat they will shrink - some people use this to get a better fit

I have been wearing this style of Crocs for many years.  Can't go wrong with them.  I have feet that are difficult to fit and need to wear something around the house that has a bit of arch support.  Crocs are the only footwear that fits the bill.  The toe box is ample, the width is just right, the length fits perfectly.  In "normal" shoes, I wear a size 10 XXW and these are perfect!

These Crocs (as always) are incredibly comfy, durable, breathable, lightweight, and easy to clean.  Attractive??  Not so much. (But I will say that I love this particular color!!) Perfect for wearing around the house/doing outside work...especially as the weather warms up. Crocs are a staple in my closet.

I am a college kid who needed shower shoes for the upcoming semester, I live crocs and have been wanting a pair as it is... so this gave me a good excuse to finally buy them!These came out exactly as expected! I chose the color ‚Äúpool‚Äù and LOVE them. Super vibrant and colorful, I am a 7 and they fit great. Awesome quality- highly recommended.

review_title: Nurse that works long hours and loves these
review_text: As a nurse who works 16 hour shifts, I was surprised when a coworker recommended I try crocs. They are by far my go to shoe for work, I am able to quickly clean them with bleach wipes at the end of my shift prior to putting them in my designated bag for my shoes in the back of my car!

Bought for my brother who has back trouble. He, like me, has wide feet. He said they were big, then put socks on and said they were fine. He will probably need a couple of days to get used to have shoes that aren't squeezing his feet. He'll probably love them after a week of wearing.

These are great to slip into/out of for quick trips to the mailbox or garden. The fit is good except I can feel one of my toes hitting the clog on my left foot, so I probably wouldn't wear them for long walks. I think this is because of my feet and not the shoes. Overall, just what I wanted.

review_title: She loves their fit and how comfortable they are
review_text: My daughter suddenly has a Croc obsession.  She has about 7 pairs, all different colors.  She loves their fit and how comfortable they are.  She has been wearing them to school (high school) and seems to be starting a trend.  She also wears them to the softball field and in between games. (Camo is her field color)  She referred her friends to Amazon as the shipping is free AND they have a great variety AND they are cheaper than at the outlets.  I think I will even be getting a pair or 2 for Christmas...  :)  BUT WE CANNOT FIND PURPLE FOR A LOWER PRICE!  That is her high school color...  They aren't as cheap as the other colors for some reason.  :(But we still love Crocs!!

I have been a CROC wearer for many years.  This was a replacement pair for some that were wearing out after 6+years.  I re-ordered the same size as the previous pair, but these seem a little shorter in the toe area -- not enough to return but just slightly smaller.

My husband, myself and kids all got Crocs for Christmas and they are awesome! My oldest son is past the youth sizes (he wears a size 6 kids shoe usually and needed an adult size in Crocs). His was a little trickier but otherwise they were straight forward sizing.

The best thing on this earth for anyone‚Äôs feet!! Bought a pair for myself and my boyfriend. He absolutely hate the style, and so do I. But I cannot deny how freaking comfortable they are!!! I have trouble finding good comfortable sneakers because I have semi wide feet. But these are absolutely amazing and comfy. Great for the entire family!! Also the material is so nice, it will not allow your foot to slide out of the shoes at all. And cleaning then is super easy. No complaints.

review_title: I'm sorry I waited so long!
review_text: I've been aware of these since they came on the market but have never been motivated to try a pair, what a mistake.They are the do-all shoe. They are shower shoes, gardening shoes, mow the lawn shoes, kick around the house shoes. If they get dirty just hose 'em off and you're good to go again. They have great grippers on the bottom and don't slip on a wet patio like flip-flops do. Why oh why did I wait so long, better late than never!

The ideal user for this product is any person boy or girl who is looking for a comfortable, durable, and water resistant shoe. These shoes are perfect slide on shoes for any quick, pick up situation. Whether that be running errands, taking the dog out, or anything else. These shoes are made for all ages, come in a variety of colors and are made for both sexes.These shoes are very durable and water resistant. I bought a pair of white ones in august of 2017, and they still look brand new (and I wear them way too often.) They clean up very easily and are perfect if the ground outside is wet or muddy. They have holes along the side and on the top which allows your feet to breathe. An amazing quality about these shoes is that they are wide enough so you have enough space in the shoe to wear a sock!These shoes have many positive characteristics about them. I would say the most positive aspect of them is that they are very convenient, and can be worn in any situation. But other positive aspects of these shoes are that they are comfortable, breathable, easy to clean, water resistant, come in all colors, and the list is endless!Most people are hesitant in purchasing these shoes because of the way they look, but since 2016 crocs have become popular again. If a shoe like these are this comfy no one should care about what they look like! I have had a very positive experience with my crocs and I would recommend any to purchase these, because they are worth the money. I am all about convenience and these shoes are my go to whenever I‚Äôm about to run out and need to slide something on quick.These shoes are made for everyone and not only are they convenient for an adult to wear, they are perfect shoes for children to wear as well. They can get them dirty and run around outside and the can be cleaned off fast, while not being ruined. They also sell gibbets for these shoes, making them personable and a fun attraction for children.Overall I would give these shoes overall a very positive review because I have gotten a lot of use out of mine. They are worth every penny and a great investment. They last a long time and are great shoes to own.

I purchased a pair of these for my mother and mother-in-law. They both have never owned crocs before and ABSOLUTELY loved them!! I purchased the teal and the coral and both colors are BEAUTIFUL.  Crocs in themselves are incredibly comfortable, easy to clean, and fit well.

I already had a similar pair of Crocs when I ordered these.  I decided I wanted one pair for inside the house, and the other pair for outside.  Even though I normally wear a size 8.5, Crocs don't come in half-sizes, so I ordered an 8, and they fit very well.

I finally convinced myself to get these and it was the best decision. They are so comfortable. I initially got a size 11 but had to return them to get a 12 due to needing a wider width. These are the only size 12 shoes I own so the size may run a bit smaller in width.

review_title: The best house shoes ever made
review_text: This is my third pair of Crocs clogs. I personally think they're ugly and I can't figure out how they ever became fashionable but so it goes. The thing is, I have fallen arches (pes planus) and I my feet kill (I used the word "kill" to describe pain) me sometimes! These are far and away the most comfortable things I can put on my feet. They're light as air and they kind of form-fit to my arches. It's like getting a mini-massage just by walking around. I wear them whenever I'm lounging around the house or doing chores but I don't wear them outside at all. Something else to note: They don't stink. At least not for a long time. I think that's pretty remarkable. When they do start to smell, I couldn't really figure out an effective way to clean them so I just threw them away and bought new ones (they also lose their form a little after a year or so). I figure I can afford a pair every year or so so that I can have happier feet.

I have resisted these shoes for years! Finally tired of ruining my regular shoes by wearing them in the garden or accidentally stepping in something I should have picked up earlier, I have finally found a shoe that I can wear and wash--and is TRULY COMFORTABLE AND LIGHT. You don't really think about how light shoes are until you put Crocs on. In fact, I liked them so much I bought a second pair to wear out and about. I never thought it would happen but I am truly a Crocs lover now!To be fair, I don't love the way they look, and my feet sometimes get cold so I bought socks. (Yes, I went there!) But I have gotten to a point in my life that function beats form and I am the happier for it.

My husband and I were apprehensive to purchase these crocs initially but after reading the reviews, we hesitantly purchased them and I am glad we did.  It has been 6 months now since we've purchased them and they are still holding up well. They are great quality and definitely originals. They also fit true to size and look exactly as seen in the photo.NB. My husband wears size nine in all regular shoes, so we ordered size 9 & it fit well.
When wearing a 9.5, the 10 was huge. I suggest a 9, size down. The orange color is bold and they look nice. Exellent quality.

review_title: Comfortable.  Keeps feet cool and dry.
review_text: So comfy.  I bought these to use for indoors.  My usual house slippers are way too hot for this California weather.  These crocs keep my feet cool and dry.  I normally wear a size 7.5 and I bought the size 8.  It‚Äôs perfect, not too loose.  Bought another pair to use for outdoors.

review_title: Admirably covers my husband's big feet
review_text: Crocs are ugly. We all know it. Nobody buys crocs to be a fashion icon (I hope). This aside, they're a good utilitarian shoe. My husband has to wear close-toed shoes to his work, and tennis shoes were killing his feet (they're big and not made to fit inside confining shoes ha).He has to wear socks with them (really highlighting his stellar sense of fashion) because apparently the holes on top pull the hair out of the top of his feet. Go figure. However other than that, he says they're comfortable and provide good support.I was also pleased that these shoes come in boat size, as not all brands carry for large-footed people.

I usually wear a size 10D, and ordered these in size 10D.  If I wore these with socks, they'd be a perfect fit.  In bare feet, they're just a little loose (surprise surprise).  I wish they'd been available in my size in another color.  My only option was Khaki, which looks like rice-fed doggy poop.  But I don't wear 'em to look at them.  I wear them because they feel great.  And for the price (under $20, delivered by amazon Prime, go amazon!) I can't complain.  They're great clomp around clogs, keep your feet warm wet or dry, kick out irritants through the many open holes, and are very comfortable on my feet.  I have yet to use the heel strap or take them for a significant walk, but that's not why I bought them.  I wanted super easy on and off, comfortable enough to run errands in, and secure enough on my feet that I didn't have to think about where I put my feet when walking in them.  They fit the bill quite nicely, thank you very much.

review_title: As always crocs are way too expensive!
review_text: Well all crocs are oversized so I can‚Äôt even wear socks with these. The last pair of crocs I had about 12 years. I didn‚Äôt think I‚Äôd like the straps but you can fold them up on top of the shoe if you want to. I do use the straps when I‚Äôm driving. As always crocs are way too expensive!

I absolutely love my crocs! They are the easiest shoes to slide in and out of, and you can get them FILTHY. All you need to do is take a wet rag and wipe them off, or blast them with the hose. Then BOOM, clean. I wear these season round, with winter-y socks, of course. I have had the crocs professional bistro clogs for work (I work in foodservice) for awhile now, which led me to just buy regular crocs because they were just soo comfy. Highly recommend for people looking for easy-on, easy-off shoes that are very comfy.

review_title: I‚Äôve been wearing Crocs for years!! They‚Äôre Great!!! üòÑüòÑ
review_text: I love Crocs. I have worn them at work for years. I work 12 or 13 hour days and I‚Äôm on my feet a lot. My feet used to hurt by the end of the day when I was wearing athletic shoes, but not with Crocs on. My feet stay comfortable all day.  I wear Crocs year round, even in the snow and rain.

review_title: Saves me from going in store AMAZING
review_text: Love my crocs but I didn't want the embarrassment of buying them in store, so amazon saved me from that. I'm a nurse in a nursing home type setting in Florida where it is hot. We walk outside a lot from building to building. So, airy crocs have saved me from sweaty tennis shoes on hot days.They fit just like in store would

... and counting.  Years ago, when I got my first pair of Crocs, I was dubious and totally unconvinced they'd live up to expectations.  Boy, was I mistaken!  Today, I have a pair of originals for warm-weather outdoor use, and another no-holes, fuzzy-lined pair for cold-weather outdoor use.  These are replacements for a worn-out indoor-only pair.  Crocs have essentially become my go-to house slipper and, used with a pair of plush socks, provide daylong comfort.  The arch support is superb and when I'm at the workbench, standing on a bare, concrete floor, my feet are happy!Enough gushing.  If you've worn them, you know exactly what I'm talking about!

I love the soft pink color. I wear an 8 and without the strap, these fit great. With the strap my left foot which is slightly larger than the right feels like it reaches to the top. I know a 9 would be too big. I'm keeping them anyway, hoping they will loosen a little.

Very comfortable! I have concrete tile floors so it helps my back. Bought a less expensive pair to see if I like them and if the size was right. Since they are Unisex shoes check the size chart. For example a Men's size 10 is a Woman's size 12. I wear a size 10 in a sneaker so a size 10 in a Croc was plenty big enough as they fit slightly larger. I wear them as a clog with the strap folded to the front. Great for a slip-on to run to the mailbox. I will get another pair.

These CROCS are my first Crocs and was kinda iffy about them at first . But now , I am obsessed with them ! Super light , comfortable and perfect for lounging around during this quarantine . This is the mint color and the color is bright and clean - just as i expected . I was going to purchase these on the Crocs site but it was more convenient to purchase through Amazon since it was more economic and with Prime arrived in less than a week . The fit was perfect for me - all I had to do was follow the size guide ! Recommend 10/10 !

I always made fun of people that wore crocs until I tried some. I can‚Äôt believe how comfortable they are. Especially for me I have to buy special shoes or inserts with arch support but these crocs are very comfortable as it is. And as promised they‚Äôre very good around the water.

Comfortable to wear all day.. We have several pairs in our family!  Some seem to run a little large...but not so much to pose a problem.  My hubby has narrower feet, so a little wide, but not sloppy feeling.  I have wide feet and mine always fit fine.  Slight arch support, probably enough for most people... I have plantar fasciitis - so no, not enough arch support for me, I wear an arch pad in all my softer shoes...  Wear in yard, on dock, around town etc...  Do watch..as heel tread wears off, can be a bit slick when walking on wet wood or metal docks...(time to buy new ones, as with most shoes/sneakers).

review_title: Extremely comfortable and a good fit.
review_text: I love these shoes. I work 12 hour night shifts at an assisted living facility, so I'm on my feet a lot. I've bought expensive shoes in the past which were not as comfy as these. And best of all, my feet no longer sweat. In other shoes my feet would sweat which would make them cold (not good in Wisconsin winters). Not so with these. Definitely will order more.Size fit perfectly. I wear an 8 1/2-9 wide and the women's nine was just right.

so it was my first time ordering crocs and I am firmly a size 6.5 but they don‚Äôt come in half sizes. so i decided to go half a size up just in case and the size 7 fit perfectly!!!! the color is even prettier in person and they are so comfy! i will definitely be ordering more in the future

In south GA, winter lawns can get soggy. These plastic shoes allow for outdoor time keeping my feet dry from wet grass and aired out via breeze holes. Very sturdy and durable, i have even walked the dogs with them and they are comfortable after a mile walk. We have a section of the yard that floods, requiring me to set up a pump system to drain water. These shoes stay on my feet as i wade the waters to place the pump in the center. They are easy to walk in thru the water.

I bought these for my daughter and she loved them, and alot cheaper than buying them through the Crocs website.  They were so comfortable I bought myself a pair.  Also, we couldn't find this color on the Crocs website either.  I would recommend.

I've never tried Crocs until last week. Always wore thong sandals out around the house, when I was too lazy to put on real shoes/sandals. These are easy to slide into...are pretty darn comfortable...fit is good! I wear an 11EE shoe, with a high instep. My foot actually measures 10.5, but 11 fits better. I would say this fits true to size (unisex mens 11). I probably have 1/2" of space at the heel....which is fine. Plenty of room in the shoe. Came in a Croc bag with their tags on the shoe....so they seem to be authentic. I would recommend!

review_title: My first Crocs.....and they are sweeeeeeeet!
review_text: I bought these for camping.....but I haven't taken them off (other than to sleep and shower) for days. These really are comfortable. They are really great for standing on concrete in the shop. They feel like you are standing on a fatigue mat or something!

This is my 3rd pair of Crocs and I must admit, I've developed an obsession. They're so comfortable and feels like your feet are getting a little massage every time you take a step, lol. The fit is perfect and I was even more excited to customize them just the way I wanted. I think I want every color at this point.

review_title: Might not be able to select size
review_text: This is my second pair of crocs and I‚Äôm super happy with them. It didn‚Äôt let me select my size so I was a little worried that my size wouldn‚Äôt come but it did! So I‚Äôm content with both my sets of crocs. If you‚Äôre worried about this, search your size specifically and more often than not you‚Äôll get your size without having to pay full price. I got these for $29

review_title: Great with socks, blisters without them.  Super comfortable.
review_text: I've had to recant all the insults I've leveled at friends for wearing crocs in public...  They are super comfortable.The fit is as expected and they've held up well so far.  I can't wear them without socks without getting blisters or severe rubbing after an hour or so, but with socks they are as comfortable as they get.  I will probably get some of their slippers/moccasins as I think they'll be a very comfortable if they're anything like these.All in all, These are great for working on my garage and around the house.  They are easy to clean and super comfortable when worn with socks.

So far, it's easy to wear 'n comfortable, however I do hope this will last longer for the price I paid versus a similar pair I bought from a Daiso store, made of cheap rubber material 'n easily worn out although things are "Made in China" now a days, still any product manufacturer is responsible in using "quality", "decent" 'n "durable" materials as well as making thoughtful, "experimented", sound design for a product to withstand daily wear with occasional treading on treacherous, rough ground to occasional speedy pace on a walk.

review_title: ‚ÄúRoomy Fit‚Äù Crocs. You‚Äôre Gonna Love These More Than Your Other Pair or Pairs...
review_text: When I took these out of the package I noticed a tag that said ‚ÄúRoomy Fit‚Äù. I had not seen that on my other pairs (I have about six pairs that I wear in place of going barefoot). Hey, I really like the extra room. They are wider and seem to have a little more room around toes as well.  I like the khaki color a lot. Like all crocs, these are comfortable and tough. I have already ordered a pair in ‚Äúdenim‚Äù.

Well these are a surprise. I bought them for a costume and walking around during Halloween noticed that my plantar fasciitis wasn't hurting. That's unusual. So anyway I wear these shoes all day every day and my feet quit hurting. That's kind of crazy but whatever. These things are goofy looking but comfortable beyond compare.

I got this for my mom cause she always taking mine, but she really liked them a lot, they are the official brand and feel very comfortable, they are a bit bigger, but it‚Äôs okay cause they have sports mode so they still fit very well.

review_title: Perfect for the new COVID life
review_text: I should have bought a pair of Crocks sooner. Wearing slippers around the house all day long made my feet hot and damp. Mule style constantly fell off and moccasin style retained moisture and got smelly. Crocks are the solution and clear winner for all day working at home.

So I was the guy saying "No! Never doing Crocks!" I will tell you man I love those things! They are so comfortable and great for camping and trips. Wear them with socks when its cold and not when its hot. Water? Dew on the ground? NO Problem... Don't get me wrong, Flip-Flops have a huge place in my heart but I just took my crocks on a 7700 mile motorcycle camping trip and I was so happy I had them. They were a great component to what I needed to be comfortable. Just give them a try but just don't start wearing them to work. Just not acceptable..

The only concern I have, is when I want to go for a walk in them, or simply play tennis in my basement... (hitting against the wall)... the bottoms get smoothed out and there is no traction left to slide or walk on. Other than that, they are pretty great! I got the teal color, and absolutely love it!

I have plantar fasciitis and get sore feet to boot. I have never been a fan of the look of crocs, but omg they are so comfy for people like me! I‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôd be brave enough to wear them out, but yes, I will be living in these in my home!

This shoes are far from fashionable and I *never* wear mine outside the house but they are great comfortable footwear. They were recommended to me by my orthopedic surgeon when I was struggling with plantar fasciitis that was aggravated by the hardwood floors in our apartment. He recommended a pair of Crocs to wear as house slippers since they have great arch support.There fit somewhat sloppy though--that's just the way they are. Don't get them too tight. When in doubt I'd suggest you order the larger size.Easy to slip into and out of and if I spill something on the floor or on the shoes I just wash them off in the sink.

Love ‚Äòem or hate ‚Äòem - Crocs are Crocs. These fit the same as the ones I‚Äôve had for about 10 years - except the old ones are worn through the sole. They are the best shoes to kick on when you‚Äôve got to run outside in a hurry to chase off a marauding deer or curious bobcat looking for a tasty chicken dinner. And they‚Äôre actually quite comfortable as well.

I have been on the fence about owning Crocs for a long time. I wasted that time. Buy these shoes. Here pictured you can see they are in "active mode" so they will stay on your feet while fighting crime or kicking rocks. They can also be worn in "relaxed mode" with the thingy on top of your foot for lazy Sundays and doing chores.

review_title: Great if you have sweaty feet.
review_text: I have sweaty feet so rubber sandals are literally the only type of sandals I can wear. Any other sandals I wear I have to wash otherwise it‚Äôll stink. I don‚Äôt have to wash these rubber sandals because they don‚Äôt stink and don‚Äôt absorb my sweat. These are well made and are really durable, but I don‚Äôt recommend running in them. They can still rip if you run in them. I had this experience before as it is why I bought a new one from this seller.

I purchased these for my ten year old son and he loves them.  He saw them at the Crocs Outlet Store and they were asking $45.  I checked Amazon and they were $31.  So we were able to get some Jibbitz with the money we saved.  The quality seems very good.  No issues so far.

review_title: Once You Croc You Just Won't Stop
review_text: Do you want your little piggies to be protected from the harsh environment? Do you care about comfort over style? Do you want house shoes that you can wear around your dogs and out in the yard without them falling apart? Do you want to be able to just hose a pair of shoes off after they get dirty? Then these bad boys are what you are looking for. Throw on some socks and some crocs and let's get funky.

I got this particular pair for my son, and he likes to wear it. He is size 6.5 or 7, and he wears the shoes with the strap up, so they fit him very well. He outgrown several pairs of crocs over the years, and always like them.However, if you wanted to wear the strap behind your heel as pictured, buy a size up - the strap is shorter then needed, I wear Woman's size 9 so should fit in this shoes well, but with the strap down, my toes painfully push into the front of the shoe, and I cannot wear them. The problem is consistent - I have several years old pair of the same crocs in another color, and it is the same - fine with the strap up, but I cannot wear it with strap down.The shoes are very lightweight.

These were for my husband, and he is very happy!  Ordered size 11, one size up from his normal 10, because he wanted to wear them with thick socks for the winter in our chilly house.  They arrived quickly and are exactly what he wanted!

Comfortable shoes.  You can do a lot of walking or standing and your feet still feel great.  Of course this is the first time I ever bought Crocs so I really can't compare these to other Crocs.  The only thing is the heel strap could be tighter.  Other than that great shoe.  I have wide feet and the width is perfect.Would recommend.

Bought for my 10 year old who usually wears a size 5 in men's, but I got him a size 6 because he is still growing and im glad I did cause as you see in picture he has a little room to grow in them. He likes them and they were a great price. Thank you.

review_title: I am a croc lover now.
review_text: I have been wanting these for so long! They are all that I have been talking about for months and I finally got them! They are way more comfortable than I expected. I don't even know how to explain it. They're just cool as heck. They're functional and in my opinion cute as heck. I have been wearing then nonstop showing them off since they arrived. I definitely will be purchasing more!

I recently visited my podiatrist because of heel pain. Turns out I have Achilles Tendonitis.  The good news, it's fixable; I can recover from this.  Surprisingly, he mentioned that Crocs are great for this ailment as they provide firm, consistent support, much better than the Dr Scholl's sandals I bought last year.  So, I bought two pair (just to be sure I have enough!).  Now, back to the heel stretching exercises the doc taught me...
